description:
I'm a big fan of brunch and this is my favorite overall brunch spot in all of San Francisco! I honestly was shocked to see that I hadn't written a review for this place earlier as I've been going there consistently for almost 2 years now!!

The vibe is chill and relaxed and fun, the staff are all super nice and attentive and friendly, the food is amazing, the menu is pretty huge, and the prices are fair. The *ONLY* downside is that it gets pretty crowded in the morning and early afternoons on weekends because it's so popular. That being said, they do move fairly quickly, and there's a cute little parklet with some seats and greenery right in front of the restaurant where you can hang out while waiting.

At this point I've tried pretty much all of the omelettes, benedicts, and scrambles, along with the breakfast burrito, the chili con carne, the regular pancakes, the beignets, and the coffee (both the regular light roast and the dark chicory roast) and *everything* I've had is great! Pretty huge portions, awesome flavors, fresh and tasty ingredients all make for excellent dishes, every single time. I've never been disappointed by a visit to Just For You and the only reason I don't go even more often is that I'd gain waaaaay too much weight if I did that!
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Slave girl and I met up with a friend in San Francisco for brunch, and friend picked Just For You Cafe. It looked like a long wait when we got there, but we only waited for 8 minutes. Woohoo!

The menu had plenty to offer. I took our server's suggestion and got hangtown fry. I also got a side of gravy for my biscuit. Slave girl and friend got a classic beignets to share, and carnita omelet and chilaquiles as their main dish.

Since I didn't try too much of their food, I couldn't say much about it other than it tasted good on the first bite. Beignets were whatever, but then again I don't really care for sweets usually.

My hangtown fry though, was very good. It had 3 eggs scrambled with bacon, oyster, and onions. The menu was a little misleading because the 3 deep fried oysters were actually placed on top of the scrambled eggs, not scrambled WITH the eggs. That didn't change how good my food tasted. The oysters were juicy and perfectly fried. The eggs couldn't go wrong with bacon and onions. It was a very good combination. I got cheese grits as my side and that was also delicious.

The gravy was what I didn't get. It was mildly sweet and I never had gravy tasted like that before. I asked the server about the taste and they told me they would check with the kitchen as they took it away. They never told me if that was how they usually make it, but they took the gravy off the bill. I never got my biscuit back...sad days.

Overall it wasn't a bad spot. The cafe had a lot of personality and the food was decent. I would go back if our friend asked us to dine there again.
author: Fan H.

description:
Great food with over the top service. Our breakfast was delish!! They have the best beignets I've ever had... even better than New Orleans. 

We had our luggage since we were heading to the airport and they were so accommodating and even put our stuff in their office. 

Great spot and look forward to returning when we are in SF next.
author: Kristina W.

description:
Beignet comes out hot and soft on the inside topped with powdered sugar. It's extra tasty if you eat it with their jam!
Frittata of the decade was not bad - veggies in egg scramble - and the provolone on top is perfectly melted it just stretches to no end. The frittata did have some soggy areas probably due to the moisture left in some of the veggies so I think it could be better. The house fries were ordinary, nothing too special and not too much flavor with them. The cornbread didn't have as much of a corn taste as I would've liked, but they do give you a huge piece of it.
Buttermilk pancake was really fluffy and great with their maple syrup.
Overall it was a pleasant normal breakfast.
author: Jeana Y.

description:
This is my second time visited this joint and the food and service are consistent. Which is great. 

Both times I came here there was a huge line outside but the wait was reasonable and both got seated within 20 mins.  

 A close friend of mine mentioned about their beignets. I love beignets and decided to give it a try.  I came here with my friend and we ordered other dishes and had beignets as dessert to share.  Omg. The beignets were very delicious.  The beignets were so fresh and melt in your mouth.  It comes with 3 pieces and we each has a piece and share the 3rd one.  We shared the scrambled and tofu with mixed-veggies with a side of sausage. It was a lot of food but we finished them because they were all so good. 

2nd time I came. We each had our own plate since we were sitting at the community table which is hard to share.  So my friend got cowgirl and I got the cowboy.  I was going to get beignets on the side but decided not to since it's a lot of food already. Good thing i didn't because the French toast was big and I actually have to give some to my friend too.  

Next time. Probably just get their beignets with cup of coffee. I think that's what I am going to do next.
author: Candice Y.

description: It was another random Yelp pick to treat my colleague from So Cal. Didn't expect the food to be so good. Had a gumbo, couldn't stop munching the bread way back to work. Yum
author: Anna L.

description:
I find it really disturbing that the African American staple food is having a correlation with being a prison food. These people obviously didn't think this through when they put it on the menu. So I guess people that mostly eat grits comes from prison aka African Americans. Way to go! And if the owners are African American (which I highly doubt), then shame on you for perpetuating stereotypes of your own culture! Definitely making a complaint about this! 

P.s. I'm actually Creole and this ain't even close to our staple foods.
author: Jaimito R.

description:
My friend and I came here after a few hours at the Dogpatch Bouldering center. Conveniently a short walk away, two small cute tables outside, and a small but cozy interior.

Their avocado toast was absolutely delicious and I added an egg on mine. Their entire menu looked delicious - I'm going to have to come again to try out the rest! The staff and our waiter were also extremely friendly and made us feel very comfortable :)

If you come here, you have to try their avocado toast with an over medium egg. SO good. I seriously wonder how they got such perfect avocados.
author: Cassandra K.

description:
We recently came here and all got the Gumbo, cause it was one of the specials. It was good gumbo, and went great with the garlic bread, but the gumbo wasn't that thick. The portion wasn't much for the price ($11 ish), and we were still kinda hungry afterwards :(
Guess we will stick to their normal stuff! They have fried chicken po boys, omelettes, etc.! Service is great, and for coffee, you can even choose light or dark roast!
author: Michael K.

description: Quaint little place in Dogpatch. I was there with my nephew on a Friday morning, so it wasn't crowded. The staff were really friendly. There is sidewalk seating that is dog-friendly. The menu looked great. I chose small order of Biscuits & Gravy with Scrambled Eggs. Very reasonably-priced. Not a fan of my eggs being on top. The biscuits were slightly too dense, and the gravy a little flour with not enough sausage. But, hey, this isn't the South. My Nephew had Huevos Rancheros with Carnitas. Looked awesome and huge! Dark roast coffee is laden with chicory...this is a bad move that California has adopted from NOLA. But I was appreciative of the advance warning so I didn't have to drink it.
author: Ian D.

description: I really like this place. The food is good and reasonably priced. I had the breakfast burrito and it was delicious.
author: Jorge P.

description:
My friend chose this place for breakfast because we were on a time constraint and needed to get to the airport. The waits are short here compared to other place in the city, or so they say. 

I can say that the waits are short if you have a party of 2. We were a party of 4 around 9:30 AM. We waited an hour. Parties of 2 were seated and seated and seated and seated. Everybody ahead of us got seated, everybody after us got seated. This is a tiny place with limited seating. My friend was ready to say that we could just do two parties of 2, when they eventually seated us at a community table. 

As for the food? Everybody in my party liked it. I happened to be sick and had no appetite. The food looked great. I ordered toast and an egg and it was fine for what I was feeling that day. My husband and friends loved the beignets and all the entrees they ordered.

Once seated the service was fast and cordial. Just watch out for the wait if you have more than 2 people.
author: Randi B.

description:
Not too shabby not too shabby. 

Located in the dogpatch on 22nd is Just for you Cafe. Service was very friendly and nearly every employee greeted me as I walked in. 

Lots of intriguing options but I elected to go with the Carnitas Tacos (surprisingly) and you know what .....it was pretty darn good. The carnitas were good/savory/tasteful as were the toppings. The dish came with a salad that was pretty good as well.

I also got a single serving of the beignet and that left a lot to be desired. I think this place was a 3.5 star for me but the beignet pushed it down to a 3 for me. The beignet wasn't as fluffy and hearty as I typically like them.  It can't be too thick or too airy, it needs to be just right and this spot I think they were too airy for me.
author: Rod M.

description:
Just for you maybe, but not for me.

Avocado toast and crab cake were obismally bland and underseasoned. And who likes a crab cake with tons of filler? Not me.

Service was slow and my brothers chorizo omelette tasted like it was from a fast food chain. Barely any chorizo but he said he liked the homestead potatoes.

The beignet was like warm and tasted like regular fried bread, nothing tasty or special about it.

I wanted to give the place 2 stars since my toast was dry and the avocado and arugula didn't have any oil or seasoning on it, and the crab cake was absolutely horrible. But, since my brother said to give this place 3 stars so be it.

Just never coming back here again.
author: Jack R.

description: I didn't want to review originally because I like to pretend this place is my secret spot  the food is always excellent and I can't say enough good things about the incredible staff! Everyone who works there is so patient and sweet which keeps me coming back. I will say that the huevos rancheros isn't the best item on the menu but everything else I've had is excellent.
author: Sarah K.

description: Fantastic menu. Ate there last week. Service was quick. Split the beignets, waffles, eggs and bacon with my husband. All of which were perfectly prepared. Nice outdoor seating area. Best breakfast place I've been to in the Dog Patch.
author: Ealon H.

description:
Service was great. As we were seated a friendly server came by to see if we would like a beignet; she had an extra one. It was a full house Saturday morning, she could have offered that to anyone. I super appreciated the gesture. It isn't the money but the thought smile behind it. My kids seemed to enjoy it. 

We ordered a Mickey Mouse pancake, a yogurt w/ granola and fruits, and a corned beef hash (one of their specials). The food didn't take that long.. when it came out everything looked appealing except the pancake. That ain't Mickey Mouse. Tess loved the fruits and granola but she didn't care for the Greek yogurt that was served. Next time she knows she need to ask what type of yogurt will be served. My corned beef hash w/ cornbread was dry and terribly under-seasoned. I never add salt to my food but I had to that morning. There was ketchup on the table but no hot sauce. I could have asked but I didn't want to wait. 

The restrooms were small and I saw biscuits on the racks in the back. It made me question their overall cleanliness. I didn't like sitting outside... all the people waiting to eat there were staring at us.

Meh.
author: Tram N.

description:
I can't explain how disappointed we were with Just For You Cafe.

It's been in my bookmarks for a couple years, and I decided to take my family when they visited because they love quirky neighborhoods and diners like this.

Service was prompt although very chaotic and disorganized; within 45 seconds, we had three different people come to our table to take our order. That is no exaggeration.

The man who ultimately took our order made suggestions for ways to alter our dishes which actually made them more expensive -- but he never mentioned the price differences.

For example, one person asked for pancake recommendations, and he said "You should do one of each!" Lo and behold, getting two different pancakes has an upcharge - but we only learned this upon getting the check.

Another asked for his take on the crab cake. He said it's phenomenal and went on raving about it, so they ordered it. The crab cake arrived burnt to a crisp -- completely black. It was unrecognizable from a properly-cooked crabcake, and obviously inedible.

At the very start, we were also poured two mugs of coffee without anyone asking if we want it, so we assumed it's included; this is the case in plenty of diners in our home state so, again, we had no idea it has a cost (or how much) until the bill came.

Coffee was poured in the beginning but never replenished, poor service continued, and the multiple instances of being given or offered things without knowing their cost is poor business, plain and simple.
author: Nic Z.

description:
My husband and I got here at 1130 and the wait for 2 was 10 minutes. They got us seated at the bar and coffee in our hands within a minute of sitting down. Service was quick. 

We ordered the beignets, chicken and waffles, and the crabbie bennie. The beignets were amazing; being a sugar fiend, I wish it was covered in more powdered sugar. The chicken was super moist and perfectly battered. The crab bennie was delicious too; egg was perfectly poached. 

We would definitely come back for the reasonably priced food and quick service!
author: Ang W.

description:
Recently just came here with a group and got a variety of different breakfast items. 

My first reaction coming here is that its a cute little breakfast and brunch restaurant. On the outside they had a sign which said beignets and let me tell you, it is amazingly delicious and the portion of the donuts is a great size to share even tho we got two orders haha!

I ordered the cowgirl which came with 2 pancakes, sausage or bacon and two eggs any style. I like the options that they had to offer for the pancakes because you could either have chose oatmeal, buttermilk, and cornmeal.

I'm willing to come back here again!
author: Brittany L.

description: Purports to be a New Orleans restaurant. Nope. Stick to the basics and you'll be fine - bacon and eggs with toast. Everything else is bleh. Weird crumbly biscuits with nasty gravy. Dried out and congealed grits.
author: Jeffrey O.

description:
Just For You Cafe is in a word Perfect. That is the TL;DR

On to the review.  Your first impression of this place a modern ironic bohemian vibe that purveys eatery. The walls a pleasantly decorated in retro 1990's era concert posters featuring old school phosphorescent pigmentations that sported a minor vogue of the era. A mix of 1980's to contemporary pop synth music adds to a comforting feel that makes for a conducive eating environment.   This establishment even sports an old school bench counter that really brings the decor together.  The staff are young, bright and affable.  Attention to detail is definitely emphasized and quite appreciate by this reviewer.  My waitress took the time to wedge my retro eatery table to prevent a minor wobble. Nice. 

On matters food related. I had a short stack of buttermilk pancakes with side of two eggs over easy. The food was served hot and timely. The eggs were perfect. I mean perfect.  That is not something I see a lot and it struck me as another example of the attention to detail they have here. The pancakes were fluffy and light while maintaining proper mouth feel thanks to the crust cooked crust.  The portion size is on the large side. Don't come here expecting some dinky little bit of food like you see at other super trendy spots.  My mimosa was served in a pint glass and was the exact ratio that should be demanded where the OJ does not overwhelm the sparking wine.  Price is definitely commensurate if not a little less than they could charge.    The variety of food here is shocking.  Awesome mexican, southern,  AND vegan? wha??? Without a doubt this place is off the chain.
author: Hector A.

description:
Fried Chicken Benedict

Well executed, seasoned properly and great value

Overall Thoughts

If it's on the specials menu, get it
author: Eddie W.

description: Wait is worth it. I had the breakfast burrito with bacon and green chili sauce and wasn't disappointed. Coffee was good and the we ordered two beignets to share for the table. Service was super nice, attentive and quick to deliver on requests. Would recommend and will look forward to returning
author: David O.

description:
My friends and I are from out of town. We were also in San Francisco during the 4th of July weekend. This cafe was one of the few that was open.

When we arrived we were greeted and seated immediately. They were friendly and not pushy about the time you spent eating. Louisiana sausage sure was spicy but it was delicious! Their biscuits were large and fluffy. The beignets were warm, fresh and chewy. They also serve Ritual coffee. 

Overall, it was a wonderful experience! We really enjoyed the Deep South/Cajun styled breakfast! I would definitely come back here!
author: Karen L.

description: This has all the trappings of a fantastic place and I intend to give it another try someday and hopefully update my review. The meal we had was substandard as was the service, although the atmosphere of the place was really very nice. All the food--two crab cakes and a burger--were over-charred on the outside and raw inside, the crab seasoning was very unpleasant, the cheesy grits just lousy. Fries were good and I did love the soup. But the mains were all genuinely terrible as I've said, no one asked us how the food was and when we left it half uneaten they took it away with a smile and charged us $60, thank you!  Maybe the chef was off that day, many people swear by it. But no one has enough money to pay for food too bad for them to eat.
author: Wilson P.

description:
I've given this place several tries and I'm always disappointed. I just had a shrimp Caesar. The shrimp were overcooked and rubbery and the romaine was limp and over dressed. It was $15 and I didn't even get a hunk of bread to go with it. 

The only item worth having are the beignets. That's it.
author: Helen H.

description: Best breakfast in the city, always stop here for the avocado toast, fruit bowl, home potatoes, so good. The service is always great and always consistent.
author: Angela L.

description:
So I got a Yelp message from the Business and they let me know that they actually use fresh oysters in the Hangtown fry. Oooo that put me over the edge of 4 star territory to 5 star.  

Thank you Just For You. I will be there for all the foreseeable weekends to come.
author: Sheewon B.

description:
Personally love brunch and always on the lookout to try new places...with this being one. However was disappointed. Got the scrabble with fries aka potatoes. My plate came with lots of extra liquid on the bottom of the plate..maybe from the scramble? Which then got all the potatoes soggy and just didn't taste good anymore. The jam offered at the table didn't have too much taste to it on the bread.

Also tried the beignet that ppl rave about. Doesn't stand out much...fried dough. Brenda's tastes better.

This place supposedly gets packed on the weekends..then again doesn't all brunch places unfortunately Overall, disappointed. Maybe This place just didn't match my taste buds But Irving street cafe(before they closed) had better breakfast than this and they were a hole in the wall basic basic breakfast place.
author: Carmen L.

description:
On a short trip and in need of a solo lunch place, I wandered upon Just For You Cafe, and was very glad I did! Tried the beignets - a huge serving, too big for one person, but oh so delicious - and the fried chicken benedict, a treat for any Southerner traveling anywhere outside of the south.

I found all of the food well prepared and with great flavor - and almost too big for one person, but hey, who can complain about that! Would definitely visit again on another trip.
author: Nikki R.

description:
I'm pretty bummed to be updating my review after having a number of nice breakfasts here. This morning was the total opposite - I was seated with just a handful of other customers on a non-busy weekday morning and was harangued by the waitress into ordering ASAP. Despite her avid attention on that front, my coffee was never refilled.

I was really disappointed by the food that arrived - the eggs I'd ordered over-medium were barely over easy, and the bread looked like it'd been in a toaster for just a few seconds. While I recognize this is not health food, there was also a layer of grease on the eggs that was quite unappealing. I took two bites and abandoned the meal, and went up to the front to pay. Although the waitress could see I'd barely touched the food, she didn't ask how anything was or speak to me in any other way. I felt quite uncomfortable with the whole situation and left a good tip, but I don't think I'll be spending money here in the future.
author: Lisa K.

description: This was the cutest little breakfast place! I went here as my last meal before going home from San Francisco with a bunch of friends. They were able to accommodate all of us (I believe there was a total of about 8 of us). We got some beignets to share, which were amazing! I got their Eggs Benedict and there was so much food it was insane. Everything was so delicious. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. I definitely want to come back here when I visit SF again!
author: Sam T.

description: Great breakfast spot! I am a regular here. The food is delicious, with generous portions. Friendly staff, cool atmosphere. Highly recommended!
author: Nicholas P.

description:
This little diner located in Dogpatch area of SF had quite a lot of business on a rainy weekday. I always wonder where all those people come from when they're supposed to be working. We even had to wait a few minutes for them to clear a table for us. The diner decor itself was very unique and had a bunch of interesting quotes, which were spread out around the restaurant and even in the bathroom! This diner definitely had a lot of character.

We got seated towards the back of the restaurant and my first impression was that the place was kind of dirty and not clean kept like a lot of the brunch places in SF. Even my utensils were dirty. When looking over the menu, I noticed they had lots of options for people with small stomachs like me! They offered a variety of options that consisted of half orders and smaller portions. I ended up ordering 2 slices of French toast. It was delicious and was a perfect portion size for me. Overall, it's an ok brunch place with options for smaller portions.
author: Catherine S.

description: We shared coffee, the beignet flight, and huevos rancheros between the two of us, and we both loved the beignets, especially dipped in coffee. The huevos were good and very spicy, but we'll probably try something else next time instead of ordering it again. Sadly, they were out of the corned beef hash special, but the prices were right and the service was excellent. Overall, we'd return for the beignets and mimosa pitchers and to try the spicy mimosa!
author: First L.

description: This was a great find...the food and the service was top notch!!!  The cheesy scrambled eggs with the green and red sauce combined (Reid's suggestion) was the perfect amount of heat and flavor!  The homemade cornbread was warm the texture was perfect for the butter  to melt.  I will definitely be back!!!
author: Cheri L.

description: Amazing brunch place!!!!! Good price, great food, great service and friendly staff. I was watching the chef when he was preparing the plates and I was pretty amazed. This place is where I won't get tired of keep visiting few times a months! Definitely recommend
author: Sara R.

description:
Rosie O'Donnell or Micheal Jackson? 

Other than that, being your friends to enjoy the great food here!
author: Gai X.

description:
This is my favorite Brunch, Breakfast and Lunch place! I have been coming here for a couple of years since a friend took me there for lunch.
It has a very extensive menu, many considerations for Vegetarians, Vegans, and Gluten Free. Try the Oatmeal Pancakes (they are amazing and wheat free!) Everyone I have taken here has loved the menu, the casual atmosphere and the friendly staff. Cannot wait to go back soon.
author: Matt F.

description:
Came here on a whim with our group of 7 at 1ish pm, we were able to get a table pretty quickly right inside. This is your cozy, diner sort of place with chill people serving you and fun artwork of movie posters and old school stuff everywhere. 

I took a freshly squeezed orange juice, the crabbie bennie, and we shared an order of beignets. The beignets were super tasty, fresh out of the fryer with a soft fluffy interior texture--probably some of my favorite beignets in SF! It was a little slow to get our food given our group size and timing but when it did come out, the crabby benedict was perfect--nicely seasoned crabcakes (with a cajun seasoning of some sort & a little bit of sweetness", rich hollandaise over perfectly cooked eggs. My side of grits was super filling (and I wasn't able to finish) but with a little bit of butter, it helped cut the richness of benedict nicely. The rest of my table took a mixture of benedicts, pancakes, scrables, and burgers, all of which seemed to be very good--particularly my friend's pancakes, which were HUGE and fluffy :)

Aside from it being a little slower in service for the food, I had to ask our server 3 times for water and I even asked another server who came by to refill coffee for water as well but we didn't get it until the 4th time asking, after all of our food had come (probably just because of the small kitchen and busy brunch hours). Otherwise, this place was pretty good and I'd recommend it if you're in the dogpatch area.

Side note, you can order a PINT of mimosa here!!!
author: Nerissa C.

description:
Good service really does make a difference. I felt warm and cozy as soon as we stepped inside. The host greeted us by saying "I'm so glad you're here today!"

Giant biscuits, crispy bacon, hot sauce collection, strong coffee, etc etc. Really cute vibes and I carried all day long!

The scrambled eggs were my favorite part of the meal, followed by the French toast. I'll be back!
author: Melissa M.

description:
Great little hole in the wall joint for a tasty breakfast. Found this place when the better half and I just arrived in SF for the first time. Indoor and outdoor seating with no wait on a Friday morning. 

I ordered the Greg's Scramble with chorizo, home fries and a cornbread. I actually really enjoyed this plate. The scramble came with a lot of flavors. I'm not a huge fan of Parmesan cheese but it went pretty well with the mix. The home fries are standard but good and that corn bread was awesome. Huge block and not overly sweet. I cleaned my plate. The better half ordered the French toast. She enjoyed it.

Parking is on the street or nearby. We got lucky just a few streets away. Pricing is fair and decent.

The vibe reminds me of a place I'd visit back home in Austin, TX. The staff was very friendly, made us feel right at home. I love the photos and posters. If we are ever back in town, I'd definitely return.
author: Alyssa M.

description:
Classy joint for beignets and breakfast!  They have art from my "See-Hing!"

Try to come early and find a parking spot!
author: Curtis L.

description: Fantastic small authentic diner near the Mission Bay UCSF hospital campus.  Everyone in our group of 4 had something delicious!  Real food, cooked on demand by the kitchen.  I enjoyed the vibe of the place!
author: Molly M.

description:
The beignets are so good! The dough is light fresh and even better when you wash it down with Ritual coffee.  The staff is super friendly and don't give you the stink-eye when you ask what is recommended. I ordered the Crab Benny - crab cake eggs Benedict - bomb and the boyfriend ordered the chicken and waffles - bomb. 

Definitely coming back since they gave us a card for free beignets -score!!
author: Marilou A.

description:
This review is long overdue.. ordered a bunch of breakfast burritos (twice!). One catered/delivered, one last minute. Both orders were FANTASTIC. Neatly labeled + packaged. STUFFED burritos with fresh ingredients. Also ordered sandwiches one time... the caprese is the besttttt! Reid + his team really know how to run a good biz. Excellent customer service!

One thing to note is that the menu says fresh squeezed OJ but Odwalla was served (this was when I ordered through catering, not sit down) - when I've swang by JFY in the past the juices were fresh squeezed, so it might be an on/off thing? Or a dine in only thing?

ILY JFY!
author: Chantel Y.

description: Great brunch. Came with a group of 6 but the wait was not too bad at all. We all enjoyed our food. Ordered the beignets to get us started and as good as the ones I had in New Orleans. Coffee came in strong or regular brew, started with the strong and worked well with the beignets. The shrimp and grits were delicious, covered with a bacon and cream sauce. Corn bread that it came with was ok, maybe it would have been better if it was was warmed up. Nice neighborhood place on a hip street in Dogpatch.
author: T C.

description:
Service and beignets were a 5. Very friendly service and the beignets were fresh and hot. 

Our main meals were cold. We ordered chicken and waffles and fried chicken Benedict 

Waffles had been pre made at least an hour before  

Chicken was pre made as well. Cold and hard. 
Biscuit ....... cold 

Unreal. No reason to pre make food to turn and burn the guests. 

Not going back.
author: rebecca r.

description: Very good food, service and environment. Was able to get my team in and seated quickly. The waiters were friendly with great attitudes. Check them out and see for yourself.
author: Derry A.

description: Came in here around 7:30 in the morning on a Friday and almost all the tables were filled--good sign. Cute cafe with good food. Waitress was nice and attentive. Coffee wasn't great.
author: Erin H.

description:
waitress took order, got food, then, heavy set guy with scruff says "here you go", and gives check while I am eating.

thought that was a little rude. wait til I'm done, or say "no rush" or something.
author: Eric A.

description: Wet nice cozy place to eat and meet up casually for breakfast or brunch. Service is great, food selection is numerous so come ready to ponder the menu and toss a coin between what you wanna eat because likely you'll want to try a few dishes. Great place for a great time.
author: Nilu S.

description: It is a really cool place to go for brunch. people are friendly and the vibe is really good. We went in a group of 10. I got their chili scramble and liked it. It made me full.
author: Iman B.

description: This place is delicious and very affordable! There is a lot of parking around, they seated us right away, and the food and drinks came out very quickly. The food was amazingly delicious, I got eggs sausage home friends and a chocolate strawberry scone, I loved all of it but I definitely recommend their scones, one of the best scones I have ever had. We will definitely be back!
author: Phillip E.

description: One of my favorite spots in the city. An intimate cafe with delicious homemade food and great service.
author: Amy D.

description:
Terrific place for lunch or weekend brunch.  Friendly and fast wait staff.  Food is unassuming classic coffee shop / diner fare but very well done. 
Weekend brunch has large crowds and you might be waiting +15mins for a table.  Pleasant low-key locale "Dogpatch" away from busier neighborhoods.
author: Alexander M.

description:
Went here with some friends to grab a bite to eat on a Sunday morning. The place was pretty packed, but we were able to beat the 10am rush and get seated right away.

To start off the meal, we ordered some of the beignets. These were decent--not as memorable as the ones I had in New Orleans, but not bad.

For my main meal, I decided to go with the Greg's scramble with chorizo and grits and corn bread. While this was not the lightest breakfast I have ever had, it sure was a tasty one. The scramble was tasty and the corn bread and grits were both unexpected hits as well.

Overall, this place serves up some quality food at reasonable prices and has quite a following. This place is the perfect setting for a brunch catch up with friends or to chase a hangover with a significant other. Definitely worth checking out if you're in the neighborhood, just be sure to get there before 10am to beat the rush.
author: Ryan R.

description: Delicious chili with cornbread for a cheaper lunch than I can find anywhere else nearby- I will definitely be returning here. The weekday lunch atmosphere is pretty chill but I hear the wait on weekends for brunch can be a bit hectic.
author: Karen D.

description: Delicious and fun cafe for the weekends. It's a long wait and a bit of a zoo, but that's part of the fun.
author: Victoria C.

description:
This is my followup review our second time today w/my honey to have breakfast.
To my dismay and disappointment the girl Carolyn..caucasian short, dark brown hair with glasses? Not sure but..when she took our order..she had NO SMILE on her face..just a fake grin on hurrying us up to order our food! I like to smile cuz I'm a happy person..hoping my smile and kindness would rub on her..it sure definitely had NO affect! I'm really BIG on first impressions and I feel Carolyn NEEDS A CHILL PILL..and she needs to be better in catering to people..SMILE PLEASE!!! 
I'm glad I didn't see her again!!
As for the rest of the crew working there..I have no problems with..the one who originally asked us first was awesome..
Thank you..Krista for your sincere smile and customer service made up for "Carolyn's 
Incapabilities" I see everyone doing a great job..hustling & bustling asking other customers if there ok! The lady with the Orange-red shirt must be the manager in charge..she was a cashier..she was super nice to us too! I didn't see Reed today but I appreciated his awesomeness when we were there first time!!
Overall..the food was still super good! My $47 bucks well spent..I gave 21% tip for food and Krista's service!
I ordered something different..the grilled cheese..eggs with Filipino longanisa was yummy!!!
My honey got bacon scrambled eggs and the hatch Chilli again which he loves being frm Texas!
I took pics of what was hanging close to us and the last time we were there..we sat again over the Micheal Jackson portrait which was great!! Upon reading other comments about this place..it could be a hit or a miss! I gave three stars instead of one star cuz I feel this place deserves a third chance in my book. For people who has never been to Just For You Cafe should give it a chance and try their food! Then write your opinions on Yelp!
Till next time..Bon appetite!!
author: Sharon Z.

description:
Great little local brunch space. The folks are super nice but also super efficient (they run a tight ship - I like that)

We ordered a veggie omelet - it was lightly stir fried veggies (onions zucchini spinach) under scrambled eggs. It was surprisingly delicious - since the veggies were not "in" the eggs they maintained their freshness and some of their crunch.

The seafood gumbo was also tasty - a creole rice dish with sausage and oysters.

The corn bread is very good. And the omelette came with gluten free bread that was actually delicious.

The staff was also quick with the coffee and tea. Just very very efficient. There is a waitlist in weekends but it is pretty quick wait. Would Cole back again.
author: Madison W.

description: This is a spectacular place !!!. Great service with a lot of awesomeness in it the food is like none other !! It's literally just for you. I felt special, like the person I am. The French toast was amazing , like none other. I have experience in the kitchen and the way the French toast was prepared was with a lot of care, texture and taste. Quick healthy all natural meal , very soulful as well feeler me right up for a late breakfast. Go check em out see for yourself !
author: Jason R.

description: Great little spot for a neighborhood diner. Excellent brunch, great service, fair prices! And the food is excellent. Home baked breads and lots of options including vegan and vegetarian!
author: Teresa W.

description: Came here cause Knox Cafe was too busy, and had a pleasant time. Simple breakfast food, the bisuits and gravy were delicious!  The grits tasted like oatmeal (is that what they should taste like?) But service was great and good affordable prices. Will return.
author: Vivian D.

description:
Definitely a fan of this place. Love their selection of good ole comforting breakfast items. 
Came by on a sunday mid-morning. Had a wait of approx 30mins. They have a small seating area outside for you to wait. I believe they're known for their beignets, though my friends and I did not order. 

The ambiance and atmosphere in Just for you cafe is very homey. Not too "hipster-ish" and very inviting. Seating is a bit tight, so don't expect to have lots of room. 

I ended up ordering this one hangover skillet, breakfast cure thing that involved fried oysters, lots of eggs, a large heapings of home potatoes and some other meats--it was huge. The portions here are definitely on point here and the dish was AMAZING. Still drooling just thinking about it. 

They have a good assortment of more southern style breakfast items. Definitely dont come by if you're concerned for the your belly..it's not a diet and eat a salad kind of place, otherwise, i would take friends and family here.
author: Diane T.

description: Had an awesome breakfast with coworkers for our team building, with several different tastes and expectations!  I am so happy to say all we happy with our meals while being impressed and happy with the service.  As usual the hot for most was the green Chile salsa! And we shared a French toast awesome!
author: Paul D.

description:
Came here for brunch/lunch with the fam late Saturday around 1-2PM, and we had no wait at all. That's right. Brunch in SF? On a weekend? No wait? I think the brunch gods blessed us.

We got the 3 beignets for about $6 to share between the four of us. If you're from South Bay--or Cantonese at all, you'll know what I mean when I say it's a prettier and square version of Cantonese donuts (ref: Cooking Papa in Santa Clara). Snowed in powdered sugar, you don't need extra syrup...it's perfect as it. I had the veggie burrito with fries on the side, had a bite of their home fries and delicious crab benny, while the 'rents had biscuits and gravy and the Greg's omelette with a delicious scone.

In all, service was so chill. We had a super cool server with a gorgeous pixie haircut and relaxed demeanor, she was not pushy with our orders and was prompt with refilling our waters. The food servers and staff were all on their A game...shoutout to the friendly Mexican guy who greeted us as we asked for a table, and quickly took our dirty plates away. 

It's not a super fancy cafe, but it's got such a "Sunday morning/lazy neighborhood cafe" vibe without the pretentious avocado toasts and ginger-banana-dragonfruit-cleanse shakes. I love Just for You, and so did the older sweet couple next to us and the young twenty-somethings snapping their food on our other side. Kudos JFY, we'll be back soon. Pro Tip: Parking is a-plenty around the corner along the residential areas.
author: Jodi H.

description:
Went to this place with my parents earlier this week after we discovered that Neighbor Bakehouse is closed on Tuesdays... that was tragic. But this place was actually really good. 

I think what made me like it so much, other than the very tasty huevos rancheros I had, was the hilarious waiter who was very charismatic and nice and would call out everyone waiting on their tables and say "yooo hooo your table's ready" - idk why we thought it was so funny but he said yoo hoo every time lol.

Also he let us sit outside to eat and they served us in that little public parklet thing out front, even though it's technically not part of the restaurant, because we had my dog with me. Super cool and nice!! Also the french toast my mom got was very yum.
author: Amanda K.

description:
We are not a family that brunches. We don't like waiting in line, and we make pretty good breakfast food at home. As a result, going out for brunch is pretty rare.

Today was one of those rare brunch days. Yes, there was a line, but we only had to wait 15 minutes which was pretty okay as they gave us coffee while we waited (raining outside, so that was much appreciated.) 

We had eggs  blackstone, a creole shrimp omelette, and eggs/sausage breakfast ( eggs and sausage ordered by he who hates the most on brunch.) The blackstone and omelette were awesome. Eggs and sausage were pretty standard. Total bill for 3 was about $50 with tax and tip. He who hates on brunch wont go back because yes, it's not cheap.

But they make their own bread...did I mention that? I'm going back even if it's just for toast and coffee (ritual coffee=good coffee.)
author: El B.

description:
Came here around 11am on a Friday.  Plenty of patrons but not full so were able to get a table right away.  The tables in the back are dark so we sat more towards the front.  The tables are kinda close together so it gets noisy.  You can't help but hear the conversations on the tables next to you as uninteresting as they are.

Nice, friendly staff.  Mom ordered the Hangtown Fry and I ordered the Chili Scramble.  Both were excellent.  The oysters, eggs and bacon in the Hangtown were a great combination.  We both upgraded to the fresh fruit which was amazingly fresh.  The chili scramble is chili on top of scrambled eggs on top of cornbread.  Thought it was a little weird but it was great.

Again service is fantastic, just deducting one star because it was so noisy I couldn't hear my Mom from across the table.  Probably the fault of the loudmouth at the next table.  Wish she had something more interesting to talk about.
author: Steve G.

description:
This is my favourite brunch place in SF. 

The food.
You get so much food for what you pay, and it's high quality. I always get egg whites and they use real egg whites, without extra charge. They make their own bread/pastries which come with egg dishes. I have tried them all and basically rotate because they are all so so good. 

I can eat as healthy or not here - you can substitute potatoes for the really good sautéed veggies, salad or grits and they are all delicious.

The people.
I feel like I'm eating at my Mom's house when I'm here. The staff is so friendly and they try to accommodate whatever you need to make your meal what you want it to be. 

Basically if I lived in the area, I'd be here almost daily for lunch/brunch.
author: Patricia L.

description: Great service, great food, AND homemade bread you can take home! What a fabulous  gem in this neighborhood.
author: Teri K.

description: Sorry - I know everyone loves this place and the owner is sure nice, but the food is SO greasy. REALLY.  Better off at the Ramp.
author: T F.

description: Had a group of 6 on a Sunday morning and there was only a 10 min wait to get us in. As soon as we sat down the waitress got our drink orders and then quickly returned to take our orders. She was great and came back multiple times to fill up our water glasses and was very attentive. The food came out quickly and was delicious. Our table got 3 beignets to share and they were nice, light and delicious. I ordered the blackcomb Benedict which had bacon and tomatoes with hollandaise sauce on an English muffin with home fries on the side. The bacon was perfectly crisp and the hollandaise sauce was really good. Everything was great from the service to the food, would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a brunch option.
author: Jennifer H.

description: We have been coming to Just for You cafe for almost 10 years and love the consistent, delicious and affordable brunches they serve here. Their beignets and fresh baked breads are legit... and they have a wonderful variety of offerings to please any palate. I always go for their scrambles, while my husband loves their breakfast burritos. This is a neighborhood gem
author: Erin C.

description:
This has been my go-to breakfast spot after work.  It opens early and has great sized portions!  The workers took a while to warm up, my first few visits were odd interactions but now they're friendly and great!

Breakfast suggestions
hangtown fry- if you're feelin fried oysters
greg's scramble
eggs and bacon
breakfast burrito
begniets

All the food is legit.  As you can tell, my return factor here is strong.  Thanks Just For You!
author: Lyn C.

description: One of the best breakfast spots in the area! Great breakfast burritos!  The wait sometimes can be a while, but 15-20 minutes of wait is worth it!
author: Jeff G.

description:
Came to JFY after seeing multiple reviews on yelp, so thought I would check it out! Great quaint place with parking. I loved that they had outside seating as well, but you know SF weather so I ended up sitting inside.. so now to what matters the food! 
Must HAVES: Grits were BOMB, I would definitely get them again! Also, beignets were amazing ( add some Jam & honey).... 

I would not get biscuits again they were dry! 

Otherwise - Greg Scramble was a good choice!
author: Lei F.

description: I love this place! The service is pretty fast and the food is delicious, I highly recommend the breakfast: 2 egs with a pork shop (if you like meat), there is also many options for vegan people. The environment is great, they are always playing cool music, and the servers are super friendly
author: Jath R.

description:
If you find yourself putting your name on a waitlist, free coffee is available for the patient. When someone calls out "yoo-hoo" and your name, you will be seated and waited upon by a friendly and attentive server.

At $12.95 the Hot Roast Beef Sandwich in the Today's Specials was excellent to me. It came with a wedge of pickle and I choose salad over fries or coleslaw. With a slice of Swiss, it came on a soft roll cut in two with one slice of tomato on only one half the sandwich. I found its thinly sliced roast beef plentiful and juicy, mmm mmm.

My friend ordered the same thing yet was so disappointed. He felt the roast beef should have been thicker and the bread toasted. He too, didn't like one slice of tomato on only one have the sandwich.
author: Caesar A.

description:
I am a big promoter of Just For You Cafe. I have been here several times, and never been let down. Most recently, I brought my brother and some friends, and we had another great experience.

I was initially won over by the pint size mimosas. Yes, I said pint size mimosas.  Gone are the days of paying $ for a tiny little champagne flute with mostly orange juice. Just For You has really stepped it up here.  More importantly, the juices they use are fresh squeezed and delicious. I highly recommend the grapefruit/orange juice combination. 

I love brunch, so I absolutely love the food here. Biscuits and gravy is one of my favorite items to order.  I also love the Chicken and Waffles, but you really cannot seem to go wrong on this menu.  The classic breakfast items are always well prepared.

The other day we agreed to a slightly smaller table (group of 5), and our server awarded us a card that we could use for a free order of Beignets. These powdery treats were absolutely delightful, and the gesture from our server was so kind. I will certainly continue coming here for brunch on many more occasions.
author: Alex E.

description: Definitely recommend this spot! Nice staff, fast service, and good food. What really drew me in was the hospitality and the customer service the workers had. It made the overall experience awesome :)
author: Madonna S.

description: Came here with my husband on a weekday for early morning breakfast. No wait. Service was great. I ordered a southern type of scramble with chorizo. That came with side of grits and raisin bread. You can choose other options like a different bread type of home fries instead of grits. Husband ordered scramble with fried oyster on top and side of grits. He ate everything but didn't touch his side of bread, probably because he ordered wheat and by the time he finished everything else the wheat bread looked bland. Food was good but I have other better breakfast places that I would prefer to go to. I would come back if I am around the neighborhood. Each person's meal was about $12 to $15 on average but does not include drinks.
author: Anh W.

description: Just For You Café wonderful French toast and bacon kind of pricey but you have to spend some money to eat good
author: Ronna B.

description: My husband and I stopped in on a Thursday morning around 11AM. Because of the unseasonably perfect SF weather that day, we sat at one of just a couple of the outdoor tables and had a lovely coffee (not the chickory one!) and beignet. Totally enjoyed our experience here. The service was very friendly and swift. The beignet was as good as the ones in NOLA, and though we didn't have a full on breakfast, other people's plates looked amazing. Prices seemed very reasonable. I want to come back.
author: Betsy H.

description:
Vinny Gambini: Are we to believe that boiling water soaks into a grit faster in your kitchen than on any place on the face of the Earth?

Mr. Tipton: I don't know. 

Vinny Gambini: Well, perhaps the laws of physics cease to exist on your stove.

I love the law . . . I mean the laws of physics . . . in accordance to Hollywood conventions that is.

What does this all have to do with Just For You Cafe you might be asking (or maybe you're already accustomed to my flight of fancy)?  Grits, baby.  Grits.

To which you could say, kiss my . . . but if you got that reference you are obviously very, very . . . well versed in tv.

Anyways, I got the Greg's scramble with chicken-apple sausage and a side of grits.  I got to say, it's been awhile since I've had a really good scramble: you get that crisp bite from the onions, sweet component from the sausage, and nice little bit of salt from the parm.  Yum.  So yum.  And I was totally feeling the grits (not literally, of course): simple yet very satisfying and it complimented all the flavors of the scramble.

Great service.
Neighborhood feel is a plus.
Neighborhood parking is not.

Chicory in the coffee is a nice touch
and remember to try the beignets.
author: Dan B.

description: The best cornbread pancakes!! Hip joint with fantastic biscuits and coffee! The service is wonderful and everyone is friendly.  This will be my go to brunch spot!
author: John C.

description:
We only came for one thing really, the beignets, and it was WORTH IT! Rain and all, it was worth the trek coming across the city.

Fresh powdered beignets with mediocre coffee is the way to go. Loved every bite. If they would have come in a paper bag, I would have lost my shit and gone wild about it! 

We will be back to explore the menu and boost this to a 5 star, everything looked and smelled great coming out of the kitchen.
author: Roman V.

description:
EVENT: the girls plus the Mr. needed some brunch... there's tons of cute little brunch places around this area... but hell... the wait is forever! But, not Just For You Cafe! No wait!!!! And it's the best!!!

PARKING: a lot of meter parking... kinda quiet around here. Not much cars! We walked here and it was a nice little walk

SERVICE: We got sat down right away! Server totally cool! Gave us water and menu. The menu was so long... and sound so good... we wanted everything and needed more time! Server is totally patient.

FOOD:
(1) French Toast - sweet and delish!
(2) Pancakes - mmMm! Super fluffy! Jam on the table!
(3) Beignets - this came HOT! Fresh from the fryer! So delish... doughy! It was topped with powder sugar and it's mmmMMm.. more please! 5 stars
(4) Filipino sausage with toast and eggs - I love the sausage! Very unique... never had this before but goes really well with toast and eggs!

**MUST GET: Beignets! Hot, fresh, and doughy! Love it!
author: Mindy Y.

description:
Wait isn't too bad.  People leave every few minutes and others are quickly seated afterwards.  Probably waited 15 minutes and this was on a long weekend.  The food is just descent though.  There's really nothing special about their breakfast items.  

We did the beignets too and they were super doughy and and it turns out, they were raw, and we realized this after we ate the first two.  My boyfriend split the last one and saw how raw the dough was, it was literally dough spilling out.  Hopefully the ones we ate weren't too raw, but it did leave a yeast taste in our mouths.  The beignets were taken off the bill, but still, beignets are kind of their staple item so they should have been cooked properly.  P.S. Their beignets are nothing like Cafe du Monde's, I don't care what others have to say.
author: Samantha C.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Wednesday and it was super crowded. We were still seated almost immediately. Ordered the grilled chicken sandwich, buttermilk fried chicken sandwich, reuben sandwich, and beignets. Grilled chicken was good with provolone cheese.  Fried chicken could have used more flavor on its own but with the honey butter it was very good. Reuben had delicious corned beef. All the sandwiches had homemade bread toasted perfectly. Beignets were too doughy more like doughnuts. 
Service was very friendly and quick. Overall atmosphere was very fun and quirky.
author: Melissa W.

description:
If you're in the neighborhood, are sauntering out of bed in the mornings, and can't be bothered to schlep elsewhere in the city, then this is pretty much your default choice. Prices are ever so slightly on the high side for reasonably OK breakfast fare, while the coffee is watery and tasteless. Service can veer all the way from friendly and attentive to indifferent and perfunctory. 

Overall, a decent choice for brunch in an area that doesn't have that many comparable options.
author: Vincent L.

description:
THIS CAFE WAS REALLY AWESOME 

The waitresses were really friendly and everything tasted sooo good 

I can just recommend it, you really need to try it, it's worth it
author: Franzi S.

description: What a wonderful way to get my body started this morning! Fresh beignets with powdered sugar? Why, hell yes! I've been dreaming of them for 6 months and stumbled upon this gem this morning. Perfectly perfect, this great breakfast filled the spot, 'Cowgirl' gets you eggs, pancakes and sausage or bacon, great service, we sat outside in the sunlight and it was clean, affordably priced, and the beignets, did I mention the beignets? Well, you had me at hello! I'll be back again. Thank you 'Just For You'
author: Lisa L.

description: A really great spot for breakfast. It's a small place, so be prepared to wait if they're busy. Beignets are made fresh to order and yummy, although NOLA is a lot better. But whatcha gonna do this is the Bay Area.
author: Vanessa K.

description: Bomb shrimp and grits... loved it.. as well as the homemade buscuits. I also enjoy the pancakes
author: Ashley W.

description:
Tasty and gigantic brunch. Started with the pint-sized mimosa and beignets. Mimosa was about as good as one could expect for a pint-sized mimosa, and the beignets were very good but not sweet (ask for honey). We got the hangtown fry, fried chicken benedict, cornbread, biscuit, grits, and home fries. Everything was solid except for the biscuits, which were a little heavy and flavorless compared to the best homemade biscuits. Great service and experience overall.

Update: I've been back a few times since my first visit, and the menu overall has been disappointing. The service has been terrific every time, but I've ordered a variety of scrambles and they all come with large undercooked chunks of onion inside, and when the scramble contains bacon it's always undercooked as well. They need to sufficiently cook the fillings first and then add the eggs--it tastes like they cook them all together. The huevos rancheros were the worst huevos rancheros I've ever tasted. I've had way better huevos rancheros in New York, which is saying something. Dry and flavorless, it's like they slapped the ingredients together with zero effort. With that said, I'm leaving my rating at four stars because the place has such a nice vibe and servers, and because they do staples (basic eggs, bacon, etc.) very well.
author: Young J.

description:
YyyyyyooooooooooHHhhhhhooooooooooooo!!!

In the mornings, this place gets busy - for good reason. You'll be called off the waitlist by a kind, animated man loudly exclaiming the line written above. After that you will be whisk away to a table, offered local coffee, and you will proceed to have a terrific breakfast. 

Just For You is an institution. It is the mecca for the diverse neighborhood that is the DogPatch. Everyone eats here, from all walks of life. You should too.
author: Chase M.

description:
As an aspiring father, how am I supposed to be a legitimate role model to my #wayfuture #theoretical kids if I do stuff like...

get just one entree
don't finish it
order stuff to-go

muzza. fuzza. please.
#iwishabreakfastWOULD
#nosharing #noleftovers

HANGTOWN FRY (bacon oyster onion scramble) was ok.

SMOKEHOUSE BENEDICT (spicy bbq pulled pork ben over openface biscuits) #fathersdaymenu is the 4th star. Yes, it's a #sopdebottom #eyeswerewatchinggeezystomachswereeatingbrekeezy mess, but that's the point.

+ Portlandia waitress #aoriver
- Receipt after every round #comical #letaeatereatbrah

Happy Father's Day to everyone in there and, like the menu said, all men AND women raising #bebeskids. (Menu didn't say the bebe part - that was my own addition.)
author: Dan B.

description: I chose this place because they had catfish on the menu, my boyfriend ordered the chicken and waffles plate. Overall the food was cool but the fish and the chicken were not seasoned well enough. The breading was great but the flavor was bland. The frittata and scones were really good. Didn't care for the crabcakes. I would go back, but I wouldn't order any meat.
author: Tameika E.

description:
Came in Father's Day, sat right away! 

Cute restaurant with more seating in the back and a few tables outside if you prefer al fresco. I got the crabby eggs benedict. The eggs were slow cooked to perfection! ((Yelper DAN B video says it all...yolk waterfall...!!))

Other than that..the beinegett are amazing!! I'll probably come back just for these and cup of coffee!!!! 

Great staff! The busser and server were on top of it..refilled coffees, waters..super accommodating :) and a plus is... they have a wide variety of hot sauces!! And I  lOve hot sauce!! ;)
author: Chanel H.

description:
Took a friend here for a bday brunch, and it was a bit hit-or-miss. The gumbo was pretty good, but the catfish with eggs was quite bland, so we kinda just mixed the two dishes together. Their baked goods were all amazing (cornbread, scone) and those big-ass mimosas... YAAAAAAS!!

PS excellent, patient service. Coffee that kept on coming.
author: Vivian H.

description: I tried this place for the very first time during my lunch. I'm just so glad there is a place like this to eat because it's great for breakfast and lunch. Even more when you don't want to spend so much money. Well portioned and great service. Friendly staff. No longer hungry and feeling great. Would come back to eat again.
author: C G.

description: I'm so sad to post this review. Today's breakfast was by far the worst meal I've had to date at a restaurant. I ordered the huevos rancheros only to received what looked like a plate for a dog.  Everything was piled on the plate spilling over the edge looking like a bowl of soup. The beans were hard, sauce was cold and tortillas were heated in a microwave making them super rubbery. The Greg scrambled was also ordered. The eggs for that were prepared correctly; however,  the potatoes were cold and burnt. How can something be cold and burnt to a crisp? The French toast brioche had no flavor. All to be washed with burnt coffee. Never again
author: Gabriela H.

description:
Just For You in San Francisco was Just Wonderful!!! 
First time culinary experience at this restaurant and we weren't disappointed! Sat outside and enjoyed the most delicious Grapefruit Mimosa's before our amazing brunch! The incredible menu selections were so vast that it took us a long time to decide what to order! A distinct Louisiana flare of selections made it difficult to decide what to eat!  
From buttermilk pancakes to grits and eggs to po-boys with shrimp, to biscuits and gravy, to fish tacos to peanut butter and jelly and Mickey Mouse Pancakes for kids, to Beignets!! What?? Po-Boy Shrimp sandwich and cornbread and chili were our choices. Excellent! So looking forward to our next visit to enjoy another great meal! Parking is a little difficult in Dogpatch area but this restaurant is worth it! Popular place for locals and workers in the area. Great for large groups and families! Fast service and friendly staff! Looking forward to another great meal at Just For You! Moderate prices and large Mimosa's! Winner!!
author: Barbara n.

description: I came by for beignets and ended up getting lunch here. The beignets were quite fresh and bigger than the devil's teeth ones. The jambalaya that I got was good and came with corn bread.  My only downside is that one of the waitresses seemed to ignore me and never gave me eye contact the times I flagged her down.
author: Dan C.

description: Cute place. Came in on a beautiful day and sat outside. The waitress was great, food was awesome and they play the jams, 80s freestyle!!
author: Kristina R.

description: I have to agree with the other posters.. avocado toast was weak. Not seasoned well. Server was nice , as was host but server didn't check in. French fries were deep fried with pieces on fried chicken . Beignets were delicious though. Strawberry mint mojito was 2/5. Strong but no flavor of strawberry or mint. I'll probably come back and try something  else.
author: Khiara H.

description:
Breakfast for Breakfast
Breakfast for Lunch
Breakfast for Dinner

Get it? I like breakfast. 

Food: I've had many things on the menu. I worked in the Dogpatch for 2 years. I've had many of the breakfast items and all are delicious. My latest visit was Duck Eggs Benedict on homemade bread. In my belly please.

People come for the beignets. I've had the famous beignets in New Orleans so I don't think it's fair of me to compare. 

Service: Always friendly but does get busy so plan accordingly. I enjoy sitting at the counter and watching the controlled chaos. These employees work hard.

Ambiance:  I love diners but I wouldn't classify Just For You Cafe as a true diner. However, it looks like a diner.
author: Viyada S.

description: Just okay. Service is always friendly tho but I feel like the food is not very consistent. They always serve me brunt and last pieces of their house potato. I'm always so bumped about that. You can clearly see it on my plate. Their **Beignets are the best thing on their menu. They are huge and tasty. Not soggy, not overly fried. And loaded with powered sugar. One of the best in San Francisco. The wait isn't super long which is nice.
author: Sandy B.

description:
Beignets!  Wonderful, huge, fabulous beignets!  
They're light & airy pillows of perfection.

I sat down @ the counter.  I ordered the chili scramble w cornbread & home fries.  And then I added an order of beignets to take home.  They said they would wait until I was about halfway done w my breakfast before firing up the beignets, so that they would be nice & hot when I took them home.

Nice!

I did not know how large they were, so I opted for 3 instead of just 1.  

My breakfast arrived in no time. 

Let's talk about the sublime texture contrasts...
the chili con carne,
the scrambled eggs,
the cheddar cheese,
the diced onion,
all piled high on top of the cornbread...

You know what all of these things together equals?  One rock star heavenly breakfast pyramid, that's what!  OMG good.  I tried to get some of each component in every single bite.  The new breakfast of champions.  

The eggs were scrambled the right way; they had fork, but were still soft.  The chili had enough spice to please but not overwhelm.  The cornbread was fantastic.  Moist & flavorful.  Good down home southern cornbread.

Huge portion.  And with the home fries, it looked & felt like the plate weighed a couple of pounds.  The home fries were just ok.  Next time I'll opt for a different side.  I ate maybe a third of it, & boxed the rest.  This turned out to be 3 small meals for me.

Service was friendly & attentive.  Refilled my coffee on their own, & didn't forget to fire up my beignets to go.

When they brought the beignets to me, I opened the container to take a look...

What beauties.  What huge beauties.

I ate one as soon as I got to my car.  I meant to only take a bite, but it was so good all my resolve went out the window in about 2 seconds.

They taste as good as they look.

JFY Cafe is one cool neighborhood joint.  Good food, good people.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Stopped by JFY Saturday.  Wanted to treat myself to something special that I usually stay away from (waistline!) and ordered the waffle with buttermilk fried chicken.  After waiting close to 1/2 hour, my food arrived.  Major disappointment!  Rubbery waffle and dry, way over cooked fried chicken breast that fought back with every bite.  And to top things off, tasted bitter & fishy.  I was hungry and rather than waiting another 30 minutes for an exchange, managed to eat half the food.  But word to the wise:  Skip this selection!
author: Evleen A.

description: Love it! Everyone be that works there is friendly and all the food I've had has always been great. I love the tofu stir fry and I always put ketchup on it!
author: Bela G.

description:
Hol' up I didn't write a review for this place yet????

[Insert review] 

Wait time- For a Sunday in SF the wait time wasn't horrendous. My friend and I waited about 30 mins but only because they couldn't read my name on the waiting list. So when you place you name down on the list make sure it's legible because they will surely skip over it. 

Food- Now the food is the saving grace of this place because it was quite delicious. I ordered the Cowgirl which consisted of 2 pancakes, 2 eggs, with 2 chicken-apple sausages. It was an extremely hearty meal for only $12. They have 3 choices for pancakes, buttermilk, cornmeal and buckwheat. I couldn't decide between the cornmeal and buttermilk so our waitress kindly suggested getting one of each. SCORE! The cornmeal outshined the buttermilk easily. It's mealy texture it subtle sweetness combined to make a really unique taste. The chicken-apple sausage was tasty as well. Not too sweet but very tender and juicy. 

Service- Our waitress was super nice but the host/bus boy certainly carried an attitude. I was on my way to the airport and had all my bags and when we were being seated he told us to we could sit bar side. When my friend pointed out we had too many bags to sit there he made a smug remark. Also when he bused our table I heard him complaining to another table that he doesn't make enough for the "meager" tip we left.  We left close to an 18% tip for a meal that was about $22 so his remarks were unwarranted and rude. 

But yea this place is pretty quaint, with outdoor seating. Probably wouldn't go on a rainy day because the inside is really small. Also there are a bunch of cute signs leading to the bathroom with instructions how to get there and remarks about bathroom etiquette.
author: Jenelle B.

description:
I was looking for a quick hearty lunch and running short of time. Service was great. Called my order in and it was ready for pick up in around 10 minutes.

I ordered the Cheeseburger and Fries it was delicious. Had a side of fruit salad which had a lot of variety by the way (nectarine slices)!

Overall I will return for other items on the menu to review
author: Naja W.

description:
Come early or be prepared for a wait.

I came here on ac Sunday morning for brunch with family and waited about 20 minutes for a table. There's not much seating inside and a couple of tables right out front. 

The beignets are what brought me here and they didn't disappoint. They were light, airy, fluffy, and not greasy like other places. 

I wasn't that impressed by the rest of the food though that was brought to the table. The home fries were burnt and lacked flavor. The grits looked even worse than the instant stuff. The pancakes I ordered were okay. I was expecting a little more than a couple slices of fruit though. Lastly, the coffee could use some improvement.

Our server was friendly and refilled our waters without having to ask. While I wouldn't come back for their brunch menu, I would come back for their beignets.
author: Steph F.

description: Good breakfast.  Even a convenient little urban park out front which is great since there's normally a wait.  The beignets are awesome, the breakfast food is delicious and the staff is friendly.  Can't ask for a whole lot more.
author: Brian O.

description: Definitely a nice little chill spot. The breakfast burrito was fresh and tasty. Enjoyed it!
author: Adrian S.

description: Friendly, fast accommodating service staff in a homey diner type environment. They serve up a variety of hearty breakfast eater fare. The beignets are supersize. I just had scrambled eggs which were fine perfectly with longanisa sausage which was yummy. I chose the grits as a side and not wanting more carbs like biscuits or toast the server offered to add cheese to the grits. Unfortunately the grits were horrible. I expected creamy served on the side of the eggs and they were served in a rice bowl with the cheese melted on top. That wasn't a big deal but the grits were about the same consistency as a bowl of  rice and the melted cheese a bit leathery like it had been overheated in the micro.
author: Steven B.

description: This seems to be the place to go for brunch in dogpatch. Even on a rainy day, there was a line but we were seated quickly enough. Great food, good service (they did mess up our order but corrected immediately). The beignets are to DIE FOR!!! They are so light with just the right amount of powdered sugar (read A LOT!). I got the veggie omelette with home fries and they were gracious enough to sub the bread option with a small green salad on the side. Would definitely come back if I'm in the neighborhood. Really cute interior decor and felt like a hip local spot :)
author: Yin H.

description: Some of the best breakfast yumminess I've had in San Francisco. Dogpatch, for me, has only had Piccino & Hard Knox Cafe to grab my interest - well, I'm proud to add @justforyoucafe to that list. I did the Cowgirl. It has 2 pancakes (I did the cornmeal), 2 eggs (scrambled), link sausage - off the charts yummy.   Two others ordered the breakfast burrito and enjoyed their dishes equally as much - there was a "bit" of a wait, but the time chatting with friends and meeting neighborhood folk made up for it - my visit was on a Sunday 'round noon - if you haven't done so, check them out. It's worth it!
author: Nick S.

description: Delicious food, and great atmosphere. But $11 for a burrito that's less than 5 inches long??? Could leave you hungry...
author: Michael B.

description:
Excellent place tucked away in the dog patch. Friendly customer service and people from all walks of life. This is your neighborhood cafe. Locals and workers come here to distress and get some quality food. 

I got the eggs, chicken sausage, with cheesy grits. The eggs and sausage were average but good. The grits were a little plain but adding salt brought out more taste to the side. 

The beignets are delicious. Ours were a little overcooked, but still mouthwatering non the less. I this place would be a bring a friend out here to try out kinda place.

Looking to try out other menu options before I make a final decision, but for now it's a 3.
author: Nikole D.

description: I only 30 min lunch! This place has great service and definitely understands when you only get 30min to eat! Thank guys!
author: Puro V.

description:
Best brunch! Lovely neighborhood, delicious food, gracious service.

The scrambles are da.bomb.dot.com. I got Greg's with bacon, homefries, and cornbread. I love all the bread/side options. I didn't get grits this time but I appreciate that it's an option. Cornbread was SO GOOD! Homefries were also delicious. Portions very generous.

I had to try their famous beignets and it didn't disappoint. Very traditional cafe du monde-esque beignet with powdered sugar. Much more airy/lite than Brenda's. 

Just go to Just for You...it's JUST the best ;)
author: Semuteh F.

description:
The food is aggressively mediocre at best, and burned, stale, or induces food poisoning at worst.

The staff is exceptionally rude.  We ate pretty quickly, and then were chatting and finishing up coffee.  THREE TIMES within 10ish minutes, the same a$$hole waiter rushed up to our table and asked "Is there anything else we can get you on this beautiful day??!"  Not in a nice, helpful way.  He said this in an extremely aggressive, rude, and sarcastic way.  Ok, we got the message and will not take up your precious table for one second longer than it takes to scarf your nasty food down.  

If you're looking for a meal that's delicious, reasonably priced, and has wonderful service try Plow, Kitchen Story, Mission Beach Cafe, Sweet Maple, Mama's, Dottie's, MyMy, or one of the other numerous restaurants in SF that knows how to treat their customers.
author: Amber M.

description: Great neighborhood cafe. Does all the basics really well. (Avoid the chilaquiles, they are served as nachos...) Staff is very lovely and welcoming!
author: Urban S.

description:
I live this place. My vote for Best breakfast, biscuits, crab cakes and eggs. And maybe even grits. 

Bring an appetite, bring your friends so you can try all their dishes or even order a plate of benigts to share.
author: Olivia S.

description: My friend introduced me to this place in the Dogpatch neighborhood. The breakfast and brunch choices are aplenty. I ended up getting Fried Chicken and Waffles which were quite tasty. It was served with syrup. My friend got an omelette and her friend got the crab scramble. We all enjoyed our food. My food didn't seem overly greasy like some chicken and waffles. It kept me full for most of the day too. Prices are pretty reasonable. They have an outdoor sitting area so if you have a dog you can sit outside.
author: Amy J.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of brunch places in general but I thought this one was pretty decent, and I'd go back again sure!

The lines during the weekend can get pretty long but they move fast. My party of two was seated in about 15 minutes or so.

The food is typical brunch food with some southern flavors like grilled catfish thrown in the mix. They even have grits!

I got the eggs and bacon with grits. The eggs were okay although they needed some salt. The bacon was quite delicious and full of flavor. This was probably one of my favorite bacon pieces I've ever had in a brunch place! The grits were disappointing since they didn't have too much flavor - I didn't notice the jar of butter until it was too late, otherwise I would have put some butter there.

I also shared a side of beignets with my friend. The beignets look really big but the inside of the beignet is quite hollow so you're not really eating that much actually. It was still quite good and the powdered sugar is awesome.

The biscuits are fluffy and the scone was quite good, not too sweet. There were cranberries in the scone.
author: Danielle C.

description:
Ordered the Crab Benedict with fries and the beignets. The Crab Benedict was delicious and the fries looked more like country potatoes but without the bell peppers nevertheless it was tasty. The beignets were so fresh it just melted in your mouth. 

I ordered my food togo because it was raining and didn't want to wait in the rain. The person who took my order told me about 15 to 20 mins but it only took me 5 mins to get there and as soon as I walked to the cash register I heard my name for the togo order and it was ready!
author: MG D.

description:
I love this little spot in Dogpatch in SF.  I don't get to the city often, but when I do (and it is the breakfast hour) I head to this joint.  I usually have the eggs (add summa dem mushrooms and cheddar) but that is because I am a creature of habit.  They have SO MANY options and I really need to stretch myself and try something new...I will, I promise.  So, check those beignets! Oh yeah, I said it.  I take my GF (glutenease) pill and I GO FOR IT!  The dark roast coffee sets these little lovelies OFF and I am here for it ALL.

They have and extensive breakfast menu and you really can't go wrong with their egg dishes and the grits (yeah...grits).

The servings are generous and the service is consistently attentive and courteous.
author: Saundra D.

description:
Just For You is in the Dogpatch enclave, which is in the embryonic (ok maybe the 1st trimester) of gentrification that polished the shiny neighborhoods such as Noe Valley. The food & service & environment are a jewel, but not the shiny faceted kind, more the unpretentious smooth kind.  Just for You delivers honest goodness.

Ima fan of a missionary position breakfast: 2 eggs over medium, link sausage, toast. Throw in Grits and I am very happy. House made bread/toast is a culinary touch that sets a joint like this apart. Perfectly done, and tasty!

I LOL at some reviews: One reporting the "grits were ordinary", and I wonder if the reviewer expected them to be served flambe and infused saffron or truffle oil? One review reporting "Thought everything was standard fare cooked well", and I wonder if it is being compared to their imaginary visit to the French Laundry? Many reviews reporting "free" coffee refills are some sort of divine breakfast/brunch intervention (but, gotta admit the refills are a great thang)

Good news is no French or German tourists visit his joint, and it is amazingly free of the "goo goo, gaa gaa" crowd.
author: Matsuo U.

description: Came here for brunch the other day with a group of friends and was not impressed.
