First, our group of 6 waited for a good 30 mins and come to find out that the guy seating people seated another group of6 who came wayyyyy after us before us. Their name was like 6 names behind us. Went to the guy to point out his mistake and asked him why he seated that group of 6 before us when we've been waiting forever in the cold...and all he said was "calm down, it's just food...I'll sit you here next"  ughh. Such a rude response and didn't even apologize for his mistake.  this totally ruined our mood and our whole experience here.  Honestly, i didn't even want to eat here after that incident but we've waited so long and aina did not have a table for 6. After another 10 mins of waiting, we finally got seated. The guy finally apologized for his mistake but we were still pretty pissed with him. He gave us 2 free vouchers for the bienets but we were only able to redeem one. Lame but not a huge big deal. We all got the mimosa. I had the Greg's scramble with chicken apple susage which was amazing!!!! The grits were alright and corn bread was decent. Bienets were good but not out of this world amazing.  The chicken with waffle was not good, chicken was not crispy. I wouldn't recommend this. Our server was amazing! But was not happy with how we were treated by the other guy....what do you mean by "it's just food...calm down"?? No, when it comes to food, I will not calm down...not when it's brunch time in san francisco and not when I've been waiting out in the cold for 35 mins!
author: Caitlin P.

description:
Are you getting post-call brunch with your friends and wondering why Plow has a 45 minutes wait at 7:30AM in a Friday morning? Desperate to eat something that's delicious, easy, and within walking distance?

Just For You cafe seemed really just for us. But probably just for you, too.

I got the chili scramble, which was chili con carne perched on eggs, smothering cornbread. It came with choice of grits or home fries, and when I asked the waitress sheepishly if I could get cheese on my grits she didn't bat an eye.

My friends and I, in our sleep-deprived delirium, maybe spoke a little loudly and had a lot of opinions, but everyone was really welcoming and didn't shoot any dirty looks. The benefit of a place being slightly divey.

The food was great, the service was amazing, and I'll definitely come back for early breakfast again.
author: Rosy H.

description: 3rd St. area aka DogPatch area there is a gem of a place,although busy like they hand out feee food on sat. but after trying it wow I can understand! Quality and portion balance is perfect! I check pics for what I had but def a go to fav now!  Also service was Amazing! (Asian girl with short hair) A+++ Service!
author: Jay A.

description:
Found this place for breakfast due to great reviews.  I concur.  Love the atmosphere and delicious food.  Started out with the Beignets... You get 3 huge ones so prepare to share...or make it a meal.  Your choice.  Next i had the "Frittata of  the Decade". I opted for no onion but i think the spinach overpowered the zucchini, which is my favorite ingredient.  Still good, but would customize this one a but more in the future.  Great potatoes and the scone was so-so.  Tasted like they heated it too long in the microwave to be honest.  My friend had the raisin toast and that was much better.

Service was unorganized.  3 different servers rotated around and in the end, none of them wanted to give us our check until we flagged one down. I am pretty sure we could have easily dined and dashed (for you criminals out there reading this).  

Still, worth a return visit.
author: Mark C.

description:
Came here Friday 1/2/15 around 11am for brunch. First brunch of the new year. There was a wait but they had a Parklet out front with seats so it wasn't too bad. At most we waited for about 20 mins. 

I ordered the two eggs any style with grilled catfish/grits/biscuits. The grits were ordinary, nothing to write about. The biscuits looked undercooked from the color but they were surprisingly pretty good. The catfish wasn't flavored enough so it was pretty underwhelming. We also ordered three beignets. They were decent but not the best.

I most likely won't come back here again unless I need a place with easy access to parking...which is why I chose this place in the first place.
author: Tommy L.

description:
Beignets were really good! must order

Came on sunday for brunch. Had to wait about 35 min but totally worth it :)
author: Melinda C.

description:
Just For You cafe is a lesser known brunch place with very comparable southern-style food as Brenda's.  With my friend and I, we started off ordering individual beignets and LOVED them (can you say BOMB)!  They are very pillow-like: very fluffy, light, and airy, then dusted with powered sugar on top.  In our opinion, we felt JFY's beignets are better than Brenda's.  
 
Honestly, if you came here JUST for beignets and a cup of joe or tea, that's really enough.  But if you're desiring something more substantial, the chicken shiitake omelette is a good brunch dish: tender, white-meat chicken, sun-dried tomatoes, and shiitake mushrooms.  For the side (included) I suggest their creamy grits, which taste like Chinese-style plain porridge (baak jook), and their moist, home-made cornbread.  

2 people enjoying 2 egg dishes (1 benedict and 1 omelette), 2 beignets, and 1 cup of joe all for $40 tip included is very reasonable.  The overall food was good and staff was very friendly.
author: Jessica S.

description:
What a gem! I came here on a Sunday afternoon and waited less than 15 minutes to be seated. Our waiter greeted us so kindly and since it was our first time, he offered us a free order of beignets!

There's a good selection of food items on the menu. We ordered chicken and waffles and the pastrami scramble. The portions were just right! 

Chicken and waffles:  nicely fried boneless chicken. The waffles had a taste of cinnamon, but were a little soggy, not as golden with a slight crisp like I usually like them.

The customer service is why I would come back. Each server was super friendly and accommodating. Very welcoming environment :-)
author: Janet P.

description: Really cute cafe to visit. Serves really down to earth and tasty food! I wish that they had longer hours but it's always a treat to visit.
author: Sophia W.

description:
Not wanting to wait in line for Plow for over an hour, we decided to spend our Sunday brunch at Just For You Cafe which only had a 15 minute wait. For SF, that is really not bad at all. I'm not sure if it's a regular thing but each time a name was called off the list, the (male) host made the most ridiculous feminine "YOOHOO" sound to go with the name. It was strange, but funny. The interior is what you would expect from a brunch place, with a good amount of seating and a moderately noisy atmosphere.

I came here expecting great beinets, unfortunately they were rather disappointing. They were not quite as soft or tasty as I was hoping for.

What did surprise me was the special I ordered, which was a duck confit benedict. This dish was so incredibly rich (of course) that I thoroughly enjoyed it. My companion ordered a chorizo scramble which was good but not great.

Overall, I liked Just For You Cafe, but it was not necessarily something I would go out of my way to get. Perhaps if the lines are too long elsewhere this would make a reliable back up option. Thus, it is "A-OK."
author: Mark O.

description: i just need to get over how expensive SF is.  Two eggs, potatoes, bacon and toast is $12 in the city.  That's just the way it is.  So once I get past the prices, which are average for this part of the city, this place is a winner.  Great food and great service.  I love the beignets, the hangtown fry is awesome, and the New Mexico green chile sauce is a winner.  The service is friendly and attentive.  I would go twice per week, but in this area of Dogpatch parking just sucks.  I have had to park blocks down Illinois and hike.  Not their fault - it's just the neighborhood - I don't visit Dogpatch Saloon or Hard Knox as much as I'd like either.  I hear it's even worse on the weekends.  Anyway, JFYC is highly recommended.
author: Ken P.

description: Charming little place. Only had a shrimp caesar salad but it was delicious. This place reminded me of little nyc style diners. Fantastic small neighbourhood spot, staff was extra friendly...everyone.
author: Derrick J.

description:
So, -1 star for the worst experience getting seated, +1 star for all the humorous signs inside and outside.  
The food is a solid 4 star!
This was my second time at the cafe.  The first time I had very mixed feeling about the food, and I am not sure I have more "clarity" after my second time here.  The beignets are really good, no doubt about that! For the rest, the portions are very generous and I like the option to get grits instead of fries, adds character.  But there is no too much flavor to the food.
We had two (!) special omelets - chicken avocado, since the rest of the menu seemed a little intimidating to the guys.  I opted for vege frittata, which was really generous on the vegetables, but I felt it could be much better if it had some herbs in it. Home fries are a must have! 

So, get the beignets, get the fries... everything else is optional :P
author: Marianna K.

description: Delicious!! The food here is fantastic. I've tried the French Toast and Chorizo con huevos and both were amazing. The only thing that sucks is that they have a small kitchen so even if the place looks empty you'll have to wait a bit for your food. But the staff is really nice! I will be back for breakfast
author: Isabel O.

description: Came into this spot for actually my second time today.  I never get Sundays off, so I was really lucky to be able to make the trip over from Oakland to checkout their fried chicken benedict!!  I was hungover as shit, so getting on my bike and making the journey didn't seem like the right (or sane) thing to do, but it had to be done!  Let me tell you, I am so so happy that I endured the journey, because this plate and the overall experience was on point!!  That and the service was most definitely top notch!  It was also really great the first time I went there.  I'm lucky to have a reason to be in this neighborhood every week!!
author: Mel O.

description: get the beignets, so damn good. all made hot and fresh, best in san francisco. its a small place that serves up a big delicious menu. The brunch menu is solid, fantastic portions and a good price. For brunch in san francisco i think it was on the cheaper side. the size of place is a bit tight but its worth it for the food.
author: Peter P.

description:
Best Brekkie we had in SFO! The Greg Scrambles was one of its kind! The mix of bacon and eggs and spinach was awesome! French toast was beautifully displayed and taste good too! 
Grapefruit mimosa accompanied by regular coffee were a Marvellous combi too!
author: Angelina A.

description:
For $12, I was expecting their BIG BREAKFAST BURRITO to be a little... BIGGER?

For what I could get for $5 at Martha Brothers Coffee, I just got charged Market Street prices for a regular Burrito. 

Feeling a bit shorted here.
author: Matt T.

description: Favorite brunch spot in SF! Service is always on point and almost always smiles (minus one lady who never appears to be having a great day). Head line cook is a frigggggen magician and it's worth sitting at the bar on weekends just to watch him work.
author: Matthew T.

description: I went here on a busy Saturday afternoon and got a seat fairly quickly. I was curious about beignets as they seem to be mentioned in every review and I didn't know what they are. Glad I tried them. My bleu scramble was pretty good too. Their cornbread is heavenly.
author: Gaurav V.

description:
Situated near 3rd Street, which seems to be the only restaurant-filled strip in the Dogpatch neighborhood, Just For You Cafe deems itself as a homey, comforting, and friendly spot that's perfect for weekend brunch. Although they have a couple outdoor tables and a parklet, there's isn't much of a view.

They serve standard breakfast dishes, but their sugar beignet is the real star. Advertised as "light, fluffy New Orleans style donuts smothered in powdered sugar", their beignets fit the description well, and they were the main reason I wanted to give this place a try. The slightly crunchy edges and fluffy, but chewy center make this deep-fried goodness a sweet breakfast treat, whether it's by itself, accompanied with a cup of coffee, or before a more savory meal.

The Crabby Bennie consists of two Creole crab cakes on muffins (or toast), topped with two poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. The crab cakes were good, but there weren't any large chunks of meat, giving me the impression that it's canned. The hollandaise sauce was thick and creamy. But the poached eggs were overcooked; the white had fully set and the yolk held together and wasn't runny at all. It was a huge disappointment, because they advertise their eggs as "poached to perfection". But they were FAR from perfection...

House potatoes were seasoned very lightly, but not enough because they were still a little bland. I needed to add some salt and pepper and dip them in ketchup in order to finish them.

The service was very friendly and food arrived promptly. The cafe is relatively small, seating around 25-30 people. But there was no wait when we visited on a Saturday afternoon, an hour before closing. Overall, Just For You Cafe is a decent breakfast spot, but there aren't a lot of unique options on the menu that would urge me to return.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Extremely fast and friendly service. Very kid friendly. Our waitress suggested the huevos rancheros with hatch chilis and it was really very tasty. Their poached eggs and bacon were Perfect. I wish their coffee was a little fresher/stronger but we were there at noon so maybe we got the bottom of the pot. The ambiance and food were so fantastic, that the coffee wasn't such a let-down
My daughter loved her very first pancake and devoured (meaning dropped most of it on the floor) her fruit salad. 
OJ was excellent!
author: Rachel L.

description: Great find for breakfast. The beignets are amazing. And join t the start. I had the biscuits and gravy. Very good. Around the table were various iterations of lluevos rancheros and other egg dishes. A great place to "break the fast" and start the day. The benedicts are only served on the weekends.
author: Tara B.

description:
My friend from the South Bay decided he wanted to come up to see me in SF. I definitely told him to choose a place since he never comes to the City. This place was his choice since it was close to Caltrain. 

I have been here before but decided why not to try it again. This time around we decided to get beignets to start with (to share) and I went with the chili scramble. It was so good. I mean I love a good egg dish wth chili on top and cornbread. The cornbread was dense and held the chili and scrambled eggs well. The chili was a bit spicy with some great flavors. Definitely enjoyable. 

Overall it's a nice decent wait but the food was amazing and well worth it. 

Pro tip: beignets!
author: Nina Y.

description: I love LOVE JFYC! Nestled in the heart of the Dogpatch neighborhood, the location couldn't be better. Within walking distance from Potrero Hill, Mission Bay and SOMA. The place has a down to earth, homey vibe and the staff and decor are very entertaining (if you visit, you will know what I mean)! Not to mention: their brunch fare is classic and consistently awesome. The servings are solid and you will never leave hungry. Get the beignets and don't miss out on the grits. The beignets are out of this world!
author: Liz O.

description:
It's rainy, it's cold, and you are still recovering from the hangover from last night. If that's the situation you are in, do yourself a favor by coming to Just For You Cafe. This would be the best decision you've ever made.

Big ass beignets swamped in powdered sugar, crunchy French toast bathed in sugary syrup, poached eggs sitting on top of Cajun sausages and house-made white toast, plus a cup of hot, strong coffee, what else could you ask for?
author: Joseph L.

description:
Great little neighborhood breakfast spot which gets packed if you don't get there early.  After several tries to eat here, we decided to come right when it opened and we got in no problem.

The staff was super friendly and helpful.  We started off with the beignets as we had read about them.  Tons of powdered sugar and very messy but worth it.  We got our son the Mickey Mouse pancake with strawberries and he loved it.  I got the bacon blue omelet.  I've never had blue cheese in an omelet before and it was a great combo.  My wife had the ham and swiss frittata and enjoyed it.  Her favorite part was the biscuits.

A great spot for families if you get there early.
author: Blake B.

description:
Centuries ago I worked at Colossal Pictures, an animation house on DeHaro. As I lived in Oakland, the only way to beat the (horrific) traffic was to get out of bed at 6, hit the road by 6:30 to cross the bridge by 7:30. As the studio opened by 9, killing time was important. 

The original Just For You was a tiny, single counter hole in the wall that exuded warmth, great coffee, great breakfast, hot coffee, and amazing beignets. It was a second home for me. 

I was heartened to see the new place, and see that the owner had expanded not only the space and continued the funky ambiance, great food, hot coffee, and yes, amazing beignets. Always a treat.
author: Antonio T.

description: LOVE this place! Food is SO good! Best brunch in SF! Worth a trek to the Dogpatch!! Awesome staff/service, I especially like the "you-hoo!" guy that seats everyone!
author: Kristin R.

description: I've been coming here for years for their beignets mostly. Just had my daughter go in and pick up an order in her pj's and she apparently didn't hear the owner Arienne Landry say excuse me twice. The 3rd time the owner said loudly, 'Did I stutter?!' My daughter being raised to respect her elders just apologized and let it go. While this owner continued to heckle her in front of the customers. I just called her myself and her response was, 'well MOST teenagers don't respond to her respectfully and THATS why she responded as so. Then she mentioned that my daughter was in pjs and how that's tacky. I'm asking ALL yelpers to discontinue support. The one star is for the employee that was nice.
author: Fia S.

description: So worth the wait if you have a chance to go here. I had the special which was a smoked salmon eggs benny. Fantastic. I will have to return for the beignets!
author: Allie L.

description:
I've been a customer of Just For You since the early 1890's. Maybe the 1880's, been so long it's hard to remember for sure, going back to when it was up on Potrero HIll, before it moved to Dogpatch and helped make DP the destination hood it is today.

Simply a great California style American diner. Fun decor - great concert and movie posters, and it took me (because i'm so quick) a long time to recognize the fake bear in the back of the photo with the woman stealthfully holding the enormous fish (look for it!). 

You can get huevos rancheros, which are very different from the usual but have a quality of its own, and you can ask for Hatch green chile sauce, from a town in New Mexico, which has a subtle flavor and kick, or more standard red. Lots of great dishes such as the Greg's Omelettes, Crab Cakes, Breakfast Burritos, Cowgirl, and many more. I'm not a coffee drinker but i hear people always being asked if they want light or dark roast - and i often get the Organic Carrot Apple Juice, as flavorful as it is healthy.

Very flexible on mixing and matching side dishes. Great lunch specials. Amazing homemade soups you could write home about. Intelligent, engaging, fun, smart, sophisticated, very experienced manager and staff. Famous for their Beignets. Very cooperative on to-go orders, large or small.

Owner is a real for-real chef, who after owning and operating for years, finally found that manager she can trust and even takes vacations now (well deserved). The chefs and cooks on duty are great, and they've been educated in cookery and recipes by her - and the breads, including Cornbread, are fresh-baked on location by a fresh baker baking freshly. 

And the customers are also smart and friendly. It's a great neighborhood spot but the kind where I also bring friends and family from out of town.

You can sit in the intimate and quiet area in back, in the lively and sometimes noisy front, or outside. 4-seater counter service, too. There's also a parklet with comfortable benches. Open until 3 during the week, to 5 on weekends.

Four Pro Tips for the price of one - 

(1) There are 2 bathrooms, not just one, the second is small but private and all the way in the back.

(2) "Crabbie Bennie" on weekends (Eggs Benedict with crab, very rich, but very good).

(3) Speaking of crab, try their Creole Mustard if you order crab cakes.

(4) Whole fresh loaves of bread, baked onsite by their own baker, available to take home.
author: David G.

description:
We live in the neighborhood and this is the best place for breakfast/brunch. Great service and food. Favorites include the BLT, pancakes, Huevos Ranchero's and homemade chorizo. 

Go early or be prepared to wait. If you do have to wait, it is well worth it!
author: Mary S.

description:
My girlfriend and I were originally going to go to Serpentine for brunch this past Sunday, but the Cowboys game ran late and we missed our reservation. Instead, we walked across the street to get brunch, cuz by this time, it was almost 2:30pm. 
The cafe is pretty small, and is decorated with ads from the 70s and 80s. Pretty cool Austin/hipster diner feel. I liked it. The servers are nice and they do their job very well.

The food is a little underwhelming though. I got the specialty scramble with turkey, avocado, onions, and cherry tomatoes. It was bland and really, I could probably cook a better scramble than that. My girlfriend got the smoked salmon benedict, which was better, but still not spectacular. The potatoes that came as a side were really really good though, and the cinammon raisin toast was also very well done (though slightly thicker than I think toast should be). The best part of the place was the pint-sized mimosas that only go for $8!

Decent place to go to, but really nothing special. Just stay at home and cook the eggs yourself!
author: Zi-on C.

description:
I am a tourist outside of my neighborhood.  This is a local joint.  After all, why would a tourist venture to a neighborhood called "Dogpatch."  Yet I never felt out of place.

Wonderful food.  I initially chose this place for the hot Beignets and Chickory coffee.  I needed my New Orleans Cafe Du Monde fix. Good call and much closer than Bourbon street.

This is a very simple restaurant with cool posters on the wall and character oozing out the door.  There is no full time hostess, just a signup list hanging on the front door--meaning they are sustained by neighborhood regulars seeking good food, not by single visit tourists.
author: Robert D.

description:
Friendly services! Big mean! The portions are huge to share with others! Love their juices too!
Been there few times with friends, they all happy with it. And the beignets are just the best
author: wing c.

description: My favorite place for brunch. Hope it was closer to Berkeley. Never had to wait in line, and the service time was realtively quick. Love the eggs.
author: Zunaid O.

description:
I came here on Saturday with a group of 4 around 1:30pm. We waited for about 10 minutes, so not too bad. We ordered the beignets, which came out pretty quickly, but we also ordered other dishes, which we had to wait around another 30 minutes for, which is kind of a bummer because I was realllly hungry. Aside from the slow food, service was excellent!

Beignets (4/5) - Not as greasy as other beignets I've had, which was nice. Delicious and sugary.

Two Eggs (Fried - medium) with Creole Crab Cake (with Home Fries and Biscuit) (3.5/5) -  The crab cake wasn't my favorite (it was kind of creamy? not sure), but the home fries (crispy) and the biscuit (nice buttery inside and crumbly outside) were great. As expected, the eggs were standard.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
Just the Place.

My first impression of Just For You Cafe is that this restaurant must be quite popular.  When my brother, mom, and I arrived on a recent weekday morning, we discovered the place was packed both inside and out.  And it was no surprise to find other customers ahead of us eagerly awaiting a table.  Thankfully we only had to wait about 10-15 minutes for my brother's name to be called.

We were seated at a "community table" for 6, where a party of 3 had just finished.  The other diners greeted us with a friendly "Good Morning!" as we sat down.  The friendly server dropped off our menus and took our drink orders within minutes.  

FOOD:
1.  The Cowboy:  My mother's choice.  She decided to treat herself since she couldn't recall the last time she had French Toast.  This dish is also served with eggs and a choice of link sausage or bacon.  She chose poached and the sausage.  Suffice to say she loved her food as there was only ONE piece of French Toast left on her plate in the end.

2.  Greg's scramble with chorizo:  A medley of eggs, spinach, onions, garlic, with parmesan cheese added to the mix with a choice of meat.  My brother chose to substitute fruit instead for the home fries ($2 more).  I tried some of the scramble.  He chose well as it was delicious!

3.  Two eggs any style with Longanisa (Filipino sausage):  I can't ever remember having longanisa for breakfast at all.  Period.  And that's how I knew I had to choose this dish.  Served with eggs sunny side up and breakfast potatoes.  Good portion.  Delicious breakfast!  Very filling.   I probably would have eaten all of the potatoes and the entire piece of cornbread if I had more room.  

NOTE:  Egg dishes come with a choice of toast, biscuits, English muffin, scone, or cornbread.

SERVICE:  Excellent.  All staff who helped us provided wonderful customer service.  I thought the bus boy was efficient in seating customers, clearing the tables, as well as greeting and thanking customers.  I found the server to be friendly and patient, which I truly appreciated.  He gave us enough time to look over the menu, provided coffee refills throughout our meal, and came to check up on us periodically.

side NOTE:  I noticed some of the staff greeting other customers by name...I imagine this must be a well-known/popular neighborhood eatery.

BOTTOM LINE:  Great food.  Terrific service.  The friendly neighborhood restaurant.
author: Michael C.

description:
I'm a huge fan of eating breakfast out -- like a little mini vacation!  I had heard about this place from several people, including a couple seated next to us at the Kabuki watching "Chef" -- they told us the Beignets were the best they had ever tasted outside of the Cafe du Monde in New Orleans.  

We got there around 9:30 on a Sunday and waited about 20 minutes, but when we had finished the wait looked more like and hour.  What a great place!  Lots of energy, really interesting crowd, and fun art on the wall.  The service is terrific -- I always love breakfast places where just as you take your last sip of coffee, they're magically at your table to refill.  

And the food! Of course we tried a Beignet and it was unbelievable --so light, sweet, and delicious.  I had what seems like a simple thing, but I'm always amazed how few restaurants get "two eggs over medium" right -- and they did -- cooked them perfectly!  Add chicken apple sausage and home fries to that and BAM!  The husband had a breakfast frittata which he loved and grits (his favorite), which he said were cooked exactly right -- another dish many places miss by a mile.  

I love this place -- it's taking its place on our favorite breakfast places list!
author: Lisa W.

description: I'm a bit surprised by the top reviews here. I got breakfast for lunch - eggs scrambled with vegetables, cheesy grits, and cornbread. I have no complaints, but I wouldn't go back- I thought there was nothing special about it. The food is a bit pricey for what it is (came out to $15 with tax and tip).
author: Marianna M.

description: Fresh beignets, homemade bread and dishes with a Louisiana twist. The menu includes a funny message about grits in the margin that I'd hate to ruin for you, so you'll have to find it yourself when you go there.
author: Montserrat V.

description:
Just for me, i was disappointed.

It seems like Just for You is resting on it's laurels. Ate there today, and nothing was as good as i remembered from a eighteen months ago. Service was spotty, food was so-so, coffee was old, and beignets were doughy. 

This used to be a great neighborhood find, but i guess too many people found it.
author: Ben D.

description: I love this place. I ate breakfast here, had the creole crab cakes, potatoes, cornbread and an order of beinnettes. So good, this place hits the spot if you want fresh baked bread and some comfort breakfast. Prices are so reasonable. I would definitely come back. I couldn't take a picture because I pigged out and didn't care at the time to take pictures.
author: Myra H.

description: I had the Creole crab cake sandwich on rye.  Funny thing is the bread is twice the size of the patty but everything else was on point.  The sandwich was really flavorful, complete with lettuce, pickles, and tomatoes (I think).  It was about $10.  I would definitely order again.
author: Melinda Y.

description:
Three sets of dirty utensils, hair in my coffee cup, particles in the vinegar, 30 minute wait to get food even though they endeared us in 15 mins. 
Once food did arrive it was terrible. I got the Greg scramble, there was no egg and too much cheese, the home fries were a charred. My husband got the Bleu scramble, overwhelmed with vegetables and no egg. Also the biscuit was very doughy. Overall not worth it and it hey have a big cleanliness problem.
author: Perizieh K.

description: This place is a neighborhood institution. The food is great and the service is always friendly. If you're ever in the Dogpatch and are looking for a meal this is a great bet and is well worth the wait if there is one. I'm personally a big fan of Nery's chicken salad sandwich, and the french toast is my breakfast go-to. Don't forget to get the BEIGNETS!
author: Raphaël M.

description: Scrambles (Greek and Greg's) were excellent and so was the Crab Benny!  Good service too.
author: Jon G.

description: Cozy little neighborhood breakfast spot. Will definitely come back. They make the simple dishes taste amazing. And the beignets are delicious!
author: Albert M.

description:
Can I give this place a million stars??? Omg, it's legit one of my favorite places to eat in SF! I think I found this place on Yelp while my boyfriend and I were looking for breakfast spots.

Parking can be a total pain in the ass, not gunna lie. Circle a few times and you'll be fine.

Anyways, as we walked up, we noticed a bunch of people outside. We realized it was busy and would have to wait. Let me just tell you, IT'S WORTH THE WAIT! I think the longest I waited was MAYBE 30 minutes? But that was on a weekend during brunch sooooo...

Ordered some beignets and they blew my mind! SO GOOD with raspberry jam! :P their food is also super on point. Very delicious.

This place is a gem and you won't be disappointed!
author: Danielle B.

description:
This is a great place to grab a good brunch in Dogpatch. The employees are very nice and the food is well priced for the portions. We got the huevos rancheros, Cheries special, cornbread, and beignets. Beignets were my favorite and everything else was delicious. 

Try to get the outdoor seating as it's great on a beautiful day!
author: Akshaya V.

description:
I love that place. 
Food is the best.  
Service is amazing.  Funny servers.  
The only things. Weekends. 10 am. Huge line.  But I can understand why.   The food is the best.   My favor place in San Francisco.   

Will continue visit here weekly
author: Yali Y.

description:
Such a great find for us. Thanks yelpers! This place has excellent customer service and when there's a wait you know the food is good. 

We had their poached salmon eggs Benedict special with potatoes. Yummy and the portion was huge. Also tried their fried oysters which was very flavorful. Their beignets are good, I've had better but theirs isn't bad at all. Can't wait to return next time we are in town to try their other items.
author: L N.

description:
Three stars for A-okay. Came here because it looked super packed one weekend, so decided to come back on a weekday to see what all the excitement was about, no wait then, seems like a popo's go-to bfast stop. Got the two eggs over easy, bacon slices which were not crispy but thick solid slices, chose grits with cheese--can't go wrong with grits, and whole wheat Just For Me artisanal homebaked toast. It was good, wouldnt go buy and bring a loaf home or anything though (that is an option). Also tried the chili which came with cornbread, tasty, nothing to rave about, tastier with some hot sauce. French fries were mediocre, waiter recommended that over the home fries. Took a bite of the Buttermilk Fried Chicken Sandwich which the waiter recommended over the Po-Boy Sammies, claimed the chicken sammie has an interesting/different flavor, but IMO it tasted ordinary..did come with large slices of pickle though! Last but not least, beignets were mediocre, a good beignet should be good without  needing any toppings, but it tasted so much more wondrous with the side of jam and maple syrup. 

Service was fine, comparable to typical diner service. Lots of variety on the menu, definitely something for mostly everyone. Nothing tasted bad, it all tasted alright or good.
author: Anna S.

description:
This place was really efficient, had really good food, and great service.

Will go again
author: Matt U.

description:
This is my go-to place if I'm craving breakfast but don't want to go through the hassle of finding a place. It may not be in the best neighborhood, but once you're inside, you wouldn't know it. I ALWAYS get a beignet from here, no matter what time of day it is. Words cannot explain how good it is, but I'll try: tons of powdered sugar with the perfect crunch on the edges, and soft like a pillow. But don't let the white layer of sugar intimidate you! You can always scrape it off if the amount isn't to your liking. With it though, omg, each bite is like heaven.

I usually get their eggs benedict, until I came on a weekday and realized those are only available on weekends. You can imagine my sadness when the server told me this! But, I knew they wouldn't disappoint so I got one of their other items instead. I can't remember the name, but it came with eggs, sausages, cornbread, and grits. I've tried their grits with cheese, and I admit, it's BOMB. Their cornbread is also to die for as well. The eggs and sausage were nothing special, but the eggs benedict is buttery delicious.

If you come on a weekend after 9AM, be ready to wait for a table. Parking is also a bit of a hassle since it's located in a residential area, but your stomach will walk out of there satisfied.

Happy eats!
author: Daisy Y.

description: I went here for the first time today, and I loved it. The crab cake eggs Benedict had such a good balance of flavors - each bite was never boring. The hollandaise was delicious and acidic too. I felt that the home fries were a tad under seasoned, but that is far better than getting overtly salted foods. I am definitely curious to come back to try their chicken and waffles, as well as grits.
author: Nathan K.

description:
Stopped in for brunch after a workout with some of my gym friends over at Arena Ready on 25th and Connecticut, so we definitely came hungry and ready.  There were 6 of us, and at around 1pm, the wait wasn't too bad for a big table to hold all of us.

I don't know about you, but there are certain days where I'll work out and then right after that think to myself, "you know what? I'm going to eat my face off. yeah."  Saturday was definitely one of those days.

Being that most of us try and eat healthy (Paleo!), you'd think something like beignets would be out of the question.  False. We got two orders of those light, fluffy, delicious and heavenly donuts for each person to have (3 in order) their own.  Absolutely incredible, and almost as good as Cafe Du Monde's version in NOLA.

After those came out, everyone's dishes came out, including my eggs and chorizon scramble with a side of grits and tortillas. And then a strange phenomenon happened...the entire table went dead silent.  3 of us had the chorizon and eggs, 2 had an omelette special, and 1 had an order the oatmeal pancakes.  Even if you're not a grits fan, get the grits.  Even if you're not a huge egg fan, get the chorizo and eggs. I promise you won't be disappointed.

Service was ok, they were able to split our check by individual (which is seriously so awesome!).  A side order of bacon got forgotten until the very end, and we had to ask for more water, more butter, and hot sauce throughout breakfast.  All in all though, not a bad situation.

This was probably my first time eating at a place around here, and I honestly loved it. Given where the gym is, we'll probably be back very soon.  I can't wait, especially for those beignets!
author: Lisa I.

description:
This is seriously the cutest little cafe I've been to in a while. Let me start by saying their Reuben Sandwich is just.. wow. I've had plenty of Reuben Sandwiches but this has got to be my absolute favorite. The customer service there was amazing from walking in to walking out. As soon as I walked in the very respectful host asked my sister (who is 8.5 months pregnant) and I to please sign the waitlist that's outside. No problem with us. He called us in after not that long of a wait and immediately engaged with us and congratulating my sister on her pregnancy. It's funny because you can tell when people are being nice because they need to know, or when they're being nice because they're genuinely nice people. It was SO genuine. After being seated (it is a bit tight in this cafe, and from what I've noticed it looks like it gets busy often. We went there on a weekday for brunch and it was pretty packed) we were taken care of by a lovely waitress who checked up on us at all the right timings. What really got me was that the general manager was walking by and greeting everyone and really helping out his team. I thought it was overall a great experience in the cafe and will definitely go again. Possibly make it a usually brunch place. 

PS: They have a variety of delicious mimosas. Pint size for cheap. Seriously, GO!
author: Melanie P.

description:
Great place!  I work a few blocks away and this is one of my "go to" spots.  Breakfast all day, delicious corn bread and friendly staff.

fav dish: pork chop and eggs
author: Mike B.

description:
Came here for the first time the other day and apparently this is a very popular spot that people enjoy coming to eat. I wasn't sure want to expect but I was expecting something pretty good since it was the talk of the town. 

The place is very small and there is limited seating both outside and inside. The staff are pretty nice but you can't really tell who works there and who doesn't because they don't wear uniforms or anything. So that was a bit confusing. We got pretty lucky and got seated rather quickly and we brought waters. It was so busy that it took our waiter sometime to get to us and order our food, which was disappointing. 

I ordered the eggs with veggies and cheese and potatoes. Our food too about 20-30 minutes to get to us, which took longer than expected considering we didn't order very much and what we ordered shouldn't have taken that long to make. When we finally got our food, it wasn't what I was expecting. There was dry cheese on top, melted would have been better. The eggs didn't taste like anything and the cheese made it worse. The potatoes were also dry and didn't have a taste to it at all. I was very disappointed and expected something better. 

I don't plan on coming back to this place anytime soon. Food needs more taste and the customer service could have been a bit better and quicker. The parking around here is also terrible but then again that is SF for you - always terrible parking.
author: Anne R.

description:
4 of us went for brunch and we all loved it.  I got the eggs + catfish fillet, the hub got the oatmeal pancakes, Nick got the scramble and Miriam ordered the Benedict.  Wonderfully yummy yummy all away around.  

Since I can't eat wheat, I particularly favored the wheat-free toast option.  I wanted the fluffy biscuit, or the scone, or the cornbread (all of which looked FANTASTIC), but I held myself back.  

Beignets arrived at the table quickly, were hot and steamy, and the other 3 said they were delicious.  Tasted like a donut thy said.

The wait for a table was maybe 5 minutes.  Super fast. (Saturday around noon)
author: Terrie G.

description:
The most anaemic huevos rancheros perhaps I've ever had the disappointment to eat. Almost no beans.  No heat to the sauce.  Very little cheese. 基本的に物足りない。
But the house dark roast coffee was quite good.
Scrambles all come out rubber bullets... I suppose you could ask for them medium rare... but that would be silly!  Better to err on the foodie side (soft eggs and choice coffee) than on the flyover state side (rubber bullets and folgers instant)
author: Josh K.

description:
Honestly came here because PLOW was a LONG wait! However... Gold mine! Chill chic staff, open air seating and some patio! Prompt and smiley service! Food was yummy (was super hungry, so cardboard would have been great)! My friend didn't feel as though her scramble was amazing, yet not bad. Potatoes were on point and homemade bread... Yum! The grits were yum, but I like grits. Maybe an acquired taste LOL! 
I would return for sure, try something different!
author: Catherine W.

description: Stumbled upon this place and it was so awesome. Everything was delicious and fast and the mimosas were giant
author: Al T.

description:
Returned here for brunch recently with the hubs, so he could have his biscuits and gravy. I, on the other hand, decided to try a little something new - namely, the chili scramble. Let's just start by saying that I literally inhaled this dish. It was THAT good. Unfortunately, I didn't get to finish it, since I was stuffed and the portion was pretty massive.

So what is this chili scramble? Imagine two (not one, but two!) large pieces of homemade cornbread topped with an egg scramble, and then all doused in chili! Brilliant. 

It was the most satisfying, homestyle, hungover (and I wasn't even hungover) brunch that I've had in a long time. 

P.S. Come early or be patient. It's a small establishment with only 8 tables inside and a small outdoor parklet.

P.P.S. Don't even think about leaving without getting some powdered sugar on your face. ;)
author: Mansi A.

description:
This is one of my regular spots. Everything is always so good and service is always on point. Whatever I decided to try I end my meal with a beignet which is a soft and fluffy pastry serve with sugar powder on top. 

Over all- good food
Good service 
And really affordable 
Never had to wait more then 20 mins to get a table.
author: Chiara M.

description:
Awesome place. I love these independent food places that cater to it's neighborhood.

I would rather much eat here than any other chain places.

I had the dungeness crab cake sandwich..did I spell that right? My partner in crime got the huge hamburger. I think my meal was better hands down. 

The huge beignets, definitely the highlight of the meal.

The best I've had in California so far.

Well, if I'm in the neighborhood, I would come back for another crab sammy.

The waitress was great..very sweet and funky fresh.
author: Vince N.

description:
I've had lunch here before and ordered a chicken salad, admittedly a boring choice for a place like this. But I was feeling guilty about my order of 3 beignets and a side of cornbread. 

The salad was ok. Something I could have whipped up myself at home. The beignets were warm and yummy. I'd come back just to have them (which is what I did today). The cornbread was bland and feel apart with each bite. I had to douse it in butter and maple syrup. 

If you are craving beignets call in a takeout order to skip the long lines here on the weekend!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Best breakfast in the area! Their Beignets are to die for!
Whenever I go to a new breakfast place, I always judge them by their Biscuits and Gravy. OMG! The flavor in the gravy, and the fact that the biscuits are home made, YES!!!!
Kids are welcome! The servers are really nice! I couldn't ask for anything better!
author: Kim V.

description: How did I never notice this place?! There's so many new restaurants near 3rd street and I'm excited to try them all! Anyways, my friend and I came here on a Saturday morning. We got here around 8:50am, close to 9. The wait wasn't too long luckily..about 5 min or less? We put our names down and there was a spot opening right away. My friend and I both ordered 4 beignets to start with! They were so fluffy and warm when we got them. I was kind of expecting to have something inside but plain was still good. For our main dish, we both ordered the regular egg benedicts over english muffins and a side of country potatoes. Yum!! It was very delicious. The waitress was super nice and checked on us few times to see how we're doing. The only reason why I am giving it a 4 star is because parking can be somewhat hard to find but nonetheless, I'd definitely would be back here since it's close to my house!
author: Monica W.

description:
I don't even know where to start this review. Honestly one of the best breakfasts I've ever had. I've been to a bunch of different places across the country, and this place takes the cake out of places I can remember.

Obviously, the beignets rock. Powdered sugar donut-like things that are like little flakes that melt in your mouth. Hand-kneaded by God. I'm convinced the sugar is cocaine, but I'm not sure. As far as breakfast goes, try the corn bread, chili, and egg scramble. Sounds odd, but it's an unreal combination with some hot sauce to boot. Trust me.

If you don't like, message me and I'll pay for your bill. I back this place up 100%. Definitely a must-try if you're in SF.
author: Sam A.

description:
I came here with a friend because the place we originally wanted to go to was closed lol. We walked in and we were immediately greeted and seated right next to another party (basically sharing a table), but I didn't mind. Everyone eating there was super friendly and it basically felt like a community dining table haha. The restaurants small and filled with a bunch of cool artwork that my friend and I made conversation on while waiting for our food to come out. I ordered the cowgirl with bacon and man...those buttermilk pancakes were heavy!! My dish was nothing all too special, but we ordered beignets which were pretty bomb. I'd say I left feeling satisfied enough walking out of here

(Also if the main bathroom is occupied, the one in the back is a tiny stall with a sink located right outside of it, kinda ehhh)
author: Chelsea P.

description:
Worth the wait on weekends for sure! Where else can you get beignets like this in San Francisco? So good!

Extra love for the mimosa pints, it's almost as good as the bottomless variety. The huge glass doesn't require a constant refill this way.

Eggs Benedict is perfect, just don't do a split plate unless you want a breakfast snack vs. a breakfast meal all to yourself. Won't make that mistake again :)

My only slight criticism is the grits, they are not something I would recommend. They were gummy and bland. Not creamy, buttery or rich like I've had elsewhere. Home fries are a much more detectible option.

Other than that, Just For You hits the spot on just about anyone's brunch palate.
author: Abby S.

description:
I came here today for brunch and truly enjoyed it! The wait was not too bad- we only waited for maybe 5-7 mins. 

We had the beignets first! :) 3 for $5.45 --- we kinda underestimated it, because we thought it'll come small-- but their beignet size is quite big! No regrets though :) 

We enjoyed our food here --- look at the pictures! :) I would definitely come back!
author: Emil J.

description: The fried chicken sandwich is my go to! On white bread with extra well done fries and ranch. Love the service here- very friendly staff. Also the beignets are a must have!
author: Courtney C.

description: Loved the first time I came here. Great food and ambiance... then we met the owner. A place that has a sign in the window that says 'we have the right to pour coffee on your cell phone'- which I initially thought was cute- has the audacity to say to a patron 'just remember chivalry is dead' when he try's to hold the door open for the owner WHO IS ON HER CELL PHONE standing in the alcove of the restaurant, not acknowledging the gesture until she thinks it wasn't given - has got some nerve.
author: Claire F.

description: First time trying this place today. I've heard great things so had to finally come try it. There wasn't any wait to sit and not too busy which was great. We got seated and took our order but then waited about 30 min for food! Way too long for some eggs and pancakes mainly. My friend got eggs, pancakes, and chicken Apple sausage. It was all amazing. I had the 2 eggs with sausage, biscuit, and a side of gravy. Only complaint was the long wait for food!! And also the gravy wasn't very great. Seemed sorta thin and not too flavorful and rich. Won't get that next time but would come back again.
author: Emily F.

description: Brunch here is wonderful! I had NO IDEA the Dogpatch was a destination! There are many places here for brunch and there is always a wait. Who knew! The guy that announces your table is a complete trip! You have to go just to experience this genius! He's so entertaining. The food is yummy too. I ordered a biscuit instead of English muffin for my andoulie Benedict but it came with an English muffin so I just didn't eat it. The French toast here is to die for. My date gave me a bite (carb light these days)!
author: Sherie R.

description:
This little cafe was the bees neez!! The beignets are delicious!! They are huge and if you intend on eating after them then don't eat a lot! Lol 

This cafe is quaint, very friendly staff and a hip, trendy total SF vibe... Loved it!
author: Laura F.

description:
Glad to find another nice brunch spot in my neighborhood!

The best thing here is you can call ahead for your table - no need to physically show up to be added to the wait =).

Total was $32 including tax/tip for 1 side & 2 dishes, a good brunch for two.

Service was great, until the end of the meal when we had to try really hard to flag our server down to get the check. Then he took forever to pick it up (I could have sworn I made eye contact with him a couple times as he came to the tables to our left and then the one to our right..) so we just walked up to the register and paid there. I made some offhand comment about not being able to flag down our server and he came to the register and rang us up, was really nice and apologetic. I felt bad.. I hope I didn't get him in trouble with the manager or anything.

* Beignet ($1.85) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/just-for-you-cafe-san-francisco?select=wbcd21iniDKuFcOMVPqqvw#wbcd21iniDKuFcOMVPqqvw
Although this looks big initially, it's actually filled with mostly air (in a good way - so it's not super heavy of a starter). It's light and has a good slight crisp to it.

* Tofu stir fry ($10.50)
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/just-for-you-cafe-san-francisco?select=wbcd21iniDKuFcOMVPqqvw#IvO3okMwGAmFWNy_y4v06w
Didn't get to try it but my friend really enjoyed it!

* Greg's scramble w/ chorizo ($10.75) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/just-for-you-cafe-san-francisco?select=wbcd21iniDKuFcOMVPqqvw#H0YKOoLF4jnJRTMUjh_F2A
The eggs were fluffy and soft and the chorizo was wonderful. The wheat toast I got on the side was kind of hard.. I later saw someone with corn bread (which I love!) and was sad that I didn't know it was an option. I got the grits, which were soft and creamy but really really plain in flavor. You gotta really love grits for grits' sake, otherwise this was pretty bland.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
My friend recommended this place for beignets, so I decided to try it. I ordered the beignets to-go, but also ended up with the greek scramble (without olives) with home fries & wheat toast. 

The beignets were the best I've had in SF to date! They taste great & the texture was what I remembered having in New Orleans. I had to get got extra powdered sugar though cuz 1 of the 3 was sugared only on a corner. And that same sad beignet with minimal sugar was simply a pillow. A deliciously deceiving exterior with one huge air pocket interior.  :(  

The scramble was ok. It had olives which I asked them to omit. The taste was good, texture wasn't to my liking. For some reason I expected diced veggies, and crumbled feta, but there were large slices of onion & huge chunks of tomato & feta, scrambled with egg that I could barely tell was there. My 2 yr old nephew could have done that. 

The potatoes were off on taste & texture, (try the potatoes at Plow!) & unfortunately I got full from the beignets and didn't get to try the home made wheat bread. But it did look & smell great. Maybe their specialty is in the breads???

I'm going back for beignets, especially since its close to the house in a lighter traffic area. May have to be seated & try a different breakfast next time.
author: M P.

description:
Cute little cafe in Dogpatch that's known for their beignets..and oh my, I was NOT disappointed at all!! It was light and delicious. I would recommend putting the maple syrup on the side and dip the beignets in instead of pouring it on to keep it from getting soggy.

About 10 minutes from SFO airport so we went there right after we landed this weekend and even though it was raining, that didn't stop us. There was no wait when we went so we got seated super fast.

Great food.
Friendly service.
Nice ambiance.
Street parking.
author: Sarah J.

description:
My assessment: Brekkie on steroids.

Powdered puff of dough - BEIGNETS.

Eggs, eggs, eggs and some more eggs.

Frittata with a lotta ANDOUILLE SAUSAGE.

Hand me the SRIRACHA please.

Southern fixins with a hunka hunka slab of cornbread.

Cheezzzzy GRITS (nommers)

COFFEE - IV DRIP.

Plenty o'parking in the Dog-patch.

BTW did you know that Dog-patch = many dogs and outdoor seating?

SCORE!  Less than 10 minutes of waiting in line at 10AM.  WIN BIG!
author: Hiromi N.

description:
I've had Just For You on my radar for a little while.  Luckily for us we decided to go to Rickshaw Bagworks down the block spur of the moment Sunday afternoon.  I was getting kinda hungry but we didn't want Piccino again and we weren't in the mood for Hard Knox.  So we decided on Just For You and got to the cafe around 1:30.  Surprisingly there was no wait.

The lady taking our order didn't seem too chatty or suggestive, I think she's the cashier or something.  Our waitress checked in on us occasionally, but she like everyone else except for the attentive and friendly bus boy seemed reserved.  He ended up getting the crabby bennie and I got the special salami frittata.  We also chose to get a beignet each for us to start with.   

The beignets were $1.80 something a piece or 3 for $5.  They were served pretty quickly and were just served warm.  They were huge and  not so dense.  He thought he detected a little bit of liquor in the batter.  I like Brenda's French Soulfood's crawfish and apple beignets more but JFY's plain beignets are less filling due to the lightness.  Their plain (only flavor) is also more enjoyable than Brenda's.  His egg was cooked well as the yolk oozed out. The crabcake was a creole crabcake which had a nice little kick to it.  The hollandaise sauce was an after note and the potatoes lacked flavor as well.  I felt that there wasn't too much crab in his dish either (lot of filler in the crabcake0.  He felt that it's hard comparing it to Zazie because their bennies are so good.  I was a little taken back when I saw my frittata because I thought that frittatas are supposed to be pretty fluffy (it's been awhile since I had one).  It was chocked full of salami, bell peppers, tomatoes and Swiss tho.  Potatoes were the same with mine though the hot sauce did help.  I love how they give you a choice of about 5 different brands.  Mine also came with my choice of toast so I chose cinnamon raisin, gotta love that option.  Though I noticed a little bit of green on one of my pieces of toast.  I believe this was some avocado from the flat top.  I'm not allergic but could you imagine if someone was & they didn't properly clean their flattop or something?  Both of our dishes were $12.95.  Even tho his had crab in it, was it worth it, no?  I think we would have had a more satisfying brunch at Hard Knox for cheaper.  Hard Knox does over bacon and eggs for brunch but JFY does have an edge with being the only traditional breakfast place in the area.  Sad to say, I think the beignets were the highlight.  Our meal wasn't bad but it was nothing special.  There are other better options out there.  Our average meal here totally makes me miss Nini's in San Mateo!  Three at best.
author: Cat C.

description: It was an extremely long wait for an alright food. At first there was a long line, and we were okay with that because we wanted to try the food. Eventually we were seated, but then after that, we waited a long time to have our orders taken. And then we waited close to 40 minutes for our food to arrive, making our wait a total of 1+ hour. After the food arrived, we were so hungry that we thought anything at all would taste incredible at this point.... except not. Both our house potatoes on our plates were burnt and bitter, and everything else may not have been too bad but not so amazing that we would go through the wait again. The service was good, other than the wait. Not going to come back again though.
author: Winter L.

description:
Get the beignets!! You will be eating soft, powdered sugar pillows of goodness. Everytime I come here with the boy, it's our main objective brunch + an order or beignets!!

Brunch I can't complain about. But then again i tried the frittata and loved it. It has a good amount of cheese, eggs and veggies. And it's cooked to perfection. 

The boy always opts for the scramble or Benedict and he always seems to love his meals. its always perfectly cooked. The amount of food they give you is humongous. We can never finish our meals. 

Definitely coming back here again!
author: Stella J.

description:
This seems to be THE brunch spot in the Dogpatch. They have a large brunch menu. I ordered the huevos rancheros. The sauce is supposed to be HOT, and as a plus, they offer a vegetarian version. Mmmmmm, it's not hot, but it's thick and they're not stingy with it. Unfortunately, it's a lil' too tomatopastey for me. Ranchero sauce should be loaded with onions, garlic, and tomato chunks (my mom still makes the best I've ever had). The tortillas weren't fried and crunchy, so it left me feeling like I'd just eaten a lazy version of huevos rancheros. On the plus, they hooked me up with egg whites and massive amounts of cheddah for this dish, service was polite and efficient, and we got to sit outside and take in the hood. I'd go back to try something different, but not any of their Latin offerings.

My fav brunch spot in this hood is still Serpentine.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
Nothing fancy or innovative here. Just good, solid breakfast. A bit of a wait though as the cafe is small-ish. But like others have mentioned just head on over, grab some coffee across the street and relax until your party gets called. 

Their beignets (covered in powdered sugar, fluffy and fresh) are what they're known and for good reason, too so do not miss out on those!

Friendly servers to boot. No complaints here!
author: Esther A.

description:
Hubby and I went Friday late morning,  no wait. :) in short- Great service(!) and yummy food. 

Details: We had beignets,  churrizo burrito and the cowgirl brrakfast. Beignets were so delish. Fresh,  light and airy. Pancakes were fluffy and perfectly cooked! I had a bite of my hubby's burrito, it has a spicy kick (yum) and was so flavorful. I had the Sunset mimosa,  ,(cranberry and fresh squeezed oj) very refreshing &came in a large glass :) FYI absolutely so phone reception in the back part of the restaurant (not sure about the front)
author: Denise L.

description:
I absolutely loved this place! I have checked out a few other brunch places in SF and this is definitely one of my favorites! 

I ordered the crab bennie... if you love crab cakes and egg benedicts, definitely try out this one! it was so delicious! You can also customize what you want on the bottom of the benedict! It doesn't have to be the typical english muffin if you so prefer. The dish also comes with these soft potatoes that taste delicious alongside the benedict. The yolk of the benedicts oozed out as I cut through the benedict. Usually I like my yolk more solid (not pastel yellow but jewel-y yellow), but I still really enjoyed my dish! I usually have never finishes both egg benedicts.. but this was the first time I did. IT WAS THAT GOOOOD. or maybe they were smaller portions? NOPE, definitely the former because I was so full afterwards haha. Also got the beignets. I LOVE THEIR BEIGNETS HERE. I have tried beignets only one other time, and these beignets blew them out of the water. Obviously I don't have much to compare to but they were soo good... Each beignet is a square shape, large, fresh, warm, fluffy.. and topped with an ample amount of powdered sugar! 

The service here was really good as well! My server took her time to answer any questions I had about the dishes and was very helpful.
author: Sandy Y.

description: Probably the best Huevos rancheros (with Hatch green chili sauce) in SF. Beignets too! Wait is a bit of a grip on weekends but worth it.
author: Rex L.

description:
Excellent beignets!!!! crunchy and buttery around the periphery, light, airy, and yet still this wonderful chew quality on the inside... done right. Dipped in 100% Vermont maple syrup from the countertop squeeze bottles, I learned how not to snort the powdered sugar by skimming with a tine all of it off, and then re-dipping little pedacitos of the beignet after wetting with the syrup....($1.65 ea. or purchase a plate of them)

That was how it went down the hatch, folks... 

SPLENDIDLY. Nice, super friendly Guatemalteco who helped serve and seat me actually gave me a little card coupon for free beignets next time I'm in (definitely going to take my family).

My $10 pork chops and over-medium eggs for lunch came accompanied with super duper on-steroid biscuits!!! (had to try and bag 'em, cuz had to save some room for that PeeWee Herman-sized Nawlin's nosh!!!!

What a ridiculously cozy place... down-home and lovely. Sat at the bar where I could watch the action from the non-stop working cook who turned all of the orders into ash, he was moving like lightning. So consistent, and yet so fast too, swigging Cokes in between orders.

Love it here.... what a great little place for lunch.

PS Lots of love put into their homemade breads for sale, including an ever-so-popular cinn raisin I spotted. One can see all of the loaves baking near the cutesie historic restroom! Loaves run about $5-6.
author: Jana C.

description: Good food, crowded but good service still. The amount of food and taste for the price was worth it. I ordered the crab Benedict and it came out cold so that put a damper on the meal, but the flavor and quality was still there and I still enjoyed it. The egg was a little underdone for a Benedict and still had a bit of raw egg white inside of it. Despite all that, the crab cake was seasoned well and they had one of the best hollandaise sauces I've had in a long time. I would go back based on the value, I like leaving a place full and that mission was accomplished.
author: Gina B.

description:
I really liked this place.  The first time we went, my husband and I decided we finally had to try it and waited for about an hour.  Now days, the weekend wait has definitely lengthened.  The wait outside can be awkward so we usually walk around the cool neighborhood and discuss how insane prices have become.  Our first time was really memorable.  We were seated at a communal table next to two hipsters couples discussing how they "have really gotten into scotch" and how "it is such an expensive hobby".  I miss those days.  Now, the tables are filled with techies and every conversation sounds like a job interview or pitch for a kickstarted.  

The oyster omelet is really good, but you might not want to try it when you are recovering from a serious hang over.  First time, my lesson was LEARNED.  It was still good though.  Their beignets are a nice little addition any meal.
author: Jessica H.

description:
The french toast was below average.   Perhaps not soaked long enough?

Sausage and eggs were fine.

Oj was good.
author: Michael E.

description: amazing food and service and everything is just great. Free coffee on weekends outside!
author: Michael G.

description: This is my new breakfast place! I had the biscuits & gravy, & a side of longanisa (Filipino sausage). Everything was delicious. The service was excellent. The ambience was laid back, comfortable, & fun. I can't wait to go back!
author: Maya A.

description: I love the beignets here. They also have great breakfast. When I was pregnant, I loved the French toast here and I was full after with plenty left over. This place is great. But You can't being the whole family. I suggest no more than 4 and you may have to wait. But it's worth it. Great food!
author: Helani H.

description:
Cute little cafe out in the growing area known as the dog patch...be prepared to wait as the list tends to get long.  The servers work quickly to get you in and out...we waited around 30 mins for a party of 3.  

Parking is great...street parking everywhere!  I love how they had a coffee pot out front for those of us shivering in the rain...but no cups!  I saw peeps just going inside and asking for some...good business gesture.  

We started off with the beignets that I read about review after review.  They were pretty good...soft, fluffy, fresh...covered with powdered sugar.  No complaints there!  

Our breakfast entrees weren't so special.  I ordered the red flannel hash...corned beef hash with beets, eggs, and your choice of bakery item.  They were out of scones and biscuits...so I chose cornbread.  Nothing was really super memorable...except the cornbread...which I'm still craving.  Yum!  

Wifey ordered the hang town fry...there were a few good sized oysters...but it was pretty mushy.  The cornbread was the highlight again...but sadly, the grits weren't so fantastic.  

BFF ordered turkey sausage patties with eggs and cornbread...she actually texted me today saying she wants the freakin cornbread again.  Haha.  Other than that? Hmm...meh.  

I get the hype...new neighborhood, homemade cooking...fast service...is it the best breakfast in the city?  Probably not.  But decent enough that I might possibly return again...as long as the wait is bearable.  

3 stars...solid.
author: Jen W.

description:
Alright, I'll admit. I did in fact bus all the way from Outer Richmond to Dogpatch just so my Hangtown fry (scrambled eggs with bacon, onions, and FRIED OYSTERS) craving can be satisfied, after watching Bobby Flay make some on TV the day before. I couldn't believe I really did it but I'm glad Just For You Cafe didn't disappoint.

I waited for about 5-10mins because I was by myself, but expect to wait at least 20-30mins on weekends if your party is 2+. This place was buzzing with people when I arrived. The menu was quite extensive - pretty much whatever you want for breakfast. I would've ordered their infamous beignets if I were with friends. Coffee comes with free refills but is only mediocre (thus minus 1 star) BUT my hangtown fry was awesome. They let you choose whether you want your fried oysters on top of your eggs or folded in.

Perhaps what will make it 5-star for me would be: better bread, a little more flavor in my eggs and maybe let it be a tad undercooked (oysters were perfect), perhaps a bit of sweetness to the bacon, and of course better coffee. Coffee definitely needs to be improved.

Service was great.
author: Jackie C.

description: I ordered a veggie and tofu stir fry with no oil and a side of home fries. They offered to sauté the tofu instead of frying it and made it custom just the way I like it. It was flavorful. The servers were polite and quick. The portions of the entrée and side were enough for a light healthy meal for my fiancé and I. Great experience, great service, healthy, nutritious and quick.
author: Morris G.

description:
This place was recommended by the girls at Rickshaw. 

We weren't sure what to order but with very helpful suggestions we grabbed a Rueben and a Crab Cake Sandwich on their own made bun. 

The unlimited refill Iced Tea and the Abita Root Beer rounded off a delicious lunch. 

Super friendly service combined with delicious food gives you a winner.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Was in SF for a weekend and my friend recommended this place for brunch! A group of hungry patrons had already congregated outside upon our arrival and the wait for us would be 45 minutes. It was better than the 2 hour wait for Plow's up the street, though!

Time flew and our name was called. A server tended to us immediately after we were seated, so we ordered 3 beignets (3 for $4.75) to start and our beverages. OMG, these New Orleans style beignets were soooooo good! This place is famous for them! Generously sprinkled with powdered sugar, hot, fluffy, airy, and so soft! Loved the taste and the texture!! Great way to start our meal.

I ordered the Greg's Scramble ($9.95): 3 eggs scrambled with spinach, onions, garlic, and topped with parmesan cheese. You get a choice of mix ins, and I decided on mushrooms and zucchini! I asked for slices of avocado too, which cost an extra $2.50. My order came with grits & two slices of dry toast. Everything was great...no complaints at all!!

Delicious food, filling, good portion sizes, extensive & cool menu, very friendly & professional servers, & of course, the BEST tasting beignets I've ever had!
author: Juliet Rachel C.

description:
Like most people, I think, I came to try their beignets.  We took them to for dessert after our picnic of sandwiches.  However, I couldn't resist and took a bite as soon as we got in the car.  They're huge!  And pretty yummy!

The food smelled so good when we walked in to order that my husband wants to go back.  Can't wait to try their other stuff.
author: Rose A.

description:
We had plans to sit down and enjoy brunch here but time constraints and illness conspired against us on this mission.  We instead ordered carry-out and we were happily surprised with the quality.

First, the folks on the phone and ones who provided the food during pickup were super-nice, very friendly.  The place had a bustling, warm neighborhood vibe; just a big open main room with a bunch of 2-tops and 4-tops, and a few outdoor tables on the sidewalk.  

OK, back to the food: it was really good.  My wife ordered the "Frittata of the Decade: (A slow-pan-fried Italian omelette with zucchini, mushrooms, onion, garlic, spinach & tomato, topped with cheddar cheese.).  I had a taste and agreed with her that this was a somewhat epic creation, really good blend of ingredients and not greasy at all.  I had the "Greg's Scramble" (3 eggs scrambled with spinach, onions, garlic, and topped with parmesan cheese); their version of the Joe's scramble.  I had it with ground beef and it passed, really good savory scramble.

We look forward to returning there for a proper sit-down brunch but good to know they don't seem to dip if you're grabbing the food to go.
author: Saminda W.

description: Very friendly staff, and a cute little outdoor waiting area. We were offered free beignets to agree to sit outside, as the inside was packed, and it wasn't a very warm day. The beignets were huge and delicious, and sitting in the sun warmed us up. We got eggs benedict and biscuits and gravy. Both dishes were very tasty, although the biscuits and gravy were a little too heavy for my boyfriend, so he got up to take a quick walk. :P
author: Alysha V.

description:
I've recently discovered the Dogpatch area and so far have loved all the places I've been. My good friend lives in nearby Potrero Hill so we rolled out of bed on Sunday morning after late night Halloween partying and headed to the popular Just for You cafe. There were around 10 parties on the list before us but it took only 20 minutes to get seated. In the meantime, they kindly served up hot coffee in paper cups. There is a new "parklet" area to sit in outside... super cute. 

Everything on the menu sounded good but I opted for the Greg's Scramble (eggs and spinach and Parmesan cheese) with bacon - extremely yummy - with grits on the side. The grits were served plain (and as such were pretty bland) but they tasted fine to me. Also, the service was fabulous!

I definitely will be back to try other items on the menu such as the Hangtown Fry (Oysters, Bacon, Onions with eggs) and grapefruit mimosas served in pint jars. And maybe, just maybe, I'll go BIG and get some of their famous beignets. Nom nom nom.
author: Wendy N.

description: Was in the Potrero/Dogpatch area for work and stopped by Just For You Cafe for lunch with a coworker! The staff was incredibly friendly and definitely made for a wonderful dining experience. I had the buttermilk fried chicken sandwich (pictured) and my coworker had the crab poboy. Both were excellent! I didn't get a chance to try the beignets but heard they were awesome!
author: Teresa C.

description: This was a nice little greasy spoon diner with character. Off the beaten track - I had never heard of it. Kind of loved my cobb salad. The turkey on it was GOOD.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Five reasons to love Just For You (and to go out of your way to Dogpatch for it):

1) Grapefruit mimosa. I think this is my favorite mimosa, period. It uses fresh squeezed juice (ie there is still a stray seed or two at the bottom), the proportions are spot on, and it's freaking delicious. At $9 a glass it's not cheap but you do get a pint!

2) Huevos rancheros. It's not a Mexican restaurant but I think their "meat sauce" huevos are the best I've had in SF. 

3) House-made bread. Also includes gluten-free, very fresh, very delicious.

4) Beignets. Lots of people write about these, so I'll skip the description and say they will serve them to you while you wait!!!

5) Relatively short wait. It's tiny and popular but this restaurant is aggressive about keeping people moving  and while that is annoying for the brunch lingerers out there, it's great if you love great brunch and would rather eat quickly than wait forever.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
We came here early today when they opened,  to avoid the lines.

Ordered Beignets and the veggie frittata. Delish!

I, however, did not care for their coffee (and I'm a huge coffee lover). Our waitress wasn't very forthcoming when I asked what type of coffee they serve. Oh well....

I would return for their Beignets.
author: Janet T.

description: Solid spot for breakfast, we usually go there after our crossfire class. I love that they have a wide selection of options... we've tried a few things off their menu and it's all been great: Greg's scramble with chorizos, chili scramble with corn bread to name a few. It's also nice that they have some outside seating so we can go with our pup. Also pricing is very reasonable.
author: Shirin O.

description:
Dropped in after a visit to Rickshaw Bagworks just down the block. The CEO highly recommended this place and its beignets and a quick Yelp preview confirmed this is usually the case. So I walked in for a late lunch and got a bowl of clam chowder and a beignet. The clam chowder came red, and I thought perhaps they had made a mistake and given me minestrone or tomato soup instead. I didn't say anything though and proceeded to slurp away. It really was clam chowder! And it was absolutely delicious! I like it better than traditional creamy clam chowder served on the coastline. Hearted.

As for the beignet, I think there are enough reviews about that, and I agree with the positive ones. These beignets are huge, one was definitely enough for me as a dessert, which makes sense given they are over a buck each. Like Jana S., I use my fork to push all of the powdered sugar onto the plate, then start eating a section at a time, folding the powdered sugar into each bite. By the end I had actually consumed all of that powdered sugar...possibly not the best idea in the world but soooo good. =P
author: Esther Y.

description: My husband and I absolutely love brunch. Especially in the city. Just for you cafe absolutely takes the cake! I was in the mood for some New Orleans style beignets and this place did not disappoint. The staff is incredibly efficient and so friendly! A man named Netti greeted us and made our entire breakfast experience perfect! He gave us 3 free beignets right when we sat down. We will definitely be returning soon.
author: Mary Claire D.

description: Excellent! Being from Louisiana, I was so happy to find a breakfast place that served Community Coffee French Roast with Chicory, which is all I drink at home. The food was great and the employees very friendly. Would love to meet the owner sometime and share some Louisiana/New Orleans stories.
author: randall r.

description:
It's all because of YOU."


When R&B singer, songwriter Ne-Yo penned these words, I think he was either talking about the Beignets or the Hangtown Fry at Just For You Cafe.

I believe where ever I am, it's important to try all the indigenous foods of the area.  But one indigenous dish I have never tried despite being born and raised in San Francisco is the Hangtown fry.  Here's my brunch:


Beignet:  comes out hot as Irina Shayk on the cover of Sports Illustrated.  Fresh, doughy, sweeten by the powdered sugar.  I got powdered sugar all on my hand.  And I don't care what you guys think, I licked it off!

Hangtown Fry:  What a enduring combination.. Like Cream Cheese and Lox on my bagel or Jada and Will Smith.  I can't help but love these combinations together.  Oysters, Bacon, Onions all mixed in with eggs.  The legend is that the Hangtown Fry was originated in Placerville and became popular here in the City.  Nothing less than genius.  

Gravy & Biscuits:  As Ernie McCraken said in the movie Kingpin:  "You're on a gravy train with biscuit wheels!'
