Because of this Cafe I found a favorite dish in the Hangtown Fry.  Just For You Cafe,   I know it was "Just For Me".  But... "It's all because of YOU".
author: Michael L.

description: It was a cute cozy restaurant. Food was good. Had to wait long. It's a know local eatery
author: Rose A.

description:
I ordered a plate of 3 beignets ($5): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/just-for-you-cafe-san-francisco?select=Snb667neu1i4hKMh4T_z0g#Snb667neu1i4hKMh4T_z0g

They are phenomenally good.  Worth a trip just for these.  I've had beignets at maybe 10 restaurants, including Cafe du Monde in New Orleans, and these are the best by far, for 3 reasons: 1) they are super light and airy.  It's 90% air inside.  They are not dense/leaden.  2) super flavorful.  It's almost a glazed donut flavor.  3) great texture.  It's a little bit like a popover in terms of perfect level of chewiness.

The cafe is New Orleans themed, and they have great chicory coffee.
author: Scott F.

description:
The sun was getting on with its day at 10:30 am.  We put our names down in pen on the clip board hanging on the restaurant window out front.  Thankfully and luckily we had beat the breakfast rush. 

The host yells our names and adds a Yoo-Hoo flare at the end of them, our table outside is wiped down and we're immediately served coffees in retro mugs with a wonderful green pinstripe trim line around the top.

A double order of the brisket eggs benedict with a side of home fries, our food arrives shortly after. 

The eggs are perfectly poached and soft to the touch with yokes breaking upon pushing the fork sideways down.  The hollandaise sauce is wonderfully creamy and dense.  The generous portion of brisket has a perfect amount of savory salty goodness that one can only wish for this early in the morning.  The perfect amino acid snack. Last the english muffin sitting at the base was wonderfully soft and easy to break up with the provided steak knives.  

The home fries hit the spot wiping up the decadent hollandaise yellow egg yoke concoction. 

Our waiters and waitresses were on point with coffee refills on an infinite loop.  

A perfect Saturday morning breakfast in San Francisco at the Just For You Cafe.
author: Andrew T.

description: Food here is good with a variety of good breakfast/brunch options and plus an awesome beignet makes this place a whole lot better. At one point in my life I was on a hunt for good beignets and out of all the places I've been to in the Bay Area, JFYC is hands down the best! They serve them hot, pillowy, bathed in powdered sugar and it's so good and surprisingly not too sweet. Wait staff is inconsistent. They were great the first few times we came and other times were really slow. The place is small with funny little signs. They have a bar area for single (party of 1) person dining in. Expect the wait to be long but the beignets is worth it. If you have a stroller leave it outside or in the car.
author: Ardielyn F.

description:
5 stars for their beignets, 3 stars for the rest of their breakfast food.

I've previously raved about the beignets so I'll use this review to describe the rest of their breakfast items.  I ordered scrambled eggs and they were neither creamy nor fluffy.  It seems they were going for creamy but slightly overcooked the eggs so they were starting to go dry.  My grits were dry, clumpy, mushy with no grit texture, and underseasoned.  I was underwhelmed.  The biscuit was huge!  But it was halfway between a biscuit and a dinner roll.  I like my biscuits flakey or crumbly, and these biscuits, although impressively tall, were neither.  I think their recipe needs more butter. ;)

All that said, the service is great and Just For You is definitely a happening spot to get your brunch on.  But I'm personally just going to stick with their amazing beignets....
author: Beatrice W.

description: It was just NOT for me cafe.... while our attempt at another brunch failed due to long wait times... we called to see if this had a long wait. 30 mins, sure that's wait-able. They offer free coffee but it was a roast that I did not like. I do like ritual coffee's latte but not this. Anyways, beignets were almost brunt & served to us. There was nothing special about it... a donut would've sufficed. It was big and no flavor. The breakfast options left me less in desire. Upon my wait, I had to decided what to get and surely it was a tough decision. Not because everything was good but because my ass is indecisive on this. Dear god, don't get buttermilk pancakes (they look delicious upon service but once you put it in your mouth it goes all downhill) way too much salt. All the maple syrup in the jar ain't gonna help. Needless to say, I did not enjoy my brunch. Nothing soon out and those sausages were kinda salty.
author: Ann L.

description: Cockroach on wall, cranky waitress. My coffee cup was empty multiple times before it was filled.  No thank you.
author: Kim T.

description: I remember awhile back I came here. I only remember that I thought their food is good. There's a wait but no big deal if you're in good company.
author: Ange G.

description:
I have a certain place in my heart for Southern food (if you knew how often I went to Hard Knox, well...), so needless to say, I was pretty excited to find out there was another place in Dogpatch that served up Southern food, and with a brunch menu to boot [ Photo: http://instagram.com/p/YYgrINQfr6/ ]!

But while their beignets were quite tasty and affordable (albeit a tad heavy, so order sparingly), their entrees (I got the corned beef hash, while my friend got a scramble) were average at best, and overly salty at worst.

So, while I don't necessarily see myself coming back for brunch often, I definitely see myself coming back for the beignets!

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - A cozy little restaurant, but with seating spaced out well enough that accessibility shouldn't be a huge problem for people.

Bathroom - Didn't check them out, so I can't comment.
author: Johnny W.

description:
my three friends and i came here on new year's day, hungover and craving some damn good brunchage. for a party of four, we ended up waiting about 45 minutes. luckily, it was sunny outside and there are a few benches for waiting people to loiter around and sit on. note to the waiting people - do not sit on the stoop directly adjacent to the café, because you will get severely reprimanded by the tenants who live there, as i definitely did. it was a great start to my 2015! the workers are friendly and will serve you coffee as you're waiting. parking was relatively easy and not too much of a struggle.

i ordered the greg's scramble ($12, 3 eggs scrambled with spinach, onions, garlic, topped with parmesan cheese. i chose the version with chicken apple sausage), and we shared an order of beignets. the beignets were delish! soft, fluffy, and coated in so much powdered sugar that any attempt to eat it cleanly resulted in a powdered sugar snowfall around the table. greg's scramble was delicious as well, and I chose home fries and a huge hunk of cornbread as my sides. i couldn't finish the whole thing and ended up taking the rest to go, but it was so delicious that i ate it for dinner as well and still craved more!

it was a fun experience! i will for sure be coming back, with the same appetite and without the annoying hangover!
author: Caitlin C.

description: This was my first time in the Dogpatch area, and had decided to stop here with my daughter after a local midday acupuncture session. The place was very inviting, casually comfortable, and we sat at a nice table for two on the sidewalk. The server was friendly and prompt. The lunch menu had a good variety of sandwiches, po-boys and a several entrees that looked appealing. My daughter had the Reuben, which she found to be one of the better ones she's tried; unfortunately, I was not as lucky with my choice. I opted for the crab cake po-boy, a featured item. It looked fabulous - two generous cakes on a soft white bun with fresh tomato and lettuce. The flavor of the crab cakes was ok,  but maybe they forgot to fry it?? With the first couple bites, the nicely shaped cakes turned instantly into piles of mush that squeezed out all sides of the sandwich. It was a mess to eat and the texture was very unappealing. Was this a mistake by the kitchen staff? I can't imagine they could be so proud of those crab cakes, which were the worst I've eaten. Ever. I would come here again to try something else, or for breakfast, but being a visitor from Colorado, that's not likely. My advice is to give them a try, but avoid the crab cakes!
author: Chris B.

description:
Pros:
- beignets were SO FLUFFY omg so good
- chili scramble = corn bread + soft eggs smothered in meaty chili THIS IS THE BEST
- mmm potatoes (not crispy, but soft and still delicious)
- quick weekday service

Cons:
- the backroom dining room is dimly lit and feels dirty
- difficult to find parking

Bottom line: delicious non-greasy diner style brunch. I can't stop thinking about the chili scramble and how soft those eggs were. I can't wait to return and show this place to everyone I know.
author: Jiann M.

description: Keeping my rating at a 5 for the brunch, but would probably give it a 3.5 for dinner.  The oyster po boy was kinda disappointing, but the curry deviled egg appetizer was just awesome.  I would totally come back here for dinner just for the deviled eggs.
author: Simon L.

description: In a city full of restaurants that only see you as a number, this restaurant sees you as a member of the community. The staff is very courteous, EVEN WHEN BUSY! They are cracking jokes and smiling. The food was phenomenal. Next time I am back in San Francisco I will be coming here. Count on that.
author: Russell L.

description: Visiting the bay and came here as a yelp recommendation for breakfast, and the gluten free pancakes and French toast of course. The service was exceptional and the food delicious. I ordered the veggie fritatta with home fries, the cheese made the meal and home fries wete perfectly spiced - definitely recommend. We also ordered the gluten free oatmeal pancake and French toast - delicious!! I would highly recommend and come back.
author: Tessa E.

description:
Just For You Café's freshly fried beignets are made "just for me". 

Yes, just for Matt G!

Not for any of you!!

I've been to this café in the Dogpatch area a few times. And all the café's dishes are really good. But the beignets are definitely to die for. 

For $4.25, I get three fried puff pastries with powdered sugar topping. Maple syrup is also available and adds a bit of sweetness to the pastries.  

Beignets: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/N6z0so39b9fzGi8UWzI1Ww?select=zUw1Dqb9hVasRjplfiD66A

The owner is from the state of Louisiana and decided to bring the Creole fried pastry and many recipes to San Francisco. I have been to New Orleans and have eaten the fresh beignets from the Bayou's finer café's/restaurants. But I find this café's version is just as good as any New "YAR-LIN'S" café's.

I came on a weekday and it's not crowded at all. 

Weekends are definitely busy. 

Yelp-sticker posted on the window and definitely one of the hottest businesses!

My bill: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/N6z0so39b9fzGi8UWzI1Ww?select=p5gjwcISe7Hv-GpEjzyFRw
author: Matt G.

description:
You definitely have to come here to get the Beignets!!! They are pretty large in size and well worth it! Warm, Fluffy, and sweet! One per person is definitely satisfying if accompanied with another dish! 

The rest of the food is good, but not much different from any good brunch place! The house fries are well seasoned and crispy on the outside! 

They get really busy on Saturday mornings, but the service remains good! Although it may take a little bit of time to get the check/order taken, they make sure to constantly check up on you to see you are liking the food! This is a small place with a homey feel!
author: Michelle H.

description:
Regular ol' traditional diner breakfast. Except they serve the same recipe for Nola's famous Beignets and Coffee. 

Not impressed, don't go out of your way for bfast here unless you're having a craving for beignets and chickory coffee.
author: Jess C.

description: This is sooo good! One of my best friends took me here with our other friend and found this cafe through Yelp! We came after lunch and it was still busy. There were tables outside as well as inside. It's a small cafe with an eclectic decor. The wait staff Natey seated us and was very gracious and informative. Zeke was our waiter and was also great. We all had the pint cranberry raspberry mimosas;) my friends had the chicken and waffles, one had it with a side of cornbread and poached egg and the other friend just the C&W. I had the Greg Scramble( or omelette, I may forget) with chicken Apple sausage spinach and Parmesan cheese on top, potatoes and  cornbread. It was soo good I had to savor each bite! Natey, I think I am getting his name wrong was so informative and personable to us, he is a great employee if I was an owner to have.  I loved his customer service! This is why there's is always a long line, great food and service! Must go!!
author: Shari N.

description:
This place is incredible.  I've only ever gone on weekends but it seems as if whenever this restaurant is open, you'll be waiting a bit.  Put your name on the list and go grab a coffee across the street at Piccino Cafe. It's Blue Bottle.

Try the Chili Scramble: 3 scrambled eggs, topped with chili con carne, cheddar cheese, and diced onions. Served on toast or cornbread.  It'll be one of the best down-to-earth meals you'll ever had.  of course go with the Corn bread over the toast - you wont forget it.
author: Kevin J.

description:
There's a reason there's always a crowd of people waiting around out front of the weekend!
Perfect greasy brunch staples. Huge menu, awesome staff, cool music. Love sitting at the bar where you get a view of all the action happening behind the scenes.
Tip: instead of regular toast, go for the cornbread!
author: Laura S.

description: Pretty solid.  Got the Reuben for lunch with a lemonade and a side of fries.  The Rueben was perfect, the lemonade nice and tart and not over sweet.
author: Joshua G.

description:
My husband and I had a lovely brunch here! We got there around noon on a Sunday, and only had to wait about 10 minutes. To start, we each had a beignet, which were delicious (as expected). I had basic scrambled eggs, bacon, and fruit - the bacon was excellent. My husband had a more Cajun-inspired shrimp omelette special, which he loved. The Mexican dishes, especially the chilaquiles, looked very tasty.

I really enjoyed the New Orleans theme - besides the beignets, I noticed they have Abita beer, and tons of hot sauces. The atmosphere was great: busy, but not crazy - very relaxed. All of the wait staff seemed to be in a great mood, and they were super attentive - refilling my coffee cup multiple times :) 

We will definitely be back. Oh, and if you have kids, the restaurant is a little tight for a stroller, but they have some outdoor seating that seemed like it would be fine to pull up a stroller.
author: Eileen D.

description: I just ate here few minutes ago. Food was terrible, something you won't even offer your dog. Service was kind of weird. Place is so loud I couldn't hear myself think. By the way black coffee I ordered might have been the worst coffee I've had in my life. What a waste of good space in my stomach, what a waste of my time and also my money :-( what a HUGE mistake. I should have gone to MacDonalds instead.
author: Winston D.

description: Just For You is my go to place for brunch in San Francisco. Located in the trendy/up-and-coming Dogwatch area, Just For You slings up some of the tastiest breakfast foods in San Francisco. I always bring my friends from out of town here because its off the beaten path and doesn't require a full morning commitment to sit down and eat food. Overall, you won't be disappointed!
author: Jared W.

description:
FIVE stars the the AUTHENTIC beignets! best I've had outside of Cafe du Monde in New Orleans. PERFECT I tell ya. I could have eaten the order of 3 myself and left and been a happy happy girl.

3 stars for the rest of the meal. I had the cowgirl b'fast with sausage and cornmeal pancakes. On either side of our table people returned their eggs for being to underdone. Yes, our over easy eggs were also underdone, but I'm not sending back eggs unless they have glass in them, they are just eggs, eat them and shut the hell up.  

Service is quick and efficient.  Looks like there is often a line but somehow we missed it.
author: Amy W.

description: More like 2.5 stars. The service is great. Everyone is friendly. It tends to get busy. I've tried several dishes here. But nothing really stands out. The beignets were fluffy but I didn't see anything special about it. Biscuits looked fluffy and fresh but they were dry. The gravy was average. The grits didn't have much taste. Maybe I have higher standards as a Texan. But I can make better biscuits, gravy and grits myself. I'd go back if I were in the area and wanted breakfast/brunch. I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.
author: Vanessa T.

description: A long wait to be seated but not to be served: just for you Café is a treasure. I will order the hang town fry which consists of egg whites--which I requested--Bacon, onions and oysters! Superb! The grits, biscuits, and beignets were also very, very good!
author: Ericha F.

description: This cafe comes under one of the best breakfast places in San Francisco, however it didn't appeal as one to me. We went for a friday morning breakfast, given the weekday, it was almost full. The service was quick and the food was good too. It wasn't anything extra-ordinary for me to want to visit this place again.
author: Seetha R.

description:
Why Just for You Cafe is Just For Me:

1) Sassy signage like, "We reserve the right to pour coffee on your cell phone."

2) Beloved airy and piping hot beignets. (Resign yourself to getting powdered sugar all over yourself and the table.)

3) A Breakfast Burrito filled with eggs, black beans, cheddar cheese, zucchini, mushrooms, and spinach. Don't forget the spicy New Mexico green chili sauce!

4) The Greg's Scramble with eggs, spinach, onions, garlic, parmesan cheese, and chicken-apple sausage.  Get your carb fix from the thick wedges of homemade cinnamon toast slathered in raspberry jam rather than the bland home fries.

5) Close proximity to after brunch treats from nearby Poco Dolce, Recchiuti's Little Nib, or Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous.

UH-OH.
author: Amy C.

description:
I arrived slightly before noon, so the line wasn't too long.  They also serve coffee out in front, which made the wait a little more bearable!  Started with the beignets,.. thin, fluffy, powdered sugar of fun!!  I think it tasted better than the ones I had in New Orleans! 

I shared the bisquit with meat gravy and the deep fried oysters on an omelet. Portions are huge and I was full off half of an order.  I even had a box of left overs for an afternoon snack. 

I will be back!
author: Chanel L.

description:
An FYI to those dining alone: don't bother outside of off hours. They've recently changed their policy to only seat single diners at the counter and there are only 4 counter spots in the entire place (so be prepared to wait an hour). 

Food can be hit or miss but when it's good, it's good, and affordable. Recommended: the beignets, the frittatas and the scrambles.
author: Jared S.

description:
I would compare sitting at this restaurant to being able to open a Rolex watch and watching all the inner pieces working seamlessly together. It's honestly a masterpiece in customer service! Judging by the service you receive you would never know how extremely busy the restaurant actually is, and believe me it gets really busy!!
Their menu has something for everyone,  some items I've loved and some not so much, none have ever dissapointed, it's all based on your individual taste really. 
I recommend you check this place out if you haven't,  and if you have I know that you wouldn't care what other yelpers say because you love it and are coming back for sure, like myself. 
Cheers!
author: Carlos A.

description: Great food and great service. My daughter ordered biscuits and gravy and it could have fed an army. The fried chicken sandwich is great. I've never had to wait there but I imagine it gets crowded on the weekends.  Can't wait to go back!
author: Lillian M.

description:
Wouldn't trek out to the Dogpatch again to get brunch here. The food was decent. Nothing exciting. 

The service was AWFUL! Took about 1 hour to bring the food out after placing. Also forgot the additional "real maple syrup" but were charged. Sounds so small to complain but when you wake up hung over and wait to 45 min get in to a brunch spot then an hour to eat, it gets annoying. 

However, cheesy grits were bomb and CORNBREAD. But sadly, Will not be returning
author: Lauren S.

description:
The crabcake sandwich was good. However, the Louisiana hot sauce the waitress suggested for my sandwhich wasn't too flavorful. If I had to order again, I'd go for something with more of a kick and ask for the bread not to be toasted so much. It was a little too crunchy for my taste. 

The beignet was just as yummy as it looked in the picture. I had it before my meal with a cup of coffee (as recommended) and I'm glad I did. 

This place has is a diner setting with some tables being a little too close together, but that didn't really bother me. 

The servers were very welcoming, open to giving suggestions, and good about checking in. 

The signs in front are also pretty entertaining. Stop to read them before you go in.
author: Jenn F.

description: A long wait awaits you! But it's brunch in a trendy area in SF, so it comes with the territory. The beignets are pretty good, but overall it's just breakfast food. As much as I appreciate it, overall, my thing with brunch is that I can make most of the stuff on my own. My girlfriend got the veggie breakfast burrito and it was sopping wet- as if they cooked the veg and didn't drain the liquid before putting it in the burrito, gross. My chorizo and eggs were fine, nothing special. The chorizo didn't have much spice to it so I had to load it up with cholula. Service was great though.
author: Samir K.

description: This place is so amazing! Our server Jessie was so sweet and quick. The food here is so wonderful and most of all the mimosas are hella big and delicious and probably why I think everyone loves me right now. Anyways I'm coming here for lunch to try the gumbo. Don't pass this place up your stomach depends on it!
author: Quita G.

description:
Came here on a rainy Sunday morning and while there was a crowd outside, my sister and I were quickly sat at the bar by one friendly, bearded server (whose name we failed to catch, but he was awesome!). The workers there knew how to approach us (as in, actually giving us time to read the menu, not bothering to ask how our food was in the middle of our first bite, and filling our coffee as it needed), and the food was solid brunch cuisine.

We began the meal by sharing one beignet, and one was certainly enough. Those pillowy, sugary dough clouds are the perfect bite to begin brunch with, along with a coffee and a mimosa of course. A tip we picked up from the workers: try dipping your beignet in your coffee! Just avoid looking at your drink afterwards and the oil droplets left by them, that is.

Following that I ordered my usual, a two egg and english muffin combo with a side of fresh fruit. My sister ordered the special, which was a salmon eggs benedict. Both of our dishes tasted fresh and simple, and the fact that all of the breads are home-baked added a sweet touch to the meal.

While I wouldn't call the brunch anything too special, Just For You is a solid brunch option that I'd certainly stop by again if I were in the area.
author: Amy S.

description:
OK, if it is just for me, why ain't Just for You open for dinner? Now I've tried to come to this cafe on several occasions in the past, but I've been put off by the milling crowds waiting to get in. It's the Mama's of Dogpatch, for sure. So I decided to stop by one weekday evening to find out it was the last night they were serving dinner. Bummer. The drawback of a location in a transitional area. I was envisioning evenings incapacitated by all the neighborhood comfort food with chicken-fried steak here and a double-scoop at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous.

But at least now I know the food is worth me waiting for on a busy Sunday morning. I had the $9.35 Bacon Cheeseburger, which was quite a generous patty of beef on their self-billed fluffy bun (see photo). Hit the spot but not more than the $2.50 side of Macaroni & Cheese, which was a delicious bowl of homey goodness (see photo). It's really solid roadside fare for the undiscriminating diner. Just remember it closes at 3PM now. This is a Dogpatch dinner-hour dining option no more (sob).

FOOD - 4 stars...a good burger worthy anytime of day (hint, hint)
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...dinerish but more welcoming (see photo)
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...the servers buzz around with aplomb
TOTAL - 4 stars...oh, I'll come back for breakfast...but I'm crossing my fingers that the dinner hours will return
author: Ed U.

description: The breakfast here is delicious.  Had scrambled eggs, bacon, with home fries and the BEST buttery biscuits, served warm. Very good coffee (we had the dark roast). You have to have the beignets, served warm from the fryer with lots of powdery sugar on top - YUM!! The service is friendly and attentive. So happy we found this place - it's our new favorite SF breakfast spot!
author: emily v.

description:
not very impressed with the food, especially when you can go somewhere else and get the same thing with a better price. 

Beignet is good, fluffy and chewy. It's a must try.
author: Carrie Z.

description:
Just for you cafe is officially my new favorite breakfast/brunch spot ! 

I never heard of this place before until my sister took me here for Sunday brunch. We arrived at the location around 1PM (*WARNING* they close at 3PM Sundays)and there was a long line of people waiting outside of this little cafe, but  we waited from 20-25mins. So not that bad! 

For my meal I ordered Gregg's Scramble w/ Chicken-Apple Sausage, home fries, and wheat bread toast. To me, the portion size is definitely filling and worth it. Gregg's Scramble: $10.50 

For dessert my sister and I shared 3 beignets. If you don't know what a beignet is, it's a light,fluffy, New Orleans donut smothered in powdered sugar! Add some syrup to the top of your beignet && OH-EM-GEE TO DIE FOR!! The beignets prices are 1 Beignet = $1.75 or **3 Beignets = $5

The servers were so nice and very efficient making sure customers were doing okay and satisfied with our orders. All in all, I would definitely come back here for a delicious, fulfilling, breakfast/brunch meal!
author: Hazel L.

description: Consistently good food!!! It's a very cute restaurant and all the staff is very nice! Everything I have had here is very good. I'm a pretty picky eater and will often times substitute and change the order a bit and they are always very accommodating!
author: Mallory R.

description: Every meal I had in San Francisco was incredible and the breakfast I had at this little spot was no different.  I was just in New Orleans for the first time and failed to try a famous beignet, so my friend and I figured why not try one here.  Little did we know when ordering three, that one was as big as my head!   The chorizo con huevos was amazing - I can be picky with my breakfast meat but it was perfectly cooked and spiced.  My friend could barely eat half of his chili scramble and made us stop back at home to drop off leftovers before heading out for the day.   We liked it so much, we recommended it to our fellow Airbnb tenants who visited the next day!   The staff was great - quick and friendly.
author: Ren P.

description:
Came here with three others during a weekend trip to SF. Sunday brunch is always a good idea :)

Even though they don't take reservations, you can call in and they'll put your name down on the clipboard for you. It'll save some wait time if you're about to leave home or something like that. It's a small space that fits maybe up to 30 customers tightly, but that just makes for a cozy atmosphere.

I got a zucchini + mushroom + parmesan scramble, with gluten free toast and orange juice (just ok). I also shared a side of oatmeal pancakes with a friend. The scramble was delicious with fresh ingredients, home fries were yummy, and Udi's GF bread was good as expected. The oatmeal pancakes were um, like eating a bowl of soggy oats in pancake form, especially with syrup. I don't know what I was expecting...

I ended up splurging a whopping $22 (after tax and tip) on brunch, but I did have some leftovers for a snack later.
author: Jenn W.

description:
First time today during lunch. Ordered a chicken salad sandwich to go. Great ambience, really fast and friendly servers.

Nice atmosphere and will definitely come back for dine-in. Giving the place a 4 star because the chicken salad was a tad bit bland for my taste buds.
author: Theo V.

description: Holy moly this place, the FOOD, the friendly service, the outdoor seating, the reasonable prices.... Clearly I'll be back! Thanks for a great experience- truly some of the nicest servers we've ever had here in the city- they really make you feel welcome and at home. Home run of a brunch spot!
author: Jennifer B.

description: I've visited for brunch a couple of times and love getting their beignets. They're not overly greasy. Most recently I've ordered the crab benedict and avocado turkey scramble. Both dishes were pretty flavorful. Customer service doesn't disappoint. If you decide to go for brunch, be prepared to wait an hour or so....if you go to brunch often you probably already know this is pretty standard in SF.
author: Christine D.

description: Every staff member was awesome, had a variety of meals. All awesome! Nice menu with good variety. Good reputation is well deserved
author: Roberto A.

description: If you're looking for a place of southern comfort food, Just For You Cafe is literally just for you. It's a small cafe so I would suggest coming in early or a little after noon. Interior gives a quirky (but homey) retro/bohemian feel. Lots of families come here too. I like how the staff was patient enough to walk me through their menu during my first visit. Their customer service is consistent and the food is amazing! I would recommend anything on the menu that's got eggs bene. I've taken friends and family here and we're never disappointed. My first dish here was the chorizo con huervos, it was so good and filling! I suggest that you simply ask if you're not sure what to get. Also, they close early, like 3PM? But it makes sense since their food suits the breakfast/brunch cravings. Thank you, Just For You! For making me feel like I'm home.
author: Andie H.

description:
Here are things to know about SF:
-- Brunch is hard to come by
-- You'll be overcharged for drinks
-- When you find a brunch place, you'll stand in line
-- After you stand in line, you'll pay $15 for a brunch that barely passes muster

That is only mildly the case with Just for You. The mimosas were giant and served in pint glasses because helllllll  yeah. They're $9 a pint but that's heaps better than mission cafe which is $9 a goblet. The line was silly but we did get stuck behind some jerks who thought that bringing 7 people to brunch for a place that holds a grand total of 20 was reasonable. The brunch was well done -- really great solid food with a runny egg on my benedict just like what we all want. And the chili cornbread thing spoke to me of home -- even if it had beans. If you're up before 10a and want a pint glass of mimosas, this is your spot. It's... just for you.
author: Kelly S.

description:
Homemade sandwich bread made from pizza dough? It was my first time at Just For You and it had that bustling, friendly feeling of old San Francisco with all kinds of awesome retro posters (including for an old Berkeley punk band). My friend didn't clue me in about their bread made from pizza dough (which you can buy to do). Drool.

A full trout dish for like $12 -- delicious and healthy with a vege stirfry and baked potato.

The big menu is full of crowd pleasers and I will def be back (if only for the bread and the Victorian water closet bathroom that reminded me of cool old houses I've lived in). I just wish they had one other coffee option than the N'orlins style chicory.
author: Susie W.

description:
Friday at 10:30am, this place was still packed!! O_O Don't people have work or something? 

1. Beignet ($1.65): This is a must order!! It was big, but I was actually expecting it a lot BIGGER because everyone wrote that it was "HUGE"!!! haha So I was expecting a UFO flying saucer size :P I love adding the strawberry jam that's on the table to the beignet!!! Then it's like an awesome jelly filled donut!!! Yum!!! :D

2. Oatmeal Pancake: I could just barely finish my 1 stack. It was a bit uncooked? =\ I was intrigued. Never heard of an oatmeal pancake before. But I wasn't really crazy about it after consumption. The pancake taste wasn't there and almost too moist and mushy. bleh. I was almost sad that I didn't get the cornmeal pancakes :(

3. Cornmeal Pancake: LOVED!!!!! Luckily my friend offered me some of hers! Ahhhh It was soooo light and fluffy! Loved the cornmeal texture!!! Yummy yummy!

Julie K and I came here for breakfast last week before heading up to the North Bay! Because seating was limited inside, we were able to quickly get seats at the counter and right in front of the kitchen! Super cushiony seats! ^^ We ordered 1 beignet, 1 oatmeal pancake, and 1 cornmeal pancake. I was trying to read through the reviews the night before. No one really wrote anything about these oatmeal pancakes, and I guess I know why now. It's all about the beignets and cornmeal pancakes here!! :D

Next time I'm in the Dogpatch, I would love to try their crab cake eggs benedict on the weekends! Love their posters and signs on the walls! Hilarious!! Their website is cute too with links to their menu! By the way, I did notice a slight price difference between weekday breakfast and weekend brunch for the same items. Also they seem to serve better stuff on the weekends of course! Service was okay. But since it was busy our food took awhile. Our server, Holly, was super sweet though!! :)
author: CeCe C.

description:
Amazing staff, delicious food. 
It was a true pleasure to eat at this place. I will definitely be back.
author: Lorri B.

description:
I came to Just for You... on a Thursday morning for some breakfast. I was told that the beignets at this place were delicious, so I set off and got there at around 11 AM. 

As I walked in, my initial impression was how clean and tidy the place was. I was told to sit anywhere and was immediately brought a menu. The service at this place is great, and my coffee was constantly being refilled. 

I ordered Greg's Scramble with chicken-apple sausage. It has spinach, onions, garlic, and parmesan cheese on top. I also got the home fries (crispy-ass potatoes) and a biscuit. It was yummy!  And of course I placed an order for 3 beignets. Unfortunately, my breakfast was so fulfilling that I was only able to eat one beignet, but damn, it was good! They aren't kidding with their sign outside that reads "Fluffy pillows of perfection"! These things really are fluffy perfection. 

Anyways, the only thing that bothered me was how expensive it was. I ended up paying nearly $20 just for that Greg's scramble, beignets, and a coffee. That's a bit ridiculous to me.
author: Arnold B.

description:
What struck me the most about this place is that the employees seemed to truly like working there. They worked quickly, and yet, were really friendly. They also filled in for each other as needed, so there was never a wait for any part of the service. Why is good service so rare these days? The vibe is relaxed and I enjoyed the show posters  for decor.

The food was great. Not pretentious or fancy - just straight up good breakfast food. I had french toast and eggs (get the real syrup). My husband had the chorizo omelet. He has a thing for chorizo, so he's ordered it several times during our San Francisco trip, but he said this place was the best hands down. The fresh squeezed juices were also great.

There was no wait when we went, but it was 10:45 a.m. on a Monday.
author: C. C.

description:
I came here twice for breakfast and each time I ordered about 5 plates because way too many things on the menu made my mouth water. 

I'm an eggs benedict lover so I've tried both their Classic Benedict and Crabby Bennie. Both were yummy and didn't fall apart like most benedicts, which can be super annoying. I also appreciated the consistency of their hollandaise sauce - not too watery and not too creamy, just right. 

I loved their biscuits with SAUSAGE gravy. Biscuits are baked fresh and are so fluffy!

Come early if you don't want to wait 30-minutes, but even if you do have to wait, it's totally worth it!
author: Ashley M.

description:
This place is getting 4 stars instead of 5 based on the wait. My husband and I got here around 10:30am and didn't get seated until 11:30 but let me tell you, it is worth the wait and the servers really work their butts off to get everybody seated in a timely matter. It's just hard when everyone loves the food! :)

They do offer coffee outside and you can pay once seated. 

Once inside, we ordered a round of their Grapefruit and Champagne Pints. YUM :) I ended up getting the crabby eggs Benedict and my husband ordered the egg Benedict with bacon. Our eggs were poached to perfection with the eggs runny on the inside. I was a little nervous that the crab was going to be too fishy tasting but it wasn't at all! It was crispy and had just the right amount of seasoning. I got a side of grits to go with mine and they were delicious. I have only had cheesy grits but these were simple and buttery tasting. They were a great compliment to my rich breakfast

Their lunch menu looks great as well and I can't wait to come back here ;)

On a side note: Parking is relatively easy in this area and there are other restaurants, shops and parks to walk to either before or after you have enjoyed your meal 

prices were good, servie was great
author: Whitney S.

description:
I was in search of delicious beignets. In the course of my research, I discovered Just For You on Yelp.  After reading the reviews, I knew a 45 minute brunch road trip was going to happen. 

This Sunday was the day we chose. I went on a 4.5 mile run before we left so I could justify this meal.  It did not disappoint. 

Though I prepared my family that we were in for a wait, we got lucky with our timing, hit a seating lull and were seated within 5 minutes of arriving. 

Naturally, we started with coffee and beignets, which were so light, airy, warm, sweet and delicious.  We moved on heartier fare from there:  I had the Eggs Blackstone and my daughter opted for poached eggs with white toast.  Eggs were poached easy and to perfection. My husband had the biscuits and gravy.  I may have stolen a bite or two from his plate while he wasn't looking. Those were good too.  A pint of Grapefruit Mimosa and my meal was compete.  I'm not eating for the rest of the day- but it was so worth it. 

I'm planning on stopping by here early on my way to Giants day games next season. Is it baseball season yet?
author: Jennifer L.

description: Delicious breakfast options including the duck confit benedict, chicken and waffles, and huevos rancheros with green chile.  Yum!  Awesome wait crew as well.
author: Eric L.

description:
2.5 stars

I was optimistic about Just For You Cafe. I picked it for our breakfast catch-up due to its 4-star rating (actually, I picked it because Plow is closed on Mondays.) 

Service was perfectly acceptable -- attentive, brought food out in a timely manner, & took our pancakes off the bill when it didn't arrive with the rest of our grub. And at 10am, there were plenty if open seats, so 4 stars for the experience. 

However, the food was just not to our liking...there was nothing that could've been done to remedy this. Kind of like the handsome guy with a good job that you feel ZERO sparks for. His breakfast burrito with chili com carne didn't look appetizing & he noted a mushiness & "wetness" in the filling. My granola (with fruit & milk) was boring...no spices to liven it up. Oatmeal pancake, equally as uninteresting. 

I wish I could've felt endeared to this homey breakfast joint, but alas, I won't be calling for a second date.
author: Fancypants X.

description: 5 stars for the beignets. The corned beef hash is good too, but the potatoes are diced and not shredded. My search continues for SF's best corned beef hash
author: Geordie E.

description: Good spot for brunch. Great begnets and hangtown fries (scrambles with fried oyster, bacon, and onions.) Very fresh oysters and great eggs (with super orange yolk). The service is spotty and the wait can be prohibitive during the weekend but good place to check out at least once.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
My first time here today and there was a long waiting list, but that seems to be very normal in these parts. Thankfully I didn't have to wait more than 10 minutes. 

My hubby ordered the cowgirl and I ordered the basic scrambled eggs with GF toast and substituted the hash for fruit.

Everything tasted good, but for some odd reason I was overcharged. My dish should have been tops $10.75 but I was charged $13.00.

I told this to the waitress and she said she'd fix it, but they still ended up overcharging me. I ended up paying $12 for 2 eggs, 1 toast, 1 cup of fruit, which comes out to $4 for each item on my plate. Yikes!

Does this breakfast seem grossly overpriced? Yes and that's a huge turn off. I don't like feeling like I'm being ripped off but can't help but think that's exactly what happened here. 

The bill was not accurate and after mentioning it, it was still not taken care of, which to me means that customer service is not first on the list here. Very disappointing.
author: V W.

description: My friend Jay and his lady Carla, took me here the last time I was in the Bay area. I ordered the eggs benedict with home fries. Amazing. The server was also nice. Its an intimate cafe so it was kind of tight and noisy.  Pretty small, so we had to share our table with 2 strangers that were on a date. They kept interrupting our conversation. They also have 2 tables in front of the cafe if you wanted to eat outside. Overall it was a good experience. Carla was also nice enough to pay for our meals.
author: Vince R.

description:
This is a nice little neighborhood breakfast dinner in the Dogpatch district. They are well-known for their beignets, which come as massive pieces of fried goodness. The powdered sugar is a bit overdone so be sure not the inhale, lest you want some type of confectionary pulmonic mishap. I was disappointed that they weren't fluffy or filled with anything. Brenda's is still the best place to go to for quality beignets. 

I can't say much for much of their other breakfast items, but just from the looks of it, the portion sizes are just massive. If whatever egg plate you ordered didn't fill you up, the big helping of homefries will.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
UGH!!!!!! This place is so horrible. The design of the restaurant is asanine. Standing out front waiting for a table was the beginning of the lamest dining experience I can recall. The tables outside are on each side of a coffee cart across the sidewalk from the door. It was cramped, people sit right on the sidewalk, and the servers have to walk across the sidewalk to get to them. 

We were seated rather quickly but it was monday at 10:30 so not a very crowded day. Seated way in the back in a room that was hotter than hell and made me feel claustraphobic. Food took forever to come out, and was so bland, boring, and not worth the overpriced $15 for lame regular benedict and mushy fruit cup. So frustrating to waste money and time and a meal on that. 

A friend got the huevos rancheros which he said was tasty, but other meals were not the same. Friends got other boring looking meals, and the bloody mary was a disgraceful tasteless watery cup of tomato juice with a celery stalk. Don't believe there was any vodka in it. The Hatch hot sauce is so hot it's inedible. Friends ordered sides of the sauce to try and they brought containers of it the size of a cup of soup. Overall- annoyingly bad and thoughtless, uninteresting, a shame it's taking up the space.
author: Lisa R.

description:
What a GREAT place for Sunday brunch.  I absolutely LOVE this place.  The whole staff was so friendly and accommodating.  It was pretty busy but they weren't phased by the chaos at all.

Great menu choices.  Especially loved the Mickey Mouse pancakes which they were nice enough to let me have.  The beignets were SO good!  Best I have ever had.  One is enough for 2 people but if you really enjoy them, get two.  They're pretty big.

This is my new favorite brunch place and I highly recommend you stop by this place on a Sunday.  Place gets pretty busy so be prepared to wait but the good thing is, people come in and out.
author: Victoria C.

description:
I came here for breakfast right before driving back from San Francisco to Portland. 

As many other reviewers have stated, the beignets are worth getting. I'm not sure I've ever actually eaten a beignet before? But! I would best describe it as tasting like a funnel cake that is socially appropriate to eat with breakfast. 

I also had the two eggs with home fries, biscuits, and a Cajun crab cake. The biscuits were disappointing, but everything else was pretty good.
author: Becca S.

description:
After working a 12 hour night shift, the homie and I were hankering for some good breakfast food. This place seemed to fit the bill. However I should have taken cue from how long it took for two hot cocoas to come out...tepid.I'm so used to having to wait a long time for my hot beverages to cool down enough so that I can drink them because I'm such a weenie. Didn't have that problem here, though. (How do you mess up hot chocolate?! The name says it all!) 

Ok. Well the food hopefully makes up for that little glitch....

Nope. I got the cowgirl with sausage. Homie got biscuits and gravy with a side of bacon. And we got a side of home fries to share. To be short, nothing came out hot, and nothing was really that good.

Service wasn't that great either. 

When I have breakfast after working a long night shift instead of going straight to bed, I expect at least a little something to make it worth the extra little bit of sleep I'd given up. Kind of a disappointment.

They were busy when we left, though, so I'm glad for them that they have a good following because we won't be coming back.
author: marlene s.

description: Came here for lunch on a Saturday, got sick the next day. As I ate at my table with my grandparent and friend, we seen cockroaches on the wall around the hanging pictures. Some mother was "smacking" them of of her son or at least I'd say it was her son. I hope they make a complaint as I have. Never again will I eat here.
author: Logan C.

description: My new fav.    Food is great Bacon, Crab Cakes-- add a little Chipotle Sauce and they are "out of this world".  Staff is friendly and never hurry you!!!!
author: Deb Y.

description: Must I say, what a great experience I had here. The food was AMAZING! First time here and couldn't have had a more delicious breakfast. The beignets were the strawberry on top! Highly recommended if looking for a good breakfast stop and just an FYI get there early, tends to have a long wait line, but well worth the wait.
author: Francisco H.

description: Solid mimosas. Got the crab cake eggs Benedict on a biscuit and it was delicious. My friend's bacon made me envious.
author: Hayden P.

description:
Yummo!  Just for you cafe is a great place for breakfast!  

We visited at 9am on a Saturday, and we're able to get a seat immediately, but it was not the same for those arriving only a few minutes later...  They had to wait a while...  The wait would be worth it.

The cafe is small, with people packed in.  It was clean, and felt like home.  Rustic and shabby chic.

I started my meal with a good bloody Mary, and the absolute best beignets I have ever had. I highly recommend trying them.  Everyone liked them in my group.  Then I shared the blue cheese scramble, raisin toast, and grits with my wife.  The eggs were cooked perfect, but it was a bit watery because of all the great vegetables in the eggs.  Tasted great.  The grits were basic, and sufficient after adding butter and salt.  The Raisin toast was really good...  a nice touch was that the toast came with no butter, so it was crunchy and you could add as much as you like.  Go for the blue cheese scramble.  Yum.  My little one had pancakes, and called them 5 star.  Our friends had French toast, and eggs Benedict, also very good.  The coffee left a bit to be desired... skip it.

The staff were extremely friendly, attentive, and helpful.  They did a great job. I tipped well.

I will be back, and would recommend this place to anyone.  Yum!
author: James M.

description:
I have been here many times and have tried and tried and tried and tried to like this place. 

The ambience decor are fantastic .The location is also great.  They make a mean oatmeal pancake.

Even with all of this, I just can't do it again.

Why? Outside of the occasional cold runny eggs or burnt pancakes which I can totally overlook ...The coffee is just dreadful, God awful...
author: Ben S.

description:
I love Just For You.

I live in the neighborhood and this is one of the better restaurants in the area. All of their food is great but my boyfriend and I especially love their Chili Scramble or Greg's Scramble.

Oh, and don't forget the beignets!

YUM.
author: Teese N.

description: Perfect place to come for breakfast when you're in the town of San Francisco. You absolutely have to try the delicious fresh fluffy pillows of perfection. The powdered sugar and the fluff is amazing. Make sure you do not go here and not order the beignets!!
author: Y N M A.

description:
The people were super friendly and the food looked super amazing and tasty.

But it wasn't :( It was just bland. And a little overpriced. At least the aesthetics were nice!

On the bright side, the beignets are pretty damn good.
author: Jessica L.

description: San Francisco breakfast and brunch mainstay with only one vegan option? Shame. Step it up, SF!
author: Stumbalina b.

description:
Came here during my lunch break from work. The place gets pretty packed, but luckily we grabbed the very last table for two. It was pretty cramped, and this table we ended up with was right next to the entry way for the kitchen. I figured, I'm just going to crap a bite to eat and be on my way. I ordered the fish tacos (it was Friday and it's Lent), and decided to chose the carrot apple juice as well. The juice came out quickly, and it tasted freshly made. 

Our food came out fairly quickly as well, but it looked delicious. The side salad that came along with the tacos was some fresh greens and balsamic, but the greens tasted very fresh and healthy. The fish tacos were what surprised me. I don't order fish tacos all that often, but I was pleasantly welcomed with the crispy crunchiness of whatever the fish was cooked in. Seemed like some sort of batter and fried, but it was nicely flavored and crispy. Pair that with the soft tortilla, and fresh toppings (sorry I can't be more specific - it was some sort of cabbage with salsa and some other little things - in any case, DELICIOUS), and you have a nice taco going on.

Overall I had a very good experience, and now that I now this place exists right down the street from work, I will be visiting here more often!
author: Jenessa R.

description: Had the breakfast French toast.  Tasty and not too soggy.  Nice place to get breakfast to start your day.
author: Isabella W.

description: I honestly was not impressed at all. I had Gregg's omelette with sausage and a scone on the side. The Omelette was bland and it was really nothing special. I was expecting some more flavor to say the least but everything was just mediocre. I left most of the sausage untouched. My friends Benedict she said was too salty. The Server was nice so I'll give 3 stars. I won't need to come back here. There are way too many better options out there in SF and this place is off my list.
author: Cartman P.

description:
Just for me? Aww. So sweet!

Okay, in all seriousness now. Just For You Cafe is definitely a small little gem in the Dogpatch. It's a small, cute little cafe that has quick, fast and amazing service tied together with amazing brunch! 

I was craving for a stereotypical brunch with poached eggs and hollandaise sauce so I went with the Eggs Blackstone which is poached eggs, bacon and tomato on toast and hollandaise sauce. It was oh so very good and satisfying! 

PS. Don't forget to get a thing of their beignets! They have to be one of the best I've had!
author: Jeanette Y.

description: Good overall. Love the beignets. Just DO NOT get french toast here that's all. It's a semi moist bread at best; it wasn't dipped in eggs/vanilla extract at all. Disappointing- can be improved upon... but this is a solid option for breakfast.
author: Boris L.

description:
Really good tasting food. And the choices to choose from are overwhelming (in a positive way)! 
I had the yummiest niçoise salad, which left me very full and happy with my choice. I can also recommend the reuben sandwich there...mmm so good.
This place is a local gem with a variety of what it looked like regular customers!

Parking on the street or take the cal train/metro, etc. it is a rather small and cozy diner, if you are curious about the size.
author: Matea F.

description: We stumbled on this place nestled in the Dog Patch area and totally love it, we drive up from San Jose on the weekends just to kick off our morning right. Food, Staff, Patrons all add to the flavor of the joint. One of our favorites, we dig it and look forward to their specials.
author: Phil B.

description:
5+ food
5+ dog friendly

We stumbled upon this cafe as we were walking to Rickshaw bags.  What a terrific place to have a big filling breakfast! They have two tables outside so you can eat with your pups.  We were lucky to meet the owner who also happened to be a poodle owner. We thanked her profusely for having outdoor seating so we could eat with our dogs.

Portions are huge. I had the Greg's scramble with turkey sausage, potatoes AND a scone (which was freshly baked).   My friend and I assumed their famous beignets would be small so we ordered 3 to split and they turned out to be huge. Good thing our dogs were there to help out with leftovers.

We dined at 8:45am on a Friday morning so there was no waiting but I could see its popularity on the weekends.

Note that gluten free toast is an option!!! Yay for my hubby who is GF.
author: Kim W.

description: Beignets are the bomb diggity. I ate an entire order of three last time... They're that good. Not too much of the rum aftertaste like in other beignets. The other food is kinda flavorless though. Not enough seasoning
author: Malia B.

description:
I came here for lunch on a rainy Friday and the place was packed.  Came with a group and am glad we had reservations!  

This is a nice little neighborhood cafe.  The furniture is a little old but clean, and the decorations vintage.  I like the ambience.  Food is good - I am told by regulars that there is a Louisiana native in the kitchen, so the cajun food is authentic.  

The beignets were irresistible!  One of my colleagues ordered some for the table.  I broke my strict low carb diet, and would gladly do it again for these beignets.

Parking can be difficult in this neighborhood, or maybe I am just unlucky.  I circled the block twice and ended up parking two blocks away.
author: Jack L.

description: Love the beignets and rightfully so. Light, fluffy and sugary...yum!
author: Shweta M.

description:
Just for you is a wonderful restaurant!   Get the Greg Scramble and get a beignet!  You won't regret it.  :)

Breakfast is served all day, and you can come in groups up to 6-8 but get there early, there will a wait and a wait list!
author: Ana M.

description:
Fantastic dinner!

We've found our hidden gem. The Duck Confit Fries, Risotto, Hoppin John, all fantastic! Apologizes for the no pictures as it was our first time in the area and was really enjoying the food. Reasonably priced, excellent service, and the owner, chef, and server were all so friendly. Couldn't recommend enough.
author: Charlie P.

description:
This place is a San Francisco institution, and for good reason.  The food is amazing, the vibe friendly and fun, and did I mention the beignets are to die for!  

I have frequented Just for You for nearly 20 years, and it has always had that awesome neighborhood vibe.  Case in point: Last week a colleague of mine was traveling from Australia and accidentally left his passport at the cafe while having breakfast earlier in the day.  Unfortunately he didn't realize his passport was missing until the end of the day, after the cafe had closed.  His flight home to Australia was in just a few hours.  The awesome dudes at the Liquor Store next door helped track down the owner and she actually came down to the restaurant after hours to help him get his passport back just in time to make his flight.  

I am so happy to have been a patron for many years and now know that the people behind the cafe are genuinely kind and thoughtful people as well.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Noel M.

description:
Just for you bills itself as a bakery but saw no evidence of  bakery. walls covered with poster memoribilia from decades past. tables in front cramped against each other. hard to get by without bumping someone,

eats: catch of the day(10.95)-
6 oz.  yellowtail panfried with tasteless pineapple salsa on top. fish was almost cold, mostly tasteless, little fish taste..
-green lettuce salad mostly green lettuce,  just crunchy, no dressing on it
-baked potato barely warm. 
melted butter patty wouldn't melt in it
coffee(1.75)
-interesting taste, kind of smoky, neither robust nor bland. many refills

foodnotes:
-post lunch, they were slammed, seating not a problem. didn't mind wait or confusion in getting a seat.
-disappointed food was cold. either it was precooked and "warmed" or it sat around before being served. take 10-15 minutes to come out.
-overall rough day in general. 
-shoulda got a hamburger(8.95)
author: Victor G.

description:
My first meal, I had poached eggs (done to perfection) with hot link (DEELISH) and the best south Louisiana style French toast I have eaten outside of my own kitchen, since moving to this great city in 1996. Every time we eat there, we order beignets for the table, also an authentically prepared deliciousness! And did I mention great dark roast coffee refilled happily, fresh fruit cups/bowls available, and yes they actually have righteous grits! And great iced tea...the list actually goes on to include everything we've tried on the menu.

Our weekly Koffee Klatch first met here on a Tuesday morning about 2 years ago. The service started out fabulous and has kept right on being that way.  We are a bit difficult to serve well...we are a bunch of lesbians and our friends over 50 who never know how many of us will show up. (We nosh and chat all over town at a different breakfast-y diner-ish place every Tuesday-for nearly 5 years now!). And we always want separate checks. The first time, the waiter sat us down at a table then said he'd just keep the other closest empty til we knew how many would be here. Sweet man!  The owner stopped by for a chat - she's from my neck of the woods down in Louisiana, and although I have avoided "eating Southern" in San Francisco, that is exactly what I wanted to do, so I did. Now when I want authentic taste served with San Francisco sensibility, this is THE breakfast spot in the City. It was simply so good that the Koffee Klatch repeats meeting for breakfast here, on a Tuesday, once every quarter or so! And now they know us, they get us right into the best spot for us so we can add folks as they arrive.
author: Calla F.

description: great service. this place is popular so.expect your typical sign in and wait. The area has some emerging artist workshops so there is an oppty to burn some time. Did i mention the service is great. i make this a point since at popular spots like these it's hard for staff to keep sanity. we had pesto frittata (wow on the basil) and crabbie beanie benedict and beignet. all good.
author: Lisa C.

description:
This place is great for brunch. I went for the 3rd or 4th time last weekend. Of course, you must, must order the beignets. I don't care if you're on a diet. Order them, eat them, and love them. Everything else on the menu is good. I got some sort of scramble, and Sara went with over-easy eggs. All done perfectly. The coffee is also good.

But none of that matters, just get the beignets and the rest of your day will be better.
author: Jonah H.

description:
My family and I had been coming here regularly for a few years now. So regular, one of the waiters, who has been there for as long as we've started going there already knows the kids in our family. 

Our last two visits, some of the food had gotten kind of salty. First my sister's food and, on a separate occasion, my mother's food. We mentioned it politely both occasions, but both times were responded to kind of rudely, defensively by other staff.

It's a shame because we really did love this place. Not sure we'll be coming here very much anymore.
author: November C.

description: Great service! Loved sitting at the bar watching the show in the kitchen. These guys have it down. The beignets are to die for...fluffy but crispy and warm! We were there on New Years for breakfast, our wait was no more than 10 minutes. It's a quaint little cafe with a relaxed atmosphere.  Food tasted great, the oysters my husband had were SUPER DELICIOUS! My butternut scramble was very tasty. Then there was the grapefruit Mimosas... yum again! We'd make the trip again, especially for the oysters.... they were cooked to perfection and made a lasting impression on our taste buds! Thanks for the great experience and wonderful food!
author: Cindy S.

description:
4.5 Stars!
We came here for the first time for breakfast on Sunday. It was about a 40 minute wait, but so worth it. We both had the specials: Frittata  with mushrooms, bell peppers, asparagus and eggplant (chose the grits and biscuits as sides). Corned beef benedict, had so much homemade corned beef on a huge piece of toast (with home fries as side). For dessert we had the beignets-OMG as good as the ones in NOLA! To die for!!
Staff was friendly and food was yummy. We can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu.
author: Lee J.

description:
When food writers describe beignets as being "pillows," I'm pretty sure they were describing the ones here at Just For You. I would gladly sleep on these things (and then gobble them all up!). For one, they're HUGE - about 4"x3" (THAT'S why they're $1.65 each) - and deep fried to a plushy perfection, with a piping hot, chewy interior and an crispy exterior. Also, be prepared to look like a crack addict after eating these, they're covered in powdered sugar. Ohh yeah.

For fellow coffee lovers like me, another great thing about Just For You is the free coffee outside while you wait (just remember to get your cup by the counter when you pay)!

Beignets and coffee? Just for ME?? Life doesn't get much better than this.
author: Clarice W.

description: Hadn't been in years because we weren't willing to do the wait on weekends. Usually there's a rather large crowd waiting outside. The food is good for the most part - good scramble and home fries. The biscuits were unimpressive - sort of like the pillsbury ones with no texture whatsoever.. too doughy. The coffee was also horrible and the service insanely slow. However, I think there is still value and love the beignets... just can't justify a long wait. Perhaps worth it for weekday breakfast no line?
author: Melody T.

description: Love the food - and they will cook to order!  Close to Mission Bay and the parking is tough because UCSF does not provide enough parking, but we walked over from there and it wasn't too bad!  Atmosphere is great, owner is great, chef is great, would highly recommend!
author: Matilda R.

description:
Lots of options for a wide spectrum of people's lifestyles and health issues.

You can do a light, yet flavorful meal

or you can do an indulgent, savory/sweet meal.

The best beignets in the city, IMHO. 

Original choices, sometimes servers are really stellar, sometimes they're basic. There is a wait if you go at the typical brunch hours.
author: Solitaire M.

description:
Located near Triple Aught Design at Dogpatch.

This is my new breakfast joint up north. Seriously. And god I love SF parking (wait, did I say that?). 4 hour parking? Beats Los Angeles any day of the week.

I had the longanisa (filipino sausage... yeah you want some o' dis? ;)), eggs and potatoes and was pleasantly surprised by the combination. I was just full enough with enough space to try the "main course" that I had been told by many to try...

THE ALMIGHTY BEIGNET!

I'm hooked. These things are like crack. They remind me of the Malasada that I've had so many times back home in Hawaii, but these are fluffier and instead of crystalline sugar, they dust their doughy treats with powdered sugar.

P. S. I DO look like a crackhead after eating a beignet. YUM!
author: Steevens A.

description:
Make sure to get the biscuits as the bread option that comes with the brunch plates. They're more like rolls than typical biscuits, but oh so buttery and delicious. The sausage at this place seem to be made on premise instead of the run of the mill Tootsie Roll variety. Their signature beignets didn't really do much for me though.

The atmosphere is laid back and the wait isn't too bad.
author: Alice W.

description:
Great breakfast spot with delicious menu options. We got beignets to start and they were fresh-made and still warm. So delicious with the (heavy) dusty of powdered sugar. Loved the fresh OJ and the scrambles, etc. The only thing I wasn't too thrilled about was the chocolate chip scone. It was more of a chocolate chip bread than scone. 

Service was nice and efficient, though they seemed a bit short-staffed at times.
author: Rowena L.

description: so far i've only tried the beignets.. they are B average. Next is the main dishes .
author: Dorian M.

description: This is my bf and my go-to spot for some good solid breakfast. We only go on off-peak times, like late weekday brunch; weekends it's lines out the door. I ordered the Cowgirl (2 eggs, sausage, 2 pancakes) eggs scrambled and subbed link sausage for andouille sausage, added a side of grits. while we waited for our food, we noshed on some beignets topped with beautiful snowy powdered sugar. The coffee is decent too. Servers are always friendly and get you your check quick without making you feel like they are rushing you out. A big plus is the parklet outside which makes for a nice place to wait. Pro tip- dont forget to sign the list clipboarded on the side of the door! Come on, that would be a SF-Rookie mistake.
author: Anita H.

description:
There's nothing wrong with a little pre brunch beignet, right ?  We were waiting for a table nearby, and u saw the sign do beignets and couldn't resist.  They're only $1.85 each, 3 for $5.

The beignet was freshly fried, topped with powered sugar, fluffy and light, not too dense, pretty awesome ;) it was a bit salty, topped with just the right amount of powdered sugar, awesome with raspberry preserves.

As for the menu, they have your standard breakfast fare, and you can customize your own breakfast burrito.  Bonus: giant mimosas.

The wait isn't too bad even though it's a small place - just out your name on the clipboard on the wall outside.  They have a cute patio area you can sit on while you wait, too.
author: Marilyn T.

description: I try and get over to Just For You on Fridays for lunch... The food is amazing and I love the ambiance... The staff is friendly and the menu spans the usual suspects to some creative tasty treats!
author: Frank L.

description: Amazing food, cute decor, and really awesome and attentive staff!!!! A must go to and worth the wait!!!! Beignets are just like those in New Orleans!!!
author: Vanessa B.

description: Really cool place. They have a great menu, and I had a bit of difficulty deciding what I wanted to eat since everything sounded delicious. I ended up ordering the bacon linguine, which was one of the few daily specials. (I also considered two more: the prosciutto and mozzarella sandwich and the diablo shrimp). The first waitress I spoke to hadn't tried any of the three so couldn't make a recommendation. Supposedly they change around the specials a lot. That's cool, I picked the safest bet. The pasta was cooked really well, and came with a side salad. However it was suuuuper rich, which made me wish that I hadn't finished my salad before eating the pasta (to keep it light). Also there was a tremendous amount of bacon, which while a great thing also made me super thirsty. In such a small cafe, I was surprised how long and difficult it was to get someone's attention for a water refill, which is why I took the review down to four stars, kind of rounding up from 3.5. I will most likely be back.
author: Lizzie C.

description:
Didn't have to wait long for my order, I came a few minutes before noon and had my bacon cheese burger and fries ($16.00) to go. This place does get PACKED! 
My burger was pretty good as well as the fries. I'd come back again since it's a block away from my division. 
Great customer service too.
author: Shaun R.

description: Recently moved to the neighborhood and been here 2x / week ever since. Best breakfast in SF hands down. Great food, great service and amazing retro posters!
author: Lena S.

description:
Of all the breakfast spots I could go to in SF, this is the only joint I'll hit up. The coffee is strong & always refilled, every breakfast option will not disappoint, and the staff is unpretentious. It's definitely a great place to start your day. 

My favorite dishes are the oatmeal pancakes, hangtown fry (I have a soft spot for fried oysters), cornbread, and a side of longanisa.
author: Lucy W.

description:
What I love about this place is being in the Dogpatch neighborhood, mostly, and there aren't tons of choices for brunch. This was the second time we've eaten there, and I had forgotten that we had the same exact impression the first time. I felt nickeled and dimed for every substitution (dollared and dimed, actually). We have a carb-free diet, which is becoming quite common, I've found. So they gave us $1 off for each of the toast and potatoes, but still charged my wife $4 for adding tomatoes, avocado and cheese to her scramble. A lot of places just sub out bread and potatoes for a few tomato slices and avocado. 

I ordered a cobb salad, which was just OK, but for the price, it seemed mighty small. Fortunately my wife didn't finish her scramble. Getting the picture?

If you want to enjoy the sunny, industrial Dogpatch neighborhood, which you should, and which is bursting with industrial character and history, I might suggest going here only for the bengiets and coffee and leave it at that. We went on a Monday, but I think it still gets crowded on the weekends, don't ask me why, none too many choices down there, I suppose.
author: Dave S.

description:
"Juuuust For Meeeee..." Who remembers that commercial? ;)

Beignets, beignets, and more beignets pleeease! Or is it I just haven't tried anything else from here? Ehhh, who cares when they got piping hot beignets! The beignets are nice and dough-like which is how I like 'em. 

Keep in mind that Just For You isn't "just for you" after 3pm... sucks for me cause I crave them around dinner time!
author: S Y.

description: Four stars for the longanisa and fast, pleasant service. Everything else (eggs, potatoes, lemonade) ordinary.
author: Inigo M.

description:
We had wanted to check this place out for awhile, and finally made it there for a late breakfast on Monday.. 

My guy had a breakfast burrito, which was good, but nothing extraordinary. He ordered potatoes on the side, but never got them, although they were on the bill. (As soon as we pointed this out, it was corrected.) 

The beignets seem to be VERY popular here, but we didn't get them. We did try the cornbread, which was probably the best thing we had here. 

I had to send my bacon back to be made crispier, and my poached eggs weren't runny. Even worse,my pancakes were raw in the middle. I sent those back too. When they finally came back they were pretty good. 
We shared one buttermilk and one cornmeal pancake, the cornmeal was the winner of the two. 

I was a little annoyed that one of the servers said i wanted my pancakes well done, and that was why they were taking so long...No, i didn't want them well done, just not raw.... 

As we were leaving, there was a line out the door, so obviously, this is a popular place. 
Some of the food was tasty, but it's not worthy of a return trip for me.
author: Amanda G.

description:
My favourite place in the neighbourhood.

Service is amazing. Food is hearty and affordable. Make us feel like family every time we visit.
author: Nick C.

description: Very good food and even better customer service. I ordered Cherie's home fry special and it was good, but too many red bell peppers for my liking. Anyways, one of the servers noticed that and gave us free beignets after our meal.
author: Shawn G.

description:
It is not a weekend in San Francisco unless I am eating at Just For You at least twice.  On my days off, I usually start here.  I go with eggs and a turkey sausage patty (sweet and savory) with homemade wheat toast and I sit outside.  I bring a notebook and plan my day, talk with the warm staff, and drink in the day's potential.

On Saturdays or Sundays, I round up my hungover friends and we grab a big table inside.  Beignets to soak up the alcoholic remnants in our bellies, a Hangtown fry (fried oyster omelet), Benedict special, or something with the hatch green-chile sauce usually follows.  Then after about 6-10 cups of coffee we are ready to tackle the day, or return to the couch either way we're happy.

Just For You now opens for dinner and I have eaten there once.  The food was decent the price was high for the flavor.  But, I understand.  Just For You is breaking into a foodie neighborhood and growing pains are expected.  The Dogpatch boasts some proud restaurants.  I was chatting with one of the staff and they told that they are currently searching for a new executive chef to take them to the next level.  

5 stars. This place is a San Francisco staple and an ambitious kitchen.
author: Grant L.

description: my bf and i come here at least twice a month, if not more often. sure, there's a TON of breakfast options in san francisco, but there's something about just for you that i'm drawn to week after week. it could be the consistency of their food, the friendliness of their staff, the proximity to where i live, and even the eclectic-ness of their decor, but i find myself craving their omelettes, potatoes, cornbread, scones, beignets, and pancakes come sunday morning. they've never once failed me. do yourself a favor and check out this truly neighborhood gem.
author: Melissa Y.

description:
Dishes selected:

French Toast
Beignets
Cornbread
Biscuits and Raspberry Jam

While I have no idea how a menu touting "New Orleans and Mexican specialties, California classics" came about at Dogpatch darling Just For You Café, the hours and location couldn't be beat given my Monday conference agenda and with breads all baked in house while meats and produce are largely local and mostly organic the restaurant seemed worthy of an early morning walk up to Portrero Hill.  Finding the restaurant expectedly small, kitschy, and without a doubt the sort of place where 'regulars' make up the majority of the clientele I was quickly greeted like an old time friend upon entry and placing my order without much delay it would be perhaps five minutes later that I was treated to a pillowy beignet lighter, larger, and far less greasy than I'd experienced since my visit to New Orleans - a good start to be sure.  Focusing more on sweets than savories, what followed the beignet would prove equally impressive with the French toast golden and soft, the cornbread a sweet block warm from the oven, and the biscuits raised high with rich buttermilk notes and a light yeasty linger than paired beautifully with the house made raspberry jam - the whole meal with tax and tip ringing in at $17.50 and worth every penny.
author: Michael U.

description:
I was expecting fireworks from all the brunch hype, but I'm not sure Just For You lived up to my expectations! 

Why it's good: 
-reasonable wait for brunch on the weekends. a safe spot to go to if you don't feel like waiting until brunch the next day. 
-beignets are sweet and fluffy and powdered sugary. didn't blow me away, but enough to satisfy my persistent saturday morning sweet tooth...diabetes is in my near future...

Why I didn't love it:
-the toast was dense and chewy. totally put me off! might not be important to some people...but made my breakfast that much less appetizing. 
-i had the cajun crabcake with overeasy eggs: the crabcake was good, but a little burnt and did not live up to the cajun/creole spiciness i was looking forward to...

verdict: totally good for a regular saturday brunch...not the place if you're lookin for a place to knock your socks off.

(if you're looking for knock your socks off new orleans style brunch: brenda's french soul food in the tenderloin.)
author: Sylvie C.

description:
Reasons to go here: beignets. Need I say more?
Chicory coffee (I like it, not everyone does). 

The egg dishes, etc. are huge and consistently good. Not amazing, but consistently good. This is the kind of place that has biscuits and gravy, if you're in the mood for clogging up your arteries. 

There's usually a wait if you go on the weekend. Having said that, they are good with groups, and it has a very homey atmosphere.
author: Sam Z.

description:
We came here after climbing at Dogpatch Boulders. The service and people here are exceptionally nice. I ordered the tofu and vegetables and got exactly what I envisioned. The vegetables were very fresh and the tofu was the right type of toughness (not too soft or hard). 

This place also serves up large mimosas (16 oz glass), which is nice. They also have large portions and the place is a mom-and-pop type joint. Enjoy if you are in the area!
author: Lillian C.

description:
One of the few exceptionally wonderful breakfast experiences in San Francisco. Price to happiness ratio: out of this world. 

No parking available and there is a line so get here early.
author: Justin S.
