description: We have always loved Just For You and continue to come back time and time again. The breakfast food cannot be beat and the price is right too! Service is prompt and friendly. On the weekends it can be pretty packed so be prepared to put your name on the waiting list outside the door and chill for 15 mins. or so. Totally worth the short wait for the great food and service. Just For You is our go to place for breakfast.
author: K J.

description:
I really lucked out and came when business was just right, and not terribly busy!  It was my first time here, and I ordered mexican chorizo with eggs along with a side of their home fried potatoes.  I also had a cup of their house coffee and fresh beignets dusted with powdered sugar.  I truly enjoyed everything I ordered, and I don't even like chicory coffee, but there's was palatable.  The service was very friendly and accommodating.  I truly enjoyed their Louisiana-style comfort food, and I certainly would go back again....

I truly love down-home local feel this place has.  You can tell the owner is very happy and the wait staff certainly makes us feel right at home.  Thank you for my great experience and I can't wait to go back again...
author: Christine R.

description:
Got a chance to try this place the other day at 730am and I was pleasantly surprised.  There's ample free parking outside and a cute little make shift seating area in the front.  It was taking up one of the parking spots instead of the sidewalk. 

Upon walking in,  the place was cozy and the servers were very  welcoming. It was fairly empty, so we had our choice of seats in the back. 
The waitress was really helpful and nice.  We took her recommendation and tried the Green Chili Huevos rancheros.  It was good,  but I do wish it was spicier like how it is in New Mexico. My husband got the breakfast special, which was a great deal with refillable coffee. 

Our water cups were always refilled and so was our coffee by the tall friendly waiter.  This is a great place to meet people and spend a quiet morning. 

We also tried the beignet and they were delicious! Eat them while they are hot. :)

I can't give a 5 star because the coffee wasn't very good.  I always drink my coffee black,  so I notice the flavors or lack of boldness. 

Overall a great place.  I would come again!
author: Katherine F.

description:
perfection place for breakfast  
try it ones few weeks ago,  then  went again
i  try to  find something wrong  ,  but  ,  not really,  the  food id 10 stars,  the service is 10 stars ,  the price is great,    trendy place,  cool people ,  i can take my dog and seat out side.   i like it
author: Li H.

description: I love this place! It is within walking distance to my house and is super laid back. It has anything you could possibly want for brunch, and it's all amazing!
author: Ali M.

description: We order the Beignets and oh my god! Def try it :) we ordered some to go too! The Egg Benedict was good. I had a combo of oatmeal and buckwheat pancakes. I liked the oatmeal one more. Also the Bleu Scramble was tasty as well :) above all, their customer service is amazing!
author: Elmira Z.

description:
I ordered the Chorizo Con Huevos, which was disappointing, because of the paucity of chorizo. It was like scrambled eggs with speckles of chorizos, instead of big chunks like I expected. I did like how they offered me a choice of corn vs flour tortilla. The home fries were not french fries like I assumed based on the name, but fried potatoes, soft on the inside, slightly crispy on the outside.

I also tried the Eggs Benedict with steak. The hollandaise sauce was heavy. Overall, the dish was very rich with the steak. I only ate about half of this dish. It was too heavy for me.

The winner were the beignets. They came out super fresh and piping hot from the kitchen. As I bit into my first beignet, a sweet whiff of steam hit me in the face. I savored every bite of the beignet, holding it close to my face each time, and repeatedly rolled it around in the powdered sugar which had fallen. The dough was light and fluffy, much better than the beignets at Brenda's (which I had eaten recently). The beignets saved what would have been just an average/ok brunch.
author: Jeanne L.

description:
I'm still drooling about the Hangtown Fry uhhhhhhggg.........(think Homer Simpson.......but prettier).

Got the potatoes and biscuits with it.. Both were tasty and.. it's actually a lot of food. I could not finish the entire thing by myself.

The bf got Greg's Scramble with Chicken Apple Sausage. I don't think that was even close to the deliciousness of what I had. It looked bland and...actually a lot less food than my Hangtown Fry. But still, it wasn't tooo bad.

After everything we wanted to try their Beignets. Called the server over..started saying "And we also wanted to try the...." he goes "Beignets? Okay, an order of 3 okay? It'll be right out!" AND it wasn't in that obnoxious know-it-all way, it was pretty cool. Apparently a lot of people order that here.

Beignets were sooooo goooood with the powdered sugar! Mmmmm Beignet............(now think Homer Simpson again with a donut) :P
author: Athena L.

description:
Half hour wait totally worth it, and you can grab a coffee while you said. Fast service and super friendly; my girlfriend and our wwitrr had heart to hearts about real grits (no butter, bit of salt n pepper) and the Tears For Fears music playing on the stereo. 

The veggie omelet special was amazing and cooked perfectly. The hangover scramble is sooooo good - didn't expect to enjoy oysters on eggs as much as I did. 

Oh, and PINT GLASS MIMOSAS.
author: Derek S.

description:
Thick slices of dense, chewy homebaked bread take their already yummy eggs benedict up a notch. I actually got the eggs blackstone: poached eggs with Hollandaise sauce, roasted tomatoes, and crispy bacon. I'd never heard of this combo before, but it tasted divine. It goes without saying that they poach their eggs perfectly: well-done whites and saucy yolks, perfect for mopping with the bread.

The servers are very attentive, the atmosphere quirky with vintage signage, and the neighborhood has plenty of parking. Great spot for comfort food brunch in the city. Next time, I'm trying their famous beignets!
author: Jen L.

description: Had a delicious roasted veggie omelette with eggplant marinara, opted for the fruit cup on the side rather than home fries and was even pleased with the fruit. And whatever you do, don't skip the beignets. Sitting at the counter is a fun experience, too. Definitely plan on going back.
author: Patrick F.

description:
I'm not hyping this up for anyone but Just For You Cafe make the best beignets in the city! This, severely rained on with powder-sugar, pillow shaped pastry is soft and fluffy on the inside and has a thin crusty bite on the outside. Great flavor, great texture and tastes simply blissful with their raspberry jam! If we had ordered just the beignets and nothing else then it would be a 5 star rating, however we ordered a couple of their other breakfasts and found it to be just so-so. 

On top of the beignets, we had their: 
-Fritata of the decade w/ a side of grits: nothing out of the world but it wasn't bad either. 
-2 eggs w/ crab cakes and a side of home fries: their crab cake wasn't too bad but we've had better. 
-French Toast: My 2nd favorite after the beignets, love love the Cinnamon after taste.

Glad to know there's a place in the city to go to when one if craving for beignets!
author: Jenny K.

description: What happened to our beignet go-to restaurant? Usually so good that they alone justify the visit. Today they were a disaster...even after returning one plate, the second was also undercooked... Like dough - raw dough in fact - in the middle..... Sad face.....
author: Kevin S.

description:
Been here a few times now. I have never been disappointed! Breakfast burritos covered in their green chili are amazing! Home fries are as good as it gets. Their special omelets are always well crafted and tasty. What tops their food is their friendly service. Even when busy the staff is very accommodating

Beignets, very well done too...Sadly NO ONE can ever come close to Cafe Du Monde in NOLA, but Just For You has very good ones! Takes me back to my trips to the big easy. 

Highly recommended breakfast spot!
author: Ed S.

description: Great food, great service, great prices. A true neighborhood gem. One of the best casual breakfasts in town.
author: Laura L.

description:
YUUMMMMAAAH!! This is definitely one of the better breakfast places in the city.

Venue: Nice medium size restaurant. may look small from the front but they have more seating in the back. Cute diner type setting. Expect to wait 15-20min on weekends.

Service: Kind of slow because they are busy.

Food:
- Beignet (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/N6z0so39b9fzGi8UWzI1Ww?select=-JEPDjcELUS7hMyCgyhJfw) - $1.75 OMG These are SOOOO GOOD!! A lot better than the ones at Brenda's French Soul Food. Better price too. These are soo flaky and light! Must Get!

- Oatmeal pancake (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/N6z0so39b9fzGi8UWzI1Ww?select=QrUGKOIOQUlUbEW7B5C08Q) - $3.25 One of the better tasting healthy pancakes ive eaten.

- Hangtown Fry  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/N6z0so39b9fzGi8UWzI1Ww?select=-zyZ-wzLqzqsSfMLa_zw9A) - $11.25 3 eggs scrambled with bacon, oysters, and onions. This one wasn't bad at all. Like how the toast has a home made taste to it. Hash was alright.

- Greg scramble (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/N6z0so39b9fzGi8UWzI1Ww?select=jZhX4NuKRv7w4GGTOIPoxQ) - $10.50 3 eggs scrambled with spinach, onions, garlic, and topped with parmesan cheese. This one was pretty good as well. The Corn bread was a little disappointing though... I like my cornbread grainier and sweeter.

Price: Price is reasonable. Especially worth it with the ScoutMob coupon. :)

Overall: Will come back to try everything else.
author: Jannifer H.

description:
Ambiance: charming southern hospitality, a mix between a diner and an antique shop it's got vintage signs and slogans all over the wall as well as a diner counter in the back.

Food: huge portions, yummy southern options, beignets, grits, sausage, everything your little southern heart longs for

Tips: 
*expect a wait for weekend brunch, put your name on the list outside
*line moves relatively fast
*staff is super friendly
*free coffee while you wait
*expect a food coma, it's good but the food is heavy!
author: Betty C.

description: The English muffin, buttery biscuits and Beignets are off the hook. They make home made bread, good for a small groups. The mimosas are great as well cures any hang over!!!
author: Mony K.

description:
Tasty omelette that didn't skimp  on the meat - staff was very friendly and actually listened when asking the usual "how are you".

Little pricy $14 for omelette + fruit cup but still enjoyable.
author: Sam S.

description: So disappointed. We waited for 25 min.  for a table which we expected. We sat down, ordered our food which took another HOUR and TEN minutes. My food was cold, and they didn't try to make it right. People who came in 20min after us were served before we were. Hint, hint...Service is also a consideration when selecting a restaurant especially at what they charge. Never again.
author: Maria M.

description: I had the 3 eggs with spinach onion and chorizo and it was excellent. The beignets deserve their French name. They are real beignets and they are super good
author: Cricri B.

description:
Amazing service and yummy breakfast.  I had the Cowboy with Gluten Free French toast and home made chicken sausage. 

Everything was excellent and we will be back.
author: Deborah V.

description: My favorite breakfast spot in the city. Very vintage inside, and even still has an old '50's school counter that can be sat at.
author: Max K.

description: I love their beignets and corn bread! It's so tasty. It's a cosy neighborhoody place. Recommend.
author: Ting C.

description:
My high school French teacher always said, "Make beignets, not war!" I always wanted to try a beignet, and whether it was truly authentic or not, it was mad tasty here during my first and second visits. (If you don't like too much sugar, you can ask for it on the side.)
(I also recently learned from someone who grew up in France that my French teacher's saying is not an authentic French phrase.)

Other Pros:
-Love the fun, colorful, cozy environment 
-Waitress was attentive but not pushy
-Personal preference: like how they serve water without ice
-Breakfast potatoes are perfect - slightly crispy yet soft inside; also has great balance of salt and pepper (could see how some would think they are tad too salty though)
-Bacon is a thicker cut. Though not as crispy as other restaurants', I like how the combo of the less crispy bacon and thick cut make the bacon THEIR unique bacon.
-Great place to people watch
-Only a few blocks away from Rickshaw Bagworks which is a neat place to buy eco-friendly, personalized grocery bags, laptop bags, etc.  

Cons: 
-Was slightly disappointed the hangtown fry didn't have more oysters. Guess I'll have to shuck my own next time. 
-If you can't handle slightly sarcastic, witty signs, this ain't the place for you. 
-If you're looking for a romantic, bougie brunch place, I would not recommend this for a date like such.
author: Judy L.

description:
This cute little cafe offers more than meets the eye. Everything this cafe serves is organic and produced locally. And their bread is freshly made in-house.

The owner is originally from New Orleans, so their menu has a few dishes normally found only in the Big Easy. Their daily specials rotate and if you're lucky, you might just get to try their muffalettas. I haven't had one since I went to New Orleans in 2004. 

Everything on the menu looked delicious, but I decided on the Greg Scramble: eggs, jack, spinach, onions and chicken apple sausage, with parmesan sprinkled on top and a side of home fries. WOW! Everything tasted so fresh. 

My husband had the Cowgirl which is a combo platter with two buttermilk pancakes, eggs and sausage. He asked if they could add bananas on top of the pancakes and they impressed us by mixing fresh banana IN the batter! It was so good. 

Life moves a bit more slowly in here. Their famous sign: "We reserve the right to pour coffee on your cell phone" is a declaration that this cafe is a place to sit, relax and enjoy your food. And that's a concept that we tend to forget with our busy lives, smartphones and laptops. 

On my next visit, I'll try the beignets :)
author: Mariela D.

description:
This is one of my favorite brunch places in the city. Why? Food is great, the staff are incredible, and there is parking everywhere! 

We went there with 5 people and were seated within 15 minutes, which is pretty amazing for a top rated Brunch Place in San Francisco. The staff there have a good sense of humor and really step up to take care of you. They aren't just sales people, they care about their customers and discourage against waste. 

As advertised, their beignets are awesome. You really only need one to share among a few friends. They are piping hot when they come out, and they recommend you have it after your meal. 

I had the corn beef hash and it was great. They have pretty good portion control, and will always offer to wrap your food up. 

One more thing. i love that they have a sign that says 'They reserve the right to pour coffee on your cell phone". That's right! Cell phones belong in your pocket/purse during a meal!
author: Winny F.

description: I always wanted to try this place because it is so packed on weekends but I was not impressed. The costumer services was incredible and right on point and very attentive but I the food was...ok. I had Greg's Scramble 3 eggs scrambled with spinach, onions, garlic, and topped with parmesan cheese with mushrooms and zucchini (the veggie version). It was ok, nothing special for $10. My AE accepted.
author: Magda G.

description:
There is always a line on the weekends and there is a reason...

Beignets
Biscuits and Gravy

Everything else on the menu is solid!  Just remember to order the bacon crispy
author: Jon H.

description:
Pretty good if you like a variety for breakfast. I'm a pretty picky eater and find it hard to find a place that stands out. 
Just for you has a lot to offer and you always leave feeling satisfied
author: Lilia R.

description: Wow last review I wrote for this place was 2006, prior to that I've been frequenting this place since 1997, what more to say but I love this place! Cypress or regular mimosas in a pint glass mmmmkay girl, they know how I like my brunches!  Now that  the neighborhood has become a hotbed of real estate and crowds have changed with a  little mix from the OG's & the newbies, I will gladly wait in that new sunny parklet of theirs to be seated.  Just for you, feels just as it states it's name, yup I leave there feeling it was just for me. ***grins***
author: B H.

description:
(See pics)

Came here with great recommendations from Julie K and Kevin N on the beignets. Yes, for beignets, I am willing to track and explore the next sweetness.

Came here a couple times. A cafe with a hint of diner. The eggs benedict was good. The beignets were quite delicious. I do wish they serve specialty coffee or French press ones because I truly believe coffee is like wine, it enhances the taste of breakfast.
author: T L.

description:
Went back for second breakfast (on a different day)... needed some triage on some Saturday morning after some debaucherous Friday night.

Seating took a bit this time (~40 minutes?) but we walked around the neighborhood to kill time.

We tore it up (probably to the shock and awe of surrounding patrons) by consuming the entirety of:

Crabby bennie (crab cakes and hollandaise on gluten-free toast with grits),
Side of grilled catfish (it was tasty but not as blackened as I'd like)
Grapefruit mimosa pint
Oatmeal pancakes (really good)
Granola and fruit (loved this; I liked that it was plain yogurt (there were plenty of sweeteners on the table))

Again, love the coffee-while-you-wait outside. The gluten-free options are a special treat for those gluten-avoiding people (my boyfriend is thrilled that he can order toast and pancakes, for example)

And our waiter was friendly, had awesome style, and totally humored our constant encomium of every appearing course.
author: Eta O.

description:
Great breakfast spot in the dog-patch.  Been here a couple of time, and the joint fits the hood; its low key, no fuss, friendly staff and southern style food make this an ideal spot.

The beignets are amazing -- i go for the omelet or the scramble; pass on the toast but an extra helping of the fruit.  You mug of coffee is kept full and the table is yours.

I don't like coming on the weekends, too long of a line -- mid week is the best.  Schedule a breakfast meeting and go here.
author: G R.

description:
I passed by this place multiple times and seen how busy it was each time so it made me want to check this place out. I am glad I decided to come and get breakfast food well after 12pm!

There is indoor: for eating; and outdoor seating: for eating (two tables) and for waiting. On a nice clear and sunny day, the outdoor waiting area was pleasant. There are menus outside for us to look at before we are seated. The staff are welcoming and energetic - good customer service.

I order the Blue scramble with home fries and 2 slices of cinnamon raison toast for 11.95. You can choose to get one or two slices of toast and both options are the same price. The portions are more than enough and definitely filled me up. They have a large selection of hot sauces (but not sriracha which is my choice above all). The scramble and home fries are delicious for a relatively low price! I also ordered a beignet bc it is all over yelp and it was delicious as well. Crispy edges, soft center that is slightly salty with sprinkled powder sugar. YUM! They put a lot of powdered sugar, but its easy to scrape off.

I will definitely come more often!
author: Shirley M.

description: This place is a little over hyped. No complaints about the food but nothing out if the ordinary. Ambience is unique and different. Go there for an experienced but don't expect too much from the food. The service is great and people are friendly, attentive and polite.
author: S R.

description: Corn meal pancakes and chicken sausage were excellent. Eggs perfectly poached. The English muffin was really good which seems like an odd thing to say since it is hard to screw up an English muffin but surprising how often that happens. It tells you they care about every little thing while maintaining the vibe and service of a neighborhood diner. If I didn't live in Baltimore I would be a regular
author: Tim C.

description:
Boyfriend had chilli scramble and devoured it, I had the greek scramble (meh, it was okay, still trying to adapt to American breakfast preferences/choices & stay healthy at the same time) and also ordered some beignets to go (WHICH WERE SO GOOD!!! better than English jam filled donuts). There was a long wait on a Sunday late morning (11 am ish) but we were still seated and served pretty quickly, the place was very busy and loud but that is to be expected from such a popular brunch restaurant. Good food, good service, very affordable.
Would definitely go back but order pancakes this time!
author: Anya P.

description:
Great service, amazing food. We were lucky and were seated with 5 people after waiting 10 minutes on a Sunday brunch! I would recommend this place over and over again and I will be returning. 

I had the lobster bene and the beignets! All amazing!
author: Kaitlin T.

description:
Anyone who lives in Potrero Hill has seen the crazy lines on 18th St. outside of Plow.  What the people waiting don't understand is that there is a much better place just down the street in Dogpatch at Just For You. And, without the long line and crazy wait.

Just For You is the kind of restaurant where, when you ask for something special or a customization like substituting chicken apple sausage for pork sausage in a scramble, they write it down, repeat it to make sure they got it right, and come out to check with you again if there's any issue. At Plow, they'll roll their eyes and begrudgingly make the change because they think their breakfast is just SO awesome - but at Just For You they understand that breakfast is all about what I want, and how I want it cooked.

Here's some more reasons why I love just for you:
- They bake their own bread and their cinnamon raisin is the bomb
- They also make their own sausage, and the chicken apple sausage is top notch
- Pint mimosas made with fresh grapefruit or orange juice - much more satisfying than a wimpy flute
- Their cornmeal pancakes - get them
- Even their homefries are awesome, not too fried and the right amount of potato

The last thing I'll say is about price.  Just For You is so affordable.  You'll get a great breakfast for two for $25, and if you want to indulge and get mimosas, side of pancakes, beignets, the works - you'll still have trouble getting your bill above $40.
author: Adam F.

description: Wow! Portions are huge! This is an every person kind of place, with a welcoming atmosphere.  Bathrooms are clean with hilarious signs and a fresh feel. Food was excellent.  It was made to order and hot when it hit the table. My eggs were perfect which is had to get right.  Great bruch spot with mimosas and beer!
author: Rachel G.

description:
The beignets... don't leave without trying the beignets.

The host is always so funny and welcoming, I love him

The food is great - best place to have brunch. On weekends the wait might be longer than usual, but definitely worth it!
author: Lizette C.

description:
I love their beignets. They are my favorite place to grab this fluffy pastry. It is did not contain too much bread; it had the right amount. 

My boyfriend ordered the po boy. It was lacking in the shrimp, and was pretty ordinary; however, this is our spot for dessert. 

5 stars for beignets.
author: Hazel N.

description: I've been informed that I'm sadly mistaken and those are indeed true beignets. If you decide to eat here you can judge for yourself. They're deep fried tasty donuts either way. Just remember avoid the huevos like the plague!!!
author: Ritu K.

description:
After writing four 2-star reviews, I need to write about some place good. 

This is a fantastic place for brunch, and they are armed with their incredible staffs. They are on top of everything, make sure everything is in order with long lines outside. 

Beignet is good here, but it is a bit on the softer side. Hash is good here. My favorite drink is the fresh squeeze apple and grapefruit juice, yum yum! Food is are not incredible, but it is definitely solid brunch offerings.

I like the casual decor with the awesome poster collections!

Yes, everything here makes you feel like Just For You!
author: Alice C.

description: Yum, beignets. Some of the best I've had outside of New Orleans. Solid breakfast burrito as well. And friendly staff!
author: Nisha R.

description: This place is quite crowded and somewhat noisy. The service is good. I love the decor its really funny. The beignets I saw in person looked bigger than the pictures. I'd like to try one of those. The eggs were done almost perfectly and the French toast was a bit too raw for my taste. Still very good meal plan on coming back to try those beignets.
author: Gilad P.

description:
Once again, long overdue.  This spot was in my backyard for many years, and I continue to drag my half-awake belly and brain to this main event (wife in tow).  

What else but the beignets, the Filipino Longanisa  sausage, and the atmosphere.. dog patch heaven. HOWL.  

http://blog.junbelen.com/2011/11/16/l-is-for-longganisa-filipino-style-sausage/

I've never been disappointed here, bring the family too... but plan ahead for the wait, strategy is everything!
author: Jay K.

description:
Neglected writing yelp reviews for over a year! Not good... but I'm back!

I was just at this place last Sunday, and I have to say it was just okay. I swear, San Franciscans all go gaga over Sunday brunch which is why there was a wait. But not too bad, about 20-30 mins. Cute little cafe with friendly servers. They have a lot of different breakfast selections, and I loved the various side options they offer with your entree. I opted for the crab cake benedict, except I got it on an English muffin instead of their house made toast. And I got grits on the side just to be daring and try it for the first time. The benedict was not bad, but it was just a little heavy. As for the grits, I was not a fan of them at all, but at least I gave them a try! I would have loved to tried their beignets, but I was stuffed. The location is great, and parking is not too terrible, but there are a handful of other breakfast joints in SF I rather go to.
author: Marilyn W.

description:
SO MUCH BETTER THAN I IMAGINED. The reviews were encouraging and I went on a recommendation from a friend, and good lord... the food was incredible, the servers were all extremely friendly and attentive, there was no problem getting a good spot which I was worried about with the reviews... Oh man, and the menu was FULL of tantalizing options, I will for sure be back ASAP!! I wish there was a more convenient location, that's the only reason why I haven't been back 7 more times since I first went.
I ordered overeasy eggs, a crabcake, cornbread, and homefries, all of it coming in a very nice little combo meal. Being a big eater, I ate it all and it put a smile throughout my whole body. I am a crabcake enthusiast and I really loved theirs, very flavorful and yummy! The home fries surprised me with their bold taste, in most restaurants they're just a modest side but these had real, delicious flavor!! Good coffee, good eggs, very yummy cornbread. Can't wait to be back and try a million more things!!!1!!!1!!!!1!!
author: Beth S.

description: My first time here today. I came here to get some breakfast. There wasn't too many parking available . I had to circle around a few times. There was a waiting list I had to sign when I got there outside the door but the wait wasn't too long about 10 minutes. I ordered the Greg's scramble. It had onions spinach chicken apple sausage and cheese.  It was pretty good. Service was good. I would come here again to try the other things on menu.
author: Susan M.

description:
Came in here after failing at 3 other locations on a Sunday morning breakfast search...I'm glad I did. It has a kind of diner / cafe feel...which is very relaxed and welcoming. We had to put our name down and wait about 15 mins....always a good sign. This was also helpful since I noticed a big sign about their beignets, it is a must try, a great thing to share for the table. I had the blue cheese scramble, which was a little strong on the blue cheese for me, but I could also see how people who love blue cheese would prefer that. The standout item were the biscuits, perfect balance of fluffy and flakey. The others in my party just got a simple 2 eggs breakfast, but they came with grits, which seemed fun.

Overall, I recommend this place for a chill, hearty, farm-fresh kind of breakfast.
author: Mayur A.

description:
I always give props to businesses for caring about their customers! Someone from JFY took the time to write that the crab cakes are Creole style & not New England style (which is the one I'm used to). I still would get a scramble over the crab cakes tho if I were to ever return.

As for their bread, while I'm personally not a fan, they are selling loaves & loaves of it out so perhaps it is simply a matter of taste.

Thanks for the 411 Reuben.
author: Sabrina L.

description: Cute little neighborhood place.  Food was good and will definitely head back if I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Edgar C.

description: I was introduced to this place by a friend who grew up nearby. I loved the atmosphere and let me declare that I may have had the best breakfast burrito here. Their buckwheat pancakes are fantastic as well. I definitely want to return next time I'm in town!
author: Vasthi F.

description: I'm here often.  Never had a bad meal.  The Chile Scramble with cornbread and grits is wonderful!
author: Steve T.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for so long and I finally tried it! My boyfriend and I had brunch on a Sunday at about 1pm. As we were walking to Just For You Cafe, I already could tell that the wait was going to be a while due to the amount of people waiting outside of the restaurant. The wait was about 20-30 minutes for 2 people (Just For You Cafe goes down the list instead of basing it on how large/small the party is so that was nice!) I was definitely expecting much, but Just For You Cafe pretty much looks like your typical "hole in the wall" type breakfast joint which added that nice "homey" vibe to it. Our waiter was extremely nice, prompt, and friendly which is a huge plus! I ordered the Cowgirl while my boyfriend ordered the Crab Benedict with Home Fries.

Cowgirl (bacon, eggs, and 2 buttermilk pancakes) - The pancakes were ah-mazing! They were thick, fluffy, and absolutely delicious! The eggs were a little bit on the liquid-y side which I didn't mind and the bacon.. wasn't the best, but it did the job.

My boyfriend said he really liked his Crab Benedict. I think he saw me staring at his Home Fries so he traded me for bacon lol and let me just say that it was the best trade ever! The Home Fries were one of the best I've tasted!  GET THE HOME FRIES! Overall, I really enjoyed this place and the fact that it's across from Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous is a major plus.
author: Joyce E.

description: Me and my friend were on a mini vacay to San Fran and just happened upon this place one morning. It couldn't have been more perfect! We were so happily surprised to see beignets on the menu! (so hard to find good beignets in california!) This place has a really good atmosphere. There are really quirky and interesting posters and pieces and pictures covering the walls. They even have very sarcastic little posters in the window. Overall it was just a fun interesting place with great food and a cool vibe. Beyond satisfied!
author: Kailin D.

description: Hip place to grab a quick meal. Fast, friendly service comes with excellent food (I had the mixed fried shrimp and fried oysters po' boy, along with decent beignets) in a location near my work. Since this is San Francisco, the $15 price tag for lunch was not too expensive.
author: DV P.

description:
Came here at 11 am on a weekend and the wait for a party of 2 was about 15 minutes. Not bad for weekend brunch in the city. I had high hopes for this place given all the good reviews but the food was just ok. I ordered the greg's scramble with grits and cornbread. The cornbread was dry and the grits were bland. I guess I'm just used to eating grits with cheese and very well seasoned. The scramble was average, could definitely get the same quality elsewhere. Ordered the beignets and they were the best out of everything we got but again, not the best I've had. 

Probably won't be coming back given all the other delicious brunch spots SF has to offer. Three stars because I'm biased towards breakfast foods. Any restaurant that serves eggs, pancakes, and french toast automatically gets three stars from me.
author: Monica W.

description: I ALWAYS get the chili scramble and it never lets me down!  The portions are always filling and there's the right amount of everything to keep me satisfied. The staff here is welcoming and always friendly.
author: Alex C.

description: Came here twice, both occasions they were pretty busy. Menu is witty. First time I had 6 people in my group and  a baby. They were accommodating and really nice. They served us promptly and didn't push us to finish faster. It was a catching up occasion so we were very happy. The prices are reasonable and the portions are huge! I never finish my food, always have to bring it home. 2nd time it was a group of 4 and same great service. We also got the beignets, and truth be told, I've had beignets in New Orleans (1st time) and these are no where near Cafe du Monde caliber, not that they claim to be. But I have a very high bar set. These beignets had a fermented taste to them, which me and my friends didn't enjoy.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
Just For You Cafe is one of my favorite overall breakfast/brunch places in SF. The service is excellent, the atmosphere has a grassroots neighborhood vibe, it's not pretentious whatsoever, and most importantly, the food is excellent. 

My one and only complaint (and it's actually a pretty big complaint): the coffee here is horrible. The house coffee I had here was so burnt that there are moments when I felt like I was tasting Korean Shin Ramen MSG packets. I know it's weird and I thought I was going crazy for a second, but the taste just really reminded me of something MSG-related. Regardless, it was disgusting. But perhaps I just had a bad burnt batch -- so I'm not going to ding them too much on it.

The star of the show here is (as everyone else has mentioned): their beignets. I just came back from New Orleans, where I had amazing beignets from Cafe du Monde and Morning Call, so hopefully that gives me some credibility when I say this: Just For You Cafe's beignets are even better than the ones in New Orleans. Yeah yeah, gasp all you want -- it is what it is. If only I had some decent coffee to drink with it.

Corned Beef Hash was excellent; Crab cakes were delicious. Everything just tasted like good old fashioned homestyle breakfast cooking. I was bit disappointed with the biscuits (they weren't fluffy enough), but the gravy was addicting.

The owner came around with a big smile and warm greetings. Always a plus when you have a neighborhood joint like this. Also, with the long waits, they provide coffee outside for those who are waiting. Little things like this just really hit home for me (even though the coffee was horrible, but it's the thought that counts).

All in all, Just For You Cafe is a wonderful breakfast/brunch restaurant that blends together incredible food with a intimate, genuine vibe. 

If it weren't for the coffee, this place would get a resounding 5 stars from me.
author: Roy C.

description:
This review are for the Beignets. 

They are the best in town. A must get if you're in the area. Woot!
author: Arlito C. L.

description:
I don't know where to start with this place. Hands down my favorite spot to get breakfast in the city. 

The heuvos rancheros with the Santa Fe green sauce is out of this world!!  I normally get it with scrambled egg, and they serve it all directly on the tortilla. (I can't be bovvered)  

Great chicory coffee. The beignets are delicious. The burritos are massive, and everything is just GOOD. 

The service is A+ too.
author: Jonathan B.

description: This cozy little eatery is a busy. I understand that weekend visits come with a long wait for the limited number of seats in the quaint breakfast joint; although Just For You does serve lunch a well. The service and dishes are better than average but the remote location and lack if seating makes this difficult to choose unless din the immediate vicinity. I would recommend this place first for the area for breakfast.
author: Michael G.

description:
I love brunch like the next fierce gay couple walking down Castro on Sunday morning after hitting the gym.. so trust me I was mucho excited to try this spot with its mean looking beignets and quirky signage.

I got the eggs (over medium) with Creole crab cake with home fries and cornbread. It only comes with one crab cake a little chauncey I'd say, a little cheesy, very mehhh but I ate it anyways cause you can't hate on crabs unless they're in your pants. Home fries were disappointing-they were charred on the outside but still hard on the inside and bland. You get your choice of side from a whole buttload of things like white, wheat, cinnamon raisin, biscuit, cornbread, scone, english muffins ohh my!! I got the cornbread.. and i got a big HUGE chunk of it!! It was okay, just plain cornbread nothing special.

The beignets lived up to the hype. They really know how I like it, hot hot hot... and fluffy.. and a little crispy on one side.. and powdery.. and they melt in your mouth/not in your hands and mmm just g dbbl o d good, and they made em just for me. Thanks!

I don't know if I'll go back, to have to wait through the crowds, but if I do I'm hoarding all the beignets to myself.
author: Angela W.

description: First time here, some local neighbor had an issue with us standing on the sidewalk.. Owner overheard and gave us free doughnuts? Good customer service, and definitely recommend people here
author: J C.

description: Just OK. Went here on a Saturday morning, and it was pretty busy. Service wasn't great, and it took them 20 min to get us water after asking twice. Our food sat up in the window for 10 min and was cold when it got to the table. Breakfast burrito was mediocre. Home fries were undercooked. However, the biscuits and gravy were very good.
author: Holly S.

description: We go here all the time. The staff is great, food is delicious, wait times are generally reasonable even at peak times and prices are better than most.
author: Audra P.

description: These five stars are not for gourmet or creative fare - they are for the killer biscuits and gravy and sugary beigniets.Great little diner atmosphere where they keep the coffee coming and are always super friendly.
author: Robert M.

description:
Often go here on the weekends for what is a really nice solid breakfast.  The food is always great.  The service is good and usually pretty quick.  There can sometimes be a little wait later in the morning,  but it is never bad.

I have tried several food items,  but generally end up with the breakfast burrito (mainly because I love getting the Hatch green chili sauce on it).  It is so good and has a really nice amount of heat.  My partner often gets the two eggs breakfast with biscuits and grits.  Their biscuits are really good homemade ones that I feel like are hard to find around here.
author: Jax B.

description:
Solid Yummy Brunch/Breakfast.

"Just" is right in my neighborhood and consistently good every single time. Sometimes there is a bit of a wait on a Saturday or Sunday morning/noon (up to 20-25 mins) but usually it's pretty painless for a party of two.

I always get the Frittata of the Decade or Greg's Scramble. Comes with buttery warm cornbread and your choice of grits or homefries or fruit. 

Scrumptious beignets that come out hot! They def are giving Brenda's a run for their money here. Suggestion: different flavors.

For you? Yes.
author: Erin C.

description: Decided to stop for a late breakfast while walking the dog. Good hearty, fresh and tasty food. Good friendly service and dog friendly! Will definitely return again. Enjoyed the outside waiting area in the street;)
author: Mariah D.

description:
In town and finally had a chance to take a friends recc. and check this place out. I went for the Gregs scramble plus bacon and it was a winner. 

Location was cozy and the back room was relaxed and not too crowded. Low volume so chatting was easy.

The beignets. Wow. Love. Love. Love. 

Not what I had in mind for breakfast but DAMN was it a nice treat! 

The menu is hilarious - ex: "Grits.... just like you had in prison." haha. Awesome.

Def worth a stop in... if only for the beignets and a cup of coffee.
author: Sabrina B.

description:
Very nice lady who greeted me to go. She remembered my name based off of my credit card. I was standing out front waiting for my food so I didn't want to disrupt any guests while they were eating.

I would give it 5 stars but I had to go in to get my food. I thought they would see me standing outside waiting and would let me know but they were very busy.  Very nice people and the prices were legit.

I had a crab cake sandwich and a salad.  The side salad was basically just lettuce from my sandwich that spilled out.  The sandwich was delicious though. I like hole in the wall and would support small time business owners like this one!
author: Toby I.

description: That was some good stuff !!  Great omelette and Belgian waffles.  Recommended for breakfast or brunch.  It's super busy, but the wait at 10a on a Sunday wasn't too bad,
author: Tim T.

description: We are regulars. Absolute favs are the beignets and hang town fry - scrambled eggs, oysters and bacon with home fries and scone. Yum! Servers are very nice with lots of positive energy.
author: Pechay P.

description:
This was our first time here after seeing the reviews from other Yelpers. We went on MLK day, expecting a long wait because of the holiday but were pleasantly surprised by the short wait. We had 3 other groups ahead of us, but things seemed to be moving along fairly swiftly. Our party of 3 was seated after about 15-20 minutes of waiting. 

We got the Greg Scramble, French Toast, Chili Scramble and a set of 3 beignets. The Greg Scramble was ok. We got it with chicken apple sausage and corn bread. The corn bread was DELISH - served hot and fresh. The scramble was alright - I felt like I've had better. I wasn't so fond of the parmesan cheese on top, but oh well. And the rest of it was not blow-your-mind status. The French Toast was thick and yummy - also typical and yummy, but not to die for. The Chili Scramble was probably the best dish we had. The chili and eggs were laid on top of homemade cornbread. It was hot and yummy and full of flavor. We couldn't finish all of it. Lastly, I realize each place has their own version of how they make their beignets. This place made HUGE beignets, each the size of my palm. It's super doughy inside, making me wonder if it's supposed to be like that, or just undercooked. Either way, I think we could've all shared one and that would've been plenty. 

Overall, I think this place would be ok to come back to and I'm glad I checked it out, but I would not rush back anytime soon.
author: Sharon G.

description: I live close by and the staff and food are amazing!  Great place to come after a night of partying!
author: Phenion T.

description:
Beignets to be reckoned with. And they are less than $2 each, so you HAVE to order one with your meal, don't you?

I ordered the special omelet yesterday, which came stocked with crab cake, green and red peppers and hollandaise. It was a pretty rich, monster breakfast, which is exactly what I wanted because my stomach was fiercely growling. Still, I could only eat about 2/3 of the omelet before giving up (of course, I first looted all of the crab cake from inside the last 1/3 too). I ordered home fries as my side, and they could've been browned a bit more, but the flavor was excellent and the manager let me know in a PM on Yelp that if you ask for well-done, they'll be perfectly browned!

The menu slants a bit Southern with corn cakes and catfish, but also things like Filipino sausage, eggs benedict and breakfast burritos. Most brunch entrees come with a side of bread (even wheat-free is available) and the OJ and grapefruit juice are both fresh-squeezed. As far as drinks, it's beer, wine or champagne... and that means a mimosa is possible. This is a great thing.

It is a very small cafe, so expect to wait on the weekends and it's probably best to call ahead for a group larger than six people. We waited about 30-45 minutes. Don't fret though---put your name on the sign-up sheet and then run down to Piccolino, where you can grab a pick-me-up while you hang out and wait with bated breath for your name to be called. 

There were just two places for improvement here... 
-the coffee: the servers kept our cups full, but the coffee itself was not great.
-the credit card policy: they can only take three credit cards per check right now. The manager let me know that they are updating their system soon and it'll allow for smoother payment with split checks.
author: Annie D.

description:
The New Orleans style beignets were hot, soft and delicious. I was a little disappointed  they didn't make variety of flavors but these babies were satisfying pair with coffee. Waiter said that's how it's done in New Orleans. 

I also ordered the po-boy fried shrimp sandwich. I love fried food and the fried shrimp was perfect, lightly crusted texture with the bite of the soft bread, fresh tomato, lettuce and pickles. I was surprised by generous amount of huge shrimp on the sandwich. I can't wait to come back to try the brunch menu.
author: Ha S.

description: Wait time is insane! Waited over 90 minutes. Food took another hour. To be fair service was great, and food was worth the wait.
author: Neera P.

description: Good solid breakfast served all day. Super friendly staff! Nitrate free meat options. It's a small place - only 10 tables inside. Cozy friendly vibe.
author: Tessa F.

description:
Delicious beignets.  HUGE mimosas (pint glass!).  Eggs benedict over crab cakes.  All around solid brunching experience.

Expect a long wait, but located in a cute enough neighborhood to do a little time-killing-exploration.  Thumbs up!
author: Allison B.

description: Loved this place for brunch. The breakfast burrito and homemade salsa hit the spot. Get there early- it gets packed and seems to be a local favorite!
author: Sheryl W.

description: In a city where start up / tech douchery is quickly eroding authenticity and replacing it was the status quo and the "idea of cool" there is hope...the Just for You Cafe. This small diner embodies all that was right about San Francisco. Simple but creative menu, corky decor and the perfect amount of cynicism, efficiency and friendliness from the staff. I love it there. Keep doing what you're doing. Yay!
author: Eric J.

description:
This place is very interesting.  When you walk inside you get a taste of two different worlds.  It looks like a small diner you'd expect to see in a small fishing town infused with a lot of funky/awesome posters/wall decor that you'd expect to see at a place on Haight.  Always busy.  Always. Prepare for a wait each time you go unless you go early.  Wait isn't usually too long, 20-30 mins on avg. in my experience.

Food is good.  Nice portion sizes, price point isn't bad. Staff is always a delight despite the hectic, borderline chaotic environment that sometimes pops up.  Very attentive and the food comes out fast.  You can't ask for more. Beignets that are fluffy, light,  and airy.  Sugary fried goodness. 

It's worth a stop/trip if you're compiling an ultimate breakfast/brunch list for san francisco. It is in the Dogpatch and parking there is just woof. You could probably find a place similar to this minus the beignets in your own neighborhood.
author: Christopher M.

description: Good nearby place for brunch. Good burgers and eggs.
author: Motohiro T.

description: Hands down this place has it right! The food is well thought out yet whimsical! A huge feeling of home. Mimosas are out of this world along with everything else! We are from LA and will come back every chance we get! Most excellent!
author: Lindsay D.

description:
I'm a sucker for the retro decor, down-home feel, cute sayings in the bathroom and of course all things EGG and Southern Comfort. Though the portions could be bigger and the food a smidge fattier, the service pushes things up to 4 stars.

I first came here to meet some colleagues for coffee and I knew I'd be back: the hearty down-home fare and feel were just too cozy to forget. I passed on food at the time but the biscuits remained ensconced in my cerebral cortex. Today I came back and indulged in an Athena omelette (you know: feta, tomatoes, olives, onions and spinach) and my BF dug into the oh-so-popular Greg's scramble.

Again, neither one of us were wowed by the portions (my wandering fork would have appreciated more chicken apple sausage in his omelette, and my heart fell just a little bit at the size of my own dish), but the service was impeccable. Examples: they easily substituted my home fries for a very tasty salad, refilled our coffees constantly without charging us for them (even after we pointed that out when we got the bill), and was just overall friendly and responsive. 

All in a cute quiet corner in Dogpatch: definitely a fan.
author: Diane B.

description: Immediate seating and parking at 830 on a Saturday?? Under 20 a person!? Yes please.  Got a cute table in the window for 2.  Fun artwork and lovely helpful staff. Food was excellent! I had some sort of jambalaya and my friend had a shrimp po-boy. The cornbread was out of this world. Moist and tender.. Not dry and over-crumbly.  My friend wanted some but I was unwilling to share. I wasnt starving but I cleaned my plate. Cute, rustic and lovely.  There is also a few tables outside.
author: Kat L.

description: Our experience here was nothing short of great! Our wait was short and each employee was friendly and attentive. Our awesome waiter Clyde was so friendly and fast! He was on top of everything and even brought me extra silverware and napkins when I switched foods without even asking. His smile was infectious and he seemed to fully enjoy his job (which always translates to great service to me) P.S. My beignet was awesome and the coffee and mimosas were delicious! I highly recommend this place!
author: Larkin B.

description: This place has great beignets, I tried them for my first time here, they are like fluffy pillows of goodness.I thoroughly enjoyed my chorizo burrito as well. Very fast and friendly service.
author: Sally Y.

description: Strange name. Fantastic grapefruit mimosas and beignets.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Best gluten-free pancakes ever. Watch out for cross-contamination if you're allergic, though. I'm pretty sure even the orange juice had wheat in it from the glass (or where they squeezed it), as did the home fries and probably the chicken sausage. I'm less sure about the pancakes so I'll eat those separately on a future trip.

But they never said they were a gluten-free diner (which can be hard to make happen anyway), so they get 5 stars from me in any case. Good stuff!

Oh, and the eggs were perfect. I've ordered over easy at so many places and had it overdone. These were nice and runny, perfect for dipping.
author: Omar Y.

description: I tried this place again for brunch with a friend, and my experience was even better than last time. The service was friendly, and the special I ordered was great. The beignets and scone were delicious, as always.
author: Anna B.

description:
A great breakfast place in Dogpatch. Home-made wheat pancakes and toast. Nice menu selection and terrific staff.

The wait is about what one expects in a neighborhood place with maybe 15 tables and a small counter.
author: Richard H.

description:
Perfect before a Giants weekend day game. Make sure you give yourself plenty of time for the waiting list. This place is small and seating is very tight. PArking is very easy.

Breakfast was Excellent!
author: Richard G.

description:
Excellent neighborhood brunch place!  

Love - 
The beignets (fluffy, powdered sugar-y, fried yumminess!)
The scones
The frittatas
The french toast
The hot chocolate

It's small so expect a wait.  If you're ok with sharing a table you might be able to get seated faster.
author: Gowri R.

description: Great place for brunch. Very friendly, no-nonsense service, cool atmosphere, hip crowd, and pretty good food. Try the huge mimosas. Beignets are a must.
author: Jaime O.

description:
I go here with my fam when I visit my sis and we love it. A very trendy local spot with good food. I always get the chorizo breakfast burrito. It always does the job.

Fun, colorful people and decor. I'm a fan.
author: Robert S.

description: Best breakfast. Being from So. Louisiana, it's always nice to find a place that does that sort of cuisine well (there are not many). They are not serving Jambalaya (insert, "y'all") that I know of, but they do serve grits - and who'd want Jambalaya for breakfast anyways. The food is great, the staff is a lot of fun and good at their jobs, and this is the perfect place for a good, filling breakfast.
author: Ryan P.

description:
This place was great.

Came here for an early Sunday brunch, walked in at 8:30a.m and sat at a table right away.

Cool little atmosphere with posters and pictures all over the wall "homey kinda" feel to it all.

I ordered ... went with ..

Benignets - Sooo good , warm , fluffy , flavorful and just perfect to pair with a nice cup of endless coffee. Covered in powered sugar .. mmmM

Corn beef Hash - They make the corn beef in house which paired with there homemade wheat bread, two eggs over easy and potatoes makes for a great filling breakfast ... 

I will be back ... Pancakes looked great, definitely the oatmeal one and the beignets will have to be back in my belly again soon.
author: Anthony S.

description:
Went here for the first time with friends for Brunch on a Saturday early afternoon. Cute little place in the Dogpatch. There were some people outside waiting and a sign up sheet. I was surprised how quickly the line moved and we were seated. Very nice straight forward service, always around to keep your drinks full. Seems to be something for everyone on the menu. Lots of scrambles etc... Gluten free bread? Yup they have it. Try ordering beignets for appetizer and check out the nice art while you wait. 

There were so many things on the menu that I wanted to try, so I will have to go back for more!
author: Don J.

description: Just had their buttermilk pancakes they were Delish. Very relaxed atmosphere for as full as this place is it is fairly quiet. My friend had the chorizo scramble he really liked it, my other friend had the bacon and eggs she also loved it, nice thick cut bacon generous portions. Everything tasted fresh and cooked to perfection I would definitely come back here!
author: Janet C.

description: i used to love the beignet here but the last two times it wasn't that good....don't think i'll be coming here again.  need to find another place in the city!
author: Julie W.

description:
Five stars for the beignets! WOOHOO! Big pillowy goodness. So fresh, out of the fryer, dusted with powdered sugar and what can you ask more? Even Cafe Du Monde in New Orleans can't do anything to kill it!

Other things in the menu seems fine as they are. Brunch stuff - Benedicts, scrambles, pancakes, waffles, etc. Not too bad either. Service is okay - they tend to get really busy in the weekend so sometimes you lack affection there sitting on the table.
author: Rika P.

description:
Love this place.  Chorizo Breakfast Burrito YES!

After a early start to a morning, I found myself in need of some nourishment while the day was still young, that is, if 11am still counts!  One of my good friends turned me onto this "Just for You" Cafe, and once we found parking (quite the challenge around here), I will say that I am quite pleased with the choice.

After perusing the breakfast menu and being in the mood for pseudo-mexican food, I chose the breakfast burrito with Chorizo.  An excellent choice.  Though the burrito isn't HUGE, (maybe just 7 inches in length), the ingredients, especially the chorizo and green chile made it amazing.  I'd say the chorizo reminded me a bit of corned beef hash made from scratch, sans potatoes, of course.   I also, um.. borrowed half a slice of their bacon from my dining cohort.  Thick, soft, yet a bit crunchy with quite a lot of depth to the flavor. Yummy stuff.

The french toast looked perfect too, though I would have preferred it on thicker "Texas" Toast bread.  Next time.

Service was friendly, yet unobtrusive.  The ambiance here was nice on this warm day.. A gentle breeze wafting over the butcher block tables, nice bright artwork hanging on the walls, and great food & service to make it all really sing. Great job guys!

I'll definitely be back.
author: Harry W.

description: Been a fan for ages - love to take friends here - great food, fun place - and yes, they make do make it seem like it;s all just for you. Go there - enjoy!!
author: Carolyn L.

description:
**Yummy breakfast**

I definitely suggest checking this place out if you are in the area and are in need of a hearty and delicious breakfast. 

I had the "crabby Benny" and also tried my husband's burrito; both were really tasty. They bake their own bread which is really nice.  Overall a great little spot. :)
author: Laura L.

description: While the menu has good options, I wasn't impressed by their delivery. Perhaps the ingredients just weren't fresh, or they under seasoned the food. The ambiance is nice, and the wait wasn't bad for a party of 5 on Saturday (15-20 mins), but the food (which is all I really care about for brunch) wasn't anything special. Not an above average brunch spot.
author: Joseph B.

description:
Great homestyle food, friendly, attentive service, in a warm fun atmosphere. Not that bad of a wait for a Saturday. They have a few tables outside. The decor adds a lot of fun personality to the place with all the interesting posters.

- Beignets: big! sweet, good with the raspberry jam, love the powered sugar on top
- Special Scramble: tomatoes, mushrooms, Swiss = delicious. all my favorite ingredients for eggs
- Grits: plain, thick, still good
- Buttermilk Pancakes: just okay, fluffy, tastes like anywhere else
author: Linda C.

description:
Fantastic place love the Greg's scramble, going back again!!!!

And we did go back two days in a row, would have gone back each day we were there only we just found it two days before we departed.
author: Dale P.

description:
Fresh orange juice. Good grits amd corn bread. Had greg' special which has parmesan cheese, garlic, mushroom and onions ...which was good but need a little more spice. 
My friend had the chorizo with eggs which was flavorful and delicious!

I definitely like this spot - very low key, home-y, and comfortable! And their service is good!
author: Hey Y.

description:
Excellent dinner! They worked with me to seat my large party (30 people) with only a few days notice. That alone was super and impressive but upon arrival we were warmly welcomed and seated quickly. We also received really fast service and constant attention. The food was excellent and everyone enjoyed it. 

Their food is also priced very reasonably, making it a great value. Fantastic experience, all around.
author: Joseph K.

description:
I started this review with four stars...because well its hard to have five stars...but you know what, its a five star kind of place... Now its no five star place, if you know what i mean...but 5 star yelp...defina-surely...

I decided to go here with a friend.  It was brunch time and now that I live in the city the dog patch is actually not that far! This is not where you go when you are trying to keep your figure and you are concerned with calories.  This is where you go when you are hung over, hungry as hell, and you just want to eat...this is not where you go when you are concerned with the whose who of SF seeing you, seeing or being seen, dressing up or being trendy.  This is where you go when you want to sit in a corner and lick the left over powdered sugar off your fingers because the beignets are that good.  This is where you go when you don't want to choose between pancakes or eggs (because you can have both) where you want chilli on your cornbread...and grits on your plate.  You can even get fresh squeezed juice.  And the food is great.  

Parking is street, but not bad at all.  They could have a little more outdoor seating, but the waiter said that is coming very soon because they just got the permit approved to expand.  Just for you is right...there was about eight things on that menu that could have been just for me and I will take up the challenge to try them all.
author: Kierstan G.

description:
coffee tastes like weed. I kid you not.... and this is not a compliment...
But, their yogurt/granola/fruit/ honey bowl is UUHHHHH- MAZING.
author: Genevieve E.

description:
It's hard to separate where a restaurant is from how the good it is.  I love the Dogpatch, and this is a great location.  There is always a line here, which is annoying, but ostensibly bodes well.  The food here is pretty good, but today was the worst in a line of poor service experiences at Just for You.  

After waiting a while to be seated, we placed our order ... 25 minutes went by, and nothing arrived.  New people with the same size party (3) sat next to us and were served there dishes which they had ordered after us and had their dishes removed, at which point  I approached our waiter and cordially asked if maybe he had forgotten about us.  He assured me that he had not (which was a lie) and was somewhat apologetic.  Another 5 minutes go by and the manager comes to our table and instead of being apologetic or even nice, just walks up and says "You've been waiting for 15 minutes, which is totally normal, so just sit tight." and walks away.  Factually, she was wrong, I had sent an email from my phone after we ordered, and it was 35 minutes earlier and still no food, and were very put off by her brusk and accusatory tone -- like we had no reason to even ask where our food might be.  Honestly, I probably won't go here again, there are places to eat with far better service and more healthy options (like Serptine, across 3rd).
author: Scott U.

description:
Sunday am Brunch with my pals T&D..I checked out some menus online..and we decided to try Just for You--
Maybe it was the beignets that was screaming out my name..or perhaps it was the breakfast burritos with Chili con Carne..

On our way to Dogpatch..our friends Mateo and Mila called...and we invited them to join...

We pulled up to the joint..and put our name down for a table of 5...There wasn't much waiting room inside so we had to wait out in the cold...it was a good thing it wasn't too long of a wait....and the pint size grapefruit mimosa totally made up for it!

My tummy was happy with both the beignet and the breakfast burrito...everyone else seemed to enjoy their food as well...

Nice little neighborhood joint...now on my go to list...
author: Mimi T.

description: So absolutely homey, charming, and adorable.  The oyster and bacon scramble...muah!!
author: Kristen S.

description: Such a cute place to get your basic breakfast or lunch. Full menu with lots of choices but specials are always a nice pick. Great staff, quick service, charming setting!
author: P G.

description:
ORDER THE REAL MAPLE SYRUP. 

After many trips to Montreal this year, and feeding my addiction with all the "real" maple syrup I've smuggled back, I've decided that I will actually springing for their "real" maple syrup every time (yes, it's on the menu....yes, it's like a shot glass....yes, it makes your beignets, grits, and pancakes even MORE amazing....yes, it's like $3, unless you get the Canadian discount) 

Just do it. Trust me. (or do what my brother does and bring his own "real" maple syrup container to restaurants....just don't sit on it by accident)
author: Mike V.

description:
I always get the same thing when I visit. Bienets, hangtown fry, crab cakes, bacon and Mimosas. Always way too much to eat and I already have leftovers but the food offs always amazing! 

Only negative side of things is the wait time. FYI it is well worth it!
author: Stephanie D.

description: Great spot! Low wait time, took the order quickly and the food came out fast and hot! Green chili (way better than green chili kitchen's), beignets and the scrambles were delicious.
author: Aimee O.

description:
Cool brunch/breakfast cafe, why so cool heres my list: 

*Menu; is full of amazing choices good ol style and new wave 
*Service; we had was top notch happy and easy while we had them running
*Location; retro and funky with neat old decor in a time warp building
*Food; was so tasty and yet so simple, love the donut starter and the eggs combos made our whole table smile..

Im from out of town and i wish this cafe was much closer !!
author: Daniel L.

description:
Great diner fare with a bit of flare. On Sunday, we had a short wait (15 min) for a table at 9:00 am.  The interior also has a diner feel, which small tables in a relatively long and narrow space.  The walls are lined wtih interesting pop art/vintage posters (e.g., a Michael Jackson image).   Server was really pleasant and helpful.

As mentioned elsewhere, the highlight of the restaurant is the pastry menu.  The beignets are wonderful!  Biscuits and corn bread were also good.  We had Greg's scramble with spinach and chicken-apple sausage and corned beef hash.  Both were very good breakfast fare.
author: Brad B.

description: skip the pancakes and go right for the beignets! My bf loved his crab cakes too, they had a great flavor.  really enjoyed some time at the little tables outside in the sun. busy place.  left full and happy. corn bread on point! next time I will have to try a biscuit, mmm.
author: Coco J.

description:
A bit of a wait because the place is rather small.

The servers became more attentive and friendlier when they present the check after not providing that great of service.

The food was ok.  Nothing to write home about.  They beignets were good, not great.  The coffee was terrible.  I had the smoked salmon eggs benedict special.  Their grits is pretty good, a somewhat redeeming feature.  But that's because I'm a grits girl.
author: Elsie N.

description:
Worms!
I keep giving this place chance after chance (I live across the street), but am repeatedly disappointed. This time, the line has been crossed:
Don't order the fish. I took it home after eating half of it. It wasn't bad. I put it in the fridge. The next morning I found worms eating my leftovers! Eeeewwww! No good, folks! I called the health inspector on this joint!
author: David S.

description: I learned early that if a lot of people are willing to wait a long time for a table, there must be something good about it.  Just For You Cafe is one of those places.  I've gone a few times now and each time I ate a good, old fashioned breakfast.  Their scrambles are delicious (thanks Greg where ever you are), the pancakes are fluffy, and the beignets are way larger than the ones I remember in New Orleans.  My kids enjoyed their various egg platters, and we loved how they cooked the bacon.  Service is very good, with the servers rushing around for orders, pouring refills and making sure to compost properly.  They are kind enough not to rush you in and out even when there's a large crowd outside.  Special kudos for that!  Weekend brunch should always be this way - good food, opportunity to relax and people watch or read a paper, and just be part of a friendly atmosphere. Looking forward to many more meals at this place.
author: Maria S.

description: Over easy with the egg white very runny, burnt toast, crumbling pancake,  and God awful coffee.   Why is this joint rated so high?  Only good thing was the chicken apple sausage which is hard to mess up...
author: S C.

description: Came here on a Sunday for brunch. The wait was not long at all. The staff is extremely friendly and attentive. The food was alright. I ordered Greg's scramble with chicken apple sausage. It came with home fries and corn bread. The dish was alright. Nothing to rave about, but also nothing to complain about either.
author: Lina C.

description:
Love Just for you. 
It's the kind of place I wish was my usual corner diner. 
I enjoy the casual ambiance, and the corn beef hash.
author: Laurie W.

description: This is a fabulous restaurant. We discovered it last year on a trip to the Bay area and returned several times that trip and several more on our most recent trip to San Francisco. They have really developed the art of making a perfect breakfast. We ordered soft scrambled eggs and they were exquisitely cooked. The grits are wonderful and the biscuits heavenly. Staff are friendly and accurate. The little parklet in front is another charming addition to an otherwise wonderful experience.
author: Kathy S.

description:
get the chili scramble! WITH CORNBREAD! you will not regret it. heaping piles of chili on top of perfectly cooked scrambled eggs and amazingly gooey cheddar cheese...i mean COME ON. the chili had a nice kick to it which worked so well with the cornbread. the homefries are nicely seasoned and came out piping hot, but next time i think i'd try them extra crispy.

the beignet, i mean what can i say that hasn't already been said about that piece of culinary genius. SO GOOD. if you're there with just another friend, i recommend splitting one...and not three. i know i know, the three beignets are so tempting! but self-control is an amazing thing. and you will leave the restaurant feeling pleasantly full without waddling around like you're about to give birth to your food baby.
author: Moraia W.

description:
I was surprised to find this place in the dogpatch area.  Great place to grab breakfast, brunch, or lunch after those long hard nights of partying.  Expect it to be pretty busy on weekends, even at 2pm.

The food here is awesome.  I had the crab omlette and home fries which was off the chain.  Also the beignets are crackin.  I recommend ordereing them.
author: Cedric F.

description: Did anybody else get sick after eating here the weekend of 10/31-11/1? Wife and baby got sick. Baby has had GI issues for 4 days and not better yet - fun times.
author: Jeremy K.

description: Stopped here for a quick business lunch when in the area.  There was a group of five of us, and we ordered everything from a breakfast food to the pasta of the day.  Everything came out relatively quickly, and we all liked the food.  If I was in the area again I'd definitely be back.
author: Megan V.

description: This is my favorite place to eat breakfast. Their oatmeal pancakes are amazing and gluten free! The staff are totally wonderful especially their host/busboy. He makes my day every time I go there.
author: Adi G.

description:
So, I'm moving away from Potrero/Dog Patch....One of the things I'm going to miss the most is Just For You.  It's got a friendly staff, the food is amazing, and there's heaps of personality from the locals.  

Grab an issue of "The Potrero View", order the Cowgirl with cornmeal pancakes, and enjoy the experience.

Honorable mention for their fresh baked bread.  YUMMMMMMMM!
author: Andy S.

description:
Of all people to suggest a place to go, it was my dad. For his first time suggesting a place: great job! It was also Father's Day, so what a perfect place for brunch. This place is located in Dogpatch, a neighborhood I've never been to, but apparently it's hip and happening and has a lot of good food places, this being one of them. It's also a popular place, since there were people waiting outside and names on a long list. But, there was coffee and sunshine to keep the crowd from storming the place. 

I honestly didn't know what to get when I got there... you can only have breakfast enough times before you realize you're ordering the same thing all the time. I was torn between going simple with just bacon and eggs and then going with something like eggs benedict. I finally decided on the cowboy, which is just eggs, bacon, and french toast. Oh my god... the french toast was absolutely divine. The bread slices were huge (it was only two slices), and it was so nice and custardy in the middle. And hot! Topped with powdered sugar and syrup, it was probably the best kind of french toast I've had all year. I also got a side of one pancake because I wanted to do my pancake test (if they have good pancakes, then they have good everything). They totally passed! It was big and hot, and perfect. 

And let's not forget the beignets... DELICIOUS! Hot, soft in the middle. Oh my, it was really good. I also love that their mimosas are in a big pint glass! It was my dream. I decided to live my dream that day. 

If anything, I would like to make this place a regular place for brunch. After seeing their menu, it was pretty clear that this place is awesome. I'm excited to try other things... I was also pleasantly surprised to see Longanisa (Filipino sausage) on the menu.
author: Caroline L.

description: Beignets.  That should be enough of a reason to come here.  If it is not, then the rest of the San Fransico inspired menu should have at least one thing to fill you up.  Their daily specials are inspired.  Parking is their only problem.
author: Theodore M.

description:
Service? Great, the staff is so accommodating and friendly. They are a small restaurant but they try very hard to accommodate groups. We had a group of 10 on Memorial weekend Sunday and they had seating for us in the back. Just make sure your party is all there when they are ready to seat you. 

Good to KNOW: There is plenty of parking on the streets. The food is decent.  I usually think breakfast food isn't hard to prepare--as long as the eggs are fluffy and the bread is soft. The cooks definitely have that down at this restaurant. Portion sizes are a GOOD size. 

I always look for unique things to try at every restaurant: I liked the Frittata (pan-fried Italian omelette) YUM!
author: Joyce L.

description: I like the ambiance and neighborhood vibe here. They're quick to fill your coffee cup and strike up a conversation. The breakfast burritos are hearty but if you're suspect to being gassy - make sure that you don't have a 930AM meeting cause everybody will smell the eggs you had.
author: John B.

description: The best thing on their menu are the beignets!!! There is always a wait during the weekends but the food and beignets are so good I'm willing to wait an hour.  This isn't the most quaint spot for breakfast but the service is always good and the food is consistently awesome!  The only annoying part is looking for parking so if you come on the weekend try to come early.
author: Maria T.

description:
I loooooove just for you! It's one of the few places I will make a special trip over the bridge for.

While there's always been a little wait when I've been here, it's never been more than 30 minutes. Service is super friendly and attentive. I took my boyfriend here for his 30th birthday and the staff was incredibly sweet and  even gave him a birthday beignet!! 

The food has a twist on breakfast classics. The beignets are warm and sugary. The hometown fry is the best outside of El Dorado county. I've had multiple omlettes from here and each one has been uniquely delicious.

Nom nom nom. Love just for you!!
author: Anne Marie M.

description:
------BRUNCH ONLY------
You can never go wrong with a place who offers the option of chicken apple sausage in their breakfast selection.  The inside is pretty small so if it gets crowded, I could see that being a problem. There's plenty of (free) street parking too. It's the typical SF brunch place to me. If it were closer to where I lived, I'd prob visit more often but not sure I'd go out of my way to come here.
author: Diana Y.

description: Clyde is the man. Good food. Good service. You will leave this place glad that you came.
author: Tom B.

description:
I'm not a hundred percent sure on how to rate this restaurant as I have many mixed feelings about it.

Service: 2 star: Water never refilled. Brought me a strawberry scone instead of the chocolate chip one I ordered.

Food: I had their special fritta, and it was overdone and rubbery. The potatoes were dry and there was no saving them with any amount of ketchup or hot sauce. I'm also vegetarian and I got a piece of bacon in my potatoes. Let me say that I asked if they were vegetarian before ordering them. Not my day. I also ordered their scone of the day which was chocolate chip. I never got to try this. My sister ordered the biscuits and gravy which she said was delicious.  My husband had the Blackstone Egg Benedict. He said it was okay, but missing some seasoning. His potatoes were also dry. The beignets were good, but nothing to rave about. 

Incident: When the scone came, I took a little bite. I started to realize something was off. Turns out they had brought me a strawberry sconce instead. I'm highly allergic to strawberries. I never mentioned this since the scone was supposed to be chocolate chip. Management came to talk to me and they took my name and number. We got the bill and there was no adjustment for this incident. The manager said she sent over a chocolate chip scone, but we never got it. After talking to the manager she couldn't take the scone off, she finally took the part of my meal of. She did call to check on me later that day, but you could tell it was just to cover themselves. The main issue I had with this incident was the lack of compassion and how it was glossed over by the staff.
author: Shannon C.

description: A nice menu with several vegetarian items, including some eggless. Good service. They have beignets!
author: Mihir M.

description: Wow, what happened to this pace? I used to live in the neighborhood and it was a go to spot. I had lunch there today and it was awful. God awful. My Huevos Racheros looked like sewage and tasted like nothing. Completely unremarkable all around. I was shocked. Not one to be so negative about a spot, but I just had to say something. Bad. That said, the service was excellent. I guess that's something.
author: J K.

description:
Long wait - pack your patience and you will be rewarded.

Coffee - good. 
Beignets - wonderful.
Servers - super.
