We had tons of food (it was a party of 5 and we randomly took the server suggestions for food) the spotlight went for the beignets (they felt light, not greasy at all and with just the right amount of sweetness), the oatmeal pancakes (it is amazing how they were able to make brown bland health food taste so good even before you soak it with other random flavor enhancing condiments), the bacon (I asked extra crispy, to the point that it just sits up and can be eaten like a Popsicle but not too thin and they got it just right).

If you have a fun group of friends and don't mind the wait just give this place a try, I really appreciate when they take your requests seriously and bring exactly what you asked for.
author: Bea L.

description:
At the suggestion of my friend we headed to this popular Breakfast place the first day of our recent SF visit.

Their ratings were pretty high and I was expecting something grand. We got there a bit late for breakfast...around noon. So the wait was around five minutes. The place is very quaint and loved the funny signs throughout the place. Watch out they will pour coffee on your cell phone if you have it out on the table! Although the place was nice and clean it was a bit too crowded. The entire staff was friendly and helpful.

I ordered the biscuits and gravy. And I will admit I had just had the chicken and gravy plate about a week before at Roscoe's in Long Beach and that's kind of what I was expecting. So when I took my first bite I was very let down by it. It wasn't bad just not my idea of what gravy should taste like! 

My friend ordered the Huevos Rancheros and they looked messy and very fake tasting. What do I mean by that? Well unfortunately the salsa although  made from scratch it  tasted like the ones that come from a can. 

Now consider this...out of all the biscuits and gravy meals I've had in my lifetime this was the one I did not enjoy. 

Who knows maybe I should have stuck to the basic breakfast of eggs, bacon and pancakes. But I saw some people eating theirs and they looked pretty blah to me. 

I'm giving it three stars because the staff was great!
author: Gabby A.

description: Went for brekky yesterday (a Tuesday). The service literally could not have been better!!! What a happy place. It's a piece of the South plonked fair square into Dogpatch. Just delightful. I always go for the beignets.
author: Jon R.

description:
I live around the corner from this place, so maybe the novelty of Just For You wore off a long time ago for me. Or maybe $10 for a diner breakfast is just a bit steep, and although it's been a long time since I had to wait for a table here (when I do go, it's before 9:30 in order to beat the crowds) I don't think the brunch is worth a 20 minute wait.

If you're forced to wait, you might as well consider the breakfast around the corner at Serpentine.

Otherwise, if you're patient and in need of a filling breakfast, and want some fresh-baked whole wheat bread, or have a hankering for beignets, this is the place for you.
author: Jill K.

description:
Love love love this place. We came at a popular brunch time and had to wait about 35 minutes which worked out ok because there is a Blue Bottle Coffee store right down the block to hold you over. 

The restaurant interior is very retro and homey. We shared some amazing beignets to start and everyone loved their breakfast plates. Service was excellent. Also they have some kind of frequent meal program where if you purchase 10 or so meals, you get one free!!! It was about an average price for brunch in the city.

Go. It's worth the wait.
author: Anne Y.

description: In the absence of a good Malaysian oyster omelette anywhere in SF, I am so happy I can find a decadent alternative in Just for You's hangtown fry. Crunchy, eggy, and seafoody. Glorious.
author: Aiko S.

description:
It's my contention that the thought of weekend breakfast is so powerful for most people that it completely shuts down their critical judgment capacity. Therefore, I always take a recommendation for brunch spots with a grain of salt. Since I'm not a participant in the weekend breakfast cult and brunch is demystified in my eyes, listen up.

First off, what seemingly appeared to be a crowd milling around in front led to a 10 minute wait. So far so good. (Breakfast cultists are willing to wait far longer than I and I assumed that is what I was in for here).

The menu left me unimpressed, even for a place that is going for an unassuming menu. Nothing really jumped out at me and I had to settle for a two egg breakfast. 

The food was uninspired, bland fare.  Almost warm potatoes and bread that wasn't all that was promised. The only thing I had that was half way decent was the crab cake and even then wasn't anything to write home about. And between my dining partner and I, mine was the far better plate. Brenda's wowed, JFY left me meh.
author: Bryan E.

description: 2.5 Stars.  I had particularly high expectations for this cafe.  The servers are very friendly, but the food is so-so.  I ordered the Crabby Benny which is a benedict with a crab cake on top.  It was reminiscent of a Trader Joe's crab patty on toast, which does not cost 12.75.  The biscuits and gravy were average.  The gravy was a bit too sweet, and you could barely taste the sausage.  The beignets were tasty, but they were reminiscent of Chinese fried donuts vs. actual beignets from Cafe du Monde.  I have yet to find a beignet that tastes similar to the Cafe du Monde ones.  I was pretty disappointed for a 2 person, $30 brunch.
author: Steph W.

description: The home fries are perfectly seasoned and the service was good.  I would go back if there were anything else worth visiting in the dogpatch.
author: Light Bulb J.

description: One of my favorite breakfast/brunch spots.  The food is consistently good and the homemade cornbread, biscuits etc. are yummy.  Don't miss the mimosa served in a pint glass!
author: Scott R.

description:
nice little breakfast place in the dog patch.

i had the the green chili huevos rancheros which was both plentiful and spicy.  they werent kidding when they said "yowza" next to it on the menu.  My eggs were cooked perfectly.  sauce had a nice tomatillo flavor.   I also ordered potatoes on the side which were a little too greasy for me.  tasted a little like burnt bacon grease.  other than that, they had good flavor.  

coffee was decent.  service was good and the price was right.  get there before 10 on a sunday if you want to beat the rush....we got there just in time.

didnt get to try the beignets, but i have heard they are fabulous.
author: Christian C.

description: Beignets with extra powder sugar....That's all I have to say~~
author: Ann L.

description:
I love this place! The food is good and they have so much variety from scrambles, omlettes, benedicts, breakfast burritos and many more.  I've had their crab cake Benedict which was yuuummy. I've also tried their frittata where I added longhanisa sp? sausage which was mmm mm good.

When u get there u sign up and wait outside where they usually have coffee set up for their waiting customers.
  
They will call your name when seats are available. Their beinets are good too, crispy outside and soft n warm inside.

One of their specialties are their homemade breads. They have a choice of white, scones, corn bread, biscuits, and others.

They also have lots of unique decorations like old movie posters. The servers are nice and fast pace. Sometimes it's a little hard to get their attention.

The later it gets, the longer the wait so I recommend gettin there earlier. 

Overall, I highly recommend. They have something for everyone!

I am always in search for the best brunch in the city and this comes very close and will be my go-to brunch place in the city until something can outdo them!
author: Bevo T.

description: best chorizo and eggs in the city.  I love the breads, all homemmade.  Chickory coffee is awesome.  I love this place.  Always great.
author: Anibel B.

description:
Very SOLID (southern themed) breakfast food. Came on a Saturday around 8am and 5 of the tables were already occupied...by the time we left, the place was pretty much full!

If you like choices this place is Just For You! haha, get it?

I ordered egg whites with whole wheat toast (homemade, was thick and good), potatoes & bacon. Everything was excellent although the bacon could have been a little more crispy. Definitely will be back if I am in the neighborhood.

Mistake: not ordering the beignets...need to go back and try!
author: Elaine S.

description: One of our favorite places... Great food prepared with love... And great people. ("Those eggs were sooo fantastic.")
author: D A.

description: Happy to be the 1,000th review for this place! Went there for the first time today with my wife and some out of town friends. Maybe it was less busy because of the Pride Parade, but we were seated quickly and though cozy, our table was a good fit for four. I got the corned beef hash with two perfectly poached eggs and some hearty slices of homemade rye. The hash was great - not too dry as is often my issue with in-house recipes. It had a nice mix of peppers and onions but no potatoes which I know some people like but I was OK without. The rye was thicker than the store bought stuff and only needed a touch of butter to complement the hash and softly poached eggs. Coffee was what I expected and the service was fast,  friendly, and unintrusive - precisely what it ought to be! Everyone at our table was happy with their food which made me happy since I chose the place. I'm curious to try the beignets next time and hope to make Just For You a more regular breakfast spot!
author: Paul S.

description:
Fold up your strollers and silence your cell phones, because as the signs plainly say, there's no room for them here.  Then come right in to this cozy little restaurant and enjoy a homecooked meal served with a smile.

Just For You has long been a breakfast and brunch staple for many, as you can see from the line out the door every weekend.  People come for their American/Southern/Mexican insipired meals, and especially for their beignets, which are heavenly on a chilly SF morning.  They also make great grits, which are a personal favorite of mine.

But what most Weekend Warriors forget is that there are other days and other meals to be enjoyed at Just For You.  I stopped in recently for lunch and had a delicious pastrami sandwich with some of the best cole slaw I have had in a very long time.  It was nice to be in there without the frantic rush of the weekend crowds, and to not have hungry faces peering in the window wondering when your table was going to be free.  I could even hear the classical guitar music playing on the speakers - so nice.

Another thing that I learned was that they have loaves of their homemade bread for sale.  I bought a loaf of the dense, hearty whole wheat bread which sliced up nicely for morning toast the next day.  It made me think back to stories of an era gone by of kids being sent to the local bar to pick up a pail of beer for the family's dinner.

In today's world of fewer and fewer comforts, a fairly priced, comforting meal can go a long way.  Pair that with friendly service and a comfortable space, and it's easy to see why Just For You remains a favorite spot in our city.
author: Liz S.

description:
This is my new breakfast joint!  Thank you, LaShanda G., for your wise recommendation.  

I had the grits + grilled catfish and fried eggs for breakfast.  Friends had the "frittata of the decade" and chilaquiles.  Everything was well-prepared and infused with Southern soul.  Best grits I ever had...I added some butter, salt, pepper, and hot sauce, and I was already over the moon.  We then had the perfectly fried beignets and coffee for dessert -- YUM.
author: Sid D.

description:
love it love it love! Our waiter was awesome they were closing at 3pm and we got there at 2:30pm no rush! 
had herbal tea with honey and lemon,Gregs Scramble yummy! BEIGNETS were just as good as the ones I had at CAFE DE MONDE in New Orleans a few months back. I don't like sweet things but I love these. Lots of fresh fruit was available too! we had no wait and also found free parking outside ( now that was a 1st)
author: Christina M.

description:
Eat the beignets warm. They serve it first (is that typical?), so I took a bite of it and well what can I say it's a pillow of thin dough deep fried and covered in powdered sugar... it was freakin' delicious! 

After I finished the eggs and the creole crab cake, all very good, I finished the beignet. Not as great after it lost it's warmness, but still a nice sweet after breakfast treat. 

It's nice inside too. It's set up like an old 50's type diner, and the paint and decor give it a very country feel.
author: Ray R.

description:
Good food here...but another Dogpatch joint not in my budget. Breakfast here is almost $10. Although the options and tastes are good, I could get an alright breakfast sandwich for around $5 or $6 elsewhere (and that's with coffee). I guess my mentality is that of a frugal bachelor so, although I'm pretty picky with my food, I'm willing to sacrifice a little if I can save some cash in the process. Shoot, I could get 2 boxes of oatmeal packets at Safeway for less than $5 and that could last me for weeks and weeks!

But, this a restaurant that serves some good ol' comfort food breakfasts and one of the premiere choices in an area lacking a lot of choices for eating. That also means the foods are pretty high in calories and another reason I try to stay away. 

When I was a couple, this was a good option to take the significant other and show off your food tastes. But again, as a single guy now, I just don't treat myself like that...but maybe I should though! Cuz I'm okay and I like myself (or do I?)...Anywho lunch time gets pretty busy and I don't like waiting so I usually just go to a cheaper joint and get my rocks off.
author: Epicurious M.

description: I've had a good experience every time I've gone. They have something for everyone on their very large menu, but don't miss the fresh beignets! They're also one of those places that has a coffee stand for those waiting outside. I need to get back here for some breakfast!
author: Kaitlyn L.

description:
Tasty. A bit of a wait but worth it.

I had the chilaquiles with soy chorizo and they were yummy and flavorful with just enough kick and the dish still had a good amount of crunch. Good texture...

My mom had the longanisa and eggs. Always fun when one of your choices can be Filipino sausage. It was good as well.

Loved the beignets. 3 for $4.75, you can't go wrong!

I'll definitely be back!
author: Lu E.

description: Great place for Breakfast or Brunch - they actually open before 10 am!  I had the break fast burrito with chorizo and ended up bringing half home.  Wonderful flavors and big portions.  Plus the Mimosas are served in pint glasses (about 3-4 normal servings in one glass!)  Everything was fresh and well prepared. Yum.
author: Kelly M.

description:
Service: 3.5/5
Food: 4/5
Wait: 4.5/5
Price: $
Presentation of food: 3.5/5
Presentation of restaurant: 3.5/5
Overall: 4/5

i had the two eggs + Louisiana Hot Sausage w/ their CINNAMON RAISIN TOAST (: i was surprised to see they have something so unique a Cinnamon Raisin Toast (btw was yummy)!! like childhood in my mouth once again. their coffee was a bit dissapointing, kind of watered down ): but their Beignets made up for it! overall i think i found a new favorite B-FAST joint. food was overall great, i can't say about the rest of the menu but their BRUNCH is great! the only thing is that, Parking is kind of a pain in the rear.
author: Eva H.

description: Great food, the crab cakes are incredible, the bignets are always made fresh. I am lucky enough to work near by so we come here for lunch on occasion.
author: David S.

description:
I love everything ive gotten here. People who work here are amazing and sweet and the food is good, plus its right down the street from home. Great neighborhood vibe! 

Dont be scurred of the wait:)
author: ella a.

description:
First of all I just want to say how happy I am being that I got to try two 5 star brunch places in one weekend. Um YES PLEASE!! I love you SF.

Anyways, we walked up put our names on the wait list and literally waited for about an hour. But luckily there was a convenience store next door, so I was able to rehydrate with a massive coconut water. For those that drink coffee, there was free coffee in front.  We finally got a table and quickly ordered two of their signature GIANT mimosas. I honestly couldn't even finish it. I mean it looked orange, but I couldn't tell if there was even any OJ in it. lol. We also ordered their beignets to start. So yummy!! They were large, fluffy, and covered with powdered sugar. We got to deck them out further with maple syrup and jam. OMFG. After much indecisiveness, I decided on their omelette of the day: sun dried tomatoes, broccoli, chicken apple sausage, onions, cheese and home fries. Delicious. I could tell my friends were totally impressed with their dishes as well, because as soon as the food arrived, and the forks were inserted into our mouths, complete silence followed...and we're a pretty chatty crew, so that's saying a lot. The restaurant in general is also super cute and quirky. I hope I don't read a review where anyone is complaining about the wait for this place, because it's worth EVERY second.  We all left feeling totally full, and super loopy. I'm not sure if that's because we went out the night prior, the mimosas were super strong, the white stuff on the beignets wasn't really "powdered sugar", or if the food was really just THAT good...but whatever the reason, totally happy.

Note: Make sure to try the Filipino sausage. I'd never tried it before, and it literally rocked my world for the short duration of time that it was in my mouth.
author: Sonya D.

description:
I completely love this place.  And I'm sure it's been said before on Yelp. but the Beignets are fan-friggin-tastic.  Seriously, these are the best Beignets in the city.  Brenda's don't hold a candle.  

As for the service... SUPER CUTE!  And that in more ways than one: rude-cute (my favorite), friendly-cute, talkative-cute, busy-cute, and yes, sexy-cute.

Plus they give you coffee for the wait.  This does not suck.
author: Erik N.

description:
Pint sized Mimosas at 1pm on a monday!  That pretty much stole my heart.
Everything you've been missing in a San Francisco eatery you will find it here at Just For You.  Amazingly nice/good/professional service.  Everything on the big menu is delicious.  They make all their own Breads, everything has a real old fashioned feel.   Plus Beignets!   If I lived near this place I would gain 10 pounds because I would eat hear al the time, so luckily I don't.
author: amanda v.

description:
phenomenal beignets & coffee. recommended it to my parents on a recent trip, and they flipped. they're big fans of new orleans, and the beignets were up to par. I've never had a bad experience!!! 

GO. GO. GO. GO.
author: Cliff F.

description:
For brunch (Sat 11am), we wrote our name on the list and waited outside with free coffee.

When we were seated, we ordered the special frittata (Louisiana hot sausage) and biscuits and gravy and turkey sausage patty.

Both were big plates, and both were awesome. The omelette eggs were not over-fluffed like at most places. And they also carry some real-deal El Yucatan habanero hot sauce.

The service is attentive and friendly. The pre-meal line and wait are likely to be long.

The only downside is that next time we come here, we'll be facing a hard decision between getting the sure-thing frittata again or ordering something new (like the pancakes or saving room for the beignet).
author: Rob T.

description:
This review is only for their breakfast.  

Recently went for breakfast with the snapper and hadn't been there since they were further up Goat Hill (her first time). It's a larger hole in the wall than it used be and I'm glad it hasn't outgrown it's britches, though it lacks the small, homey  feel of the old place.  Since it is larger and it was packed, it was a bit noisy, but expected.

The place was packed this past President's Day, the wait was about 20 minutes and what I expected for a holiday or weekend, no issues there.  More so, we never felt rushed by neither the staff nor those outside waiting to be seated, not even their dogs watching through the window.

Service was prompt, efficient, and friendly, whether occasionally asking if my daughter was enjoying her food, etc., (French toast and chicken apple sausage on her birthday, are you kidding?) or the constant attention to my cup of coffee, for example.  Unfortunately, it is coffee, not the coffee/chicory blend they used to serve and that which is part of what I was looking forward too...it was such a compliment to their food...

The food was great.  In addition to finishing her meal (I'm still considering "his daughter's postprandial vacuum cleaner" as my profile name, maybe later), which was really good, I had the Creole crab cake, over medium's, potatoes, and their home made bread.  Raspberry jam on the bread and Creole mustard on the crab cake...oh my...

I also bought a loaf of the bread to take home.  Whether sliced thick and toasted or for French toast or sandwiches...it is sooo good

Are there better places for breakfast in SF? Sure, and many have unique qualities to distinguish them from each other.  This one is a cool combo of a little bit of Louisiana and a lot of SF and I like it a lot.  

But, please, please, please bring back the coffee/chicory...
author: Mike A.

description: Really great service and food is excellent! I loooooooovvveee the artwork!!
author: Rita A.

description:
i think.. its outrageous that they charge 4 bucks for a damn side of pure maple syrup
n they dont even specify if its from vermont
ru kidding me
anyway
if u go here just stick to the beignets i guess
no need for maple syrup on that haha
author: Ruby S.

description:
Love this place!  Huevos rancheros here are a thing of beauty.  Love the no cell phone, no strollers policies.  I've finally got it in my head that I have to have cash.

Gotta try dinner here now!
author: Andre L.

description: I'm adding a star cause the owner, Ruben Corro, messaged me. That goes a long way in my book. I will be back Ruben! It shows customer care and I really am a sucker for that :)
author: Maryam R.

description: Love this place for the area that it's in.  The beignets are yummy and fresh.  The portions are always more than enough.  The home made raspberry jam is yummo along with the rustic organic bread.  Theres plenty of parking and the feel of the place is cozy.  I will go back again.
author: Katherine T.

description:
This place falls squarely in my category of food that I don't make at home. I like having options other than just the same old egg, meat, potato and bread nonsense. I like some variety in my boom boom, that's why you'll always find the grits AND cornbread on my plate.

"Grits: They're the pasty white stuff you had...in prison"

The variety of options are fantastic for the specials as well.  Usually fresh and unlike other restaurants, not likely to be found repeated on the menu the next time you're there.  So if you see it get it NOW!

"No Greg hasn't worked here in a while, but he sure could scramble"

And yeah, the beignet's are good, but don't get them because I said so.  Get them because you want deep fried dough covered in sugar, and dynamo donut is too far away.
author: Michael M.

description: Ok, we just relocated to SF from Louisiana last May, so we know genuine southern cooking. Just For You Cafe has got it figured out!!!! We went in here for brunch and waited a good 35 minutes for a table inside. It was TOTALLY worth the wait. They move people in and out of there so fast, and the servers, busers, and hostess are all smiling and pleasant despite the chaotic atmosphere (it's only chaotic because it is so busy because it is that good). We started out with an order of beignets considering it was mardi gras time and we were really missing those french donuts. They were hands down the best beignets we've had outside of Louisiana. Yuuummmm. We all ordered the breakfast burrito with slight variations. All three of us thoroughly enjoyed our burritos and breakfast potatoes. We also ordered a side of the biscuits and thought they were great. I am looking forward to our next outing, at JFYC. Hopefully it won't be raining and we'll be able to enjoy it with our pup (they have two tables outside). P.S. we have decided to use them to cater an upcoming event that we are hosting. I'll update my review and let y'all know how that goes.
author: Kelsey K.

description:
After partying until 4am last night (this morning), my good friend, Kitty, let me and one of our other friend crash at her apartment in Mission Bay right by the ballpark.  We decided to have brunch together at San Francisco's Dogpatch (even though I was nervous about seeing tons of dogs), so the alarm was set for 11am, but we did not leave until about 12:15pm.  We took the T-Line and in to time we arrived at Just For You.  The wait did not seem long so we wrote our name down for 3 on a yellow pad by the door.  We walked around the the block to see what else was around and when we got back, we were seated after a few minutes.  

Celeste: "Hey, why did they skip us?"
Si-Eun: "They are only party of 2, harder to seat party of 3"
Kitty: "I think we're next"
Celeste: "Yeah, looks like it from the list"
Kitty: "Wait a minute... is that lady trying to steal our table inside?"
Celeste: "Hmmm... I think so, what is she thinking?"
Si-Eun: "She's probably asking the staff member if she and her family can have our table..."

The staff member walks out followed by the lady trying to steal OUR table.  He looks at the list and says that there was a party before them (that was us) and could not seat them inside.  She looked at us and gave me a dirty look, but I smiled at her before going inside.  Just because she had a baby in a stroller, she thought he can cut in line... no f'ing way, she's not special.  Okay, moving on...

I am so in-love with the BEIGNETS (light, fluffy New Orleans-style donuts, smothered in powder sugar)!  I was expecting it to be bite-size and surprised to see it so big... like cute little pillows.  It was very yummy and paired well with my tall serving of mimosa, which gave me a good buzz at 2pm.  The menu is great (the design was simple, yet it was fun to look at), and there are tons of different kinds of food I would have never expected to see including Longanisa (Filipino sausage).  I had two-eggs (over-medium, though they made it over-easy) with home fries, cornbread, and turkey-apple sausage. 

Good food, great service, not a single dog in sight, okay crowd, easily accessible by public transportation... I'll be back here again soon -- if anything I will come back for some BEIGNETS!

This was written on the menu -- it's hilarious (just like some of the other posters about cell phones and stuff):
"What's grits? It's that pasty white stuff... like you had in prison."
author: Celeste M.

description:
Have I really not written a review for this place yet? I searched my reviews to no avail...harumph.

SO! yes, listen to everyone and make your way on down the street to Just For You. Notice I said 'down the street'. That means anyone with an 'X' parking permit and you know who you most recently are. All the rest of youwse, stay away, you are making our line too long.

The coffee will shock those not used to the chicory of New Orleans but the mimosas will have you smiling. My most recent digestion of the omelet with Blue Cheese was tres yummy and all the rest of the cats at my table were licking their whiskers too. 

The wait staff is very friendly and dressed to kill or at least copy. The menu is sardonic and so are the signs outside. Expect to get treated like swine flu if you talk on your cell phone while interacting with another human being, bring your oversize stroller inside or otherwise act like a yuppie from Noe Valley. OOOOOhhhh, there go my fans....

It isn't fancy fare, but is will hit your ribs and not leave a phone number, all that without breaking your wallet in two. Nice.
author: Miel H.

description:
dogpatch 1/21/12

Just for you has been just near me since I moved to the dogpatch a little more than a year ago. I am moving away soon and really wanted pancakes so figured I'd come full circle and return to the diner I ate at a bunch of times when I first came out here.

First off, my how times have changed. Waiting lists to sit at the counter, dogs and crowds, babies and coffee, all hovering on the street outside, the neighborhood has really come onto the radar.

My breakfast was simple: Corn meal pancakes, a 1 pint mimosa, bacon, and coffee.

Let me just start by saying that the meal was incredible. Somehow it wasn't but somehow it was, the pancakes kept whispering to me.. love us... love us....

I sat at the counter after a long and chilly wait that was sort of my fault. I went next door to reno's to get cash and missed my name being called I guess. But when they came out and called another party, then another, then another till I was still the last guy standing there and my name still at the top of the list I began to wonder. Then when they escorted out a guy who had walked in alone, told him to put his name on the list, and then sat HIM, I asked the person if they had had an opeing for me, and pointed at my name. He looked at the list, seemed surprised to see my sad and lonely name, not scratched out in a sea of black ink and found me a seat. Mostly my fault but it was cold as hell and they were full, but not totally slammed. Something I would hope they checked on once or twice.

I had time to look at the menu while waiting outside and knew what I wanted to order. The aformentioned pancakes, coffee, bacon and mimosa. My order was taken quickly, my food popped up in the window even faster, they were very busy but very on it.

I have to say though that from stopping in a few times their food seems to have a lot of variation to it depending on who was in the kitchen. Sometimes the beignets looked fluffy like pillows, like they do at Brenda's, but sometimes they were darker flater crisps closer to east coast fried dough. I don't know what was going on any of those days, but today everything looked great.

The coffee was coffee, endless and warm and mixed by me with too much sugar and cream to say much about it. I liked it. It was the energizing hot elixer i needed to help me power through a very late brunchfest.

The bacon came out looking ironed and crisp and thick, I like something a little more greasy and hot, but it was good. Wafers of salty delight, especially when soaked in some syrup, they did have a tendency to crackle and sometimes melt away. Almost like crackers. It was also a large serving, long, wide, thick pieces, 4 or 5 of them. None of that shrimpy little tails nonsense.

The mimosa was LARGE and fresh and priced at A.Q. which apparently is eight bucks. It was cool and refreshing, mixed well enough that there were bubbles and the elegant touch of sparkling white wine, but it still kept the bulk and satisfaction of fresh juice. A thick wholeness to a drink spotted with light bubbles. It was refreshing and a stark contrast to my coffee(as it should be), it cleansed. 

Finally to the pancakes. They were also unassuming, some thick disk laid in front of me soaked in syrup that was rapidly disappearing. I liked that. Like a sponge the cakes fused with all the syrup I could throw at them. The amazing part was that the tops and bottoms stayed crisp. Like thin wafers, each toasted edge crackled as I cut and bit them, exposing the many celled walls within.

The insides were like a corn muffin, but so much more. They crumbled dryly, but dont be fooled. Once I had a bite in my mouth there was nothing dry about it at all, steamy and hot it became a sweet soft filling taste of joy, soaked in honied syrups. All at once they were crisp and light, moist and dense, delicious and wonderful. I scraped my plate clean.

All in all I had a surprisingly great experience and a wonderful meal, everything was unassuming and then wonderfully complex. Which brings me to the one off note, my breakfast after tax and tip was about $25. I spent that much at another place recently but also got eggs and home-fries. Hell, I spent that AT Just for you, and got more. The menu in the window showed prices lower than the ones inside. While I don't feel it wasn't worth it, I do feel that given their location and presentation and the fact that it was still pancakes, bacon and coffee poured out of a vat, or pulled off of a pile and served on plain bulk flatware that it could be a little lighter on the wallet.

http://alwaysthefatkid.tumblr.com/
author: Raccoon S.

description:
So, apparently this place is not just for me.  I thought id be able to show up, with mom in tow, to a brunch joint id never been to before, and we would be the only ones there...cuz after all, it's just for me.  Nope.  Everyone else thought the same thing.   It was good though, we showed up, put our names on the list, and got a nice table outside that was indeed just for us.

It's too bad that this place is all the way in the dog patch, and required quite a trek to get there, because it could easily become one of my new regular brunch spots.  Deliciousness and large portions make Lauren a happy gal.  Its also one of those brunch places that is only open till 3:00 so they do what they do and they do it well.  I recommend this place too, because I ran into Mr. Yelp himself with his family and friend, and if Nish eats here...I should too.  :)

My mom and I split the Greg's special.  It's an omelet with spinach, goat cheese, garlic and onions, and split between the two of us it was a perfectly light brunch.  We opted to stay healthy and get fruit instead of home fries, but the fruit salad was fresh and full of variety.  I probably could have eaten more.  I usually can, and the beignets looked amazing, but my mom wasn't feelin the donuts, so it just gives me more motivation to head back at a later date.  The place is small.  The wait exists, and its cash only, but there are so many more things on that menu that I want to try.  Ill definitely be back.  After all, brunch is my favorite meal of the day.
author: Lauren F.

description:
This is basically just Boogaloos or Saint Francis Fountain but I can bring my dad there without fools giving us the up and down. Yes that's right, bitch, he is rocking shorts in the middle of winter and a fishing hat. What. You think your tapered pants look any less ridiculous? Fuck it, we're going back to outer Third. 

I digress. Just For You: I love it. It's in my favorite historic district (please see profile photos for 1892 artistic rendering of Dogpatch, k thx), they have beignets with which you really can't go wrong, they've got a cute sassy little design thing going on, and the staff are friendly and awesome. 

Sometimes they're out of cups for the complimentary coffee but (a) you can't complain because it's free, and (b) take a walk while you wait, you lazy fuck. It will do wonders for your vascular system.
author: Megan W.

description:
Convenient if someone you know lives across the street (I do.)  I wouldn't go out of my way to come here for a meal.  What I'm saying is:  if you parked your car on 22nd St. near Third and you would rather get some local eats rather than lose your parking spot, go here.   Me, I would rather go to a 3 star cafe than lose my parking.  I'm simple like that.

I've tried various breakfast items as well as lunch.  Burgers are decent.  Coffee is good.  Breakfast is not great but they do have a good variety and all of the expected staples from omelettes to pancakes.  Salads sound better than they taste.   Overall, the food is ok.  

What really sucks here is their service.   Every single time I have been here, the waiter forgets something we've ordered and also never comes back to check if we want refills on our coffee or tea.   Even when they are only three tables occupied!  Wtf.  

So what is Just For You?  Crappy service?  So-so food?  Hipster casual decor?   Bottom line, the value here is simply the variety of menu items and the location, that's it.  If service was better, I would be much more enthused to eat here instead of dropping in as a matter of convenience.
author: Courtney Y.

description:
In the spirit of exploring both sides of an issue I took Ed M.s advice and decided to try two of his favorite breakfast spots to truly see if SF has better breakfast joints than SD. This was one of them. I am still weighing in on this theory, but thank Ed for pointing me in the direction of this fantastic place.

There was a pretty long wait so we opted to share a table with some strangers so we could be seated more quickly. We ended up having a lovely breakfast, great conversation about food with the couple who we were seated with and a laundry list of new places to try. 

I don't have a very big sweet tooth but the beignets were really good and completely worth the sugar intake. In fact all of the food was very good.....and they serve grits, I love grits. 

Our impromptu breakfast companions ordered decaf coffee, while I, having just had a super delicious latte from Piccino, opted out. I am glad I did...their coffee was so bad they sent it back. 

Overall a great little breakfast place, reasonably priced, and though they don't take credit they do take checks....who takes checks anymore? Service was so so and they did that thing I cant stand and asked if I needed change. Just bring me the GD change and stop being presumptuous already (clearly this is a pet peeve of mine). For this they lost one star.
author: Drue C.

description:
In my never-ending quest of new restaurants to experience, I don't often like to repeat. 

There are so many other places to extend a chance to! So many flavors to be had, atmospheres to covet and dishes to criticize.

You know it, you do it too. This is what we live for. 

As an emergency go-to, our destination was Just For You. Why not? I had loved it so when I went a couple years back, let's repeat!

Oooh, how I wish we had NOT. 

Service: rude. We are nice gals, we are fun & easy to talk to. We got NOTHIN from our waiter. He wanted us out and out NOW. Gave us the check right after serving our lunch. Uh, sorry - I guess you can't read our minds, as you thought you had the powers to Sir, we wanted the beingets for dessert. This was in fact, the only reason we came here. 
But you wouldn't know that, because you were too busy trying to shove us out the door.
So, i go up to the counter and order some. Doesn't ask me how many. Like 5 minutes later, they're at our table. Ok. We were just served our lunches, and you give us the f*ing beingets NOW?? Everyone knows you got to eat those bitches hot, what the hell? 

We were struck with the imposition of stopping our lunches to eat them right then, as they are best when fresh. Jerk. 

Not only that, but the food sucked. The country potatoes were uneven, some under cooked and in huge pieces, some small and crispy. Not the good crispy that brings you back to your childhood with Mama's hash browns and pancakes - no. Crispy as in they had been there all day. We're talking eating someone's breakfast leftovers for lunch. 
What the fuck? 
Cobb salad - completely underwhelming. 
Shrimp po'Boy - passable. 
Parking is difficult, to put it diplomatically, and atmosphere is outstandingly not worth it.

I don't know who the "You" is in your title, but it sure as SHIT ain't me.
author: Katie W.

description:
You five star reviewers can have Just for You.  Sadly, it's Just Not for Me.  It disappointed.  We did get seated right away as there was an open two top but that is about the best thing that happened at JFY. After a long night out and the trek to BFE, it was high noon before we got there.  When it is noon on a Saturday before I get my coffee on, I WANT COFFEE FAST AND REFILLS AT FREQUENT INTERVALS!  I spent much of my time at JFY staring at the sad sight that was the bottom of my coffee mug. 

Ok, the food.  One of us ordered the Hangtown Fry and the other the Greg/Gary-something's Scramble.  Both egg dishes were solid - even tasty.  With one big exception.  The G Scramble was supposed to be topped with Parmesan.  Guess what was actually on top of the scramble?  Big loads of powder cheese which hails from a green Kraft can.  WTF?  I am not 7.  And even a 7 year old in SF probably expects better than Kraft "parm."  Not good!

Where JFY starts dropping stars fast is in the side department.  The grits are billed a being "just like you remember from prison."  Their words, not mine.  Although I've not actually been to prison, I am going to go out on a limb and concur.  One might also expect to find the biscuits behind bars.  I am going to be generous and call them day old.  It may have actually been weeks ago that they were packaged and frozen in a factory bakery far away before reappearing post microwave on my plate.  Not good.  Not cool.  The potatoes were fine.

All in all, unless you live in the Dogpatch, please do yourself a favor and skip this place.  Brenda's Soul Food kicks the ass of Just for You!
author: Mike K.

description:
This place was pretty good for brunch.  I tried it out for the first time this past Sunday.  It was busy but the wait was not that bad.
The food was ok.  I got just got eggs and potatoes which is pretty basic.  My boyfriend got one of their scrambles though and it was kinda watery.  I also had a mimosa and felt they may have skimped on the champagne a little bit.  We tried the cornmeal pancakes, never had those before, and enjoyed them.
They have complimentary coffee while you wait for your table which was nice.
Overall, this place was ok.  I'd go back if I were around it but I wouldn't make a special trip just to come.
author: Norman M.

description:
If I told you this place was awful, would you believe me?

If I told you that you'd regret going there, would you cross it off your list of new places to try?

You would? OK. It's awful and you'll regret it. 

Now. That said, I think I've found a new favorite breakfast spot. I'd have to rank this place on par or above Liberty Cafe and Universal. Perhaps it's my affinity for their Southern influence or maybe it was a hormonal surge that begged for a "comfort-food brunch" (grits, gravy and all) as opposed to a "Cali-cuisine, this is how we do it" brunch (read: chi chi scrambles with exotic organic veggies.) Either way it was deelish. So good in fact, that even the finicky kid ate half of my Chicken Apple Sausage scramble. (wow)

The only draw back was the wait. But that's cool, it just gives me one really solid reason to drag my butt out of bed early on a Saturday morning. I pity the fool who tries to nudge their way past me to get in the door, before I've had my coffee. ;)
author: Stephanie I.

description:
I recently went into Just For You Cafe for brunch in the Dogpatch area.  This area has changed quite a bit with the "T" Muni Metro line and the building construction.

To start, I see they serve beignets and am reminded of New Orleans when I get them.  So I get the order of 3 knowing I will take home those I don't finish.  It is topped with lots of powdered sugar.  It's delicious and I'm loving it!

For my breakfast, I get the veggie version of Greg's Scramble, which includes spinach onion, garlic, mushrooms and zucchini all top w/ Parmesan cheese.   With it I also order biscuits and grits.  While my scramble was delicious, my biscuits were on the doughy side and my grits were similar to Cream of Wheat making my sides only ok.

The service is down-to-earth friendly and relaxed.  With great customer service I will return.  Thanks Just For You Cafe!
author: Janet H.

description:
If you ever feel like ditching the first half of a work day to eat a cozy breakfast you must do it here. 

Even on a Thursday morning there is no where to park but fortunately they aren't as busy either!  No line....just walk in and park your lazy I- don't-want-to-work-today ass down at a table.  

Order the beignets....ya just gotta.  

It can lean on the California healthy side.  Seriously....breakfast burritos with black beans?  It's a mexi-crime really to do that to burritos. 

Coffee is strong and always getting refilled....I love that. I don't' even have to ask they just keep pouring it in.

Corn Beef Hash is pretty bomb ass.....it does have a three months supply of your daily recommended salt intake in it though. 

Don't go on the weekend unless you are willing to wait...and aren't too starving when you get there. 

Oh and in case you forgot already...

order the beignets.
author: Jay H.

description:
All roast turkey fans -- they have a great homemade turkey sandwich!!  I LOOOVE roast turkey on drier and less sodium side.  If you agree with me, give them a try.

It was also cool that they also fed me their turkey on weekends when they only serve brunch food, not normal lunch menu that includes sandwiches.
author: Mami T.

description:
Inconsistent. 

Some days the service is fine, some days it sucks.
Some days the food is good, some days it sucks.
Some days the wait is out the door, some days it isn't.
Some days the beignets are great, some days they are AWFUL.
Some days the biscuits and gravy are good, some days they aren't


They are always a bit pricy.
They are consistent on that.
author: Sara D.

description:
beignets made after you order them! doused in powdered sugar just like in Nawlins'! better if you eat them fresh out of the fryer, but if you have to get them to go, tell them NOT to sugar them and have the powdered sugar on the side. 
good eating!
author: Jeff W.

description:
All the way out in the dogpatch is one of my all time favorite brunch spots in SF. Its not nice or trendy. Doesn't have a crazy menu with blood orange mimosas and all that but what it does so it make a damn good breakfast.  

Beignets are fantastic and highly recommended each and every time you come here.  They have a creole slant on some of the items here like po'boys and stuff but I have yet to actually try it. 

And yes, like all brunch spots on the weekend -- the wait sucks.
author: Morgan H.

description:
8:01 am

Boss snaps out of yelping mode...."lets eat something different"

I thought to myself...geez genius...you're on yelp already...why dont you plug in "breakfast" into their search engine.

"Dave....any ideas what we should eat for breakfast?"

Hold on dood...lemme go to the computer...turn it on...open internet explorer...go to yelp.com and type in "breakfast" and "san francisco"

Ah....i found a nice place.....ooooo......look...chili scramble.

Hmm...I'll try the Big breakfast burrito wit bacon smothered in chili con carne....

8:43am

We're both fat now...comatose.....and half the portion is still untouched.

STUFF AND HAPPY.....food tasted great.   Must...try....again....zzzzzzzzz
author: Dave L.

description: Great food.  Great service.  And no bullshit "no substitutions".  I can never finish an entire order of eggs benedict and, when the waiter overheard me make that comment to my husband, he volunteered a half order because, as he said, "it's for you".  I've never been able to get a restaurant to do that even when I asked.  Breakfast is our favorite meal and this is one of our favorites.
author: Amy K.

description:
Great cozy breakfast/lunch spot hidden away in the Dogpatch!

My co-workers and I came to this spot for lunch. It was after 1pm and the place was still busy! So I glanced at the menu posted on their window. Before getting here, I thought I wanted a bowl of soup to soothe me on this cold afternoon. However, after checking out their menu, I quickly changed my mind. I don't know if it was because I was starving, but just about everything on the menu from the pancakes, huevos rancheros to the po-boy's sounded so much more comforting! 

We started with the beignets. WOW! Large doughy, air-filled pillows covered with lots of yummy powdered sugar. Melts in your mouth. They aren't exactly like the traditional tasting beignets in New Orleans, but close enough for me.

I ended up getting two eggs with a grilled pork chop, grits, and homemade cornbread. That meal did it's job - my hunger was fulfilled and my soul was soothed. The cornbread was a little dry for me, but nothing that a little bit of jelly couldn't fix. The pork chop had just the right amount of seasoning and went well with my eggs. 

Other dishes on the table included the breakfast burrito (HUGE burrito filled with eggs, beans, and your choice of fillings), bowl of yogurt with fresh fruit and granola (this too, looked awesomingly delicious) and their pasta of the day, which was linguine with lots of veggies in a light sauce. Everyone was happy and satisfied with their choices. 

Young, hip, and friendly staff!

NOTE: Cash or check only. Yes, you can write a check for your food, odd as it sounds (My co-worker actually did so that day).
author: Kimberly S.

description:
It's NOLA by the bay which is actually in the Dogpatch area of San Francisco.  This funky little hip joint serves hearty Cajun/Mexican style breakfast and other specialties.  Upon entering, you'll notice the neatly framed psychedelic and colorful posters hung over the wainscot walls. A huge Blue Marlin is hung over the arch way to the kitchen.  At 2:30pm in the afternoon, they were half full and still serving breakfast.  Today, I ordered the beignets 'to go'.  You get three good size, puffy, powder sugary, pillows of French donuts in one order.  Maybe I should have eaten it there.  Upon getting home in 15 minutes, the beignets were tasty but not quite as puffy. 

I love their gentle reminders displayed on the wall:

"For your dining pleasure and the enjoyment of those around you, we ask that you observe the following: No sitting at an uncleared table. Please sign the list and wait to be called. No yackin' away on your cell phone. Turn off that annoying little ringer and talk to the person next to you for a change. No credit cards. It's our little way of lowering the national debt. And most important: No whining. Thank you!"

This is a no cell phone zone.  Don't let them catch your phone ringing or as the sign says, "We reserve the right to pour hot coffee over your cell".

I see that they serve Po-boy sandwiches here.  I will definitely have to come back to try these.
author: Nanette L.

description:
I'm nominating the entire Just For You menu for the September 2007 Heart Attack Breakfast of the Month. It's the first time I've ever dreamed up such an award, but it is nevertheless given with very high esteem.

Absolutely killer beniets are a must to start off your meal. A MUST. After that, you best order something with grits involved. This is not the kind of place where you order home fries, son. There were four of us & we all got something different. I ordered the two scrambled eggs with crab cake, grits & cornbread, which was, in a word, SCRUMTRULESCENT. I also tried some catfish & a bite of cornbread topped with homemade chili.

I really dig the neighborhood as well. In five years, 3rd Street is gonna be very much alive & kickin'.
author: Pete J.

description: Love breakfast here, nice to get there early. Huevos rancheros red is amazing in texture and flavor. Cheese grits are fab and they make the fluffiest biscuits. They win my heart with the grapefruit mimosa in a pint glass, best way to start the weekend. Only downside is the coffee taste like diner coffee and since SF is rich in amazing coffee, I don't get it.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I want to love this place...I do.  As an early riser and resident of Potrero Hill, a convenient breakfast place is right up my alley.  We've given this place a few chances, and I hate to say it, but we're done.

The food isn't good, primarily because most of it is cooked incorrectly.  We've ordered beignets twice - raw in the middle (and we saw another table send an order of them back for this).  Hubby got eggs benedict - hollandaise was the consistency of water.  I ordered poached eggs - yolks were barley warm, and the eggs were served in a cup that had about an inch of water in it.  Bacon was so undercooked that it wouldn't keep it's shape at all when picked up - it slumped, dejectedly, as if it was embarassed to call itself bacon.  And the coffee isn't good, and is served lukewarm.

I think this place would be GREAT if they got a couple new line cooks.  The wait staff are great - fast and efficient; the place is cute; and it's hard to find a decent breakfast (NOT BRUNCH) in this city.  But the food is simply not worth the $ - ten dollars for a plate of eggs, etc. and coffee is sort of expensive for breakfast, and you'd expect to get a great meal.  Sadly, here you won't.
author: Shannon H.

description:
I am a frequent "just for you" customer.  I pretty much always order the same thing (either a sandwich or salad).  Every time I order I am always paying a different price which can vary from cents to as much as a dollar - no biggie right?  I don't question because I like the food and the service is pretty quick with "to-go" orders.  

Today I ordered my regular sandwich roast turkey (which is supposed to have mayo,mustard, pickles, tomatoes and lettuce) SIDE NOTE:  They have NEVER once put pickles or mustard on my sandwich even though I've asked every time.  Anyway - I ask for no lettuce and to add avocado and bacon instead (just like i do every time).  My wishes are always granted in those regards and I'm usually charged an extra $1.00 - $1.50 at the most.  Today was a different story,  I went from paying  $7.95 (something along those lines) to paying $12.10 FOR A F'ING SANDWICH.  Are you kidding me????  

When I asked the host about the incorrect charge she told me that I had ordered a side of bacon and a side of avocado.  I corrected her and said NO, I wanted a little bit of each on the sandwich - something that shouldn't cost me an extra $5.00 being that the sandwich is listed on the menu as $6.95.  The girl/lady - whoever she was, then told me that it was going to be that way from now on and SORRY!   

I think it's very poor customer service, at the very least she could have discounted the difference of what I usually pay and let me know for next time.  Now there's not going to be a NEXT TIME!!!!  I will never go back based on the service today.  

Oh - and another thing.  I don't know who she is, I assume the owner.  She was very rude to one of her employees.  She even rolled her eyes to the customer about him.  I made eye contact with another customer who was standing there waiting and he made an "uh-oh" face.  It was very weird and rude.

Overall - the food is good when they get the order right and precise, I just won't be giving my paychecks to them anymore!!!!
author: RC V.

description:
Bayonets? Bengay? Beignets?!! YES! The beignets here live up to the hype. Light and pillowy, could see the air escape as I cut into it. Chewy and tasty. At first I thought we would not be able to finish all three, but just mere seconds later I was wondering if we should order more to go. Not too sweet at all. YUM! 

Breakfast was also good. Since we planned on getting the beignets, I had to rethink my original plan of getting the Cowboy breakfast. Carbs, you know. So, I got the 2 eggs with sausage, biscuit and home fries. I really did not want the home fries or grits, but considering I ate half a watermelon in the morning did not want the fruit substitute ($1.75).  The  eggs and sausage were fine, though I would probably pick bacon next time. The best thing on the plate were the biscuits! Oh my goodness, light and flaky. After a little garnish of butter and jam, they were incredible.  So much for limiting the carbs, but it was worth it. Breakfast was about $25 for 2 people (including beignets). A return visit for sure.
author: Mashi M.

description: Beignets are a slightly denser, chewier version of NOLA's but they are huge!  One per person is plenty especially if you plan on ordering a regular meal.  I would suggest passing on the egg scramble with chicken applewood sausage as you will bite into a substantial amount of grizzle from the sausage - yuck.  Home fries are really dry and have a cardboard taste. Stick with the beignets, they warrant the 3 stars.
author: K W.

description:
Our friends are regulars here and introduced us when we were visiting two weekends ago. I was in the mood for beignet's and they knew of a place in the dogpatch neighborhood and brunch was never the same after this day. Just for you reminds me of this cute little cafe in Seattle that my bf and I would frequent. 

We came in around 1pm and didn't have to wait for a table. It appeared we missed the breakfast/brunch crowd and were seriously lucky since we all were starving. I ended up with the Fried Egg Sandwich with bacon - and it was delicious!! The spicy mayo is really quite amazing, and the more tabasco sauce you add, the better it tastes - so I made mine super spicy!

The bf ordered the corned beef hash which was made fresh and not canned! It came with a side of potatoes and two slices of toast but was smokey & a little brackish. We ordered and shared three beignet's and sadly it wasn't enough for 4 hungry foodies. JFYC is known for these delicious soft chewy dough with dulcet powdered sugar - it was ahhhhmazing! The best beignets I've ever eaten. Beignet's aren't the healthiest treat but we didn't seem to care and decided to order another set to share.

I'd have to agree with the other yelpers on here....these are probably the best beignet's I've ever had and I'll definitely stop by the next time I'm in the city!
author: Janet T.

description: The beignets - yes, they're that good. You'll eat one and won't feel like the rest of breakfast but of course since you've been waiting awhile, you'll have ordered more to make it worth it.  Be careful of the powdered sugar...my friend inhaled down the wrong pipe, he coughed, and it sprayed everywhere.  He and the counter looked like they were in a flour factory or like they were getting ready for a mime performance.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
We ordered the bleu cheese scramble and the corned beef hash and eggs. They kind of got our orders a little mixed up, I wanted the biscuits, my husband wanted the corn bread, they came on the other's plates. We just made the switch-a-roo, no biggie. But my husband also wanted grits instead of potatoes, and they forgot and just gave him potatoes. Oh well. It's not a 5 star restaurant, so what do you expect. 
Husband really really liked the corn beef. I seriously think he's meat deprived(but is in denial), since he married a vegetarian. My bleu cheese scramble was ok. Not too much cheese in it. The one thing that I really liked about Just For You was their mimosa. Sunny Saturday brunch in February deserves a mimosa. $6 for it?? Well, this is the BIGGEST mimosa I have EVER had! It came in a pint glass, so well worth your six bucks! 

$33.00- tax, tip, and a we used a coupon for 1/2 off the second meal!
author: Caroline C.

description: If been to Just For You Cafe about 3 times now and have enjoyed it each time.  The beignets are deliciously yummy and very messy!  There is a nice variety of food to choose from, and everything I've had has been very tasty.  I recommend this place.
author: Landy G.

description:
Meandered into Just for you because I didn't have time to wait for the pizza I had a hankering for, thank God because I now have my new favorite salad in town. You get one fucking enormous salad here, and soo much more than green leafy goodness! It was like a treasure trove and I was pillaging the shit out of it! There are standard spring mix greens, artichoke hearts, asparagus, blue lake beans, tomato, cabbage and mushrooms...oh my! Plus I topped mine with chicken. So hearty, so satisfying!
The diner has a good vibe and the staff are friendly & helpful, though by the sounds of it I go at prime downtime. weekdays, in the late afternoon there are only a handful of people getting their grub on. One day I will brave going in for an early lunch/late breakfast so I can try their grits and mimosas.
author: Colleen B.

description:
The boyfriend and I made the trek out here (we lives in Hayes Valley) because we were meeting another couple with a 1 year old baby, so we wanted somewhere with minimal fuss, plenty of parking and lots of YUMMY food for good prices- Just For You delivered on everything. 

It's a medium size space without too much going on for decorations, fast/friendly service, and a really delicious breakfast... 

We all shared the beignets (OG style, if you go here and don't order these SHAME ON YOU, they're worth the extra 10 min on the treadmill!) eggs Benedict special, Louisiana sausage, and unfortunately I can't remember the other dishes that were ordered (it was pretty early in the morning for us and I was nursing a slightly fuzzy head from the previous nite's festivities... HICCUP). 

Try getting there early, by the time we left the wait looked obnoxious. 

Highly recommended and will be back!
author: Nenette Y.

description:
I was feeling peckish today at 11:00AM and by noon everyone in the office could hear my stomach morbidly cry out for some sustenance.  
I have very limited time and resources during the work week so what could be fatter, ahem, faster than bacon and eggs?  I know, cornmeal pancakes!  Delicious flat, sweet corn-bready goodness.  

To quote a famous politican, "I'll be back."
author: Monica L.

description:
Greasy, sickening...

Who puts tofu vegetable stir fry on the menu and doesn't offer rice?!

There was literally 1/4 inch of the cheapest cooking oil (can anyone say canola?) on my plate.  The veggies, when squished, oozed out oil.

..but maybe that's why this place is known for its doughnuts and brunch. Stick to the front page of the menu, and you'll probably be safe.
author: Carrot C.

description:
Really bummed out. I totally had a hankering for beignets. I was psyched they offered the yeasted variety, but completely bummed to find them so incredibly greasy and even boring. Yes, I know that beignets are fried, and bound to be greasy, but these were extreme.

I ordered scrambled eggs with chicken apple sausage, grits and biscuits. The eggs tasted diluted and bland. The biscuits were the packaged, frozen variety that had been thrown into a microwave and the chicken apple sausage was just eh. The grits were as to be expected. I've had better, but these were nothing to complain about. 

My companion had a scramble that included artichoke hearts, and was overwhelmed my the intense pickling flavor. He got a side of very bland potatoes and a piece of sweet, but decent cornbread. 

In other words, this Sunday's brunch was hugely disappointing.
author: Casey D.

description: I gave this place 4 out of  5 stars because it's on the smallish side, but overall the food pairings / selections are great! Most of everything I sampled off my co-workers dishes were top notch!  I'll certainly be back!!!
author: Dallas S.

description:
To set something straight...They do take Credit Cards. At one point they didn't, but they do now.
My family and I had a nice brunch here yesterday afternoon. It was raining so the wait was not too bad (around 30 minutes), but I can tell that on a nice day the wait is probably a lot longer. 
First off...the food was good.  There is a ton of selection. The pancakes were awesome! Everyone at our table was happy with their food.  The staff was very friendly . I was happy to be at a nice SF food spot, that was popular, and I didn't have to be surrounded by a bunch of hipsters.  There were no hipsters in site!! Hooray!
I will definitely come back.
author: Christopher D.

description:
This is a small, funky place that serves a wide range of good food with good service.  The fact that it's popular keeps it in business.  The fact that it's popular makes waiting a pain in the hiney (heiny?) when the crowds start descending on the weekends.  I hate to wait. 

Lucky for me, even if I've been up waaaaay too late the previous evening, I'm a morning person so I will only go to J.F.Y. on the weekends when they open and before the bands of marauding hipsters and families with strollers and toddlers show up.

The huevos rancheros are (is?) really very good as is the french toast.  This morning I had the 'Cowboy' (French toast, 2 eggs over easy and sausage or bacon -- I was in the mood for the little piggies this morning).  Coffee (okay coffee, nothing orgasmic) was promptly refilled and there were a plethora of condiments at each table.
author: Nancy W.

description:
Update 5/13:

 Service is still killer but I have a question for the cooks at JFY:
Why is you Sausage gravy sweet? That's just wrong, y'all...

As a person who does not have a major sweet tooth, I must recommend this place on their beignets alone.

They are the BZOMBB. and really, where else but in SF can you enjoy your loving southern breakfast while jamming out to Miami freestyle tunes from the 80s?
author: G Z.

description: Least kid-friendly place I've been to in SF in a while...the service was terrible, we did not feel welcome and we were rushed out of the restaurant. Kids were well-behaved and it wasn't even crowded yet when we got there.
author: Elena Q.

description: I give this place no stars. The food may be good although, I did not get a chance to find out. The lady working at the register was very rude and unprofessional . I asked for the manager or the owner and to my dismay she stated she was the owner. I can not believe that an owner of an establishment that deals in customer service would  act so unprofessional. I will never go there again. She needs to understand that word of mouth is very powerful tool.
author: Tracey T.

description:
So solid. I love eating meals for breakfast that I am too lazy to cook for myself. This is where the huevos rancheros and crab cake bennie enter my life. 

Why are poached eggs so magical? And how do they always make them here with the perfect yolk texture? Yes, I love me some sloppy yolks. I always go for the vegetarian red sauce which is so flavorful. Not super spicy but super good chili flavor. 

Crab cake is really fresh and made with good size chunks of meat. I ask for the creamy sauce on the side and usually use a tiny bit but mostly hot sauce. My fiance swears by the grits (they'll bring you brown sugar if you're nice) but I always opt for the fruit because it's not just stupid cantaloupe. We're talking real chunks of berries, bananas, grapes and well okay there is some melon. 

Anyway, the coffee is no frills but man does it get the job done. I had 2 cups on an empty tummy and I was very, very awake to say the least. Anyway. I will be back and am excited to check out their happy hour and a dainty pint of mimosa goodness. mmm mmm

What bumps these guys up to 5 is that their service is fast and they're super cool. I was in on a not busy morning waiting for a friend to show up for 35 mins. That's right, I sat by myself reading a magazine slurping coffee in a booth for 35 mins and they were super cool to me and kept refilling my coffee. I appreciated it because it was still foggy and a little chilly. Thanks guys!
author: Allegra F.

description: As many have said epic beignets (popped my cherry). The spicy salsa on my hash plate was equally dericious too. Very popular but worth the wait
author: Gordon E.

description:
We have wanted to try this place for a while. Finally, last Friday, we did. We went in at around 7pm, and the place was not too crowded. We grabbed a seat and within 30 seconds, we had menus. I was thinking, great, service so far is really awesome. 

After about 10 minutes, someone finally came to take our order. We did not order any drinks, except water, but I got the Bacon Cheeseburger with a side of mac and cheese and my girlfriend got a Turkey sandwich with Fries, and we asked for both with no Mayo. It did not take long to get the food, but when it came out, they brought the mac and cheese out first. I was unpleasantly surprised. For a place that specializes in southern cuisine, I really expected something a lot better. It was not very cheesy, lacked flavor altogether, and basically tasted like something out of a box. The burger and sandwich tasted alright, but, when they came out, both had mayo. 

The reason I am giving this place 3 stars is because I think they may have just been having a bad night. Every time I walk by here during breakfast time, there is such a huge group of people waiting to get in for a seat. I am thinking we will go back, but it will be for breakfast instead of dinner.
author: Michael C.

description:
The beignets are very good and very messy.  Get at least one plate to share with everyone.

Coming from New Mexico, I've this love for good green chile (with an 'e' not an 'i') and Just For You has pulled through.  I ignored the fact that is was microwaved, because you really can't get New Mexico chile goodness all over your home fries anywhere else.

The owner here sometimes is really, really mean.  She tends to bark at her staff for not making patrons leave fast enough.  If you want to spend a long relaxing brunch chatting it up, you'll probably want to go somewhere else.
author: Matt Y.

description: This place is an old, gritty  "Mel, kiss my grits"  type of place.  The food was average breaky fare...nothing really stood out but it tasted good.  Pricing was on the higher side for the portion sizes.  The service as good and the food came out fast... All in all I liked this place and would come back in the future....the only thing missing was a redhead named Flo, yelling at Mel in the kitchen...
author: Blake J.

description:
Yipppppeeeeeee! No wait, for once! It seems that the trick here is to come at 1 PM on Labor Day Weekend... :) Otherwise, Just For You Cafe has been packed every time I've gone. The ambiance is cheerful, cozy  and casual. Perfect for a breakfast spot. Tons of colorful artwork on the walls and a blue marlin hanging by the counter, right above the entrance to the kitchen. I love the beignets here. They are HUGE and come in an order of 3. Have tried the huevos rancheros, cornbeef hash and carnitas omelette (my fav so far). 

Located in the Dogpatch district, the area has character and is usually sunny and warm. More outside seating would make Just For You even better than it already is.
author: Trinh T.

description:
The only thing worth the 20 minute wait were the beignets.  The food was so-so at best.  The menu descriptions sounded much better than what we actually got.  It stumps me why this place is so popular. It "could" be the food that brings people to this place cause it can't be the service - I've gotten better service at Taco Bell.  Ok... maybe it wasn't THAT bad but you get the idea.  

I ordered the bfast burrito with "chorizo" and added house fries for $2.25.  First of all... really?  $2.25 for 8 potato wedges?  I know times are hard these days but seriously?  Second of all, the "chorizo" was not what I expected.  It was more like cut up Italian sausage which is NOT the same thing as Mexican chorizo.  My friend's omelet was strange - it was basically scrambled egg over grilled veggies.  Hmmm... not exactly my idea of an omelet.

Proly would have given 5 stars if we only had the beignets and coffee.  Too bad we ordered food.
author: AT V.

description: The best niçoise salad.  I've tried a few places all over the Bay Area.  This is the best one so far. Order with spinach.  Don't forget the anchovies.  Yummm!
author: Alex D.

description:
I promised my friends, the San Francisco couple that lives in this neighborhood, that I would keep the Just For You Cafe a secret and not tell anyone else how awesome it is.  I'm trying to keep that promise, but given that it's already obviously not a secret on Yelp, I figure I might as well add my voice to the chorus saying this place is rad as hell.  

For years I've been searching for the perfect biscuits and gravy in California.  Now, I am a California girl, but I spent many summers working for my family in South Dakota, where I became addicted to this magical breakfast food.  Since returning, I have been unable to find decent Bs&G anywhere.  Either the gravy is wrong (I've gotten brown gravy on biscuits before, or gravy made with bacon instead of sausage) or there's some other weird element messing it up (one place put scrambled eggs on TOP of the biscuits, then put the gravy on top of the eggs - what?) so suffice it to say, I have been craving proper Bs&G for a while now.

Just For You hit it out of the ballpark.  The biscuits were fluffy and delicious, the perfect vehicles to soak up the generous amount of fresh, creamy sausage gravy.  Easily the best I've had in California.  My only, minor complaint was that the gravy was a little thin, but the taste was perfect, so I'll excuse it.

My tablemates also let me taste their cheesy grits and cornbread, both also excellent.  I want to try everything on the menu here.  We also got in pretty quickly just after noon on a Sunday, which was faster than I expected.  The service was fast and cheerful.

So why not five stars?  THE COFFEE.  Some of the worst restaurant coffee I've ever had!  It was all burnt and thin.  I have no idea how such an awesome breakfast place could fuck up coffee, but it was a bit of a downer given how great everything else was.  But I drank it anyway.
author: Sarah D.

description:
What happened? You guys were the best, but the last couple of times the food really hasn't been so good. The order of "EXTRA hard over easy pls"
always came back with runny sunny side up, but because the food was so goo - we just kind of got used to it....but now....? It's all just gotten a little too soggy. 

C'mon guys - you can do better!

oh yeah and its cash only.
author: Raoul R.

description:
They serve up a slammin' Cobb Salad -- even tho I order it sans the chesse --meh my palette isn't really into all the funk.  

The service is pretty rapid fire, folks are always ready and kind.  Gotta love a place that has that old world feel... but because I am forgetful, I was disappointed again to discover they were cash only.

No worries, ATM next door -- except those asinine fees...

I did however get some [1985] edition $20 dollar bills from that ATM machine next door. I'm going to frame one.
author: Krys F.

description: Consistently stale bread (even with claims of baking it fresh daily), mediocre food, high-price tag. The only place you can have a sando and soup and pay close to $20. For that kind of money I choose Serpentine or Hard Knox.
author: Honest T.

description:
Just For You is a nice spot to visit if you are in Dogpatch.  I have never been floored by any of their food, but never I've been badly disappointed, either.  Parking is difficult in the area, especially during lunchtime.

I am taking off one star because the service is spotty.  One time I went to the counter to place a to-go order and the guy behind the counter didn't acknowledge me....he didn't ask if I needed help, if I had been helped, if I'd like any help....I thought it was quite rude.  But other times the service has been okay.  I think it's just....spotty.  The prices are on the high side, too considering what they serve.
author: Juliana S.

description: Dogpatch diner deluxe. Funky cool decor, friendly service, big menu, outstanding eats. Anything with a southern twist seems to be the sweet spot here. Best po'boy I've had in ages - shrimp and oyster combo - mmmm. Pecan pie also a knockout.
author: Stuart M.

description: If you want a big, legit, tasty, and hangover curing breakfast, this is your place.  A no nonsense old school diner with tonnnnns of breakfast fixing.  Not to mention the Beignets, of course.  That being said, the breakfast is substantial and tasty.  As a Southerner living in SF, it's nice to find a spot that serve a good down home breakfast, even if it is a bit pricier then it is back in Dixie.  It's worth it, and you'll probably be pretty good until dinner if you come here for Brunch.  I'm a fan.
author: Sean H.

description:
I never do 5 star because I figure better is out there somewhere!  But, this place is simply great, great, GREAT!  The staff is friendly and helpful (they'll give you ideas not on the menu or check to see if they can do what you want) and ambiance is breakfast feel as it should be - cozy, cool and calming.

I always start with a beignet (1 for $1 I think) and then onward. Was suggested once the prosciutto scrambler with spinach and fresh parmesan - add whatever else like mushrooms...I am hooked.  Coffee is solid and prices breakfast like and reasonable.  Recommend it to anyone coming to the city and forewarn it is a bit out of the way, but on a nice day to work off the great meal I sometimes walk back to my hotel in Union Square.  It is a hike.
author: Mike E.

description:
Decent sausage and biscuits...but the beignets are still my favorite, with raspberry jam....yum!
I usually stop by Just For You on a week day morning when I'm "home sick" or have an off week day where I don't have to work because you can get the buy one get one half off coupons on the back of the 16th St Safeway receipts or SF Weekly, but they are only good Mon-Fri.  Weekends are usually way too busy with lines out the door, so I tend to stay away.
I agree service is not that friendly and besides the beignets there's nothing that I LOVE about Just for You, but it's within walking distance of my house.
author: Sarah M.

description:
My brother swears this place has the best breakfast burrito he has ever had in his entire life.  The beignets are awesome, and it's hard to find a good beignet this far away from Nawlins.

In fact, I was going to give this place 4 stars but then I realized that I had the best omelet ever there.  Blue cheese and red bell peppers.  Who knew it would be SO delicious!  Also the corned beef hash and eggs are supposed to be really good.  Cute atmosphere, good service.  The location is a bit weird and is always hard for me to find being from the E.B.  But if you can get there, you should!!
author: Tempe M.

description:
I'd previously written (3/07) that the cooking staff had quit.  I'm happy to report that they're back (7/07) and cooking up a storm.  Thank god.  You don't want to mess with something that works this well.

Hint for those on the waiting list: Get an order of beignets for outside.  They go well with the free coffee usually provided.
author: Tom H.

description: Abomination! "I can't remember when I've had a meal that I wish I hadn't eaten" said my companion. We'd heard so much about the Just For You, when in dog path this morning we thought we'd see what it's all about. About half full, we had no problems getting in and were greeted by indifference. The person who sat us offered not a smile, not a good morning......just here's a table. The waiter was unavailable mentally and spoke so softly we couldn't understand him. Finally, the food........eggs ordered over easy came out hard cooked, for three of the four of us. The home fried......ranged from briquets to underdone yet tasteless, the biscuit.......leaden. The Louisiana sausage was tasty and spicy and the crab patty very good.
