On a Sunday morning around 10AM, there was plenty of parking in the area. We came early enough to beat the major crowd; we still had to wait for about 15 minutes, but not bad for a party of 6. We ordered mimosas--theirs come in a pint glass (the more, the merrier), beignets (of course!), and we all picked different breakfast dishes. There was a lot to choose from the menu...being Filipino, I even got excited to see "longganisa" (Fiipino breakfast sausage) on the menu. I was tempted to order it, but since it was my birthday, I should try something different. I ordered the Eggs Benedict Special (instead of ham, it was roast beef) from the Specials of the Day. The beignets were good, but not good enough to constantly crave for, and sadly, I didn't enjoy my Eggs Benedict Special.

Even though I didn't enjoy my main dish, I would still come back here for breakfast/brunch if I was in the Potrero Hill area. Love the Mimosa Pints! And the staff is friendly and attentive. But I would definitely order something else...no Eggs Benedict Special for me anymore!
author: Barbra C.

description:
Years ago, this was a favorite breakfast spot for me, in the original hole-in-the-wall location on 18th St.  I'm glad to see from other reviews that the beignets are still good.  

I hadn't been to the new location, as I'm rarely in that area, but recently stopped by for a mid-morning weekday breakfast.  Unlike some other reviewers, I found the service to be just fine -- I was handed a menu as soon as I sat down, my order was taken promptly, and my coffee cup was refilled without my asking whenever it needed to be.  Although I'm decidedly middle-aged,  I experienced none of the "hipster disdain" that I sometimes encounter from unhappy servers.

The food was as good as I'd recalled.  I had biscuits and gravy; the gravy was nicely flavored with sausage bits, the biscuits were fluffy, and there was exactly the right ratio of gravy to biscuits.  The coffee was also very good.

While I wouldn't travel out of my way to eat at Just for You, I'll certainly stop in again if I'm in the vicinity and hungry for a good Southern breakfast.
author: Barbara B.

description:
After eating at Just for You nearly every weekend, and often twice on Fridays, I was ready to compare the beignets to "the real thing". So while in New Orleans I stopped by Cafe du Monde excited to try theirs. Um, well, I have to say, I'm a bit disappointed to report that Just for You's beignets are just for me. Seriously, they are *better* than "the real thing" at Cafe du Monde. 

Oh, and besides that, I love their breakfast and the staff is adorable. Love that I've now become a regular, and they recognize me! :)
author: Angela G.

description:
Aw man...I wish this place was better! I keep giving it chances, but I have to accept the fact that this place is average. The last time I was here, I was irked by the "hostess" front man. I put my name on the list and checked that either the counter or table would be fine. Nobody else checked the counter even though it was clearly available. He comes out and says the counter was available, looks at the list, and calls out my name. As I start walking towards the door, he starts individually asking each name before me whether they wanted the counter seat. Hello!! You already called my name!!! Somebody obviously took the seat. I don't have a problem waiting, but don't call my name and give the seat to someone else. That's bad form!
     Besides that, the food is average overall. The beignets ARE amazing. Nice and crisp on the outside and soft in the middle. The cornmeal pancakes are also delicious. Too bad the breakfast burrito is pathetic. The egg and potatoes are cooked well enough, but there is no salsa, no hot sauce, no flavor. Besides the beignet, there is nothing that I can't make at home. Its a shame since I love brunch and I love brunch places (especially ones that are close). But eh...whatever.
author: Siao W.

description:
just for you is not just for me. it was just ok. maybe because it was super hot that day and we had to wait a long time, or maybe because i was annoyed by the fly that darted about our food. that and overall the food, honestly, was just good, not great. 

- beignets (3 for $4.75): these were tasty.  big square pockets of dough heavily dusted with powdered sugar. these were nice and light. 

- greg's scramble ($10.50), 3 eggs scrambled with spinach, onions, garlic, cheese + meat of choice - chicken apple sausage. and you choose a bread - corn bread! the corn bread was big thick and buttery, yum. the egg scramble was savory with good sized clumps of spinach.

- huevos rancheros  ($8.95) + home fries (+$2.50), 2 eggs on a tortilla, smothered in special sauce, black beans, cheddar cheese, all topped in a red sauce. visually, it wasn't what we were expecting. the red sauce was a big sloppy amoeba on top of the eggs and tortillas (pseudo quesadilla). i guess it just wasn't as appetizing.

- coffee ($1.50): regular stuff though it was nice you could get a cup while waiting for a table. i really needed the coffee.

- orange juice ($3.50/$4.50): kinda pricey but i guess they charge more for odawalla.

maybe i should have tried the french toast or wafflles or had more sleep to be less grouchy when i come here. that and if i had a fly swatter in hand.
author: Cindy W.

description:
i met my girlfriend in new orleans back in january and almost immediately she started raving about the hangtown fry from this place. i need to go to san francisco with her and eat this incredible breakfast. it will change my mind about breakfasts.

it was disgusting. and that's not just eight months of being over-hyped on a dish talking. the oysters weren't fried - they were just warm and squishy and juicy and their bitter oyster juices were sloshing into the scramble with no cornmeal dusted and fried boundaries. what the fuck? 

the beignets were ok. they didn't taste like cafe du monde's and as far as i'm concerned, that is what a beignet is so i was disappointed by them as well. but not enough to give it the one star review. the beignets were three star. but i wasn't there for the beignets and i'll never set foot in this place again for what they did to those eggs with those oysters.
author: Will R.

description: WORST DISPLAY OF MANAGER/EMPLOYEE VERBAL ABUSE IVE EVER WITNESSED!  Great food, excellent service, but i have to be honest when i say that i was embarrassed for the staff and personally insulted by the complete lack of professionalism shown by the manager.  This made such a impression on me that i joined yelp primarily for this purpose.  I recently began working in the neighborhood and have enjoyed several lunches at JFY but in the same breath have personally witnessed out of line behavior by the manager 2 out 5 of my visits.  Yelling across the room, cussing at the staff (f bomb) and shortness with customers.  I enjoyed eating there so hopefully someone reads this and fires that lady.  Regardless they will not be getting anymore of my business.
author: Lester M.

description:
Mmm, breakfast. My favorite meal. Read about Dogpatch neighborhood in a Men's Journal magazine and went exploring. My gf had heard about Just For You and decided to give it a try and we were not disappointed. I tried the biscuits and gravy, big biscuits, very tasty, gravy was good, needed pepper. Side of bacon, good meaty bacon with enough fat for flavor. Mt gf had the Hangtown Fry, bacon, onions and deep fried oysters (Mmm) . She loved it.  Not something I'd eat for breakfast but that is what is great about this place. Standard breakfast items AND off the wall items too. and all of it good. Everyone around were talking about how good the food is. 

Note: Get there early, place fills up quick! Kitchen works fast so the lines aren't too bad, the have comp house coffee while you wait BUT if you walk a block down, there is a small Blue Bottle coffee shop for your elite coffee tastes. 

Like the decor of the place, it seems small but there is another dining area in the back.  We will definitely go back to sample other items on the menu.
author: Bill S.

description: Located in an unassuming storefront that gives the impression this is nothing more than a coffee shop, this full breakfast joint is clearly popular with the neighborhood. At 9:30 a.m. on a Saturday morning it was full, but there was still a table in the back. A full menu, including the beignets everyone mentions, with varieties of omelets and egg dishes, plenty of sides. Despite being quite full it wasn't as noisy as many places would be with the same crowd, probably because of the high ceilings. Only negatives: the back room is a bit dark, and I found the coffee a little weak. But the food was terrific, the service was great, and the people-watching is superb.
author: Mark P.

description: Our friend Matty introduced us to Just For You Cafe.  He said it was one of his favorites for breakfast.  HE WAS SOOOOO RIGHT!  This place is the BOMB...probably the best breakfast I've ever had in the City.  We started with an order of beignets as an appetizer (at breakfast...ya gotta love that)...and they were amazing!  I had a chicken apple sausage scrambler with potatoes and homemade raisin bread toast...and ordered a side of pico de gallo to mix with the eggs.  YUM!  I think the pico de gallo was made to order...it tasted that good.  Our server was efficient but slightly out of it...perhaps he'd had a hard night.  IT HAPPENS.  :-)  Atmosphere is fun and the neighborhood is eclectic.  Do yourself a favor and get some food at Just For You Cafe...you will be glad that you did!  It's one more reason that I need to visit SF more than once a year!
author: Eric H.

description: Wow! Longanisa on the menu...memories of Saturday morning cartoons and oh-not-so-good-for-you breakfasts that only a Filipino mother can fry up came flashing through my brain.  All in all, a Pretty Damn Good Breakfast Place.
author: CeeLo L.

description: This place is amazing! They have the BEST beignets. There's usually a long wait for a table on the weekends but so worth it.
author: J L.

description: I'm a craver, I often eat according to my cravings and the #1 thing I've been craving for the past several months is Just For You's Nicoise Salad!  I just had one for lunch yesterday & it was perfect!  Nicely seared tuna, salty anchovies and the right amount of tangy dressing.  Yumm, I'm ready for another one!
author: Kimberly K.

description:
We waited maybe five minutes for a table, and the beignets arrived quickly.  I have no basis for comparison, but it was a good start.  The volume of the place was unreal.  My gentleman caller had the griddle cakes, and I the Fritatta of the decade, which was very good, although flat and round like a pancake as opposed to the slice I had been expecting from previous fritatta experiences.

My concerns lay in the plate clearing.  We must have been forgotten, because our plates sat in front of us for 15 minutes (I checked my watch) before being cleared.  As we had the Sunday papers with us, I was fine with this, but under other circumstances, this would be enough to drive me over the edge.  The whole experience had a charm to it (even though you may not be able to tell from this review) and I plan to return.
author: Beth V.

description:
Great place for brunch on the weekends. they serve eggs and bacon, pancakes type breakfasts.

they also have some fancy things like beignets (french doughnuts). No fancy coffee just regular coffee.

usually a line so you will have to wait
author: roy d.

description:
I don't mind the long wait or the tight quarters -- it's part of the charm and is totally worth it for the delicious brunch bonanza we enjoyed. The only way it could be better: fountain Diet Coke.

Update:  I've since been back a few more times and can report that everything I've tried has been awesome, but my favorites are the oatmeal pancakes (they don't always have them but daaaaamn, they were worth the repeat visit), the breakfast burrito (there's cream cheese scrambled in with the eggs!), and the special roast beef eggs benedict (a pile of things I wouldn't think to eat for breakfast but it's a new taste sensation).

Get there by 9:30 and there's no wait. Get there by 8:30 and park right in front!
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
Apparently there has been a change in staff -- as some others have noted -- but my brunch was quite tasty when I went yesterday.  The Greg's scramble was nicely done (if I really want to nitpick, I could say it would have benefited from a touch more salt, but I don't want to nitpick, so I won't).  

The beignets were just like what beignets should be:  warm, slightly crisp on the outside, chewy and airy on the inside, covered in confectioners sugar, and reaching up from the plate they're on with barely invisible tendrils of butter and grease to strangle your carotid artery right there in the restaurant.

I had a little bite of oatcake, and it was good.  I'm not sure I've ever had an oatcake before, so I can't really compare it to much, but I couldn't complain.

The service was prompt, the coffee was always full, and the food came out in short order.  There's still a line outside, and everyone else seemed happy, so give it a shot, and see how you fare.
author: Jay M.

description:
YUM.  Get the beignets.  

All the other eggs dishes are delish.  Mine was poached egg with bacon and tomatoes on english muffin. I wanted to have everything.  The crab benedict was awesome too.

Be prepared to wait...there are benches but you're waiting in the best weather of SF.  Put your name on the list and drink the coffee they leave out for you or go inside and get pint size mimosas.  oh yeah.  get it in ya.

I'll be going back.
author: Julia H.

description:
This was my first time here.  Apparently, there is always a wait.  As a table of only two, we were seated within 20 minutes. Even if it had been longer, the free coffee while you wait outside and friendly faces make the time pass quickly.   The snarky signage on the window ("We reserve the right to pour coffee on your cell phone,") and on the menu ("We have several flavors of tea-if you're nice, we may even let you choose") were greatly appreciated.  

Note about the "free" coffee: I am not sure if the coffee outside is free or self-service.  It has always been on the bill, but I continued drinking it after I was seated.  I don't even think it's advertised as free.  Do they honestly expect one to stop drinking coffee once one has started?  Must have caffeine

I had the Bleu Omelet/Scramble.  It was delicious!  I was debating between a scone and corn bread.  Our waitress recommended the cornbread.  The rectangle, warm and dense, was an incredible compliment to the bleu cheese-just as she promised.  I will definitely be back!

******
The Second Coming

Off the "Specials" menu-Roast beef eggs Benedict: English muffin, chunks of roast beef, tomato, avocado, poached eggs and Hollandaise sauce.  Oh my goodness!  It was delicious!  I opted out of the potatoes because I ordered two buckwheat pancakes, hearing others rave about them on my previous visit.  They were OK; they tasted like other pancakes.

********

The Third Visit

I ordered some sort of scramble off the specials menu that tasted good, but not as memorable as previous ventures.  Grits were lack-luster.  The shining stars of this visit were the oatmeal pancakes.  They were very different and very tasty.

I have found arriving before 9AM on Sundays guarantees you immediate seating for parties 4 or less.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I went here on a Saturday morning at around 1:30. (Yea, yea. I said SATURDAY morning.) There was about a 15 minute wait, but the neighborhood  is cool, and killing time while you wait is no problem. You'll want to be really hungry anyway because as soon as that plate of beignets hits your table, it'll all be worth it. In case you don't know, beignets are fried dough puffs covered in powdered sugar. They are heaven on a plate. Ok - They weren't as good as the ones in New Orleans. But hey, this isn't New Orleans. This is SF and I'll take what I can get.

The menu here is amazing. Too many choices, and everything sounds great. Cornmeal pancakes? I'm happy to know such heavenly things exist here on earth. 

After studying the menu for way too long, I had a scramble with goat cheese and artichoke hearts. I went a little crazy and added sun dried tomatoes. They might be the best eggs I've ever hung a lip over. You get to pick between cornbread, biscuits, or a scone for your bread. How to decide?? I had the cornbread, which held the form of a giant brick. Not the best I've ever had. Kind of crumbly, and not greasy enough for my taste. But what it lacked in texture, it made up for in girth.

I think my favorite thing about this place is the condiments. Each table comes equipped with maple syrup, a plethora of hot sauce choices (Cholula, Tabasco, AND Crystal), and - here's the kicker - a vase FULL of butter chips!  Fuck yea. Here I can eat all the butter chips I want and not get the hog stare from the server.
author: Chelsea T.

description:
This is a cute spot.  There is a bit of a wait, but it is bearable.  I have found that I like many dishes, but I am trying new dishes until I find that something I love to reorder again and again.  I did sample my friends Hangtown Fry (oyster scramble) and I think I did love it.  The oysters were lightly pan fried before it was prepared in a scramble and it was damned good.  We also washed breakfast down with huge glasses of mimosa's.  Nice!  They bake their own breads, and I love the raisin bread.  The potatoes aren't so good, and I often have to fix up my grits.  I do prefer my grits creamy and sometimes cheesy.  These are stark white corn grits.  The plain and simple delicious Beignets are nice light and fluffy.  I anticipate trying a Po Boy Sandwich upon my next visit.

I hope my rating isn't too harsh.  I just think a good breakfast spot should master either its potatoes are grits.  Overall I like this place!
author: sonia m.

description:
I don't know why they named this joint "Just for You." If this place is really for me, they would serve garlic fried rice and egg with my longaniza. (Sorry I had to point that one out. That's just the Filipino cravings in me...lol) 

With that said, I really came to Just for You to try their beignets and have some good times with my mom for mother's day. I loved the local vibe that Just For You has. This cafe isn't hidden too deep within the dogpatch, but can be easily missed as you drive down third. I ordered myself the Crabby Benny - which is just crab cakes and poached eggs sandwiched between two pieces of toast. This was pretty good, but I prefer SAVOR's version better. My boyfriend ordered the longaniza plate, which he loved. Being a connoisseur of Longaniza, I found Just for You's style of this Filipino Sausage very unique. It had a mesquite flavor to it - reminded me of Lay's BBQ chips. Although they are not the conventional longanizas, they were pretty good. No lie. 

Overall, the beignets are worth the trip across the city. As for the rest of the food, I am sure you can find something similar in your own neck of the woods. 

Recommendations: 
Beignets
Order of Longaniza on the side
author: Lisa T.

description:
Only a 15 min. wait for brunch on Saturday morning!  They even had a carafe of coffee outside for people waiting.  The waitstaff is extremely efficient and attentive.  The beignets remind me of the ones I had in New Orleans.  (They put a ton of powdered sugar on them.)  I had the Hangtown Fry which was good, but there were a few too many oysters for me.  Next time, I'm going to try the eggs benedict which I saw and wish I had ordered.  

Thus far, one of my favorite places for brunch in the city.  It's a nice casual place to have a relaxing brunch.
author: Joann C.

description:
My friend and I had brunch there today.  Wait was reasonable (about 20 min), and we were seated rather promptly and service was good since we were seated at bar.

Fresh beignets were pretty awesome, but my scrambled egg was bland and too wet for my taste.  I had 3 egg scrambled with chicken apple sausage, and it was so so.  Not something I'd wait for 20-30 min to get.  People seemed nice and service was very fast and prompt though.  Love their efficiency and beignets but not scrambled eggs too much.

If I'd go there again, maybe I'll try their French toast.  They looked pretty good.
author: Yoko S.

description:
Oh my god thank god I don't live near Just For You.  If I did I would weigh 800lbs because the brunch food is delicious.  I cannot get enough of the Beignets and the delicious menu.  Sure you have to wait if you have a group because the space is small but that's part of the charm of this Dog Patch icon.

I love how there are signs here that would probably make some Noe Valley parents flip their lids.  The stollers one cracks me up so bad but yet, it is so true.  Don't bring your huge honking stroller.  I hate those things and show a little respect with the cell phone.  When did people become so entitled with their cell phones.  Anyway I digress, go to Just For You for the food, charm and atmosphere.  I have always had a great experience there!
author: Dave S.

description:
i was taken here randomly ages ago and keep coming back. its this tiny bit of querky southern style diner heaven in the middle of the dogpatch, which is, lets just say, not the nicest area in the city, for all that its 'up and coming.' 

the menu is hilarious to read, and the food is amazing to eat. i took my mother here and she also was wowed by it all. reasonable well priced, filling, good portions, fun atmosphere. theres often a bit of a wait, especially on weekends when everyone in the city goes out for brunch, but its worth every second.

and i know everyone keeps raving about them... but omg the beignets. they are massive. and amazing. the perfect ending to a meal. or start. ... or meal in itself. any excuse. 

a quote from the menu 'Grits! just like you had in prison!' because i totally remember that one time... i mean.... ;)

go. eat. love. repeat.
author: Haley F.

description:
The food here is rich. You'll definitely have to walk it off afterwards. This place is average (which doesn't mean its not good, its just that SF offers plenty of competition for brunch, and the Scrooge in me would rather go to Brickhouse where its less cramped and noisy).

*Special shrimp benedict: great twist on an old standby. Get a side of their home made green chili sauce .
*French toast: below average
*Coffee: average

Bottom line:  I wouldn't go back.
author: Mehul P.

description:
Really impressive brunch! We arrived at 10:30 am on a sunny Sunday and only had to wait 15 minutes. There is free coffee outside while you're waiting, but you need to go inside to get a paper cup near the register. ("Otherwise the whole neighborhood helps themselves to coffee and the cups blow away.")

I had the Greg's Scramble with chorizo, which is hands down the best scramble I've had in SF. Biscuits are good as are the home fries. The beignets are good, but basically they're just fresh donuts with powdered sugar. (3 for $4.) Our server was lovely and cheerful, and the coffee was good and plentiful.
author: Adam Z.

description: Very good for breakfast.  Ordered off the day's special menu and both items were great.  Got there around 10:30 AM on a Sunday and waited about 30 minutes.  Street parking only.
author: Jim M.

description: Super-friendly cafe that lets you sip coffee while you wait for a seat.  I'll pay their biscuits the highest compliment I can give, which is to say that they're even better than my guilty-pleasure KFC biscuits!
author: Corey C.

description:
Great place for a weekend brunch.  The breakfast burrito is good.  Beignets are good.  Pancakes good.  French toast good.  Hangtown fry good.  Grits with cheese GOOOOOD!

The only thing that isn't good..... the wait.  But what do you expect?  With the food being so damn good, you're gonna have to wait.
author: Kenneth K.

description:
01.02.13 with 1 other.

small place, delicious food. good brunch spot, but i suggest small groups

we ordered 3 beignets and mimosas to start. both were great. the beignets were plain (not filled) with tons of powdered sugar on top. the mimosas were with fresh juice and in a pint glass.

i ordered the home fry special with scrambled eggs, it had a good balance of potatoes, veggies and egg.
author: Jay R.

description:
Made my second visit here today... totally awesome!
Not only are their wait staff oh so nice. The food is super delicious and so clean tasting. They make their own bread and lots of other items, that are so fresh it will blow your mind 

Today I went with their po-boy with shrimp. Not only were the shrimp perfectly breaded the sandwich itself was filled with the most beautiful veggies I've seen this time of the year! 

All I can say is I know the dog patch sounds far... the beignets alone are worth it!
author: Amy S.

description:
Superb food, best service in galaxy (or at the very least, DogPatch)!! 

Was having a crummy day and was looking forward to some comfort breakfast with Chron and NYT in hand. There was a very short wait, but they were extra attentive to ensure I was seated quickly. Automatic with coffee, water and immediately took my order. My scramble with homemade turkey-sausage was delayed by 20 minutes, which was a mild bummer, and they comp'd it (without me even griping)! It was delicious and they did not overdo it with apologizing (as some many BS 'service' oriented places do), didn't rush me out or anything. I was a fan before, but now am a loyalist and evangelist.
author: tom w.

description:
i ordered the crab cake po' boy, and my 2 other girls ordered the crab cake breakfast plate. we all agreed that the crab cakes were seasoned well, and very delicious.  they enjoyed the biscuits and grits with their breakfast.   

my only two hangups about the place are the lack of attentiveness of the wait staff.  it took us over 25 minutes till someone came to take our orders. we also had to flag them down for water and hot sauce. secondly, there were many huge flies in the place that kept dropping into our food and drinks.  2 of us pushed away our mimosas because of the fly landings.
author: Sheri N.

description: I've been coming here for a long time.  The coffee and the breakfast is excellent - scrambles, breakfast combos, everything.  I usually get the "cowgirl" or "Greg's Scramble" which can be modified however you like it.  The place has a unique New Orleans feel to it I think because of the owner.  You can often find her milling around the kitchen or talking to a regular.  I like this place because it is consistently good - has been for the 10 years I've been coming here.
author: Nathan V.

description: Excellent breakfast place. All their bread stuff is terrific.
author: N Z.

description:
Excellent Weekend Brunch local.

The portions are big. Beignets are huge (who doesn't love fried dough).  The green sauce on the huevos rancheros is hot hot hot.

The reason for the 3,  it is a bit pricey.

Great hangover stop for sure.
author: Ken p.

description:
This is one of those places that make me wish Yelp did fractional stars, as I'm having a very hard time choosing between three and four stars here. I think it's a solid three-and-a-half. 

Service can be painfully slow and ineffective, especially when they are crowded (which is often, it seems like. They are a pretty small place). That is my biggest beef with the place. There's often a wait, cause they are popular, and it seems like they have a hard time keeping up when they are busy. A party any bigger than 4 is not terribly feasible here although it can be done.

On the plus side, they have grits ("that white pasty stuff you had in prison"), a relative rarity in San Francisco. I like the beignets just fine, although they are rather like injecting a bolus of sugar and fat directly into your veins. Which, you know, sometimes is just what you want. But I digress. The menu and signage are entertaining, and the decor is something diverting to look at before you get your coffee and are fit for company. Overall the breakfast fare is quite good; I have to say that their Hollandaise sauce was way more like soup and rather disappointing, but everything else I've had has been nice.
author: Heather R.

description:
I absolutely love it. I come here about once a week being that its my boyfriends neighborhood brunch place.

The staff is nice and friendly. The food is great and comes in pretty large portions. I always walk out stuffed!

Love it!
author: Art A.

description:
My Father visited recently and my household decided to do an early morning breakfast with him.  We wanted something close to the house (Potrero Hill) and good old trusty yelp sent us to Just for You Cafe.  

We got there around 8:15am and there was no line.  We got seated right away.  Those people who got there at 9am had quite a wait.  On the upside, they have hot coffee sitting out on the sidewalk (the waiting area) for anyone who might have been freezing in what this city jokingly calls 'summer.'  

The food was good.  I had the corn beef hash with poached eggs.  Kate's (in the lower haight) still is the best I've ever had, but this was far from bad.  The other food (omelets) went over really well, and the pancakes looked fabulous.  Refills were slow but the restaurant was packed.  The servers seemed a bit stressed and overwhelmed rather than forgetful.  They brought the check without asking if we wanted dessert so we had to correct that - this place has these...things.  I've never encountered them before, but yelp told me I had to order them.  I trusted in you, yelp.

Yelp was right.  These things - which the other reviews tell me are called beignets - are amazing.  They are some sort of puff pastry with powdered sugar melting on them.  Sort of like a donut, but not, sort of like cream puff crust, but not, sort of like...I don't know. Whatever they are, they are amazing.  They are the best hot.  They were pretty good left over too, but they were fantastic hot.  The more I type about them, the more I want to go over the hill and get more.  They are that good.  If you go here and don't try them then you are stupid.  Seriously.

I will most definitely be back.  

Notes of interest:
 
They don't let strollers in the restaurant.  You've got to leave them out on the sidewalk.

Cash or (wtf?) personal check only.

They have two small (two top) tables outside but when we were there they were used as a waiting area rather than for service.
author: Dee B.

description:
2 Words: Veggie Ruben.
This is the best sandwich I've EVER had.
Seriously!
If I could just eat their veggie ruben everyday I might just consider being a vegetarian. maybe! LOL.
I've had a Cobb Salad here too and mmhh yummie.
author: Grace P.

description: Drove over last night for an early dinner at 6pm, found parking easy and had no problem grabbing a table.  A bottle of Miller for $2 served in a frosty mug was a nice start, the server was better than fantastic, and decided to try the Jambalaya with a Beignet side.  Jambalaya was not what I expected, but only because it was prepared differently.  Imagine a rice dish with meat and vege's almost like Chinese Fried Rice, but with a bit of Southern tang.  Very nice, very light (which of course is unusual for Jambalaya) and a nice selection of hot sauces to spice it up a bit.  But the Beignets were the real winners, perfectly fluffy with a light doughy taste and the right amount of powdered sugar on top.  All in all a reasonable, good, interesting dinner.
author: Jeff V.

description:
This is my first review for a restaurant I've visited only once. In fact, I'm giving it the 5 stars based on one breakfast item served there. It's the frittata. I've yet to find a place that does frittata like this place. And I've utterly failed at duplicating it in my own kitchen.  

I love eggs, but I gave up on anything sounding like omelets or scrambled eggs on the menu at restaurants serving breakfast. The eggs usually come out crusty or spongy and sometimes both. I can't stands spongy eggs. One popular joint serves them stiff and in the shape of the omelet pan. Yuck. At most places, the eggs on the plate seem to have lost a fight with the watery vegetables mixed into the omelet. 

Just for You, on the other hand, has a way of cooking eggs that brings out a smoothness and a fluffiness in the eggs that is pretty darn wonderful. 

Thinking about it makes me want to take the day-long trek to get there from the East Bay. BART needs to stop working on their BART-safe mugs and put a new station next to the place, a JFY line that runs only on Saturdays. Sweet.
author: jeffrey k.

description:
My peeps and I were there for dinner last night, and everything was first rate.

Apps - hush puppies, crab cakes, chicken empanada, clam chowder
Entree - 2 shrimp po boys, 1 crab casserole, and 1 seafood fry
Dessert - pecan pie with whipped cream, ice cream

Wine - Pinot Noir by La Forge

Every dish was clean, ungreasey, flavorful, and flavorful. 

First time here, and it certainly won't be my last!!  A gem.
author: edward a.

description:
$7.95 - chorizo con huevos:  scrambled eggs and chorizo with grits and cinnamon toast.  toast is a pass (very dry), eggs and chorizo were ok, not as good as sunrise cafe.

$8.95 - cowgirl bfast (2 HUGE pancakes, 2 eggs, 2 sausage)  the spicy sausage is crazy spicy.  solid standard fare.

$4 - one order of 3 beignets, which are also HUGE, about the size of the palm of your hand.  drowned in powdered sugar.  i wish the dough was more sweet instead of the sweetness only being on the surface.

service is quick and attentive, however i did notice pockets of disgruntled customers that were not acknowledged for a good 20 minutes.

i would come back for the sheer fact that they serve bfast all day.

parking is more of a biatch then you would expect.
author: Josie M.

description: Great food, great service, cool little cafe.  Prices are decent.  Recommend cobb salad or burgers for lunch, and EVERYTHING on the breakfast menu is GREAT.  I used to go here all the time, as I used to work across the street, but have recently moved and have a different job.  Will be back next time I'm in the dogpatch.
author: Ryan H.

description: Yummy Beginets everything so fresh and on point!!  get there early gets really packed!!!  Grits are on hit too!!
author: oNEloVE C.

description: I really like the service here,  though sometimes you need to walk up to the counter to get/ask for stuff if they get busy.   The food is pretty good, though a tad greasy.   The chickory in the coffee was a pleasant surprise as i've never had it before coming to this place - and god I thought it was pretty good coffee - and after I found out the flavor was added chickory I thought i'd take a quick look in the wikipedia about the plant.  "...In the United States chicory root has long been used as a substitute for coffee in prisons..."  This basically threw out everything I *thought* I knew about good coffee :-O  Still all in all, nice place - and I always loved the chill atmosphere of the 'patch.
author: Ryan Y.

description: Delicious Breakfast. Chicken apple sausages, grits, corn bread, & eggs cooked to perfection. Parking was impossible.
author: Vanessa G.

description: Great breakfast atmosphere, excellent and friendly service, yummy food, and pint size mimosas. Yes please.
author: Ali T.

description:
OMG! OMG! OMG! OMG! OMG!

You know the worst kind of torture? 
- Worse than the Avada Cadavra curse used by "he-who-must-not-be-named" on "he-with-the-weird-scar-on-his-forehead"?
- Worse than Stupefy, Imperius, Expelliarmus AND Obliviate put together??

It's running by Just For Your Cafe with my marathon training group at 9AM Saturday morning on the 17th mile and getting the tantalizing, arousing and enchanting aroma of warm Beignets smothered in sugar and served with warm syrup, and of warm coffee and the sound of the spoon stirring in the milk..... DROOL!

THE FIRST LOVE:
- Two eggs any style with:
   + bacon (classic!)
   + Louisiana sausage (hot n spicy... like moi!)
   + Chicken apple sausage (as if mom were cooking it!)
   + Longanisa (Oink! Oink! on the grease and fat!)
   + Creole Crab Cake (umm!)
- Beignets powdered with sugar (their speciality and my vice and best way to win my stomach... and hence, me heart!)
- Frittata of the Decade (Can't go wrong with the all veggie goodie with zucchini, mushrooms, onion, garlic, spinach & tomato, topped with cheddar cheese)
- Chilli Scramble (and they don't kid when they say "chilli")
- Pancakes (you can beat my pancakes anytahm!)
- Chorizo Con Huevos (Perfect for oiling away that nasty hangover but watch it! It is spicy, fattening and greasy as hell)
- A PINT... I'll say that again... A PINT of mimosa!
- Coffee (run-o-the-mill but satisfying)
- Great service and the ladies behind the counter are funny, treat you like family and really look after you
- Great energy to the place with mostly locals frequenting it
- Lots of parking if you're driving and the T-Third stops a block away and if you're a runner like me, run here!

THE HEARTACHE:
- They only take cash so daddy's plastic don't gonna work here, baby. There is an ATM in the liquor store next to this place
- There is almost always a wait (25-30 mins) but they serve coffee and the place on the opposite corner serves Blue Bottle coffee... shh!
- Place is compact so its a bit tight if you're sitting at the bar
- That said, if you're 1 to 2, sit at the bar. If you're bigger, ask for a table
- I live in the Inner Sunset, so either I take the T-Third to get there (its on 22nd Street at 3rd Street) or I go here as I'm mid-way through my run (F@#K!) 

THE NOTES:
- Leave any attitude outside or at home. Don't complain about the wait or the small space
- This place is laid back and the hosts treat you like you were eating in their kitchen... be nice and tip well
- Look at all the art and signs on the wall.. frigging awesome!
- If you see me run by, throw me a Beignet will you?... pretty please!

... and yes, I'm currently reading Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows... Accio Beignet!
author: Amit S.

description:
I've been here three times in the last six months - which is like a treat since I hardly ever drive into SF on weekdays and have no business to be in the Potrero Hill district of the city. The weekend brunch menu is very "full-filling" and you definitely won't leave there feeling like you didn't get your money's worth! Oh, did I mention you need to come here for the beignets? Three for $4.00 is a steal and I can't seem to find any place else on the left coast that sells them outside of Cafe DuMonde in Louisiana. 

Word up to the wise: weekend brunch starts getting crowded at around 10:15am and don't forget to observe the "turn off cell phone" signage!

Also, CASH ONLY y'all !!!!!!! Drop by the ATM if need be before going here!

Remind me next time though that after having a gigantic meal at this establishment that the bike ride back to AT & T Park to sit in my seats at the SF Giants game by 1:05pm will take a little longer than usual on my full stomach!
author: Will C.

description:
Excellent menu, great food and clean! Had the Hangtown Fry: 3 eggs scrambled with bacon, oysters and onions - Yummeeee!  On the menu it states "If this doesn't cure your hangover, you'd better just go back to bed." - Very very true!

Will definitely be back for the rest of the stuff on the menu!
author: Luanne T.

description:
COBB SALAD KICKS SERIOUS ARSE!!!

Great menu, actual food even butter... must come back & have more.
Quick and friendly service.   

Just go, GO!
author: M E.

description:
The eggs and potatoes are delish. We didn't try the beignets but they looked really tasty. Even though the place was slammed our server was really hustling to keep everyone happy, which is always appreciated.

The wait was insane though. So when I factor the goodness of the potatoes by the pain in the butt hour wait. I decided on 3 stars. Go at either 9am or 2pm but I guess that's the rule for everywhere for Sunday brunch.
author: Abby P.

description:
I really like this place - top for me on the list of great breakfast joints in the city.

We had to wait a good ole' 45 minutes to be seated and had to wait outside and let me tell you - it was freezing! However, they do have a little table outside with warm coffee for everyone to enjoy while waiting.

So yes this place is really busy on the weekends and you might have a long wait outside, rain or shine - but it is sooooooo worth the wait.

One taste of the sugary beignets and the yummy omelettes with thick toast and your choice of grits or potatoes, and you will be hooked - planning your next trip back.
author: Melanie T.

description:
This place has yummy beignets!  MMmm...

I also enjoyed their homemade cornbeef hash, which is shredded and mixed with their home fries (large potato cubes).  Coupled with eggs over-easy, it was a yummy combination.  

Make sure you bring cash ands switch your cell phone to vibrate.
author: Nina L.

description:
Their breakfast is just okay. Hence, the middle of the road rating. Why, then, do I keep coming back here? One word: beignets! It's hard to find good beignets in the city (and even in the Bay Area), but Just For You does it right. Their beignets are pillowy puffs of perfection, with just the right amount of powdered sugar on top. Your taste buds will sing. A caveat: don't order three beignets at once like I did. Even though I was voraciously hungry at the time, I felt like my stomach was going to explode by the time I finished. I think I even fell asleep on the muni when I was going home...but anyways. Unlike Lay's potato chips, with beignets, you can just have one!

As an aside, their menu is very entertaining. Yes, you read that right. For those who are easily amused and/or like sarcasm, you'll have to check it out for yourself.
author: Christine T.

description: Cute place for breakfast.  Nice place for convo and a meal. Crowded and small but cozy.  Lots of variety on menu. Will be going back when in town.
author: Winnie B.

description: Where else can you get a correct breakfast burrito and scrumptious beignets in the same meal? Just For You has seriously tasty food, generous portions, friendly service, and easy parking. Oh - and the line isn't ridiculous, even on the weekend. Are we still in San Francisco? I'm their newest fan!
author: Rebecca O.

description:
We just tried their new dinner menu.  Very impressive.  The burger was quality beef, and not overcooked like mos places.  The fish tacos rival anything available in the Mission.

If the breakfast scene is too crowded for you, try the dinners here.
author: Alex A.

description: I Just come here for the beignets! They are doughy and that's what I look for in my little doughnuts. Breakfast is bleghhhh and not much to get excited about.
author: MiSa S.

description:
Agree with nods to super good, large-portioned, non-pretentious, no-attitude service brunch/breakfasts.  The New Orleans style coffee w chicory they serve is a nice treat and goes down quite well with the beignets.
Yes, the beignets are perfect. Little nubbins of fluffy fried dough with powdered sugar on top. Impossible to feel bad looking at (and quickly devouring) a plate of their beignets.
The food itself won't win any awards, but it's very fresh, clean-flavored classic Americana fare.
Only down-side is the rushed service. Honestly, that's the other side of waiting in line for a table, but once you're seated they want to get you out as fast as possible. The upside is that waits are never ridiculously long (yes Outerlands, I'm looking at you) even on a perfect sunny sunday San Francisco morning.
author: Rebecca P.

description: I love that Just for You serves Filipino longganiza (Sausage) for brunch - that in itself makes this a great place in the Dogpatch :) Great place for breakfast/brunch - although get here early and beat all the hipsters trying to calm their hangovers with fluffy beignets. Great that they are also serving dinner as well - and there is never a wait! I am definitely a fan
author: Christian S.

description: I love the home made feel of this place. Its nice and quaint, with a classic SF personality. We signed in for a table and were sat shortly there after. The Beñets are good, lots of powdered sugar. I liked my French Toast, the home fries and eggs were good also. Great non-frufru coffee, and delicious OJ. I'll be back for more menu offering.
author: Kameelah R.

description: The huevos rancheros here are TO DIE FOR!  The fact that they serve breakfast all day long also makes them one of my favorite SF staples.  I haven't tried their lunch or dinner yet, because I simply can't pull myself away from their amazing breakfast menu.  I know, I know... I am an addict, but at least I admit it!  Eat here and we can discuss our rehab plans over a big plate of beignets :)
author: Cortney E.

description: One word: Beignets. Get them, because they are delish. A Dogpatch favorite that attracts "regulars." Good food, good portions, plenty of selection when you are indecisive. It's casual dining in a comfortable space. The pre-meal line and wait is likely to be long. So get there early. Pair that with fairly priced, consistent food, and it's easy to see why Just For You keeps people coming back for more.
author: Alex H.

description: This really is one of those great finds. A cook in another restaurant gave me a card saying he worked in both places. The decor is nothing special but the breakfast menu with crab cakes, home made bread and beignets was a surprise. The staff was very gregarious and people from adjacent tables all conversed with us, complete strangers. It was warm and welcoming and I will certainly be back soon and often.
author: Ken B.

description:
I've been to this place countless times and it's always good.

I've always had good (maybe not always great) service.  They may not be extra-chatty, but I don't mind that.  I'd rather have my coffee constantly topped-off in silence than asked how I'm doing.  One time, all I had to do was look at the overhead fan (it was chilly inside) and without asking, they turned it off for me.

The food is consistently good and the portions more than enough.  And yes--the beignets are so-o-o good.  Try them with the jam.  And I don't know where else I can get grits.

The only reason why it doesn't get 5 stars is because there's nothing on the menu that I MUST have or crave.  Just For You is more like my good old stand-by, versus my destination.

The wait can be long on the weekends for brunch...put your name in and hope it isn't a cold day in the Dogpatch.
author: fi l.

description:
When it was in Potrero (where Chez Maman is), I used to live for the breakfast burritos. On any given Saturday or Sunday, you'd find us sitting at the counter marveling at the short-order cooks technique. 

Well, he left and Just for You moved to the Dogpatch. I've been a few times since and still love the atmosphere, attitude, coffee, and food. The homemade toast is always a hit. I like both the raisin and the wheat. And even though I'm not vegan or vegetarian I like their tofu stir fry (by the time I eat "breakfast" or "brunch"t hese days, it's truly lunch)

It's a good spot, often sunny, and there's coffee while you wait!
author: sarah s.

description:
A quaint and cozy spot in the Dogpatch with AWESOME beignets with a heavy (not light) dusting of powdered sugar.  Heavy dustings of anything sweet, for me, is a good thing.  Schmear it with some raspberry preserves...yummmm...

They've also got great fish tacos on their lunch menu.  Oh...and their bleu scramble's pretty damn good as well.  Come to think of it, everything I've ever had there has been rather enjoyable.

Note: don't be "scurred" of 3rd Street...Newcomb is at least 2 miles down...
author: Alice L.

description:
Yesterday, I made my second pilgrimage to Just For You.  I do not return to restaurants that I don't like.  So, that tells you something right away.  But, I cannot bring myself to give this place more than 3 stars.  If I could, I would give it a solid 3.5.

To Just For You's credit, this little Dogpatch cafe has style.  It is homey and cute.  It offers a plentiful selection, serving a number of unique dishes--wonderfully crisp beignets, oatmeal pancakes, unusual scramblers and omelettes.  Hell, the menu is even written in a cute way (with little jokes and comments beside the dishes).

But, let's face it.  Breakfast is the easiest meal to make and to make well.  So, if you are going to rack up points for breakfast with me, you have to really excel at making it.  Your menu must offer options that I could not make or would not try at home, kids.  And, Just For You falls short of this bar.

If you are feeling lazy, or just want some good, basic fare outside of your own kitchen, this place is great.  But, if you are looking for a "knock your socks off" breakfast in the city, seek it elsewhere.

Ps.  It's cash only.
Pps.  There may be a wait.
author: Margo C.

description:
I really really wanted to like this place more than I did, so much so that I've been several times, weekends and weekdays.

Yay for having grits. Yay for having beignets. Yay for general deliciousness. 

Boo for having extraordinary wait times on the weekend. Boo for having staff so overworked that they don't actually get a chance to talk to you for 20+ minutes *after* you sit down. 

The food is great. The space is too small, and the service as a result suffers. If I go there on weekends nowadays, I eat before I go.
author: Jon G.

description:
Upon entering into this establishment for lunch the day after writing my prior review, I was harangued by the staff and owner for giving 3 stars.  After fruitlessly defending myself by pointing out that there should be a quotient in the city for five stars, I agreed that restaurants should be judged in their genre. (I was also afraid of a summary beating, with their delicious homemade bread).

I eat here at least two time a week.  I favor the specials, Allie's spice cake and the clam chowder, when they make it.
author: Peter B.

description: Service was great... Cypress mimosas awesome. Wish the food was a little spicier.
author: Shanna G.

description: A great Dog Patch choice! Good food, tough parking but worth it, just circle a few times. Really nice menu choices, solid food, one of the top Dog Patch Area places to go.
author: Troy S.

description: Wanted to try a new brunch spot for Mother's Day and found this place on yelp. After reading all the yelp reviews about their famous beignets i just had to try 'em....SCORE!!!! They remind me of a smaller version of the funnel cakes u get @ G.A. (great america~wait is it even called that anymore? LOL). Bottom line they were yummy in my tummy..It's small on the inside but there's an outdoor patio which is great when it's nice outside. We didn't wait long either to get seated. I ordered the chorizo con huevos and it was goooood. I'm definitely a fan of this place.
author: Eli S.

description: This place is sooo delicious! Let me preface my review by saying that I live as far away from Just For You Cafe as you could and still live in the city. After making the trek out here, I have to say it was well worth it! The beignets are a must try - they were the perfect appetizer split 2 ways prior to my greg's omelet with chicken apple sausage! My boyfriend loved this place too, the new mexico green chiles in his huge breakfast burrito were a hit. This place is reasonable, delicious, and better than most of the places in the Marina - we have some pretty great places over here too...but this is the best overall. Also, family friendly...and you gotta love the free coffee outside while you are waiting in the cold!
author: Michelle N.

description: Just for you had a great and diverse breakfast menu to suit just about every palate and need.  The service was excellent,  the coffee was strong, and they got my picky girlfriend's crispy bacon demands right, but what I valued the most of this place was their AUTHENTIC NEW MEXICAN GREEN CHILE!  If you've ever lived or dined in New Mexico you know that green and red chile is a way of life there.  I lived in New Mexico for 8 years and have harvested and prepared green chile with old grandmas so I know what good, authentic green chile is.  Just for you hit it head on, and I can honestly say it's the best and only decent green chile I've had outside NM.  I will definitely be going back any time I need a green chile fix, or just great food in general.
author: Uuri K.

description: The food is amazing--good old American breakfast food.  Total comfort.  And I love the atmosphere.  Warm and cuddly.  Especially good on a rainy Sunday.  The beignets are crazy good and I always go for the scrambles.  The only thing I don't like?  The loooong wait to get a table. But, that's what happens when you are this good.
author: Ariane M.

description: Awesome food, awesome smells.  I'm in mourning that I didn't order the beginets, but my dad and I both got huevos rancheros, mine with green sauce and his with the vegetarian red sauce  Even though the menu said the green is HOT  HOT, his was actually spicer.  But both were delish.  Coffee good, service ok, kinda slow, the only reason why I'm not giving it 5 stars.  Next time I'm sticking with carbs carbs carbs.  I peeked my head in the kitchen and saw some fresh dough rising and thought "Why did I order eggs on tortillas?"  Then I cried as I ate.
author: Alanna C.

description: One of the better breakfasts I have had in a while. Great atmosphere, great service and amazing food. Get the special, whatever it is. It is usually quite the unusual treat.
author: Brooks B.

description: Any place with grits is okay by me. Good place to blow your diet. If you really want to bust a gut, get the spicy chili verde huevos with a side of grits and top if off with some beignets. You might need to be rolled out of the front door but it might be worth it.
author: Faith S.

description:
The food is good but I thought it was expensive for what you get.  I have to admit that I was really craving beignets when I came here and I was disaapointed-- not really like the small light and fluffy ones I've had at Cafe De Monde or Powderface in Oakland.  

I'll go here again and see if my first impression was way off base. So many people have raved about this place so maybe it was just me being particularly picky that day.
author: Leslie H.

description:
If I could eat here every day I would, but I don't think I would be able to fit through the door after a while!


Amazing food, wonderful real San Francisco people. 

Wish I had enough room for pie.

p.s.

you can order the beignets to go, just don't wear black
author: Jon H.

description:
As a long time Dogpatch worker I was really excited to see that Just For You was going to start serving dinner three nights a week soon.  Well, soon is now!  Tonight was their first night doing dinner on top of their always stellar breakfasts and lunches.  

We walked in to a fairly empty room (which is unusual and bound to be the last time) and were warmly greeted by the owner and staff.  This place always has a friendly vibe, but tonight there was a different more relaxed feel with candles on the tables and dimmed lights.  

The menu is pretty much the same as for lunch and breakfast, but with some dinner specials on front.  The pasta special was amazing with fresh grilled prawns and pesto cheese raviolis that were nice and light, not heavy feeling at all.  I only had a taste of these, but wished I had ordered that for myself.  I had the classic Cobb Salad which is always good there, so not too much to add to that.  

One of the great things about Just For You is the casual, but not flaky feel you get there.  It's also great that they will actually take a check if you don't have cash.  It's actually kinda refreshing that the do NOT take plastic.  

So, all in all, it's a great addition to the neighborhood that they are doing dinners now and keeping true to what they do best - good food at a reasonable price with a fun, friendly atmosphere.
author: Erik A.

description: Really good basic home cooked breakfast food.  The beignets are wonderful (whats not to like, fried bread with powdered sugar).  The menu is to the point, but you have your choice of a lot of sides.  The staff bend over backwards to give you good service in the midst of the madness.   We ate at the counter and watched the fry cooks workout, what a show.   Everything was hot, fresh, and tasty.  The wait was 35 minutes at prime time so next time I will go a little earlier or maybe on a weekday.  Couldn't figure out why we were stuffed before our eggs were gone.  Could it have been the beignet appetizer?
author: Deborah T.

description:
I find it very hard to believe that this place has four stars. Came here with a friend after a long night of dancing with a hankering for some good brunch. She wanted to try this place based on the reviews on Yelp and yelpers haven't failed me yet so I was excited.

We got there and the line was friggin' long, which I can deal with if the food is good (Mama's!). So we wait and wait forever, and then with 3 people in front of us on the list, we duck into the convenience store next door to find some cold medicine for my friend because she was coming down with something. I swear we were gone for less than 5 minutes and when we came out her name was crossed off the list! We told the guy manning the waitlist what had happened, and he said he would work us back into the list. A few minutes later he comes out and we look at him eagerly and he says to us "I'll get you guys next". Then the next time he comes out to call names he COMPLETELY forgot about us! If you're going to seat us next, we appreciate it and will wait, but don't tell us you're going to seat us and then completely FORGET about us! If our best bet was to put our names back on the list, TELL US instead of having us wait around when you're never going to seat us. When I realized the guy completely forgot about us I put my name on the list and we were finally seated. I think in total we waited over an hour in line.

We ordered the beignets to share and I had the blue cheese scramble and my friend ordered the eggs benedict. First off, these were the WORST beignets I've had. I can't say that I'm an expert but these tasted bitter, like they were fried in oil that hadn't been changed in a very long time. They barely had any flavor and they were just greasy squares of dough with powered sugar heaped on top. The beignets at Angeline's in Berkeley are way better. Definitely not worth the calories.

Next, my blue cheese scramble arrived and it looked straight up nasty, like barf. There were lots of vegetables and chunks of blue cheese and the serving was tiny - it didn't look like they used 3 eggs to make that scramble to me! The home fries were barely crispy and didn't have much flavor. I eyeballed my friend's benedict and it looked pretty rough around the edges as well. Her orange juice looked like it had been diluted with dishwater... or something. Both of our plates arrived at our table lukewarm. Unacceptable!

Left $35 poorer and grossed out. I'm sticking to Mama's for brunch!
author: Bella L.

description: 5 stars are purely based on their Chorizo Con Huevos...YUM! For me it's worth waiting in line or parking and walking out in the rain for pick-up.  I haven't been for lunch but need to because if their breakfast is that good I would like to think their lunch is too. And yes the line/wait can be long but its worth it in my book.
author: Vicki R.

description:
i really like this place. i love the super thick toast, and the grits are good, and there are so many interesting omelets and scrambles and other things. and of course the beignets are awesome. 
the atmosphere is fun and cute, you can watch what's going on in the kitchen, but the wait is sometimes long and the price is a little high in my opinion.
author: Sarah J.

description: I must admit, I came here just for the beignet's! But the service top notch, too. The Beignet's (which I can only compare to the ones at Cafe Du Monde in NOLA) were light, fluffy and crispy. They were mouth-watering, awesome fresh beignet's. MMMMM... I expect to go there soon for breakfast one day, too. We had our helpings of beignets at 1:30pm.
author: Julissa C.

description:
I eat here a lot. I like the food, the staff is relatively nice, and it's very close to my office.

Downside: overpriced, overall.
author: C. A. S.

description:
First I'd like to note that I think it is silly to give a place less stars because it doesn't have good vegan options.  This place does not claim to be a vegan-friendly restaurant at all.  Its southern food.  You want great vegan food, go to a freakin vegan restaurant.

Now on to the review - this is my favorite brunch place in my neighborhood.  I love that I can walk there.  I love the specials.  I love the lousiana hot sausage, frittata, and the best home fries.  I don't love the wait but I'm willing to deal with it because this place is so great.
author: Emily d.

description:
I've found out the trick to Just for You's beignets. As a Baton Rouge native and former New Orleans resident, I have noticed that the beignets can be somewhat off. Sometimes they are great and sometimes they are a bit yeasty.

However, I have found a pattern to the problem and a simple reason behind it. Apparently, beignet quality is determined partly by ambient humidity. When it is raining or drizzling out, the beignets are excellent. If it's sunny, better to skip them. It's always humid in Louisiana so it's not a problem there.

I would prefer if the beignets were served with a powdered sugar shaker, as they always are in Louisiana. Sometimes the sugar doesn't cover the top of the beignet and sometimes it's all over the plate but not all over the beignet. It's nearly impossible to get powdered sugar off the plate with a beignet. If it does not come from above it doesn't stick.

Other food there is not humidity sensitive and some of it is pretty good. I don't find many places here that offer grits and sometimes grits really hit the spot. (And no, I have never been to prison.) Always grits with cheese, please. The crab cake omelet is tasty and I like the scramble with blue cheese and artichoke hearts.

Check the back of your grocery receipts for Just for You coupons.
author: Jen L.

description:
Love me some Just for You.  The food and atmosphere here are great - a yummy and fun neighborhood place.  For a detailed review of what I like there, check out my blog:

http://lawyereats.blogspot.com/2007/08/mabels-just-for-you-cafe-just-for-me.html

This is one of my fav. brunch places in the city - go there!
author: LawyerEats S.

description:
A friend and I stumbled upon this place in a kind of somewhat deliberate scooter-ride kind of way. We sat at the counter where there was great service and we got to see some of the food being prepared. They have beignets where are these huge donut-y things that we didn't order but I have been thinking about ever since.

Very cute, cozy and in a part of town that I never go to, so it was fun to feel like we were getting away.
author: Melissa M.

description:
Yum! Really good breakfast/brunch fare. I definitely want to come back and try something more adventurous (I had eggs, homefries and biscuits which were all delicious but the menu had a ton of other great-looking options). The ride over to the Dogpatch on the 48 was quick and provided some great views. The wait was kinda long, but it was Sunday morning and you can pick up the newspaper next door while you wait.

Also: yeah, the beignets are AWESOME.
author: Anna C.

description: Came here for a late lunch the other day. Pretty quiet around that time, only a few other tables were occupied. I had Ian's chicken strips plate, which was outstanding. Chicken was tender with crispy breading and it came with grilled green beans and creamy garlic mashed potatoes (drools). The bf had a bbq beef po'boy, which he said was okay but he wasn't a huge fan of the spicy sauce. We also had an order of the hush puppies which were pretty good. Service was great so no complaints on  that end. Will have to come back if only to try the beignets.
author: Marie W.

description: Every time I open my wallet I see my frequent buyer card for this place, and I get a little sad, distance defying growl in my stomach. oh! for Beignetsssssss with chicorry coffeeee and something spicy on a plate.... (And annoying stereotypes of san franciscans, bantering on over- knowledgeably about innovative child raising strategies they are deploying on their terrified looking urchins..  but hey... it's san francisco)
author: Will T.

description:
I like this place because it is a traditional American diner, done really well. They do lots of breakfast food, burgers, sandwiches- basically everything you expect from a diner.  They also add to this some Mexican and Cajun influences.

What wins me over is the quality of the ingredients and homemade nature of the food. 'They use sources for produce and meat and eggs that high end restaurants use, which is important for those of us who don't want to support feed lots or eat canned food. They do this pretty quietly without a lot of fanfare, and they've been doing it long before it was fashionable to know or care how a cow was raised. They also make most of their own bread.

I'm giving them 5 stars because they know what they're about and do it well. I don't expect cappuccino in a diner. There is a straightforward honesty to the place, and if you're expecting some fancy, wacky twist on a diner, you won't find it. The staff is super nice and efficient but busy, and the owner is a friendly curmudgeon who sets the no-nonsense vibe of the place. She genuinely cares about the place and her customers and it shows. Just don't blab on your cell phone at breakfast. Really. 

You do have to order 100% maple syrup specifically or they serve a blend. I'm probably fussier about this than most people but at least they have it. 

We really appreciate them being in the neighborhood.
author: Neil H.

description:
Just for You is the first business that showed me Dogpatch is more than a frightening industrial wasteland. Looking down from the 20th Street overpass, Dogpatch doesn't appear to be the most inviting of places, even in the daytime. Since the time I first moved here, though, its constant renovation has begun to yield some more welcoming buildings. The sparsely-warehoused area right around Just for You feels like it was created exclusively to be visited on Sunday mornings for walks in the park with your dog. It's almost enough to make me want to go out and GET a dog. But that's not really the point of the review, I guess. 

First, let me get the obligatory beignets mention out of the way. The beignets are great. Get some no matter what else you order. As a main breakfast dish, get the pancakes; their cornmeal or oatmeal pancakes are some of the best I've had. In my experience restaurant pancakes are usually either "okay" or "terrible," so this makes them that much better.

The scrambles and the Mexican breakfast dishes are hit-or-miss. I've had them when they are pretty good and the flavors work very well together, and other times when they come out surprisingly bland. They're never awful, but the pancakes are a better deal and more reliable.

Even if the food was terrible, though, I would probably still go here for the ambience. It is always busy, but they're careful with their limited seating, so it's never quite as cramped as you're afraid it will be. The ever-changing neon posters and amusingly caustic signs plastered over the walls should be too jarring for a relaxing breakfast, but it really defines the place's visual style. A thousand times better than the pallid beach-with-seagulls-and-reeds scenes you usually wind up with at breakfast-y restaurants. And they have thick, squat coffee cups, which I enjoy beyond all reason and justification.
author: Mark B.

description: Great comfort food. Eclectic menu options for everyone. Friendly staff. The line is worth the wait.
author: Mike O.

description: classic sf description, from scratch organic locally sourced ingredients, etc.  tried the frittata and the greg scramble with chorizo.  home fries too chunky.  both entrees were just ok.  i would agree that the beignet was great, freshly made, not too oily.
author: Rob C.

description: Love it! Just For You Cafe is just right for me! What a delicious lunch/breakfast! I got the roasted potatoes under an assortment of yummy fresh veggies, grilled to perfection, with just the right amount of cheese melted on top and the pièce de résistance - 2 scrambled eggs scrambled just right on the very top. My mouth is watering just thinking of it again! it's called the Cherie's Home Fry Special and sure is special! And the service is great, just the right amount of attention and friendly.
author: Jenny B.

description:
I give this place a 4.5. We were pleasantly surprised how short  the line was to get into this place. We found this place on YELP (THANKS YELP!) and read  we would have to wait in a long line to be seated. I think we scored due the rain, but our wait was only 10 min or so. When we first stepped in, I could tell why there's always such a long wait. This place is small....only 7 tables or so, but a very at- home warm welcoming atmosphere. Cute, colorful, friendly is how I'd describe it.

We were greeted by the host who asked if we'd like to sit at the counter. At first, we thought no, but then we realized we'd get to sit near the the cooks & see all dishes come out. I know most of you would agree, sitting near the steamy kitchen is a big no no, but not for us. How lucky were we??! Seriously.  I had no idea what to order. We read Yelp reviews & everything sounded delissshhh. But after ooking at the all the food come out..that helped me make my final decision! I ordered the Greg Scramble with chicken apple sausage. YUMMY! The veggies were FRESH! Spinach, garlic, & onions..MMmmm. I think that was my most favvv. of all that we ordered. We also ordered cornmeal pancakes. Super yummy. And of course, we didn't forget the beignets!! How do you say that? Silent "t"? Those  were delicious!! Powdered sugar with syrup sprinkled on the beignets are to-die-for. If you haven't had beignets before, go here! Theirs are delicious. 

This place is pretty close the Giants stadium so if you're up for breakfast before heading out to the game, this is the spot to check out. Loved it! But .5 marked off because it's just too small for me. :( 

I wouldn't suggest going here if you're with a group greater then four or else you'll have to wait since most of their tables only seat 2. But I definitely recommend this place.
author: Annette Y.

description:
I like the breakfast here (served all day). The menu item that pushes this review to 5 stars is the home fries. Some of the best home fries I've ever had: crisp on the outside and soft and tender on the inside. So tasty! Also, the toast made from homemade bread (served dry, without butter) is delicious.

I live around the corner, so I go here often. I like seeing the same folks (servers and patrons), and everyone seems friendly.

On the weekends, the wait to get a seat can be long during typical brunch hours. Also, they may not be open for dinner on weekends. Check the hours.
author: sam l.

description:
so what did i have for breakfast?

cornbread..... 

topped with a simple omelet...... 

topped with CHILI. yeah i said CHILI!!!!!

oh and a side for grits. 

im an undercover fat ass.
author: Euge L.

description: The beignets were awesome.  Food was excellent in general.  The ham is cut and cooked like bacon, or the bacon is so thick it's like a piece of ham.  I like that it's in a slower part of the city, less traffic, at least at the time we were there, no wait, no fuss, friendly and lively atmosphere.
author: Andy B.

description:
come hungry, leave fat.  i usually get two meals out of brunch here.

Alice P is right on about the biscuits, they are more like rolls, but they are good, i usually get them.  they will fill you up quick though.  the cinnamon raisin bread is good too.

the wait can be long though on a weekend, and you may have trouble getting a table for a group larger than 4.  weekend brunch offers more dishes though, so it's worth the wait.  (pay for a coffee inside and sip while you wait.)

i would slap someones baby if it even reached for my beignets.  they's good.

i usually hate reading long reviews, but i need to give credit to the character of the staff here.  we're talking about honesty in the customer service industry... in 2010:

the first time i came here i sat at the bar.  dude next me eating by himself.  waitress approaches him... she remembers him from the last time he was there, she had accidentally overcharged him (by some negligible amount) and wanted to give him back the difference.  any other place would have ate up the difference and laughed the whole way to the bank!  just for you is awesome.
author: eric f.

description: Absolutely decent food. Fresh baked bread, and yummy homemade chili.
author: Alissa P.

description: I knew this place was Just For Me as Adam Ant was playing as we were seated! The frittata was delicious. The home fries were okay. My breakfast-mates had the beignets and said they were amazing. I didn't taste them because I know a new addiction when I see it.
author: S T.

description: What a cute little place!  Parking was breeze right around the corner, the service was great and the prices were crazy low.  For the gluten intolerant, we found the oatmeal pancakes to be an awesome choice.  For a little extra, we got real maple syrup too (a major bonus for those allergic to corn!)!  Woo hoo!  The kids wanted to order more food than they could possibly eat because it all looks so yummy.  We'll definitely be back very soon!
author: Kelly M.

description: Several weeks ago, I embarked on a beignet hunt... I found Just For You.  Like most things, I put off my visit and just by happenstance yesterday, some friends and I walked by and sat down for brunch.  Service was iffy but I'll give it 5 stars anyway due to the piping hot beignets smothered in powdered sugar.  My black sweater was covered in powdered sugar, leaving one to believe that beignets aren't my ONLY addiction.
author: Krista C.

description: Can I just say, I've never been disappointed. This place is GREEEAT! It feels like I'm home in Sacramento enjoying the freshy cooked meal of my mum. I love the servers and enjoy the fresh lemonade. You will spend an average of 10-15 per meal. The vegi reuben could easily be my favorite sandwich (ever). Listen to me when I say, awesome. AWESOME!
author: David C.

description: Well, maybe it's just my bad luck, but I've tried this place twice, and both times I couldn't enjoy my meal, because the woman (whom I believe is the owner) was barking out orders and yelling at her staff so loudly.  One time she was being so mean to the guy that I actually almost wrote a letter to her afterwards, because it was so uncomfortable to be there.  She was absolutely oblivious.
author: Bodacious T.

description:
love this place!  came here for the 1st time last night and it was super-cute, mellow, and cozy. i love that you can order a baked potato on its own -- yummy for a light meal, and just enough food for a little snack. the fruit cup was good, too -- no BS cantalope and melon; it contained strawberries, bananas, and other REAL fruit. :) 

i will definitely come back here if i'm in the neighborhood again.
author: Elle B.

description:
Oh my, I did not know beignets could be so delicious!  I love this place and wish I could go more often but it's bit far from everything.  (Probablllllllllllllly a good thing that I can't.  Not sure how long I could fit in my jeans if I could go back as often as I wish lol.)  

I usually get the "cowgirl" special (2 pancakes, two eggs and sausage/bacon strips).  I give the sausage/bacon to my fiancé since I don't eat pork but I'm always stuffed with what's left.   

Staff is friendly and service is quick which is nice when you wake up having a major craving for pancakes :) 

Make sure you get the little punch card.  Always nice to get a free breakfast to a place you know you are going to come back to!
author: JR Kaz K.

description: One word: BEIGNETS!!! They are so good! And cinammon free which makes them real beignets! They come warm and melt in your mouth. Despite being very popular the wait does not seem to ever be very long for 2 people (parties of 4 or more seem to wait quite longer). The waitress was super nice, very attentive, coffee always refilled. Parking is easy around that neighborhood. Go around 10am to beat the brunch crowd.  Great great Potrero place. Note they only take cash or checks, but there is a liquor store next door with an ATM.
author: Jean-Francois R.

description: No bad if you get a chance to avoid the owner. On a bad day she's got a serious attitude and seems to treat her staff like crap. Breakfast is good, dinners getting better.
author: Stanley D.

description: If you a vegetarian don't even bother heading to this place.  Everything of interest on the menu includes some sort of meat product.  I was pretty disappointed with what I got - two eggs over easy, grits and cornbread.  The cornbread was the only good thing out of the three.  We also got the beignets - boring, the bakery I worked at in high school did better fried dough.  The service  was over attentive and some how totally in efficient.  Three servers came to take our drink order and yet one drink was forgotten.  Maybe it was an off day, but it this place seemed to be lacking in L-O-V-E.
author: Bryna M.

description:
or as my mother says "the place with the scooooonnness". Yes, she gets this dreamy (I refuse to use the term "orgasmic" and "my mother" in the same sentence) drawn out voice when talking about this place. I was looking for brunch places to take my folks on their recent visit, and this place is just down the road from me, and I thought, why not? The folks are always wanting to go to the "real San Francisco places" and it's hard not to get more real than the Dogpatch. So glad we did. We went around 9am during the week, so parking wasn't too bad - but I would guess that weekend brunch might be a parking headache. But we got seated right away and literally drooled for the next 15 minutes over the menu. My dad got the chorizo scramble, my mom got 2 eggs with apple turkey sausage and the (infamous, for my mom anyway) blueberry scone, and I got Greg's scramble with chorizo. The chorizo was on the mild side, but no complaints with the eggs - nice and fluffy. The Greg's scramble was a nice mixture of stuff along with the chorizo but I probably could have done without the parmesan on top. But that's probably my fault in thinking parmesan and chorizo would go well together. The place itself is nice and homey feeling, the coffee was excellent.

Oh, and the beignets.... well, let's just not get started on what they did to my mother. We'll save that for therapy.
author: Elena N.

description:
the wheat free pancakes are to die for....for someone with food allergies who NEVER gets to eat pancakes, i tip off my hat to you.
they are so GOOD
awesome !!!
author: alma h.
