description: I have never had Cajun food in my life and I woke up one morning craving it.  I went on yelp and found this place.  I am so happy I went there.  This place is very quaint and welcoming.  The staff is very friendly and the food was delicious. I especially liked their beignets. When they bring them to you they are hot, fluffy, and covered in powdered sugar.  Their crab po'boys were excellent; the crab was delicious.  I would definitely go back here, especially for breakfast.
author: CHERRYL H.

description: Service was good, but the beignets were just ok.
author: JJ S.

description:
i'm in love just for you.  *love* 

their menu is funny and sarcastic. there is a waitress who has the cutest, tiny olive oil voice ever. they serve beignet, grits, and have coffee set out for people waiting to get in...

it's cash only...if you forget, they'll send you next door to the convenience store that will give you cash like an atm.

just for you is just for me.
author: heather m.

description: I thought my food was good, but when I returned to my office I was not feeling so hot.  I had the special of the day, fresh sole, and it tasted good at the time.  I had terrible heartburn and then threw up my lunch at the office!  I will not return here though, because the owner was a nazi.  She was very cold and yelling at everyone; not the "just for you" environment I enjoy eating my lunch in.
author: Lulu B.

description: Yummy breakfasts!  I love their menu (make sure you budget time to read thru the irreverent comments like "Grits - just like you had in prison.").  Moist, FLUFFY pancakes, perfectly cooked eggs, and a range of sausages to accompany the perfect breakfast.
author: babsie g.

description: This is our FAVORITE Breakfast joint EVER!!!  The servers rule, and have given us the best recommendations ever!  The food is great and reasonable priced.  We never had a problem with waiting for a table or sitting at the counter, and really, it never seemed like anyone else waiting did either.  Our meal:  The Greg Scramble with Chirrizo and the huervos red sauce on the side.  Two coffees and two mimosas. The Apple Sausage RULES and the coffee is great!  Anytime anyone asks us where to get breakfast in the city...Just for You is the place we recommend.  We've not yet been here for dinner, but I'm sure its fabulous!  Also, the atmosphere is right up our alley.  I would LOVE to live in the Dogpatch and be one of those Just for You early morning regulars :D
author: Jessi K.

description:
Super Duper retro-kitschy place with fresh, well-prepared breakfasts and lunches. This place used to be so small when it was up on 18th Street that it only had one table... their location now in Dogpatch/Potrero is much better to handle the crowds. 

As dependent as I am on mine, I still appreciate the NO CELL PHONES policy posted in multiple places around the restaurant. Threats include throwing it in the soup and pouring coffee on it!!


Food? Thick cut bacon, buttermilk pancakes, good fast cup of coffee as soon as you sit down, and eggs done the way you ask. You can get grits "just like you had in prison", but make sure you get toast on one of their homemade breads. if you're there for lunch, burgers are great, the turkey sandwich is *real* fresh roasted turkey like you'd get the day after Thanksgiving (somewhere where the turkey is cooked right)
The shining star? The BLT. It is the BEST BLT I've ever had. There, I've said it.
author: Jackie C.

description:
Food and service continuing to slide

Service has always been pretty bad.  Food used to be pretty good (good enough that you put up with the service).  No longer...  

This morning was the last straw.  Bacon burned and stale.  Biscuits, despite being "homemade", were not fresh (seemingly microwaved).  Pancakes cold. Eggs overcooked.  Potatoes burned and pasty (i.e. old).  Toast nearly black.  Coffee bad.  They messed up our order.  

Then on top of it, one of the servers (older, matronly) was completely rude to us for no reason other than we couldn't make space quickly enough for her to put down two mugs of coffee (one we didn't order) and a soda.
author: Kate M.

description: I don't think its anything special. Its a little overpriced and the wait was pretty rediculous. Like a half an hour. Geez. Also, they didn't have gritz and I haven't had that for years, so apparently gritz are on low supply there.
author: Tiffany D.

description: This place is delicious!  I am a huge fan of the bennets.  Of course like any breakfast joint there is a wait but highly recommended
author: Jessica C.

description: I've been here twice and i don't think its amazing. It's convenient if you live around the area and has decent food. One thing I did like was the beignets. Everything else was just ok. I could probably make most of the food at home.
author: H. A.

description: This place served me some of the best food I've ever had. The beignets were amazing,delicious and cheap. There must be an entire box of powdered sugar on each plate of those things. The reuben was the best I've had in my life. The corned beef was very very fresh and amazingly cured. It had no fat on it and was the perfect size. Same goes for the BLT, perfect slices of bacon. I love the style of this place too
author: Max S.

description:
I guess two and a half stars is as close as we can get to "average" here on good ole Yelp.  I'm just sad that Just For You is "average" now.  Years ago, on Potrero Hill, it was exceptional.  I'm not sure what happened, but it's saddening.  You'll note from my other reviews that I very rarely write negative reviews, I am usually a "if you've got nothing good to say, say nothing at all" kind of girl.  But watching a SF institution slide is too painful...

OK.  Here we go.  The primary problem seems to be related to the microwave.  If we could steal the microwave, maybe we could bring Just For You back to life.  On my final visit, I ordered 4 things, hoping each time to find something I could eat.  Breakfast Burrito- rubbery, overcooked, dry eggs wrapped in a flour tortilla and microwaved into oblivion.  Only the green chile sauce made a bite go down.  Next, tried the biscuits and gravy.  As a southerner and lover of biscuits, I know that it is a capital offense to microwave a biscuit.. but there it went, into the microwave, and out it came like a molten rubber hockey puck.  Covered with gelatinous cold goo.  So, I tried a scone.  Sadly, microwaved until I could bend it in half without breaking it.  At this point, desperate, I went for beignets.  Finally!  Yummy beignets.  Fresh, soft, fluffy, good.  No microwave in sight for those, at least not this time.  Which is probably why they took 20 minutes, but so be it.  

That was it, the last visit to Just For You after 10 years of slow decline.  It's just such a shame that a cute place, with an interesting and funny menu, a SF standy has gone so low.  I am painfully aware that there are bad days in any restaurant, but when it gets to be bad years, at some point you just have to let go.  At least there will be one less person in line now, right?  *sigh*
author: Jennifer P.

description: Go for the beignets. They are spectacular. Chewy and hot on the inside with a slight crunch and sweet and gooey with powdered sugar on the outside. Yow. Worth the trip just for that. Rest of breakfast is pretty dull.
author: Liboo K.

description:
It's hard to pass up an authentic greasy diner when the craving strikes.
Young and old religously gather here every weekend for brunch. Although, they have no bloodymary's, they can cure your hangover with an oyster scramble. They also have fresh homemade bread (just like grams used to make). The waitresses are darling, fresh faced girls next door, with and edge. Love it!
author: magdalena w.

description: Great brunch place.  Beignets are especially delish.  As are the huevos rancheros.  Good service and some outdoor seating (especially nice in "sunny" Potrero Hill!)
author: Kristin P.

description: Quaint place for lunch and some good food.  I had the Catch of the Day, which was blackened catfish with string beans and a baked potato.  Wash it down with a soda and a beignet and I'm a happy camper.  Parking can be a little pain to find in this area.
author: Jeff H.

description:
cool out of the way place on a sunny but cold (my favorite) day.
but, i dont know what it is going to take for me to find home fries that are properly cooked. no matter where i go, they are either undercooked or over crunchy. potatoes are so prolific, you'd think someone would nail the home fry. but not yet. not yet.
p.s. i have noticed over the past year or two the service is much friendlier. but maybe im just past the initiation phase.
author: coffeecake j.

description:
The place is just "OK"

I've been there twice with friends and it really isn't that impressive. Decent breakfast menu.

In fact, I am always a little put-off by the signs that threaten to "break your cell phone" or whatever, if they hear it ringing. For what?! The place is cramped and loud anyway. Get over yourselves. It's fairly rude and obnoxious to post signs like that for your customers.

The two stars are just for the food.
author: D D.

description:
I held back writing this review because I really do like this place and the owners and staff are really nice...  I work in the Potrero Hill area and often call in take out orders from this place.  They must only cater to sit down patrons because every take out order I have gotten is horrible!!!  When you order take out, you trust that everything will be right and you don't need to check inside the bag for the necessary condiments and order specifics.  Moldy toast twice!!!, no cheese on eggs after paying extra for it, no butter in the bag for two huge pieces of toast, no syrup in the bag with pancakes, fries when I ordered salad,..  I mean,  who needs five thousand salt and pepper packets and a months supply of ketchup packets when all you ordered was french toast and fruit salad???  Anytime I mention the problem, the owner/manager is more than willing to comp my next meal but that's not the point.  A comp'd meal just doesn't suffice when you get back to your desk and open your food container with joy and anticipation to find that you have to eat bone dry toast with your sausage and fried egg breakfast when you really ordered bacon and scrambled cheese eggs...  Do you really want to pack your food back up, get back in the car and drive back just hear "oh, so sorry, let me comp that for you and have you wait another 10 minutes while we get your order right"....  Maybe I just have bad luck with this place but I really like the food, hopefully the management will read this and implement some sort of checklist for take out orders.  I keep giving them chances but each time I end up back at my office dissapointed, again...  Hopefully this review will hit Just For You where it hurts, (in the pocket) and maybe they will start to be more cogniscent of the lackluster  take out service they provide...  As far as I am concerned, I would rather drive a little bit further to get a complete meal rather than be dissapointed again...

P.S.  I called the owner and asked her to read this review, maybe I will give them one more chance to get it right before they are banned from my weekly breakfast roster.
author: Sean W.

description: Standby breakfast joint within walking distance. Food is good, filling and consistent. Coffee is just this close to my favourite. Waitstaff always top notch with a good attitude ready to re-fill the joe. NO CELLPHONES ALLOWED. Yet grumpy owner marches around talking on her cordless land line phone. Huh? If you haven't tried grits before take the plunge here. They are really good and good for you(mix a little jam or syrup in them). Look on the back of your receipt at the 16th ST. Safeway for a Just for You half off (order 2 entrees and the cheaper one is half price) coupon. That makes the total bill a little more reasonable.  There is a lengthy wait on weekends after 10am. Minus one star for owner rating herself.
author: alistair g.

description: Very cute place with tasty food at  reasonable prices! I came here for the first time today and loved the vibe upon walking in. Very casual and greasy spoon-like, something I'd imagine to walk into in the south or midwest or somewhere other than California. I just ordered the two eggs with toast and fruit and it was delicious! I don't know how my scrambled eggs don't taste as good as theirs but they just don't. I will be back for sure and can't wait to explore some of the hardier menut items. Note - they only take cash so be sure you have some!
author: Lindsay A.

description: So delish- been here a few times and it's always good. I'm reading the reviews and my mouth is watering in fond remembrance! And they've got sweetest waitstaff EVER...that's it, I'm going TOMORROW!
author: Leslie C.

description: Was working on 3rd and went in for lunch and was very pleased with the whole experience. Service was good in a laid back way, food was fresh and home made. I will be back.
author: Matthew K.

description:
a po' boy is a messy affair and so, it goes without saying that any sandwich that calls itself a po' boy is going to contain a robust amount of grease.

just for you's shrimp po boy manages to safeguard the splendid extravagance of an authentic po' boy while restraining the amount of oils and fats - it feels less greasy but no less tasty.

their cajun-battered, breaded shrimp are grilled to zesty perfection, providing just the right amount of crunch, offering themselves on a blade of romaine lettuce that is squeezed inside of a toasted louisiana baguette, garnished with garlic mayonaisse, lemon, beefsteak tomatoes, and homemade pickles. it is nothing less than exquisite.

i'm astonished that the restaurant's other guests order anything else but with san francisco being a city that prides itself in its diversity - which is gamely reflected in the faces of the restaurant's clientele - it should then come as little shock that there is a favourite dish to appeal to each guest.

i know why i'll be back.
author: christian svanes k.

description: Love this place. Was one of the first customers when they were on Potrero Hill and continue to be a customer at their location in the Dogpatch. Great breakfasts, great homemade bread. Generous servings and the owner who is from Louisiana serves up some great Cajun style cooking. Love the Greg's Scramble which has been on the menu since day one. Lunch is good as well. Anyone living in the Potrero/Dogpatch  consider yourselves lucky to have Just For You in your neighborhood. Great food.
author: Phil K.

description: I went fairly late for brunch on a weekend, and thankfully there was no wait. Parking was a breeze. The ambiance, while homey, felt more run down and thrown together than cute. The service was fantastic, but  there were only a few other tables at the time. I was not that impressed with the omelet I had. I will try them again for the beignets. Also, this is the only brunch place in SF that I've found that has Hangtown Fry on the menu! That's the one thing I'll concede about Just For You, the menu is pretty extensive for breakfast.
author: kathy c.

description: Start with the beignets, then have breakfast. I had the crab cake benedict, which didn't seem to have enough crab taste. Get one of the egg combos with the cornbread. The grits are good here. Serious kinda place, so no foolin' around. Besides, the people watching you will make you feel guilty if you do anything other than ...order, eat, & leave. Usually a line, so have patience Grasshopper.
author: Arlene C.

description: Busy, busy place! Extremely nice waitresses. Loved it. I tried the Greg Scramble with chicken apple sausage with home fries and biscuit. Loved the home fries, crispy, just like how I like them. Biscuit was yummy with butter, and lots of it. Scramble was good also. Lots of sausage. A little expensive for a small glass of OJ though.. ($3.50) Well at least for me it was. Definitely will be back!!
author: Juliane N.

description:
I've been to a couple of the breakfast joints in San Francisco (Mama's, Dottie's and Crepevine) and now Just For You Cafe.  To be honest with you, I didn't give a damn about the name Just for you cafe in the beginning.  I was looking forward to all the great reviews that I read on Yelp.  So I trusted the fellow yelpers!

There was no line when I entered.  You seat yourself.  I sat down and soaked in the atmosphere.  It does remind me of Haight Ashbury, but it doesn't have a warm feeling to it.  This place is a locals joint
.  
I ordered an omelette with homemade wheat toast and I chose to get the fruit instead of the home fries.  I also ordered their homemade sausage.  I received my order within 15 minutes.  Still, I didn't get a good feeling like I was going to enjoy my meal.  I didn't receive my order of the sausage and just waited it out hoping that it would come.  By that time, I had finished my meal and reminded the waiters who looked like they were trying to avoid me for 10 minutes that I didn't get my extra side.  They asked me if I wanted it.  By that time, I was full and I didn't want to stay any longer.  So I paid and was comped my drink.  I respect that and I paid and left.  I left the place feeling like it "JUST WASN'T FOR ME".
author: Walter C.

description: Eggs and grits and grits and eggs, and beignets.   Two-for-one breakfast coupons in the Guardian and Weekly, too.  Miss it at the top of Potrero Hill, but Dogpatch is close enough.
author: Laurel B.

description: Their BIG SALAD is the REAL DEAL!!!  Actually, I think its called their "Garden Fresh Salad" but I imagine that if Elaine from Seinfeld was crazy about some "Big Salad" she once had, this is the one she was talking about.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
This place is wonderful.. 

The beignets are better then Elite Cafe (By a long shot)
The Biscuits are real.
The Coffee has Chicory 

This place is the real thing, good n'olins style food, good price. You have to try this place out. 

Seriously.. Go.. Really.. Its all that.
author: Mark C.

description: If breakfast food is what you fancy, even at 1 pm in the afternoon, then Just for You is definitely a place you should check out. Eating there is like having a home-cooked meal, but not at home. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere cozy and eclectic. As for the food, practically everything is made fresh; from the bread they bake everyday to the freshly squeezed grapefruit juice. Seeking something sweet, try their beignets perfectly crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside, dusted with powdered sugar. Try any one of their daily specials or stick to your breakfast favorites of eggs, choice meats and fresh home fries potatoes. Seeking the healthy stuff, get a big helping of yogurt, granola and fruit for all for about ten dollars. They also have lunch items, and up until about a month ago are now open for dinner. So check these guys out, you will not be sorry!
author: Cynthia G.

description:
i wish there were more breakfast places like this in la.  this place was splendid!  very cozy and hip without trying too hard.

i had a tough choice because for the first time (in a long time) there were so many more choices for vegetarians!  i ended up getting the "frittata of the decade" with home fries and a biscuit.  the frittata was fluffy.  i was surprised being that there was sauteed veggies (zucchini, onions, tomatoes, spinach, mushrooms) inside.  home fries were perfect!  the biscuit was great- plentiful too!

in addition to the frittata, i ordered a side of beignets.  i personally am not a fan of doughnuts, but this really did some justice.  crisp on the outside, pillowy fluffy goodness on the inside.  not to mention it's covered with powdered sugar.  yummmmmy!

my cousin had ordered the cow girl (2 eggs, 2 bacon/sausage, and 2 pancakes).  you have a choice between buttermilk or buckwheat pancakes.  she chose the buckwheat.  i've sampled some nasty cardboard tasting buck wheat pancakes before so i was a but hesitant to try hers.  dude.  let me say that this is far from cardboard and probably the first time i've seen buck wheat pancakes look (and taste) light and fluffy.

this is definitely a go to place for me now when i'm up here in the bay.  if only my stomach was bigger i would of ordered and eaten more!
author: ann.ie k.

description: Just For You is a gem - they knock out a solid breakfast menu (at very reasonable prices). There's almost always a wait, but it's worth it. Be sure to try the beignets (I like them with a little maple syrup - DEEEEElicious). The oatmeal pancakes are also surprisingly tasty (and don't feel as evil as the buttermilk). We've experienced some spotty service and climate control issues a few times (otherwise 5 stars) - overall a fabulous find.
author: rachel m.

description:
restaurant 1 of 50

this is a funky place to get breakfast with quirky signage and a lot of good stuff on the menu.  it's a bit out there, but close to muni.  there was a lot of people shuffling around outside, so i expected a crazy wait, but it actually wasn't too bad.  biscuits and gravy were BOMB!  the green chili sauce... not so bomb... in fact, kinda gross actually.  why was it sweet?!

at the end of the meal, we ordered the beignets.  they looked and smelled so good... but when i tasted them, they kinda tasted a little odd.  like they had some kind of weird alcohol flavoring?  maybe we just got a bad batch.

i def wanna go back again and try some of the other stuff they serve.
author: vlad k.

description: I followed them from the top of Potrero Hill to Dogpatch and I would go even farther for the beignets, pancakes and egg dishes. So here is the running arguement with my breakfast companion, am I any less masculine because I order the Cowgirl?
author: Seamus M.

description: 4.5 stars.  i have to give them extra 0.5 star because its' so nice of them providing coffees for people wait for tables. We had Beignets, Eggs Beneficts and Chorizo con huevos, and they were all very good!  It was a great meal to start the weekend!
author: Sophia L.

description: 3 stars because all of the food here is just okay EXCEPT the beignets. the beignets are outstanding! little pillows of perfectly sweet air. best beignets i've had to date!
author: Regina C.

description: The wait here is ridiculous but the food is well worth it if you're not in a hurry. The beignets are the best I've had. Hangtown fry is awesome. The sausages are awesome too. 5 stars if it weren't for the hour long wait. Also, I'm not feeling the coffee a this place. Chicory? Tastes like RAID to me. Aside from that though this is a good place to get your morning grub on.
author: Brian H.

description: This is a good spot!  I love the 'hood, not many people know the joys of Dogpatch and that's the way I like it.  If you want breakfast on the weekend be prepared to wait in line, but it's pretty easy to get into on the weekdays.  The food is good, good ole home cooked food but not good ole home prices; be prepared to spend a chunk of change.  Get the benets and stay away from the dry cornbread.  Mmmm cornbread, there is nothing wrong with cornbread, unless of course it is dry.
author: Michael M.

description:
why 5 stars you say? well let me count the ways.  this was a perfect brunch location for j and i meeting in the city to dish.

1-very accessible location and even street parking.  enough said.
2-very cute atmosphere.
3-bitterness and sarcastic menu.  this wins 2 stars right there.  they are sassy and i like it.
4-lots and lots of comfort food including beignets.  which were out of this world.
5-amidst all the egg and meat drenched omelettes which do sound good if i did partake in all that, they have one completely VEGAN dish!  and its amazingly amazing.  tofu and stir-fried veggies, broccoli, onions, mushrooms.  

yes there was definitely food coma for quite some time that day.
author: Kat R.

description: I'm a longtime fan of this legendary snack shack. I love the no-nonsense attitude, the hilarious menu, and the flaming hot huevos rancheros with green chile sauce. Whenever a friend visits from out of town, they want to eat here. XOXOX!!!!!
author: Jaina D.

description: An excellent breakfast/lunch spot with a broad menu that's sure to satisfy. There'll be a modest wait before you can get a seat but go with a good friend and the time will fly by. Breakfast started off on a high note as we dove right into the beignets... warm, sugary and a little doughy in the middle. mmm. I also ordered the Frittata of The Decade... who could resist with a name like that? It's not your typical frittata (a little more like a scramble) but it tasted great so it made no difference to my mouth. Along with home fries cooked to a crisp (just the way I like) and a serving of your choice of toast, this meal will fill you up right at a good price. I'll definitely be back... hopefully many more times.
author: James C.

description:
just for you is an awesome awesome place for brunch.  i've only ever had typical brekkie/brunchy stuff here and they know how to do it up right.  they're beignets are pretty good (i didn't think cafe du monde was all that anyway!) but they're egg dishes are solid, cornmeal and oatmeal pancakes are SO damn tasty (sorta crunchy on the outside but light and fluffy on the inside), i love their sausages, fruit bowls are always fresh, and their home fries are some of the best i've had in the city (lots of SF places don't seem to fully grasp the concept of homefries).  the menu's pretty extensive (they've even got grits- YUM!!!!!), but surprisingly everything we've tried has been really good as opposed to some of those places that offer way too much but does it all half-assed.  

it gets crowded but if you go a little after prime brunch time, there's usually a table avbl (the ones outside aren't bad on a sunny dogpatch day) and i particularly like sitting at the counter, ol' skool.
service is remarkably efficient considering how busy this place gets.
author: Bird B.

description:
Oh "Just For You" how I wish you were just for me only. Yummy, delectable breakfast food - just for me!

The waiters are always prompt and friendly.
The prices are beyond reasonable.
Greg's scramble with chorizo, spinach and (i think) parmesan cheese is my all time favorite. 

I'm so lucky to have you "Just For You." 

If only there wasn't always a wait weekend mornings... it moves pretty fast though.
author: A K.

description:
Gruyere? wildflower honey? aioli? arugula??...no presense on an SF brunch menu??? With so many brunch places in the city, I wondered how this diner was surviving. 

Driving up to the eatery, my first impression was that this place was a hipster hangout. A line of "just rolled out of bed, i don't give a shit but I somewhat do with these Ray Bans, skinnys and flannel scarf" patrons were waiting in line to get their breakfast on. Stepping into the diner however, I noticed how the cozy tones and funky posters combined with the aromas of powdered sugar and cinnamon made this spot instantaneously amicable. I ordered a Beignet to share with a friend. It was huge, warm, fluffy and extremely delicious. I could of eaten two of these, drank my coffee and been in state of complete bliss. I did however, want to try more items. I went with a grilled catfish fillet, scrambled eggs, grits and cornbread combo. Talk about a lot of food!  I liked that the catfish was prepared grilled instead of fried. My love hate relationship with carbs also fully appreciated and then fretted over the extensive bread options (cornbread, cinnamon raisin, scone, english muffin, toast, wheat) and choice of grits or homefries (I chose grits). The bread here is homemade. The quality of the classic diner fare was not sacrificed with quantity. Prices are also very reasonable with most menu items under $10. This place beats Serpentine (aka what's up with the communal table between two restrooms) across the street in my book. 

One or two cons about this place: Coffee contributes extensively to my ability to enjoy breakfast. I wish they served better coffee here. Also, this place takes only cash or check. A friend was visiting me from NYC....you can figure out the rest. Anyway, these aren't reasons enough to deter continuous visits. I'll be back for the creole crab cakes, the bread and the beignets. Loving it.
author: Annie Y.

description:
The best place in the city to have breakfast. The staff is really nice. The food is awesome. The only problem I have is that I like everything on the menu, so it takes me a few frustrated minutes to decide what to eat.

I suggest the oatmeal pancakes or the juevos rancheros.
author: Krunal P.

description: This place is just what you want for a sunday brunch. Reliable tasty breakfast foods, generous portions, plentiful ordering options. Plus, I don't even like sweets normally but I nearly ate a whole beignet on top of my full meal. I should mention that our wait was inordinately brief, despite arriving at primetime on a gorgeous sunday. That probably influenced our experience--heck, the food may not have been all that great after all, but when you're hungry and bucking up for an hour long wait, then almost too suddenly find yourself presented with lots of food.... You get the idea!
author: L H.

description:
Has anyone else been shorted in change or been overcharged here? Just wondering. It's happened to me a couple of times, making me wonder.... Anyway, the food is good. The owner is obviously southern and knows what she's doing. I don't EVER go on the weekends because I'm not willing to wait. They are open early mornings during the week, and it is a nice place to stop on the way to work. Mostly just neighborhood people. 

I would give it four stars, but I have to give it three because of the money thing and because the owner's bully attitude does not charm me. I know some people think it's cute or are too afraid to not pretend it's cute, but I'm over it. Still, the food brings me back.
author: Anna F.

description: Nice breakfast spot.  The begniets are delicious and its not ridiculously busy, even on the weekends.  (Well, for San Fran anyhow.) My only downer was that the $4.50 oj was not fresh squeezed as stated on the menu.  It was Odwalla or something.  But my fruit and yogurt and granola bowl was awesome and full of fresh cut fruit and berries - not the filler type of fruits either.  The waitstaff seems friendly, and we got a table much quicker than we expected.  Good place.  Good value.  Good food.
author: Brent F.

description: This place made it to my lists of favorite breakfast spots!! The food was delicious!! I loved the extensive menu!! So much to chose from! The beignets are a must!!! They are huge, fluffy, crispy and piping hot! So good! I could eat an whole order by myself! I had the fried egg sandwich on home made bread with home fries. Although they forgot the cheese, it was still delicious. My bf had the sweet scramble. It came with veggies, sausage and roasted red peppers that gave it a sweet kick. Anothr delicious dish.! I highly recommend this place for breakfast lovers... only recommendation.. get the beignets and one other entree.. the portions are huge!!! And either go super early or late to avoid lines..
author: Denise L.

description: I've been here a few times with a friend who's really familiar with the area and haven't been disappointed yet. their 'frittata of the decade' is a scrumptious pan-fried veggie omelette that has garlic, spinach, onions, mushrooms, zucchini, tomato & topped with cheddar cheese. the accompanying home fries are just right. was a bit surprised to see Filipino sausage, longanisa, on the menu. my buddy seemed to enjoy his huevos rancheros. it's a small, homey brunch spot that tends to get crowded during mid-afternoon.
author: Chris C.

description: My husband and I stopped for breakfast here, on New Year's Eve. We knew service would be slow since it was a holiday and there was a line of people waiting to be seated. Nonetheless, we decided to sit outside where we wouldn't have to wait for a table. We sat got the menus but once we wanted to order our food and our drinks, the server who seemed to have completely forgotten about us took about 25 min or more to actually come outside. Once we actually ordered it took about another 20 min to get our drinks only, mind you I had a hot chocolate and my husband the house coffee. The hot chocolate came from a package with water pretty disgusting and well the coffee was cold. I ordered the beignets and the soup of the day which was potato leek the beignets where perfect and so was the soup. Everything went down hill from there. The food was over priced for what we got my eggs where soggy and tasteless and burned in some parts and home fries where over seasoned and some where undercooked. The corn bread was dry. It's a sure bet we won't be coming back here again.
author: Melissa H.

description: Charming menu, cool, friendly staff, and delicious food. Went for breakfast, decided on the chili scarmble with cornbread and grits - and it exceeded expectations. 'Just For You' filled me up, cheered me up and sent me on my way.
author: Sarah M.

description: I got the Greek scramble, homefries, and toast. The potatoes were excellent -- nice and crisp on the outside, soft on the inside.  The scramble was very flavorful, perhaps a bit too heavy on the olives.  They are strong olives.  Each ingredient spoke loudly, a testament to the quality.  The toast was ok; I should have stuck with white.  The wheat was too hearty to make for good toast.  The bucket of butter packets on the table helped out.
author: Joe H.

description: Since much has been said about the breakfasts, thought I'd put in a good word for the lunch fare.  Sandwiches come on a choice of bread & I recommend the homemade: fresh & tasty always.  Real turkey on the turkey sandwich.  Great fresh-tasting hamburgers.  Po'boys to die for.  AND THE SOUPS!  Some of the best homemade soups in town.  And a side salad isn't just a pile of boring greens, there are other veggies mixed in.  Go on a weekday afternoon when it's slow and have a gabfest with the hilarious owner.
author: Michelle C.

description: The beignets are the main reason why I come to this place.  The rest of the food is good and fresh, but I wouldn't come here if it weren't for those deep fried crispy chewy suckers covered in powdered sugar.  Mmm so good.  There is always a huge crowd, but I've never had to wait more than 15 minutes for a party of two.  Their turnaround is fast.
author: Michelle M.

description: Other than having to wait in line every single time we've been to Just For You, it is HANDS DOWN one of the best breakfast spots in the city, although also probably one of the smallest.  The portions are more than enough and always come out fresh and tasty.  Coffee is dark and steamy and staff are friendly.  Definitely a favorite in the cozy Potrero Hill/Dog Patch neighborhood.
author: Redloci R.

description:
Get here early but the wait is worth it. Nothing fancy except the great food and friendly service.
Regardless of which fad diet you are on or which triathlon you are training for, the beignets are a must.
I wish it were a little closer to me so I could walk there and is the only reason I don't go more often.
author: Faisal M.

description: Yummy, yummy, yummy!  Superb Oatmeal Pancakes, love em love em.  Greg's Scramble is pretty good too and the Beignets are pretty awesome.  Real great comfort food Southern Style!
author: Karin A.

description: Cute atmosphere, food looked good we just had drinks and beignets. Weird neighborhood.
author: Danielle E.

description:
buckwheat pancakes. yummy bacon. pint of mimosa. no wait. window seat. attractive company.

yeah... pick any three and this place is still amazing =). Friendly folks, good food, not super expensive and really really good.

Beware card friends: Its cash only.
author: Lacey W.

description: This place is cute but what's not so cute is biting into egg shells.  My friend and I both ordered scrambled eggs and we both had eggshells in our eggs.  Everything else was great...nice wait staff and a pretty big menu.
author: Joni S.

description: My girlfriend and I have two places that come into mind every time we want to eat-and Mabel's is one of them. The food is comfort at best, with a distinctive twist to southern and California basics. If you're familiar with beignets, then these are the only items on the menu to avoid. Otherwise, feast yourself on oyster po-boys (my lady's fav), lovely breakfast dishes, and an always-on-the-mark atmosphere and service (not too friendly, not too lame). Good stuff happening out there in the burgeoning dogpatch.
author: Libby T.

description: Two reasons this place gets four stars from me - amazing beignets and can it be true? REAL New Mexico green chile! If they served cream with their coffee instead of milk, I'd probably give 'em five stars.
author: N J.

description:
love it.

the chili scramble hits the spot like you just wouldn't believe.
the ambiance is terrific.
the beignets are mandatory (enjoy them with a mug of hot cocoa).
they have raisin toast.
author: jennifer y.

description: Pretty yum, I'd say. The beignets may well be a skosh better than the ones at - dare I say it - Cafe du Monde!  I had a scramble which was really good, and the grits were divine.
author: Elaine U.

description: Inevitably every time I get talked in to going here I end up waiting outside just long enough for my boyfriend to remember that you can get a "99 cent out the door" malt beverage at the store next door, consume it on an empty weekend morning stomach, and to be drunk as we get seated.  This ends up in him ordering every single item that looks good to him on the menu.  The upside is that everything is pretty good, and the bill never gets that high.  The benieghs (however that's spelled) are worth ordering.  The mimosas are delish and come in pint glasses (so I can catch up with the bf).  They carry chicken and turkey sausage (an veggie too I think) which is nice since I like savory breakfasts and I don't eat pork.  Street parking is free and usually pretty reasonable.
author: Dina A.

description:
great homemade bread, great stools at the bar, awesome mimosas...
great homemade hot sauce.. good quality products.

love the old fashion travel posters from travel agencies on the wall

for two we spent 40 bucks.. not something love to do often, but a nice treat, nice friendly service too.

we took a walk around the industrial area after breakfast.. good times
author: Jippers C.

description: I was looking for a good breakfast place and I found so much more.  I got the Greg Scramble with bacon and it was so delicious I am still thinking about it.  This place has become my new breakfast place and I do not even live that close.  The other + is that they serve pint glass Mimosa's for only 8 bucks and the grapefruit mimosa is also good.  The server was great too because I asked him for his opinion and he gave me an honest answer instead of the "Everything is good" answer which drives me nuts because thats not always true.  The food came out fast the servers were great and everything was great.  I am so glad I tried this place on a whim.  I was a first time customer and now a life long one.
author: Lynn Y.

description: There's a reason why this place consistently receives 4 stars. IT'S THE BEST Breakfast restaurant in SF. The only reason I didn't give it 5...it's tiny location. The beignets are better than the one's at Cafe Du Monde in New Orleans. I haven't had one meal I haven't enjoyed. They are consistent, portions are plenty, their service is respectful, and breakfast is served all day! I haven't tried anything other than the breakfast items so I can't speak for the rest of the menu. This is a must if you have visitors. Arrive early on weekends, b4 9am. We're going here before heading over to see Wicked at the Orpheum for breakfast at dinner time! Perfect evening!!!
author: Lissette I.

description: The beignets are great, but as a vegetarian, the bkfast options are kinda weak.  The place is pleasant enough, but that tofu dish is lame.
author: Lesley G.

description:
pretty damn awesome... everything is homemade - including their bread.... i like "greg's scramble"... yummmmm. also, their wheat free oatmeal pancakes ROCK

be prepared to wait in line, but its worth it for sure....oh, and bring cash because its cash only... if you forget, there is a liquor store next door with an atm...
author: Kate G.

description: The signature beignets are awesome.  Otherwise the standard good, consistent brunch food.  Perfect for my local brunch place, but sometimes I cook better at home.  Cash only, and often a long wait.
author: Janet S.

description: I had a delicious Creole crab cake sandwich here for lunch today and the owner and staff were amazingly helpful! I was looking for a hair salon in the neighborhood and everyone gave suggestions. The owner Arienne actually make a handful of phone calls for me trying to locate one. She ended up finding a very nice place I have an appointment with tomorrow. =)
author: Grant E.

description: Great breakfast and lunch spot in the Dogpatch.  Not a secret any more, but still worth a trip over for the beignets and great big plates of eggs and other breakfast delights.  http://www.justforyoucafe.com/
author: D.C. C.

description: Bring a jacket, reading material, and perhaps a snack for your long wait for a table (hot coffee is complimentary). The beignets rock.
author: Keith R.

description: Yes, it's a trek for me to make it all the way out to the Dogpatch, but I don't care.. I love the food and the folks at Just For You..    The specials are usually varied enough and tasty -- and if you're in the mood for something special, I recommend the beignets..  Fluffy pillows of new orleans donuty goodness..  So good!  Besides, there's always easy parking in the hood.
author: Dennis Y.

description: It's probably 3 stars for me but the prices bump it up to 4 stars.  I think reading all the Yelp reviews totally overhyped this place for me.  It was just a tiny bit better than alright.  The beignets weren't totally cooked through and a little too gigantic for my taste, best ones I've had so far in SF have to be Universal Cafe.  The scramble was pretty good and the potatoes were okay, some big chunks were still kind of hard.  I didn't get to try the wine or champagne but for $4 I should have.
author: Jen C.

description:
Oh man. I hate telling people how great this place is because the line can be bad enough as it is. Sigh.

It's awesome! I've been going here since it was a dinky little rat hole on Potrero Hill! (No, no, no rats. But it was a hole.)

The beignets are amazing unless you're one of the Olsen twins and the only meat on your bones is on your fucking ass.  Otherwise, suck in the calories, baby. It's worth it.

P.s. They serve grits. "Just like you got in prison," they brag. I shit you not.
author: Tracy Y.

description: Two stars for friendly service, but food was so overrated.  Toast was cold and hard and eggs were painfully average.
author: Rupa P.

description: After doing some research I decided to hit "Just 4 U" for a weekend breakfast.  I was pleasantly surprised as the wait was much shorter than expected.  Once seated.. I was charged up and ready to take down molto coffee, beignets and a Greg's "who no longer works there any more" scramble with Chirozo.  BRING IT ON Just 4 U.. I'm hungry.  Anyway.. I digress.  Scramble was yummy and fresh as was the coffee and OJ.  Problem with the story gets back to the service.. Homeboy forgot the beignets.. so you lose a star.. sorry kids.. maybe next time.
author: Tom C.

description: I miss the Just For You, that was in the (now ) Chez Mama location! The only place that made a hamburger like my mom, huge patty on sliced bread. hee hee
author: Helen J.

description: Went here for brunch last week, they claim to be Louisiana style place, which it was. There was a wait but they keep a thermos of coffee outside, which I think is very thoughtful. I had the crab benny which was pretty good, the eggs were poached just right and hollandaise was good, but the crab cakes tasted more like stuffing than crab, my friend had the scramble with chorizo which she raved about, portions were huge, and prices pretty good, I think it was under 20 for the two of us.
author: JIll H.

description: I love this place.  I want to marry it.  The beignets are awesome - always made to order and piping hot.  I always get the hangtown fry (scrambled eggs, bacon, oysters and onions).  Pure perfection.  Service is really good too.
author: David H.

description: Really nice breakfast place, new interesting takes on some classics. Defiantly check it out!
author: Evan S.

description: I've given this place 4 or 5 tries since I live nearby and I'm always disappointed with the food.  I think they're trying to go for a Southern theme but their breakfast burritos, huevos rancheros and biscuits and gravy were all mediocre (the sausage in the gravy was very grisly).  I tried it again this morning with just some regular eggs and bacon but I can make it better at home and the homemade wheat bread reminds me of the crappy bread that you get at whole foods.  It's hard for me to believe that this place gets the same star ratings as plow (which is just a few blocks away).
author: jean m.

description: Benigets!  Better than Cafe Du Monde. Their corn beef has is alright.. not as good as Kate's Kitchen but overall a good rendition.
author: Susan K.

description: Part of my southern heritage is BISCUITS AND GRAVY. I am very critical of any attempt at the southern dish- and Just for you won my heart with their recipe. Some say there is swiss cheese in the gravy? The service is great, the food is fast. Overall great and low key.
author: Lindsey S.

description: Great food.  One of the few places in the area that has real food.  Seems homecooked.  Everyting I tried was great.
author: Alan R.

description: One of the best breakfast spots in the Bay Area! The beingnets were a delightful surprise, as were the fabulous omlets, eggs benidict etc. Go early on the weekeds to avoid a long wait as this is a popular place to go.
author: Jade S.

description: This is a big time "jackpot party"!!  One of my favorite breakfast spots and it's in my hood.  I always order Greg's Scramble with the longanisa. A Filipino breakfast sausage that kicks ass!  The combo of the parmesan cheese, spinach, sausage and eggs is crazy good.  My girl always gets the home made corned beef hash...only on the weekends and it runs out fast.  The place has a lot of character as well, friendly service and free coffee for your patience waiting for a table.
author: Ramon L.

description: Best beignets I've had since Cafe Du Monde in New Orleans. Near perfection in a beignet and I have tried about 10 other places that have tried and haven't come close. The rest of the breakfast was just average for me. So eggs, potatoes and biscuit get three stars and beignet gets five stars, which makes this a four star for me.
author: Emily O.

description: decent food, a great place to try for you carnivores if you wanted to try something new.
author: Kat C.

description:
I like it. Wife likes it. We like it. Sat at the breakfast bar after waiting about 15 minutes on a Saturday morning. 

Great food and good portions. Could probably have just ordered one breakfast and a side to split. EXCELLENT beignet. Best I've ever had. And probably the best drip cup of coffee I've ever had. And quick refills. I like it.
author: Gym W.

description: There's no better place in San Francisco to savor the flavor of New Orleans than by nursing authentic southern-style chicory coffee in your cup.  If you've not been lucky enough to have spent a spell in "The Big Easy" then perhaps the dark roasted coffee & chicory blend may come as a bit of a shock to the Nola Virgin palate.  First the earthy, sweet aroma pulls you in like a whispered "voulez-vous coucher avec moi," then failing to resist temptation you find yourself with a warm mouthful of full-bodied black magic that goes down with a tang of acidity.  This beguiling coffee's finish has a hefty hit of bitterness reminiscent of a long lost love that left you wanting more, more, more . . .  Good thing somebody'll be round pretty darn quick to fill 'er back up again - so go ahead, indulge yourself as eagerly as good manners will allow!
author: RichiePoo B.

description: Ever since the Crescent City Cafe closed years ago, this has been my go-to spot for yummy Cajun brunch. I even moved in down the block to be close by! (okay, not *totally* true). The specials are great, the beignets, crabcakes and other "Leeziana" delicacies make me smile. Yum!
author: Andrew S.

description: there is nothing better than a blt or burger in this joint... fast flair, new Orleans style all round. maybe someone sometime had something not so hot... but dont let that change or sway you away... there is nothing i mean nothing that isn't great! Also walking distance from my pad. Im in love...
author: Rachel L.

description: Pretty awesome kitschy brunch place in an unlikely neighborhood.  They served up great food for a very hungry crowd.  I only take a star off because the highly lauded beignets weren't as fantastic as I expected and the service was pretty unattentive.  But eggs, bacon, potatoes, OJ were deliciousness!
author: Elena S.

description: House specialty scramble -  Hangtown Fry: fried oysters, slices of bacon, onion, and scrambled egg.  Yummy washed down with freshly squeezed o.j. and guaranteed to cure *any* hangover. It's been put to the test many a time and has consistently passed with flying colors. :-) And the beignets are heavenly....
author: Suepattra M.

description: This restaurant was the victim of my Sunday Fun Day. I had a delightful little meal here. The food was delicious. I started out with some beignets, which were amazing! The biggest things I have ever seen drowning in powdered sugar. I also dabbled in the crab cake Benedict (perfectly cooked crab and egg) and the amazing, creamy biscuits and gravy. The portions were huge (I was able to pass along my little heaven to my hung over friend who spent breakfast sleeping in my car). Did I mention the erroneous selection of condiments, I am talking in the upper teens...a little delight for everyone. Also a plus is the mimosa served in a pint glass- much classier than the often too small $8 mimosa served in a champagne flute.
author: Alicia J.

description: First off, the beignets were SO good!!!! Now when we got there, there was a wait, no biggie! We finally get seated after sipping on some Blue Bottle Coffee from across the street & we order. Now, the food was pretty darn good & again those beignets were SO good & HUGE!!! My ONLY REAL disappointment were the grits; after putting butter in them & the BF putting crumbled blue cheese in his, we could not get ANY flavor out of them at all!!! They tasted like watered down Malt O' Meal crap (for some good grits hit up Brenda's on Polk & Eddy) & we just let them be! However everything else was SO could! They Chili Cheese Scramble on the VERY tasty corn bread was AWESOME!!!
author: Rob L.

description: All hail the beignets! Soft, piping hot homemade delectable donuts dusted with powdered sugar. I think I have died and gone to heaven -- and that's just for starters. Just For You makes their own homemade sausage and their breakfast omelets are out of this world. But by far my favorite thing to order is the Crabby Benny -- crab eggs benedict on top of toast. There's usually a short wait for a table, but don't despair -- they've got self-serve coffee out on the sidewalk. Just For You is absolutely my favorite place for brunch.
author: Katie B.

description: The place to go for cajun crab cakes with your sweet pea and pumkin pie. Super breakfast, super casual, super busy, super parking and best of all, super prices.
author: Michelle S.

description:
perhaps i mis-ordered.  i am usually a fan of mexican-style breakfasts.  huevos rancheros call out to me from menus far and wide.  chilaquiles might well be my choice for Last Meal on Earth.  if it involves cheese and salsa, i am usually a happy camper.  

so, after a substantial wait (they do provide an outside coffee cart to help you through), i felt that going with something i was sure to like was my best bet.  unfortunately, the huevos rancheros left something to be desired.  without going into too much detail, there was WAY too much liquid on my plate.  we're not talking "sauce."  the tortillas were floating on a pool of liquid from the beans and water from the salsa.  it was not pretty.  it was relatively tasty, but my experience had already been compromised.  the home potatoes were also nothing special.  my breakfasting companion had the Frittata of the Decade: worth ordering for the name alone.  he seemed satisfied with it.  

i like the location, as it's tucked away in a relatively industrial area but has a quiant neighborhood feel.  the service was good after the wait was over.  
 
if you're in this neighborhood and willing to wait for a solid but not extraordinary breakfast, then by all means, hit Just for You.
author: Kirsten F.

description: High ratings just for having very fresh beignets.  Seriously.  Their breakfast was very delicious too.  Been there twice will return without hesitation and when I have a ride.
author: Adrian N.

description: Great local brunch place in the Dogpatch. The breakfast burrito is huge and really good.
author: Tiffanie S.

description: Pretty good stuff. Only 2 outside tables but the inside atmosphere is comfortable and inviting. Order the huge beniets!
author: Walker C.

description: I'm giving just for you cafe 4 stars because its my breakfast joint.  The food is decent but the beignets push it over the top.  There's typically a wait on the weekend so put your name on the list and grab a coffee from across the street.
author: Clayton K.

description: I hate waiting in line for brunch places, which is like ... everywhere in San Francisco.  That being said, this was worth the wait.  Here's the skinny.  They serve complimentary coffee outside while you wait.  (But you can also head across the street to Piccino's for the good stuff.)  Their plates are gigantic.  Their beignets are awesome.  They serve Filipino longanisa, which is slightly less greasy than my mom cooks them, but still good with half the fat.  Their counters - though adds some character to the place, a challenge to sit at for the vertically challenged.  Their service is about as friendly as you can get for being hurried.  Which is by the way, a good thing, because after waiting 45 minutes, you want your food ... NOW.   All in all, a cozy neighborhood brunch experience, and apparently now open for dinner.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Jean A.

description: Love their Beignets. Have bunch with my other friends there last Sunday. Good that they were there early... it took 45 mins for us to have a table. Small place with nice food and waiters. For sure will go there again.
author: zoom z.

description: Fabulous food, service, ambiance, excellent parking... looking forward to coming back!  The beignets are out of this world!  Even later that day when we had left overs, they were still great.  Also, they made my eggs, egg whites without any problem!  Super friendly and coffee was good, hot, fresh and kept flowing.  Very casual, laid back and fun.
author: Liz L.

description: The wait was long, but it was well worth it. The best huevos rancheros i've ever had. The largest mimosas we've ever seen (we didn't get them). Everything looked incredible.
author: Sachin A.

description: Had a stellar brunch here today. We all loved the food. All the basics were spot on. If you can make the trip to 3rd st. it is worth it for some of unique aspects of the menu.
author: Justin B.

description: Nice place for breakfast.  Big breakfast, friendly people, good food.  Highly recommend it.
author: Kare V.

description:
Four of us came in for lunch on a Monday - restaurant was packed at 1pm - that must be a good sign to start with!  Had always heard great things about Just for You - especially the Nawlins food.  

The Oyster Po-Boy was great - reminded me of some I've had at roadside restaurants in Louisiana.  Oysters were fried perfectly and the French bread was crispy on the outside and soft inside.  I had an order of fries (watch out it's a big order) and they were "handcut".

Most importantly - the food was served within 10 minutes of order - that has to be a record for similar restaurants in SF!
author: Ben M.

description: The beignets are as good as it gets outside of the ones I've tried in NOLO! Love them and the lightness of the my fish/potatoes/biscuit brunch. The coffee was just okay though.
author: Stacey H.

description: man this place blows! i heard things were better and went in with friends but nothing different at all. my food was blanketed in salt and the owner was still marching around like hitler, belittling her employees and paid no attention to her patrons. someone put this place out of its misery already
author: kevin j.

description: Loves it! I was super excited to find beignets in SF but the food is soo good I forgot all about them. The crab cake Po Boy is amazing!
author: jeff p.

description: its a classic breakfast spot!!! Why do they serve longanisa lmao but its cracking!!!
author: tim e.

description: This place is okay. I can't justify paying so much for some breakfast. I've been here a few times and it's always hit and miss on what I order. Personally I'm gonna stick with breakfast if I were to come back. The oyster po boy was a big disappointment. Also there fresh bread is like eating a brick. Other than that his place would be ideal if they dropped their prices a litlle. In the mean time I'll go to some hole in the wall joints.
author: cj b.

description: One of my favorite brunch places.  The corned beef hash is the best I've had in the city -- real strips of corned beef, none of that dog food-like stuff some places like to pass off as human food.
author: Jenn S.

description: Hate the wait, love the food.  Hate the service, love the coffee.  Hate the chairs, love the beignets.  It's a real love-hate relationship, but with so many menu choices, beignets and damn good strawberry jam, and actual quality bacon, the love almost always wins out.
author: Eclipse T.

description: Looks like I was lucky enough not to have went to this place for the first time during breakfast. I went there a few days ago for brunch... on a Thursday. There was no wait-- and the waiters were ready to take my order. Almost too ready. They seemed a little annoyed that I wasn't ready. I'm sorry it was my first time there, I'd like to take a minute to decide what I would like to eat first, thank you. Anyways, I had a very delicious omelet with chicken apple sausage and biscuits and grits. I was very happy! Although the service is a little rude, I would definitely go there again just because I love going to breakfast...and I need to try those beignets...
author: Jess D.

description: Excellent sunday brunch spot. More than likely you will have a wait but the wait is more than worth it. Fantastic french toast and great "huevos rancheros" a must visit.
author: Jerry M.

description: This place is awesome.  It gets kinda crowded though which kinda stinks, but still I like this place because of the nice people that work there and the great tasting food.  Also they fill your coffee up very regularly, and I felt like i had like 8 cups before i left, I was so pumped after leaving there.  Also it's cool that they dont let you have a cell phone there!  Highly recommend.
author: christopher h.

description: This is one of my favorite brunch places. The lines suck, but I thought the food was worth it. We ended up sitting at the tiny counter. We were so hungry when we finally got seated. We started with some beignets, which were really good, but not the best I've had. I actually think the ones at the Grand Lux Cafe in Chicago are the best! The Hangtown Fry was awesome! I loved the flavor of the oysters. It's a very hardy meal. Everyone else's meals around me looked delicious too. I would love to come back for more, but the line is so long....
author: Diana S.

description: What was I thinking!?!?!   I've been around Dogpatch for so long and I had never tried the food from Just For You?!?!?!  I used to think that my apple whole wheat pancake is da bomb, but their cormeal and oatmeal pancakes just proved me wrong.  And, for once, I'm so glad that I'm wrong.  Their pancakes are flavorful even without any syrup or butter.  They are soft, fluffy, and not greasy at all.  Even the fruit cup is supreme.  You might be wondering how different can diced fruit be.  Just for you didn't cheap me out by giving me a bunch of honeydew and cantaloupe.  I thought I also got a good amount of apple, pear, banana, and strawberry.  The fruit cup had no added sugar or flavoring.  Good stuff.  The girl who works there was cool too.  I'll go back for the buckwheat pancake next time.  Tofu scramble sounds good too.
author: Vivian H.

description: stopped here after an afternoon union meeting. i thought the place was about what you would expect from a cafe in the area, maybe better. tuna melt sandwich was hot and full of tuna. plenty of french fries, i could not eat them all. fair price for good food. short waitress was very attentive and polite. i would go back when i am in the area again.
author: scott c.

description: A great hole in the wall place to brighten this questionable neighborhood, one of which I used to live in. Now the early bird special is a great deal for those that live around and want a great cheap breakfast. Beignets are beyond awesome and don't be caught yappin' on your cell phone in here or you will be treated like a piece of trash which would serve you right anyways. Always crowded at peak times and there is one of those nice little yellow notepads to sign your name on outside when the crowd is swelling out this tiny hole. The cowboy, which includes chicken apple sausage, has to be one of the best things on the menu. (UPDATE) I did not realize they are now open for dinner, so I may update this review after trying out the new part of the menu!
author: Bowser J.

description: cute little place to have a quiet brunch.  Everyone was very polite and the food was pretty good.  From what i heard i was expecting the dishes to be a lot better though.  Overall a good experience~!
author: Victor M.

description:
We went here after reading some bad reviews or OK reviews for Sally's and the other reviews really liked this place. Unfortunately, both me and my GF did not eat the potatoes that were served to us. It tasted like the black part of the grill through the whole potato, even though they didn't look burnt. Not edible. 

Pro's
- quaint localish atmosphere
- had a tasty chorizo scramble
- bomb baked goods - muffin, bread, and the fried donuts looked awesome
- Has some creative menu options (oyster in an omelet, new orleans style fried donuts)

Con's
- Potatoes terrible... 
- Cash or check only, and its not exactly largely advertised anywhere, somewhere else there had the same issue I did at another table. Then the ATM is next door, welcome to $4 in fees. oops.


If I go again, I'll definitely sub the potatoes out for ANYTHING. Id even rather not have them on my plate. I can't believe they even served them they were so bad. How do you mess  up potatoes?!?!?
author: Brian E.

description: Had never been here before but my breakfast companion assured me it was good. We both had the Chili scramble over cornbread with home fries (2 orders), one coffee, one beignet, and a small orange juice. The check was $35 plus tip. The place is OK. The cornbread was good. Not much eggs ( I had to really look to find them on the plate), a ladle of non-descript beany chili, and the home fries were nice and not greasy. All in all mediocre and a bit pricy. Maybe I ordered the wrong dish. The beignet was good.  I would not go out of my way to return.
author: Bob J.

description: Every time I go here the place is jamming. Great food and great service. Perfect spot to bring a friend but not so much a cafe for singles.
author: Ryan F.

description:
DELICIOUS!

I had a friend visiting from out of town and she wanted to grab a classic brunch. We did a little searching on  yelp and saw the great reviews and numerous mentions of beignets. So off we went

The beignets were as good as everyone said!  So delicious...I would drive back up to SF just for the beignets.

The mimosas came out in very generous sized glasses and tasted more champagne than oj. In other words the mimosas were great! ;-)

I had the frittata of the decade which was good nothing too special but nonetheless tasty. My friend got the french toast and Louisiana sausage
which she was very happy with.

Will definitely be making a trip back here soon
author: Patty L.

description: Just For You is a wonderful breakfast place on the weekdays.  It's probably very crowded on the weekends.  And remember, it's only open until 3pm!  Anyway, I've found Just for You to be quiet, cozy, and serving great food.  I love the chili scramble.  I love the beignets.  I love the grits, oatmeal pancakes, croque monseiur, biscuits.  They have amazing home-baked bread.  It makes the best toast.  And their coffee is good and strong.  Overall, the food is healthy, fresh,  rich, and hearty.  Yum!
author: Lita F.

description: So far, my favorite breakfast spot in the city.  Flaky, yummy biscuits that alone are worth a visit.  Scrambles too are excellent.  This is a great neighborhood breakfast spot, with just enough friendly attitude; at the door, a sign warns you to not talk on your cell phone while inside, or they'll put it in the soup.  Parking in the neighborhood is easy too.  Yay for Just for You!
author: Leslie S.

description: Perfect weekday lunch spot if you need a break from work to chill out in the sun with a Mimosa and a crab-cake sandwich. But what really keeps me coming back is the coffee and beignets afterward. Mmm Mmm..oh my. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.
author: Richard K.

description: love - love -LOVE the oatmeal pancake hmmmm. Only down side would be they don't accept CREDIT CARD! ARGGGHHH.. but i love the food here.. Sunday breakfast at this place just makes my weekend.
author: Ateh M.

description: Saturday morning brunch. Very short wait (no problem in the gorgeous sunshine, bench outside and complimentary coffee for waiting people). We sat at the bar, so we were up close and personal with the really friendly, personable staff. Huevos Rancheros were very yummy. As others have said, huge portions... maybe next time we'll share a meal...  Overall, highly recommended.
author: Cary M.

description: Reliably imperfect execution (salt/doneness...), but honest service and plenty plenty of selection when you are indecisive.  Forget the weekend, don't even try, but you can usually sneak in easily during the week.  Can't say as much for parking, but worth a lap or two.
author: stephen g.

description: I love the food here, especially the pancakes, grits, and biscuits.  The servers are super-nice, but sometimes the service is a bit slow.  My only real gripe:  the coffee.  I think it's low quality to begin with, and then made weak.  But despite that, the food is good enough to keep me coming back (although usually after I've visited Martha's or Peet's for a strong cup of jo).
author: Amy E.

description: One of my favorite breakfast/brunch places in the bay area.  The entire staff is extremely friendly and the food is consistently good.  The beignets are a must have and the frittatas are great.  Parking is also easy if you don't live in the area.
author: Dave L.

description: I can, will, and do cross town for JFY's amazing cornmeal pancakes. I have no idea whether anything else on the menu is any good, because I can never get past the pancakes -- they are just sublime and there's no way around it. Well, once I got some kind of omelette with veggies and cheese, and it was quite nice and large and tasty, but it wasn't a giant cornmeal pancake slathered with raspberry jam with crispy bacon on the side. Okay, the beignets are lovely, too, but oh, those pancakes. I want them to have my babies. I want to elect them to office. They're THAT good.
author: Fawn F.

description: I love the beignets! They are the reason I've gone back, despite the long wait.
author: Katrina C.

description:
While waiting outside for a table, I peered through the windows to see what people were eating.  A man & woman were seated together at a table near the window.  I was immediately struck by the size of her biscuits.  "My what big, beautiful biscuits you have," thought I.  Anyone who has ever brunched with me (or had fried chicken with me) knows that I love me some biscuits.  

My bf & I were seated at the counter with a bird's eye view into the kitchen.  When it came time to order I, of course, ordered biscuits with my eggs.  While we waited for our food we were able to watch the parade of other people's orders coming from the kitchen.  Of course, I was not the only one who had developed biscuit envy that morning.  However, I was horrified to see the kitchen staff warming up biscuits in the microwave.  "No no no!" I wanted to scream.  Had they not learned at a young age, as I did, that breads get mushy & soggy in a microwave.  Did they not know that mushy & soggy are not complementary adjectives when it comes to a biscuit?  Needless to say, I was a bit disappointed when my artificially warmed biscuits arrived.  Even with generous amounts of butter they were relatively tasteless.  My eggs were super yummy though.  I did not care for what they call hash browns.  They are basically just a bunch of cut up chunks of red potatoes.  

What I did love love love were the buckwheat pancakes.  I had not had buckwheat pancakes in years.  And, theirs did not disappoint.

I will definitely be back.  This place is too close to my house to not want it to be really good.
author: Jeff P.

description:
(updated)

you can't go wrong with Mabel's.

constantly good food. breakfast is delicious. we have never gone for lunch, so i can only speak on behalf of the morning crew.  been going here for years.

i order the same, good ol' fashion original chorizo burrito, sans the beans.  mmm-mmm...

gary orders the same crazy dish, which i can't recall, as his plate has quite a bit, whereas, my burrito is it.

service is always good.  tables turn, but there is that rush hour when you are required to wait, but it definitely is worth it, as you can take in the area, the quite cool Dogpatch neighborhood.

it is (yes, I will say it)  "totally awesome" when you call in an order during the work week, and they know your name... RIGHT ON!
author: Benjamin B.

description: So, when my boyfriend and I want a brunch/breakfast that we know will be good, we come here... (esp. after a night out) .Sure there is a wait on the weekends, but that is because it is so good. The specials are great, and there are outside tables for our dog...yummy, oh and the waitstaff is fast....XOXXOOOXOX
author: Farrah A.

description: Do not hesitate to come here for a good breakfast, or soup and sando lunch. I have never had a bad meal here and the service is what I would expect from any good breakfast/lunch cafe. I liked it better when they were the worlds tiniest breakfast place (now the worlds tiniest french bistro Chez Maman) but whatever, its still one of the cities better breakfast spots.
author: Brian Aaron J.

description: Great comfort food at a reasonable price!  Very good for helping you through a hangover.  Service is fine.  It can be pretty loud, at times, but that adds to the whole experience.  The bignets and scrambles are excellent.  And the bread is "home made".  YUM!
author: Kevin M.

description: Friendly service, great vibe. Not impressed w/ paying $2.50 for a tiny container of fresh salsa. Bathrooms need improvement.
author: Vicki L.

description: Came here for brunch and everything was--good. Not great, not memorable, but it was perfectly tasty. It's the kind of place I might frequent if I lived in the neighborhood, but I just don't think I'd go out of my way for it.
author: Michael S.

description: Five stars for being so unique, not-over crowded, and the only place with beignets in SF (correct me if I'm wrong).  Chickory in the coffee and all. I love when I feel like I've been transported to another place. Add some heat and humidity, you could be in New Orleans here.
author: Val U.

description: Mediocre, at best... not bad, but not worth the hike.  Maybe I just caught it on an off day.
author: Godot -.

description:
Every visit here has been great (both food and service).  I love this place.  I wish all the hipsters would stop coming here so I could get a table without a huge wait, though.

Daniel

P.S. Everyone raves about the beignets, but the cornmeal pancakes were awesome.  I highly recommend getting them.
author: Daniel Q.

description: Okay this is my favorite local breakfast place. Yes, the  Beignets totally rock. You can even order them in less than 3s. I love that I can get a sandwich with a side of excellent salad and not just fries. Don't order the biscuits unless you get them with gravy. They are dry dry dry. I will admit that I like my biscuits on the buttery side. The specials are really great and not just what didn't sell from yesterday. Corned Beef Hash is homemade and not that canned junk so places like to pass off. It can get crowded, but that's what happens when you have great comfort food. I want to give them 5 stars but the service isn't as good as it used to be. Not sure why, but if you need a refill or or your order doesn't come shortly after the rest of the table, flag someone down or you could be waitin' a while.
author: Stephanie R.

description: I sat at one of their outdoor tables on an absolutely perfect day.  There wasn't much of a wait, the service was fine, and I found parking with ease.  So I was in a pretty good mood to begin with. The "Special Frittata" was a disappointment however.  The meat in it was overcooked but the veggies were raw.  Tasted like someone's first attempt at making an omelet. The home fries and cinnamon raisin toast were tasty, and filling.  The beignets were excellent (though, can you really screw up a beignet?). I'd give them a solid 5 and the rest of it a 3.  My advice, order some beignets to go and eat them somewhere else.
author: Tom R.

description:
Just lovely...

my gf and I were out trying to discover a new brunch place to call our own...I can't believe we live in Potrero Hill and have never been here before!

Great, great food (the Beignets were sinful!), and the service was so lovely and courteous, the atmosphere was special (interesting cubano music playing while in a Southern homestyle cooking restaurant).

This is our new favorite, and I highly recommend stopping by for breakfast if you haven't already...
author: Rollio R.

description: I have been here 3 times. It's a good breakfast spot. When we do go there it's crowed. I usually get the eggs and catfish. I love fish!  The first  and 2nd time I went it was real good. The biscuit is good.  The 3rd time we went The catfish was not cooked all the way. The cafe was packed so I totally understand it can happen. We gave it back to the waitress and has the cooks cook it more for me. It took awhile for us to get the waitress attention but it was fine. I would go back again but I would like to find a better breakfast spot.
author: Ge I.

description: Always a very long wait, due to the trendiness. This means the waitstaff is rushed to the point of rudeness, bluntly telling you to get out of the way if you are standing in the wrong area (the whole place is small and not well-designed, so there is always bottlenecking in the narrow passways between tables). The food is very expensive for what you are given. The quantity is fine, but the quality could be better. When they were out of ingredients for an order at my table, instead of asking if we'd like an alternate, they just substituted ingredients, and when we pointed it out the waiter got huffy. They also push the beignets very hard with every order, which are nothing special.
author: Geae D.

description: Rated 4 out of 5, but definitely not because of the food.  Interesting little spot with laid back people in a neighborhood many aren't aware.  Worth checking out and coming back because of the people there and the location.
author: amy v.

description:
went there for beingets, they hit the spot. very few things better than crispy, donut-y, powdery, jammy goodness in the morning, at least for me.
not very comfortable sets it seemed through out the resturant (it's pretty tiny) which is a killer for me.
author: marcella r.

description: Bottomless mimosas and fresh outta the fryer beignets! It doesn't get better than this unless you're at Cafe Du Monde in NOLA. You GOTTA check out their weekend brunch and trust me, order the Beignets. I only go to Protero Hill for two things: Food at Elizas and and brunch at Just For You.
author: Shauna B.

description:
Okay guys, the place ain't that great. The wait is ridiculous, the seating is elbow-to-elbow, the beigniet - well, they were good - but the rest of the food was just breakfast food. I think it gets high marks because it's the only game in town. To which I say again - OPEN MORE RESTAURANTS, SAN FRANCISCO!

No joke, every notable breakfast place has lines down the block on weekends, and Just For You was no exception. I think if I happened upon it and walked in without a wait and sat down at my own non-shared table and enjoyed some yummy beigniet and oatmeal pancakes, I may have been more impressed.

Also, one waitress handling the entire establishment? That poor girl!
author: Jillian L.

description:
I've waited for months to eat at this place because every time I want to have brunch there, there's an intimidating line outside. Fortunately, the line moves much more quickly than you'd think.

My friends enjoyed their scrambles (the hangover cure with oysters was a particular favorite). I enjoyed my egg and crab cake thingy. 

We'll visit again!
author: J L.

description:
Been here several times over the course of many years. Decided to write a review today because I have most recently been there 3 times in the past 2 weeks. 

I love their beignets - some of the best I've had in quite a while. Recently had the Eggs Benedict....pretty good, but honestly, nothing to write home about. Prior had the Biscuits & Gravy and those were above average. Extremely rich and filling, so be warned before you order this meal. And prior had their Burger & Fries which was also very good. If memory serves me well I have eaten their B'fast Burritto, the Cowboy, Cowgirl, Huevos Rancheros and a number of other entrees over the many years I've been in Potrero. To me this is one of the better b'fast places around - the menu is so extensive that it's truly hard to make a decision, especially when you're hung over. 

I recommend going here for sure
author: Anon Y.

description: If I could give this place a ZERO I would....I didn't even get to taste the food, I couldn't get past the rude, inconsiderate servers.
