Me and two others came here at around 11 am on a Thursday, and there were no tables available, so we placed our names on a list that was attached near the door, we were asked if we needed a table twice, by two different servers, we told them we needed to seat three and they said ok and closed the door, as we waited outside for a table to become available.  After waiting not too long, about ten minutes, a table of four left and we waited and watched through the glass windows as the servers went by and ignored the table which needed to be bussed.  We decided to give them a hint by going inside, as it was windy a bit, and sitting at the table.  Another ten minutes go by and the same servers that asked us earlier if we needed a spot, walked around us several times, so finally my husband gets up and goes the the cash register and asks if someone could clean the table off for us....a couple minutes later a male server asks us if we are done, we told him we hadn't even gotten started and that we had been waiting for a table and needed this one wiped down and the empty glasses and bill removed...he then tells us "Well can you move then so I can clean the table and there are people waiting outside for tables and we need this, so you will need to move"....well there were no people waiting a head of us for a table and we told him this and he again insisted we move so he could wipe the table off....not usually a big deal, but he had a serious attitude with us even though we had been nothing but patient and respectful....I felt as though he didn't want us to be there, so we said ok we'll leave and did just that....we were completely put off by this one servers attitude...we also noticed that for such a small place they had more than 3 servers and they were very slow to do anything. We left and drove to Kate's, which was just as busy, and only had ONE server, a young woman who was friendly and prompt, and refilled my coffee more times than I can remember, thank goodness Just for You Sucks, I would have missed out on the homemade corn beef hash and coffee that seemed to never disappear at Kate's!!!
author: Kathie C.

description: on sundays when i get out of bed before noon + have enough energy to wait around in line, i come here.  there's always a wait, but the place really gets slammed after 11:30.  hardest part is choosing one thing from the menu- so many items look good.  service is excellent; friendly + fast + great w/refills.  yes, it's not super cheap- usually $10-15 per person per entree, not including drinks + sides + beignets.
author: Zoe L.

description: Went here this afternoon and they now accept credit cards! Yea! And their beniets are still AWESOOOOME!!
author: Meagan F.

description: oulala, i really like it.  The only place i've seen beignets on a menu in SF.  Wait!! The only place they serve champagne in a beer glass for $4! It was noon and i was drunk again, hahaha. I was sitting at the bar with my current gf and the owner was so sweeeeet, she gave me an extra beignet, hiiiiii, laissez les bon temps rouler...
author: Damien J.

description: I'm a breakfast food luv-ah, so I'm in heaven when I go to JFY 'cause they serve breakfast all day. I especially love the homemade biscuits & beignets! All the dishes are as great as the witty comments on the menu. :-)
author: Michelle E.

description:
I live right around the corner and have a 5 year old who wakes up at 6:30am every morning. Weekends too. So we never have a problem walking right in and getting a table at Just For You. In fact, our only problem is waiting for it to open on weekends.

We go here about once a week, mostly for breakfast. As good as I hear those beignets are, we have never gotten them. I always opt for the catfish fillet next to my two eggs, potatoes and corn bread. That or bacon. Very good stuff. They also will make a Mickey Mouse pancake with strawberry and grape eyes, nose and mouth.

Marcella is usually there as our waitress. She usually talks to our daughter about princesses. Really sweet.

The burgers are good too.
author: Bill M.

description: Great place for breakfast.  There is usually a wait on weekends, and the service can be a little spartan and generic but the food is fantastic.  They put out some coffee for those who are waiting outside which is nice (though the coffee should be better).  The beignets are the best I've had outside of New Orleans, and it's nice to have some grits and eggs just like back home.  The biscuits are nothing special; tasty and flakey, but  were dry, but it was almost 1pm so they may have just sat around too long.  Note that is is cash only and there is really no where else around as a backup, so don't head over unless you are OK for a wait.
author: Wino K.

description: First place to eat on New Years Day.  My two friends intro'd the place.  Seems to be very popular since there was  a line out the door right when we sat down....we came just in time.  Parking isn't too bad first of all.  Customer service is great:  looks you in the eye, gets "it" on refilling coffee and drinks.  The beignets are awesome!  The menu has some humor on it and quite diverse.  A lot of homemade stuff i.e. breads (lots of choices like scone, cornbread, wheat, biscuit, etc).  Their eggs menu is simple, you get eggs, bread, home fries or grits, and then an add on like a homemade patty etc.   I loved the coffee (but then again I was hungover), but my food was a bit cold - I'm thinking because their customers kept leaving the door open OR they cooked mine first and my friends took longer to make.  The biscuits were "ok", not as buttery and flavor able as I had hoped.  The homemade hamburger patty was a bit bland too unfortunately, but my friends who ordered their specials like the corned beef or roast beef scrambled loved it .  I definitely want to come back to explore more, and its nice to have a good environment!
author: Neville B.

description:
I already had experienced their mediocre food, incredibly bad service, and dingy atmosphere, though made the mistake of going back simply because it was a holiday and my first few brunch choices were closed. 

For my return visit, no host was present to communicate table availability, nor were they particularly good at managing the self service list that they hang by the door. My server preferred serve coffee in disposable paper cups and needed prodding in order to serve the coffee in non-disposable coffee mugs. 

I heard that this restaurant used to be located on top of potrero hill, and rumor has it that it moved to its current and markedly lower-rent location as it had trouble remaining competitive with the higher-quality and better managed establishments of its old neighborhood. This makes sense. 

Sometimes a business can survive by simply being "not that bad." This is one of those establishments. This restaurant may be able to survive if it continues to move into lower-rent districts away from any other food options.
author: Tristan F.

description: I wonder if all those signs are meant to get a point across in a fun way? I wonder if it really is kinda rude to yack away on your cell phone in a restaurant, even if the room isn't quiet as a library? I wonder if baby strollers really are too big to fit into a busy restaurant where servers are trying to deliver food promptly, not to mention hot pots of coffee? I wonder if being nice and friendly to other people (like, for example, servers in a restaurant) increases the likelihood of them being nice to you? Guess I'll ponder all that over my next outstanding meal at Just For You.
author: P C.

description:
HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!!  ADEQUATE FOOD........

My husband and I live just a few blocks from here.  We love the breakfast (dinner, not so much).  But the service is horrible.  Last night there were 3 tables seated for dinner.  I never saw the waiter or waitress stop by a table other than to take an order and drop the food on the table.  As a matter of fact, our "waitress" decided to sit at the bar area, eat HER dinner, play some scratch off lottery tickets from Reno's (next door) and win.  She immediately bolted out the door to collect her winnings.  All the while, my husband and I sat waiting to have our plates cleared and get the check.  I had to ask a cook for our check.  I hope she hit big money on her lottery tix because there was no tip on her table from us.  She didn't even apologize for leaving the restaurant.  I don't care how good the food is, there is no reason for bad service when there are only 3 tables with 2 people at each table.
author: Linda B.

description:
Writing this review was a suggestion by one of the staff, the owner of the restaurant I think.  This my second AWFUL service experience at this restaurant so I think it is time to talk about it.  The staff has a bad attitude.  In short, I placed my name on the waiting list outside of the door for a table.  There was no signage or verbal indication about where we should wait so we waited in the restaurant.  After a while, I went outside to check the list and our name had been crossed off.  I told the wait person that we were actually on the list but we did not hear our name called and she became annoyed and actually agitated with us.  We said that we would wait for the next table but she was no longer communicating with us.  She went outside and told another party of 2 (which was the same number as us) to come and take their choice of tables.  She then, rather rudely, told us that we could sit in the other table that was ready.  Because of her attitude, we did not feel welcome in that restaurant anymore so we decided to quietly leave.  As if her prior rudeness was not enough, she could not resist continuing to provoke us by commenting on our decision to leave.  She followed us out of the restaurant practically yelling  in a very smug fashion, "It is fine if you leave"  (which we already knew) and "don't forget to write about this in yelp".  

I only take the time to write this because, as I mentioned, this is my second bad experience there and it WILL definitely be my last.  What exactly are you paying for in a place like this?  The food is not exceptional, the selection is ordinary, and the decor is rather dreary.  All that a place like that can really offer is good service, charm and comfortable atmosphere.  This place has none of the above.
author: Donald G.

description: Solidly dependable and there every morning when I need it!   Good breakfasts, friendly service, good value and rarely a line before 9:30 am (get there early!)   "The Cowgirl" (eggs, bacon and pancakes) keeps me happy until dinner time!
author: David M.

description: cute little place for brunch... BEIGNETS BEIGNETS.... i LOVE THE BEIGNETs here!
author: Tess C.

description: Mmm...I love additions to my Saturday + Sunday breakfast stops.  I finally got to check out Just For You's beigniets today--delicious!  I love all the breakfast options and that they serve brunch until 3pm...definitely can make it in by then while nursing a hangover.
author: Amy C.

description: hmm...there are 125 reviews before mine, but i guess i'll just put in my two bits.  the chili scramble on cornbread is pretty much perfect.  cornbread, scrambled eggs, cheese, onions and a big yummy pile of chili con carne that is just the right amount of sweet.  yay.  they also have a green chili that they serve with the huevos rancheros that's delicious and a little bit spicy.  this is perfect hangover food, and i gladly spend half an hour on the bus to get here when i can't find a friend with a car willing to venture outside of the same old boogaloos/pork store circuit.  the servers have always been really sweet too (as in, "how sweet," not, "sweet, dude").  i really, really wish it were closer to my neck of the woods, but its absence makes the heart grow fonder.  and the chili makes the fart grow stronger.
author: Mynameisdavid M.

description: This place is terrible!  And the neighborhood is really dangerous!  People get shot by crack dealers ALL THE TIME just waiting to get seated for brunch on weekends.  Stay away if you value your life!  Or even if you don't.  Just stick with the Denny's by the Metreon, or the Mel's across the street from there if you're feeling expansive.  Seriously.
author: Ludwig S.

description: Beautiful, warm, sunny afternoon in the dogpatch. My friend and I moseyed over to Just for You Cafe and sat outside to drink up the noontide sunshine. The menu is large. You basically look at it and find yourself wanting at least one thing from each category. So making a decision can be difficult if you have a liking for it all. I had the pleasure of the New Mexican Green Chile Cheeseburger on toast and was slightly afraid of the 'fire' 'fire' 'yowza!' warnings next to the green chile option...So the waitress kindly offered to put it on the side. It was different to eat a burger on toast, but I must admit that the toast was pretty good and I liked the creole mustard spread. To eat the green chile alone was spicy, but once you slather it on the burger, I didn't find it to be that hot and just kept adding more. Sure, you may sweat a little but maybe the 'fire' 'fire' was unwarranted. I really enjoyed it and want to go back to try the people-raving-beignets and other stuff.
author: Faye P.

description: it was the only place nearby that was open early in the morning. parking was not too bad surprisingly.  during the wait you can enjoy a cup of free coffee outside.  a wait for a table of two took 15 - 20 minutes.  the menu was somewhat pricey compared to a few other places i have been to. i had the special omlette with sausage, spinach, mushroom and cheese. there was not to much sausage or mushroom. the waiter only checked in with us to see how we were doing to leave us the bill. don't think i will be returning to this cafe.
author: Jen P.

description: Not bad. The wait is always long. The selection is OK. The food quality is decent. The service is good. Street parking is always easy. I've been back several times, and I guess the main reason is the uniqueness of the food.
author: Joe C.

description: yummy breakfasts (you should've seen me grubbing away in front of my computer), yummy beignets (better than powderface), not so exciting coffee (go to sundance for that!)
author: Jill k.

description: Great place for breakfast.  The homemade bread, muffins and cornbread are all delicious.  Had the Greg's scramble - Yummy!  Hidden gem in the dogpatch.
author: Megan S.

description: Went on a Saturday morning around 10am and had to wait less than ten minutes for a table. The place was a little bigger than I thought with a few tables in the back.  Lots of choices on the menu and nice wait staff.  They make sure your coffee cup is never empty.  I got the Cowboy (french toast, eggs, and bacon) and hubby got Greg's scramble with chorizo.  The portions were good and satisfying.  This is also the place I go to if I'm craving beignets:)
author: Winnie L.

description: If you order the beignets -- steaming hot, smothered with powdered sugar, and well worth the wait -- then make sure you eat them right away. For lunch, get the clam chowder, which is chock full of clams. Fantastic service -- all of the waitstaff I encountered were friendly, helpful, and seemed super excited to be working there.
author: A. T.

description: This place is a really good weekend brunch place if you don't mind waiting a few minutes (and have cash - no credite here)  - they usually have free coffee out front while you wait, or my MO, go across and down the street to the corner cafe with the blue bottle coffee (mmmmm).  Anyhoo, Just For You has the BEST biscuits!  And they do have good coffee of their own.  I usually get their greek omelet which is really tasty.  I have had fairly good service for a reeeeallly busy place.  The beignets are totally worth trying too.  Finally - you can park here really easily which is a definite plus.
author: Urbo O.

description: I love beignets, I love potatoes mixed with veggies cheese and poached eggs on top. I love Just for You Cafe, and you will too.
author: Arnold S.

description: great staff & the only place in SF for proper new mexican green chile. flown in fresh too. nuff said.
author: Eloy T.

description: Awesome breakfast and brunch.  I do breakfast meetings....and Sunday brunch.  Expect a short wait on the weekends.  Make sure you order the beignets!   They do a stellar lunch as well.  A bit on the expensive side, but worth it.
author: David D.

description: Solid, reliable food in a cozy but high energy atmosphere (weekends).  Have been coming here for years and can always count on a good breakfast with top quality ingredients.  To the person who complained about dry toast - did you notice that the menu said it is a "butter your own toast" place?
author: Michele D.

description: Checked out this place the morning of the carnival parade.  Our party of three had a slight wait, and we're engaged in conversation too much to take advantage of the free coffee while you wait, but I did notice others partaking.  the seating was a little cramped, but the coffee and water came promptly.  After getting a few chuckles out of their irreverent menu, I ordered the Crab Benny.  We called the waiter back to order the beignets after last-minte deliberation.  like others have said, fried dough and sugar, can't really mess that up too bad.  I thought the crabcakes had too much vinegar, there was definitely something that wasnt' right about them, the grits were decent, but I'm a northern boy, so I don't speak from any experience.  My compantion thought the cornbread good enough to box up after only being able to devour half of it, aparently her egg scramble was better than my benny.  I'd be willing to check this place out again, but maybe when i'm in a lazier mood, and there isn't a parade of half-naked brazilians luring me out the door.  cash only
author: shawn g.

description: I work just down the street, and this is my lunch time go to. The staff is super nice, and you just got to love the owner! She is awesome, as is the food. My favorites are the tuna melt, yummy baked potatoes and the great home fries. The breads are made there, fresh and delicious. I love the signs that remind people to respect public courtesy and turn the damn cell phones off!
author: NIcole N.

description: Um, it was good, but I'm not sure what all the fuss is about. I had an omelette, it was about what I'd expect, we continued with the day.... ?
author: suz q.

description: right now, in my hallway, sits a styrofoam container and a bike helmet. inside the styrofoam container is a beignet, belonging to the same person who forgot his bike helmet after a sunday brunch at Just For You. I'm only willing to give this place three stars because my vegan meal was neither brunch nor satisfying, but my egg and dairy loving friends had a great time. It's too bad that Just For You isn't exciting for vegans, but between the many eggy options, the old school brunch diner atmosphere and the coveted Beignets, this place is a winner for you Ovo Lacto's. Love the Dogpatch and it will love you back.
author: Alex D.

description: wow, this place is awesome.  it has taken me a while to get over to it, but man, i'm glad i finally did.  (usually my weekend breakfast routine involves proximity to my bed).  had the beef chili and cornbread with poached eggs.  it was a delight and different from the standard brunch fare one sees.  minus one star for wait with no more coffee......
author: Katie M.

description: This was our second visit to Just for You. Our first stop was lots of fun and a must stop when in the city (dog patch area) for breakfast or brunch. We arrived early on our second visit so no wait to find a two top. Expect a wait on popular breakfast times and days. Our visit was good however the presentation was off compared to our first visit. Hang town Fry was good however portion appeared to be smaller than our first visit. The egg scramble was adequate heavy on the parma cheese. Corn bread was excellent and side potatoes were very good.I would try the pancakes on our next visit and a different egg dish. Down the block from Just For you is a small coffee spot serving "Blue Bottle" coffee which I had on my first visit waiting for a seat at Just for You. When I had my second cup at Just For You the coffee was not near the quality and taste of my cup of Blue Bottle. I may have not noticed the difference had I not just finished my cup of Blue Bottle. Just For You Cafe is still a must visit for breakfast or brunch when we are in the area.
author: Gerry C.

description: Such a gem - love this place for brunch.  The home style cooking and yummy dishes make it well worth the wait (expect and hour if you go during prime brunch time)
author: Lisa K.

description: Best hangover breakfast this side of the Mississippi.  Not sure if that's true, but it sure feels like it when I'm there for the medicine that cures what ails me.  Ok, it's definitely greasy spoon, but good.  Have never had a bad food experience.  Everything is really good - and for the dishes, they are all perfectly executed.  Great salads, omelets, frittatas, smokin french toast and beignets.  Pretty good staff everytime I have been there - ok it might not be one of those "it's all about the service" places, but I know that walking in AND I have never had anyone do less than a great job as our server.  And I have been tons of times, so I would think I have had the chance to be disappointed, but I haven't.  If I wasn't watching my girlish figure, oh boy you would see me there a little more often.  Of course, if you have never been, get there early because there's always an insane wait, but it is worth it.  And if you are there early enough to have the fresh pot of coffee (before they run out of the cream, that is) outside while you wait for a table, even better.  I am so happy this place is in my hood.  Oh, I think this place is only open on weekends.  I could be wrong but I have never checked weekday.
author: Isa L.

description: i give this place 5 stars because EVERY TIME I've been here I've been met with great service and equally good food. the food is very "classic" in every sense; simple yet great flavors and texture to each portion of every dish. combined makes a great "no frills" satisfying breakfast. The house baked goods are made very well and the pricing is very fair for the excellent level of service and the food. The staff is very well trained and don't come off "phony".
author: Jubei K.

description: just for you gets four stars easy for there food and easily gets 2 stars for their horrible wait staff. i have eaten here hundreds of times over the past few years and have never once received good service from a male staff member.  ordering out from here is a good way to go....
author: andrew h.

description:
servers are friendly, beignets are the best!  (although i don't remember them being so large @ cafe dumonde in naw'lins)

it's also the first time I've tried grits - not too bad.
author: rien d.

description: Just wondering if you still allow patrons to feed their dogs off the dishes used for your human diners? That was so disgusting (even as an animal lover) and the staff did nothing to stop the guy when he took  a second plate from the table and left the dog eat directly off it.
author: anthony g.

description: hands down, one of my favorite places to eat breakfast. service is magnificently surly. i like to think of it as being fed and being insulted in the same breath. the sign alone: we reserve the right to pour coffee on your cellphone should be pasted in every restaurant in town. i am sucker for the huevos rancheros, but just about anything on that menu is good, honest, simple eats, without aires. indulge in a beignet or pie (yes, even after breakfast.)
author: Virginia A.

description: It's like traveling the world over breakfast.  Okay, not really, but where else can you get fabulous beignets AND one of the tastiest breakfast burritos around?  Just for You is a treat.  Of course, there's always a line on weekends, but it goes pretty quickly.  If you try the vegetarian breakfast burrito, you'll understand why I like to call this place "Breakfast Burrito For You".
author: Shalom G.

description: the food is amazing. the waitress with the voice is amazing. check out this nonpretentious place for good bfast. seriously.
author: Gabe B.

description: been here twice and have not been disappointed. as a breakfast-lover, i must say that JUST FOR YOU does the trick.  and i think the beignets are yumm...fluffy on the inside and warm.
author: Lily C.

description: to be fair, i should note that i went here when i had a head cold. had tea and a scone - they do give you a huge cup of tea, but the scone wasn't really a scone, it was more like a slice of cake - so i was sad that it was missing that nice sconey hard outershell. we got there at 10:30 so we didn't have a real problem getting a seat. the other people i was with both loved their dishes, eggs benedict and turkey apple sausage w/ a much raved about cornbread. they split an order of beignets - which were really huge and covered in a mound of powdered sugar.
author: Toisha T.

description: This is a great little diner!  I've been there many times and have never been dissapointed.  The atmosphere is friendly and the food is excellent from their breakfast to lunch menus.  Try their made to order breakfast burritos or corn cakes for breakfast & try their fish tacos or Croque Misseur Sandwich(basically a grilled cheese with gruyere) for lunch.  If you like cole slaw, it's "top of the line" here.  Lots of burgers and creative hot menu items as well as a bevy of salads for light eaters.  You don't see this stuff at the typical "choke & puke" diners.  An all day breakfast/lunch menu also makes for great choices & satisfying portions.  The wait staff is courteous and attentive and will fix anything that isn't quite right - no questions asked.  JFY is a small place with a six seat bar.  With mostly inside seating and a few outside tables, it can get a little crowded but it's ususally a fun atmosphere & not too terribly noisy.  A bit of low-volume, pumped-in  trip-hop helps to soften the kitchen noises.  Nice place to chill & fill.
author: Tim F.

description: On a Sunday afternoon, this is definately a scene.  If you're a small group and willing to sit at the counter, you can probably be seated in 30 minutes.  The food is fantastic.  I ordered Eggs Blackstone (much like eggs benedict but with tomato and bacon instead of ham).  I was far from disappointed.  My homie got corned beef hash (a special prepping us for st Patty's day) with the most delicious scrambled eggs he's ever had.  The coffee was ok.  Service was good.
author: pauline e.

description: This is the best breakfast place in San Francisco! You'll have to wait for a table but it is so worth it. The food is fantastic and there are things for everyone - My husband and I are complete opposites, I am lactose and wheat intolerant, and my husband loves his sausage, bacon, and pancakes!! We both love this place!
author: Sam D.

description: just for you is the business. fortunately it's not near my house because if it was i would be hugely obese due to their delicious beignets.
author: adams l.

description: Oatmeal pancakes, crab cakes, hot mustard.. droooool. This place is so amazing. The bf and I go here almost every Sunday for brunch. I can't say enough about how delicious it is. We always walk out way too full and happier than we should be considering the next day is usually a work day
author: RJ B.

description:
these guys consistently serve tasty breakfast and lunch dishes. the coffee's good, the parking's reasonable, but on the weekends the wait will turn some people away.  unlike my review of burma superstar - which i don't think is worth the wait - something about standing around drinking free coffee and chatting with friends in the potrero sunshine makes waiting for a table here A-OK.  perhaps it's because people frequently ditch before their names are called, and the wait is usually only 20-30m or so, even around 11:30. 

service can be a bit slow, and i've (very rarely) had food that was fast out of the kitchen but slow to get to me, which is always a downer. occasionally a side order (beignets or extra sauce, etc) is forgotten and needs to be re-ordered or taken off the bill. however, i've seen them accomodate large groups and weird requests, so extra points in their favor there. 

the benedicts, scrambles, huevos, biscuits and gravy are all great; the grapefruit juice is fantastic.  

if i could give 3.5 stars i would; 3 stars due to occasionally harried, diffident service, but the food is always fab, and i keep going back.

**updated 12/08 to add to the above**
on the beignet flipside, occasionally you get beignets you didn't order, and that don't go on your tab, thus preserving the tally on what must be some sort of universal beignet balance sheet. mmmmm.
author: m l.

description: This is one of those places that I always pass by, heard of, but never seem to come to mind when looking for a breakfast place. But this weekend, a friend suggested it and away we went. It's every bit as cute inside as it looks on the outside. Unfortunately, tables for 3 seem to be hard to come by as group after group of twosomes behind us kept getting seated while we cooled our heels outside. Finally we got a table in Siberia - the last table on a banquette waaay at the back. Got coffee service right away, but didn't see our waitress again for another 20 minutes. When she finally came back, we asked for her opinion on some items on the menu, which she couldn't give because - get this - she is allergic to wheat and can't eat 99.9% of the items offered. I went for the Cowboy (2 eggs, French toast, and sausage/bacon). I was very excited to see that they offered a Filipino sausage called longanisa (yum!) which they allowed me to substitute for the Cowboy sausage. Overall, the food was great. I really wanted to save room for the beignets that I heard so much about, but my serving was huge and those longanisa were sooo good. So, 4 stars for the food minus one for the bad table and sporadic service.
author: Rey L.

description: I often go out to eat by myself.  I suppose it lends well to my recleusive nature.  It could be because Im just a looser and nobody wants to eat with me.  Or the fact that Im a chef and find myself crtiqueing everything that I eat.  I even look at the walls wondering why they had choosen that decor to enlighten the experience.  We don't sell food in this business we sell an experience.  How many places have you gone to that have great food but shitty service and your just not willing to return?  I know I've been to plenty.  Maybe people aren't into the idea that Im gonna either dog everything or take for ever eating it as I savor every bite.  I've heard about Just for you a lot.  I live maybe 1/4 of a mile from it in the "Dog Patch"  its so close I should have been there more often.  I will say however my breakfast experience wasn't the greatest.  I had this incredible urge to eat eggs benedict as soon as I awoke.  With my half closed eyes I wasn't interested in whiping out any holandaise. So I opted to take my walk down the street to see if they had the item I needed to satisfy my hunger.  I was a little disappointed at getting holandaise from the dry variety.  Basically you boil water and whip in the dry mix until Nappe.  It was also served on toast instead of an english muffin.  THe flavor was alright but certainly not what I was hoping for.  The waitress is cute, though so I suppose they get some extra credit for it.  I geuss in all honesty this is what I expected.  Nothing real special about it but a good place to eat being in my neighborhood.  I wouldn't travel across the city to eat here but I will probably eat here again.
author: Pat W.

description:
pretty good. as long as you are expecting diner quality.

my hangtown fry was okay with only two oysters. the big jumbo kind, granted.  But I prefer the small to medium oysters.  The oysters are breaded and fried so it's hard to get that crispyness with giant oysters.

the beignets were about the size of my shoe.  it sort of looked like somone just tore a huge fistfull of dough and threw in in the deep fryer.  of course fried dough is gonna taiste good no matter what i guess.

I would give this place another try, they do bake there own bread, the food just wasn't well put together and was kind of sloppy.
author: john m.

description: Food is above average, portions are just the right size, but this place is overpriced.  Good vibe here, always pretty crowded, but I think they could offer a better value.  This easily becomes a $30-40 brunch for 2 people.
author: P C.

description: i love this place!  a good friend lives in the neighborhood and everytime i am there we definitely make sure to go to just for you for breakfast.  the beignets are delicious!  wait staff is super friendly. and prices just right.
author: meadow m.

description: Great breakfast spot, with beignets that are to die for.  The menu changes weekly with creative specials, always consistent food.  Avoid peak hours, the wait can be pretty long, but at least it's on the warmer side of town in a great little area.
author: Buckeye W.

description: crab cakes and eggs- yum. turkey apple sausage patties- yum. not at all greasy. All day I dream of breakfast at just for you.
author: Christina G.

description: I really enjoy eating here.  It has more personality than most places and feels like a real reflection of the neighborhood where it resides.  Can't give much advice on the menu as I always get grilled cheese and cole slaw for lunch or buck wheat pancakes for breakfast .  Both are fantastic and meet my expectations.  Stumbled upon yelp and felt compelled to write.  Do people really have the time to write full page reviews on every business they frequent?  People seem to analyzing every detail for the supposed benefit of others.  I have a sneaking suspicion that this Yelp thing is more of a power trip for people than review site for consumers.  San Francisco's self appointed critics should spend more time doing and less time critiquing those that do.  My two cents to take or leave.
author: Joe H.

description: more like "just kidding".  totally overrated.  bad food and long waits.  first time i went they forgot about our order then finally served us - three plates with broken hollandaise on them.  that's nasty.  Gave it a second chance and it wasn't any better.  the wait staff is very cute and nice though.
author: Claire D.

description: my 13-year old and i were starving after hitting the annual 3rd street sale in dogpatch...we stumbled into this cafe and i almost died on the spot upon eating my first ever beignet. never heard of them till then but figured  - hey french doughnuts how bad can they be? and now i'm jones'ing practically daily for them. y'all sf folks are so lucky. anyhow worth the petrol get get'em while their hot. oh yeah, all the other food we devoured was outstanding. viva la comida.
author: chris p.

description: love the pint sized mimosa.  brunch burrito isnt half bad either
author: Henry W.
